reviews.review: Great time for two or more people!. My girlfriend and I tried out the SAW and the Sherlock room, and let me tell you, so much fun!!! Definitely a struggle at first but once you get the hang of it then it gets easier and way more fun!! Laura was awesome at helping us out when we were really stumped but still kept it challenging for us. 10/10 would recommend. Thanks Laura!
Fellas beat the Ladies. All I can say is that we had 2 teams of 5, guys in one room & the girls in another, we gave them a whupping lol. Brilliant entertainment, highly recommended.

The Sherlock room was great. We really enjoed this room, it's a real treat for a true Sherlock fan (I mean the books not the show). As an escape room it's worked great: the pauzels are complicated and based purely on logic. The only downside is that the background story is kind of detached from the room itself, but it's a very small issue that didn'tT hurt our enjoyment from the game, I would recommend a group of 2-3 people for this room, and it can be sutuble for children who enjoy logic riddles.

Late night "Mindlabyrinth". We made a reservation for the late evening of Saturday on the same evening via easy to use SMS reservation, which was answered almost immediately. Place was easy to access. The English of our staff member was a bit hard to understand during the discussion before the game. Nevertheless the few hints during the game were well formed. The game was entertaining, Mindlabyrinth was 3/5 on difficulty scale and we solved it by 2 quite inexperienced gamers with rather ease. Overall we were satisfied with the experience.

Saw and X-Files. We went for two "Escape room" experience. The setting of "Saw" was really great. Not spoiling, but you will be put in a room like in the movie.The "X-files" was following the steps of Mulder and Scully. For us (family of teenagers) the games weren´t too challenging. We got out from both under 45 minutes.

A lifetime experience :). We were there with my friend from abroad. The text message booking was easy and when I asked information on phone they replied after the first ring and they were very friendly. We recieved our picture from the game after couple days. So everything was good. We were in The Real Saw room, the designe was just as a movie the test were really exciting instead of that was the first game for both of us. Nice english speaking staff and the helps were coming in English as well so my friend who doesn't speaks hungarian can enjoy the game too. Niki from the staff helped for us when we were stucked somewhere in the game and we would like to say a huge thank you for her and her collegue (who I really sorry but I forget your name anyway she knows who are you so) thank you for both of you we really appreciate that! That was our first escape room experience and we can highly recommended to everybody your company! We will definitely go back if not for other reason just like to find the snake what you "lost"! :) Thank you for everything! :)

Great experience!. We came late at night to the "Mind Labyrinth" room on Maria street with no reservation, and the very friendly staff welcomed us. The room itself was very well designed and pretty challenging. Highly recommended!
Really good fun. Cannot recommend highly enough!! Very friendly staff. Sometimes we had a few too many hints so just say whether you want them or not. Some of the rooms need them!
Great fun with a logic game. I was there with some friends of mine and it was awesome! Great for working together and it also trains the brain, with the puzzles. We are sure to visit again.

More emphasis on the great idea less execution.. I like the idea and the whole approach how they changed normal flats and cellars into an exciting labirynth.But I would put more effort on the execution, the quality so that I would feel that I don't pay only for the idea. An open door for the upcoming competitors...

Terrifying - but you must experience it!. To be told we were going to be taken to a dark room, tied up and left to escape filled me with utter dread. Never done anything like this and little did we know, our booking was for the most difficult room!I really don't want to give too much away, as the thrill and excitement definitely comes from not knowing what to expect or what is coming next.Lets just say it was an amazing experience. We entered terrified and left smiling! The adrenaline rush was immense and once we DID escape, the whole party looked back and said how incredible the experience was. We want to do it again.

Best place with the best staff. We had our team building there and we enjoyed it a lot. The Paniq room was well equipped , the game was superb and the staff was extremely professional!We enjoyed every minute of the game and we would highly recommend this place.
Fun rooms. We tried both 'The real saw' and 'Sherlock' and found the rooms clever and tricky and well-designed. Worth a visit!

Excellent rooms - SAW room was excellent.. As an escape room fanatic, I can say that the Saw room here was one of my all time favourites but all of the rooms we did here (5 in total) were very good. Compared to escape rooms in the UK, the prices were also very good (about £7 each) to do a room.

Room cool but not "long" enough. We were a group of 5 people and made a reservation online for the "Lost 2" room. The room is in walking distance if you live in the city center. The team is nice and the room itself was also done very well - why just 3 points? Like I said, we were 5 people and the game was just not long enough to justify the high price - we were finished in like 20 minutes and felt a little underwhelmed afterwards. But they have a like 8 rooms - and I would def like to try the Saw or the Darkroom one :)

Lots of fun. We went for the 'time trap' room, where you travel through time from retirement to your school years. It took place over 3 rooms and was really fun. It felt easier than the one we did with 'Trap' and we completed this in 40 minutes
Great experience for the whole family. It was a great experience for the whole family including the kids. We could finally escape that helped making the kids happy.

Great fun and different . Four of us did the lost 2 room, great fun, we did need to ask for help a few times! Really nice staff, definitely worth booking one of the rooms for something different to do on a visit to Budapest. Great value compared to the ones in UK.

Many different rooms to choose from. A lot of variety in the escape rooms of Paniq room. We have played several rooms, in grouos of 5, 2 and 3. The rooms are suitable for small groups. My personal favourite was Time trap, but with so many different themes, each member of our team had its own favourite.
Escape asylum. We enjoyed this place a lot. Took our two teenage kids and had a blast. There are a lot of these in Budapest and this was our first.

Sherlock room. It was a very good experience to us , everything was great, and the game itself very tricky, we enjoyed it. We will try the other rooms as well in the future, you should not skipp paniq room:)

Amazing Fun!. After doing much searching, me and my friends decided on this escape room based on high reviews and their interesting 'tracks', and we were not let down! We chose the Lost 2 track, and without spoiling the details, it was a great experience that tested our minds in lots of ways. I think we were afraid going into the escape room with it being too easy or too hard, but we found it just the right amount of difficulty for us. We went as a group of four and I wouldn't recommend anymore or less. Great experience, will definitely go again

Pretty good . This was one of three escape rooms that we did in Budapest. We enjoyed the experience, but it wasn't our favourite. The clues were a little simple for our tastes and we only got stuck when one of the clues didn't make sense to us. (We have the solution and it still doesn't make sense to us, which is a bit of a worry). Having said that, it was a very enjoyable hour and a bargain at the price.
excellent rooms. We enjoyed so much our first game here (the mind labyrinth) that we came back to try the Sherlock and Time trap escape rooms!!
nice themes, a lot of variation. The real saw and sherlock are the most fun, if you visit budapest please visit paniq szoba, price-quality the best

Sherlock. We went to the Sherlock room and we enjoyed every single minute of this experience. As a couple we know each other very well but it can be really interesting to see how the other person reacts and acts in stressful situations like that. :) I think it is better to go in a group (at least 4 people) as there were some tasks what we could solve parallel - and we could have more time. At the end we could solve all problems and could exit the room but it was really good that we could have some hints from the organizer.Some negative: the "documents", papers, other staff we have to use to solve the problems - some of them was a bit used, torn, there were writing by other players on them, so it needs to be renewed. This room was challenging and hard but with some cooperation you can solve every single problem!Keep your eyes and mind open and try it out!

Great game, loved it!. It was an amazing experience and we loved every minute of it! Everything about it was awesome: the rooms were logical and atmospheric, the staff was helpful and enthusiastic, and their help system was great. We really only received help when we needed it, so we didn't feel like the room was spoiled for us. We went there with my boyfriend and we felt really proud having escaped :3 We would recommend this place to anyone who likes puzzles. If you're inexperienced, you can choose an easier room on their website, as they have a handy difficulty rating for each room they have.

Organisation & thought required . We visited here during our trip to Budapest, having already completed a couple of escape rooms elsewhere, and decided to have a go at the Saw room as we knew it would be tricky and we weren't wrong! We were shackled to the wall, on separate sides of the room to one another, with nothing to light the room but a faint glow - which was actually pretty scary and felt really realistic. The room was exactly like the bathroom from the first Saw film and the props were really accurate.A couple of things did let the room down for us though. Having pre-booked the day before online, after ringing them to enquire and being told abruptly to do so, we arrived ten minutes beforehand and they were very surprised to see us. The room wasn't ready and as a result the set up was rushed - the first clue wasn't locked, meaning we got in quite easily, but then had a surplus key which it took us a couple of minutes to figure out where it could possibly go. We were also not given one of the numbered clues we required to solve the room. A more hands on clue that requires using a liquid was not pre-warned and ending up soaking my partner, meaning he had a pretty soggy rest of his game and trek home. The only other disappointment was that we wasted quite a bit of time on a clue in the second room, only to be told over the walky-talky five minutes later that it wasn't part of the game yet and to ignore it. This was extra frustrating as virtually everything else in the room had a "do not use" sticker on it if it wasn't part of the game, but this didn't so wasted our time getting out. Overall it's a really scary, interactive game and was very much like the real Saw but the room requires a little bit of work and the team working there need to be more organised.

Trap in time. We've been in the other day at the Time trap. It was an amazing experience. The chain of the problems you have to solve, with the room's installations, makes you feel 100% inside it's world. I really really recommend to everyone, and thank you very much :)

Excellent game!. Well, I was with my friends and the game was kinda satisfying! We finally managed to escape, but in the rooms were a lot puzzles, which we could only sold with thinking a lot! Thanks for the game guys, we liked the staff, too!
Very exciting rooms. Excellent game, with lots of fun, and very exciting gameplay. I know, we will play in all of your rooms, asap!
Awesome. The PANIQ-ROOM was awesome. Challenging and very entertaining. Didn't get out, but it didn't matter, still had a good time.

You have to visit this place!. We really enjoy these real-life room escape games with my husband, and PANiQ-ROOM's "Time-trap" was one of our favourites. They have several, really creative and fun rooms. We also tried their "The Real Saw" room, and we were amazed, you'll feel like you're actually in the movie (The Saw). We will go back to try all of their tracks!

Awesome! :D. We tried 2 track of Pániq-szoba. I absolutely recommend for everyone! Its a room escape center with more than 4 tracks. The game was very exciting with a lots of creative and unique game items. Thank you for the unforgettable experience!

WOW!. The game is very immersive, I went with my family and even my 12 year old little brother could enjoy it. I highly recommend it after a dinner or before a wild party. Rooms are nicely designed, game plots are creative and surprising.

Best choice in Budapest. I visited tons of escaping games before, but it is the number 1. We just wanted to try out the Sherlock, but it was so fun, so we decided to play the Saw also. EPIC!!!! It's like the film. Best choice in Budapest

Best escape room in Budapest. This company is developing extremely fast. They always have something new when I visit them to play another great game: a new office, new games, they never rest! The operators are nice and they are always smiling at you, and they speak a very good english tough. Very helpful staff. I can't wait for the next time.

First try. When my colleagues came with the idea to visit this place, I was not really amused. After one hour in the room - we escaped in time - I was really excited. First try, but not last try. For sure.

Egypt Trap. It was our first "Escape". We were 5 people (my wife and my 3 sons) and it was so excited!!! we succeeded to exit and it was great. Of course we came back the day after for another game. People there were wonderufull too!
Amazing experience!
great adventure. We were lucky to find Trap Egypt on the internet. The game was not a middling experience! Thought-provoking relaxation!
Brilliant game . We did this activity during ou visit of Budapest and it is really fun. A good thing to do with teenagers who are sick of museum or monuments. It truly cheered mine up!

ACTUALLY WENT TO THEIR OTHER PLACE ON PAULAY EDE. We heard about this place and wanted to try it. we are both into puzzles and games and were looking for a new adventure. we booked in at 1:30pm and had no problem finding the place. we were not told much when we came in, but afterwards i realized that is part of the game. it starts as soon as you walk in and they do not tell you much, for a reason. they give you a locker to put your coats and bags in and its locked. then they open the door and you walk in and have one hour to figure it all out and get out. we got out of the first room in time only to enter another room, they gave us 5 extra mins but we got stumped. they came in and explained where we went off. it was fun, and exciting, and will def go back again. this is a franchise and they have them all over europe.

Had to go back the next day. There were three of us and it was a first time for all of us in escape room. First we did the Medieval. There was 60 min to complete it and we got it done in 59min . It was very challenging and cool. We were hooked. We had to go back the next day and do the Egyptian room also. That was completely different and way easier for us. We got that done in 30 min so in half the time. The reservation system thst they have on their website is really good and easy to use.Suosittelen erittäin lämpimästi. On yli puolet halvempaa kuin suomessa.

Who's the man who works there . Came in Monday afternoon and fell in love with the gentleman working. Absolutely beautiful and so nice and well mannered. If it's you just know I spent my time thinking of you rather than the puzzles

Egyptian room. We did the Egyptian room, just two of us and managed to escape with 6 minutes to spare. Staff are helpful and prompt with the puzzles when necessary. The puzzles are fun and varied, we had a fantastic time doing our escape room experience. We went on a sunny day - worth a visit even if the weather is good!! Definitely a highlight!

Excellent designed rooms and really fun and challeging. Have played quite a few of these rooms around the world. And the rooms at Trap is really well build. Everything worked as it should, in other places you often see that certain special devices malfunctions if you fiddle to much with them (ruins the game), and it is really nice, that not every puzzle will lead you to a new locker combination. After playing Armageddon we dicided to return the next day. Unfortunately everything was sold out, but they opened the place a couple of hours early just to allow us to play the "Secret of Tomb" room. We weren't dissapointed, the room was just as great as the Armageddon. And remember, don't forget to celebrate your succes (or lack thereof) afterwards in one of Budapest many nice pubs/bars/restaurants! :-)We will definetely be back for the other three rooms at TRAP, the next time we are in Budapest.

Fun weekend. Interesting and fun rooms, we did all 5 of them (TRAP). There were 4 of us, 2 adults and 2 teenegares, and each one of us had a different favourite room. Game masters speak english well, are friendly and we were given discount cards after the 1st game. Of course there are minor things that could be better but all in all it was great. We recommend the TRAP experience :)!

Our first escape game and it was brilliant!. We went to the Egyptian Room on a rainy afternoon in Budapest - managed to get a last minute booking and had to really persuade the hubby to go (he wasn't keen on the idea). We had a brilliant time though - this is a really fun experience that everyone should try! The puzzles were well thought out. Good value too.

One of the best escape rooms in Budapest. We are an experienced team and we visited 7 different escape rooms while in Budapest and we highly recommend TRAP. Perfect location, a variety of different theme rooms to choose from, very nice game master, good prices. First we visited the Amazon room which we really enjoyed, so we booked the Egyptian and loved it as well. Both rooms had great decors and puzzles. The also gave us discount cards for our second visit. We will definately visit them again in the future. They are a francise, so you can find them in other cities as well.
Great experience for reasonable price!. You should defnitly try it, cool staff and interesting quizzes:) we liked it so much that we did the of the rooms, which were all great on their own way.

Good fun. Went here with the whole family, we were six persons and it still worker great even though a maximum of five is recommended. We did both the Haunted and Armageddeon rooms. Of those two I would say Armageddeon is the better one, with a bit more logical puzzles.
Great rooms. We've been into 2 rooms in our trip in Budapest, both belong to TRAPInteresting riddles which require an out of the box thinkingDefinetly recommended

Fun for all. Our experience was great. There were 4 of us, 2 adults 2 kids. We were even given a little more time so the kids wouldn't feel as beaten by the game. It was difficult yet fun. This is one of the best designed places I have ever been to. Thank you for a great time!

Fun afternoon activity . My partner and I did the medieval room having read the reviews on trip advisor. This room is heavily puzzle based - everything is trying to solve a puzzle so if you like that sort of thing it's the room for you (I note some of the other rooms are more animated or scary). I actually thought it was quite hard. The man gave us clues when we didn't ask (maybe he deemed it necessary) but a lot of the time we struggled to understand what he was trying to tell us and it wasn't that helpful. One of the puzzles relied on just "knowing something" which perplexed us a little after (when we asked how you did it). Overall we took 65 minutes so they fact they let us go beyond out allocated 1 hour was nice. Would go back and maybe do another. Great value for money as well - around(12,000 Hungarian forint) £30 a room which I thought was great value for money.

Great Experience!. Came here on Sunday as a couple and loved it so much that we went again on Monday. Baring in mind there are two locations, we went to the Trap rooms at Paulay Ede where we did the Egyptian and Amazon rooms. Both are brilliant and get you thinking with lots of creative activities to escape. I would personally recommend the Egyptian room as it was very different to normal escape rooms and very interactive however both were good fun, I only wish we had enough time to do the medieval room too! To Note: the rooms are a lot better value for money than those in the UK!

Ice breaker or "Asteroid breaker". So I am a solo traveler on an organised group holiday. On day 2, 5 of us who literally knew each other less than 24hrs decided to attempt a "Trap puzzle room." We were in the Armageddon puzzle room. I loved how it was spread over multiple rooms as I had done a previous one in another country and everything was in one room. This lay out was very impressive and really added to the experience. We managed to complete the puzzle with a little time to spare. Great team building exercise. We feel like the best of friends now thanks to the TRAP puzzle room experience. I highly recommend. Would love to try another room!
Good escape room. The riddles were varied and consistent with the theme. As there were quite a few hard or physical challenges it is less suitable for young children.

Amazing concept - great for group adventure. For all those who like adventure like Crystal Maze, this adventure is for you. The staff were really helpful, welcoming and we really enjoyed the whole experience. It is a must do if you fancy a change from drinking and clubbing. You solve puzzles inside different themed rooms to escape the trap. They have Egyptian, Medeival, SPACE and different themed puzzles. It is value for 60 mins spent trying to escape the trap.

Enjoyed very much. We have visited the room 'Armageddon' recently and enjoyed it very much. It was fun to solve the puzzles piece by piece with a 17 and 12 year old and 'save the Earth' within an hour.

Adrenaline rush. We visited TRAP on seemingly the wettest day of our break in Budapest and it is absolutely one of my best memories of this wonderful city.TRAP is in two locations across the city, but we visited the 'Secret of Tomb' room, which was just down the road from us. From the beginning, the staff member working was friendly, funny and full of advice for the challenge ahead.While the setting is a little dated, the challenge is timeless. With occasional help from the staff, we managed to just miss out on finishing the room by about 3 minutes.A great laugh and I would revisit TRAP on the most beautiful day of the year if I ever went back to Budapest. Should not just be a rainy day experience!

First room escape experience. We arrived 5 minutes late which was not an issue and we were also allowed to stay in beyond our 1 hour time slot until we got out! Our host was very helpful in assisting 3 first timers/idiots to get out the room! The room itself was expertly put together. If you're looking for doing something different from the norm i couldn't recommend it enough!

Two very good experiences at TRAP. My family did two of the four possible escape games at TRAP during the summer of 2016: The Secret of the Tomb and the Egypt rooms. Both experiences were excellent! The booking site is easy to use, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the cost of the games is economical for an hour of fun for five persons! My youngest child was 11 years old, and she could still fully participate in solving the puzzles. The games and puzzles are very clever! Very tricky in fact, but very fun!We visit Budapest often, and we definitely plan on returning to TRAP to try the other two rooms! I highly recommend visiting TRAP while in Budapest!

Lots of fun for everybody!. Well, that was just amazing! We had our first Escape Game experience at TRAP Budapest. And it certainly wasn't our last!Escape Games are really popular in Budapest and you'll find one at every corner. We found TRAP Budapest on the internet and decided that it looked very interesting. We chose the "Secret of tombs" adventure, which we can recommend to everybody who doesn't mind getting some goose bumps.On the homepage you can find the different rooms, which TRAP Budapest offers at its two locations. They are rated by difficulty and design. If you play an Escape Game for the first time, it's rather hard to decide which is the optimal difficulty for you. Maybe it would be helpful to integrate some more information about the difficulty on the homepage, for example something like "suited for beginners" or "only for seasoned Players", etc.We were a little worried, that it would be too difficult for us and that we would be stuck there forever. Luckily, the guy operating the Escape Game was very nice and helpful. Whenever we were stuck in the game, we could just wave at him and he would give us a hint on how to continue. We are two grown-ups who like puzzling, and we found "Secret of tomb" challenging in just the right way. We needed about four to five hints to complete the game and sadly didn't make it in time. So, I guess, you could say it's not easy. But it's not frustrating either, because as already mentioned, you can get help if you need to.The Escape Game itself is localized in a small basement, which makes it even creepier. It's amazing to see what these people made out of the little space they had. All in all there are four different rooms belonging to "Secret of tomb" and you have to unlock one after the other to find your way out of your little prison. There are so many clues hidden in these rooms, you'll surely never get bored!As already mentioned, the staff is very friendly, helpful and patient. They explain everything to you and you can ask all the questions you like. The price is very fair and well payable, even if you're just a Group of two people, as we were. We really enjoyed ourselves and can recommend this experience to everybody! A must do in Budapest!

Knights rule :). Last weekend we did a "room escape weekend" in Budapest. Played 7 rooms in 2 days and TRAP was one of them. We choose the Medieval room and were thrilled with the puzzles. The decor is great and all of the puzzles are made as they were realy made in King Arthur's time. We felt like we were in a real medieval castle. :)

Great game (Medieval room) very original!. I contacted Trap Budapest via Email a few weeks before our trip and asked about playing in 2 rooms at the same time (we were a group of 11 people). I received a quick and detailed reply and booked the rooms accordingly on the website (very easy).We arrived as planned and played (very easy to find the location) the Medieval room. Our friends played the Egyptian room. We played a few escape rooms in the past and the Medieval room was great. We really liked the fact that solving a puzzle, changes something physical in the room, very cool!We managed to get out in about an hour (didn't have a counter which was a little annoying). Our friends came out of their room at the exact same time. We are a family of 2 adults and 3 girls (14, 12 and 7) and all of us enjoyed the game.The price is also very fair.A few points for improvement:a. Add a display of the time passed (countdown from 60 minutes would be nice).b. Improve the quality of the voice communication with the operator. It was very difficult to hear and understand what he said.c. It would be nice to have a souvenir photo.d. The operator could be nicer…

Great Fun--Our 12 Year Old Rocked It!. Truly, I am not great at these challenges but my braniac brother and his 12 year old daughter were fabulous--and, my sister-in-law and myself each lent our own abilities to solve the various challenges to get us out of room (into another!). There was an "Overseer" (probably laughing his head off at us) that intervened when we were a little lost--but only once! We laughed so hard--and crawled at one point (so be prepared). This was a great outing for our family and I would do it again.

We saved the world with 12 minutes to spare!. A great activity. We have done a couple of escape rooms and I really liked this one as it was themed and a fair difficulty. We did the Armageddon room. Loved it.
Impressive rooms. We tried both the Egyptian room and the Medieval room. The Egyptian was a more immersive and fun experience where the puzzles were nicely integrated into the room.
Great family challenge!. We had a great time in the Medieval escape room - fun for all the family, including the smaller children!

Great time. We were there 6 members of one family. the staff is very polite and helpful and the 2 rooms we visited on the first week of August were both stimulating and fun for all of us. a great quality time for the entire family. we had the Medival and the Egyptian rooms both are great, we recomend to start with the Medival and then the Egypt which is more difficult.
Great experience. The Armageddon room was challenging and fun. The thing we enjoyed the most that you didnt need lots of keys which had to fit onto different locks. Would definately visit again.
Fun and challenging. Very well done and challenging. The game was full of surprises. The location is very central to many hotels and the pedestrian area. Great way to spend an hour in Budapest.

ADDICTIVE!. We only planned to do one escape game a day, but we ended up doing 2-3. Trap has 5 rooms- we did the Egyptian, Secret of the Tomb, Armageddon and Amazon room. Each room is different in design and layout. There were no problems/faults with any of the rooms so its really well organised. and the staff were really lovely too! Highly Recommend !
Excellent!. My other half and I tried the Egyptian escape room and it was absolutely brilliant! Quite challenging and lots of innovative puzzles to work through! Would recommend to anyone.

High quality and well done. During our escape room themed weekend we've done 2 rooms at TRAP (Amazon and Secret of the tomb) and we really enjoyed them. The Amazon one was definitely the more challenging one, but both are definitely worth doing. Also our gamemaster Berti was really helpful, thank you!

Secret of the tomb was awesome!!!. Perfect team activity and a REALLY well designed room! We were 5 people and it was perfect! George was soooo great! The room was challenging but we've been doing escape rooms for a while and so it was really cool.

My first escape room experience: rewarding. We were a group of friends, all of us had their first experience in such games. We took tried the secret of the tomb. It was a lot of fun and loud laughter!!, we could not escape on time but the operator left us until we managed to escape with a delay of around 20 m we were grateful for that. The only negative points are:- the theme is not linked to the game, i mean we were not told anything at all about the theme or the story. Just reading it afterwards in the internet I figured out what was it about! - the last room puzzle was not clear at all and very confusing!.Otherwise, i'm going tomorrow to the Egyptian trap because i enjoyed that experience so much./

Armageddon room, brilliant. The puzzles were logical, diverse, did not require you to spot some really small details from hidden angles and the flow was good. Visited with three people and got out 10 minutes before the end! Would recommend warmly.

Castle in a basement. I have been to many (30+) escape rooms and TRAPs Medieval is one of the best decorated rooms. The game play is also quite specific as you will not find padlocks in that room. This is nice refreshment after tons of combination padlocks in other rooms.
Great experience and I highly recommend the visit, particularly for families.

Great game and experience. Not the best escape room we did (of a total of 5) but still a nice one. We managed to break the record of the medieval room by 2 minutes which was a nice accomplishment. The room looked ok and the gameplay was fine.

Great fun. Top score.. The kids (teens) loved it. So did the adults. Great for team building, kick offs etc.
Knowledge of local language not neccesary, rather some basic knowledge of English.
Only minor advise to the arrangers is to be more available on the phone.
Great fun. We tried the Egyptian room, and had great fun. We made it out in time, luckily. Staff was very helpful and friendly and booking through the website was very easy.

Superb, great for kids!. Five of us (2 adults, 3 kids aged 9-12) did the medevil room, what great theming, puzzles, and decor, totally immersive. Everyone was able to contribute.
We also tried the Egyptian room, which was a very different experience, more challenging and we needed some help, but I still really liked it.

Great fun!. We had done one previously in England but this was on another level.
We ended up doing two rooms in two days it was that good!
We first did the rocket launch then the Egyptian one.
If your stuck for something to do in a small group for €7 each this is great!

Nice game, but the game master didn't have a good flair for when to help. TRAP was our 3rd time to try an escape game, and we were a bit disappointed about it after having read the positive reviews. We played the Egypt room, and there were some nice challenges, but it didn't really match our kind of logic. There were no locks, keys or codes, and the solutions to the riddles sometimes didn't seem logical. The game master sometimes gave too much help too fast, and at other times didn't respond when we asked for help (probably because she was taking care of other rooms at the same time). We didn't make it in time, but were allowed extra time to finish, which was nice. But it ended up being a somewhat frustrating experience. I guess it's a matter of taste, but we liked other games better.

Really well thought out. This was the first time any of us had done an escape game and we didn't really know what to expect. We chose to complete Trap's 'Amazon' themed escape room, the idea being that we were lost in the forest without a guide and needed to find our way out.We had an hour of being in one room, solving puzzles that gave us keys or codes in order to unlock padlocks. We ended up escaping the room with only 20 seconds to spare, although we did need a hint from the game master at one point. The game was so well thought out and suitably challenging. If you had done escape games before I think you might find it easier because you might know how you need to be thinking and not come quite so close to the finish time as we did.

Amazon room. Good fun. We have done a number of these escape games, and this was average level of difficulty with slightly above average theme throughout. There was only a single room rather than two or three rooms which surprised us a bit that there was not more to it. Be sure to check the location of your game as there are two sites and Jungle was not at the one we thought it would be. Overall, we had a very good time.

Tremendous fun, great challenges. We (a family of three, aged 49-12) did two of TRAP's escape challenges - The secret of Tomb and Medieval. We found both great challenges that we could all participate in. There was a mix of physical, mathematical, spacial, visual and logical puzzles to get out. There was help offered, but only when we were struggling and mostly it was encouragement to continue with our strategy. We found both good value for money and a great escape from the midday heat.

Awesome puzzle with some great twists!. We went for the armageddon room and had an amazing time; it was really well thought out and logical but yet still challenging enough to be satisfying! Came straight out and booked another room for the next day.

Excellent and unique experience for the whole family to enjoy!. Mainly myself, but other family members too, are very competitive! So this seemed like the perfect activity for us to do together. We had a blast, our host was so friendly and talked us through the process of getting out of the rooms! I don't want to spoil the experience, so will leave it there. This is good value for money and a challenging, yet fun experience. Getting out of those rooms is anything but easy!

Egyptian room - great!. We were going to play the Medieval room, but the manager suggested we do the Egyptian room instead, as we were experienced players. And it was a good suggestion, as lots of the puzzles in the Egyptian room were things I'd not come across before. I thought it was a very good game, though the sets are a little worn. Nice staff too.
Good fun for kids & adults. Very pleasant staff and good fun. highly recommend on a rainy afternoon :) fun way to kill an hour. located in a basement so slightly musky/dump smell but still fun .

Very good!. We did both Medieval and Armageddon and we liked them both very much!Medieval were more playful and very fun!Armageddon very cool with cool puzzles!They are very different but very fun, I want to go back and try the other rooms too!

Great escape room. Very inventive!. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience here as a team of 2. Very inventive gameplay. Not just boxes and keys. Great fun. Only negative was that the room master did not know the room that well (or was not paying close attention) as he told us to ignore a clue only to then tell us we needed it after a few wasted minutes.

Everything fine except game master! . We played Amazon room and it was very nice and hard enough, cool puzzles and great atmosphere! Buuut our game master girl was really unpleasant and rude, we got the feeling that only think she wanted at the moment is us to leave!

one of the best escape rooms i've been to. we did the medieval room, being a team of two and it being rated the easier of the five but still very good theme. it was fantastic fun, an escape room with a bit of an edge as some of the methods of finding keys are hands on - fort boyard/crystal maze style puzzles rather than logic or hide and seek type. We've done only a handful of escape rooms but love them and this was the best one we've ever done and for a very reasonable price. It does get very booked up though so I would recommend booking a good few days or weeks in advance to get a convenient time and date slot that suits you.

Great place. Trap has two locations. All rooms are suitable for larger groups (we were with 5). The puzzles are very original and they have used nice techniques and details. Amazon was my personal favourite, followed by Armageddon. In total we have done four of their escape rooms.

So much fun. Me and my boyfriend wanted to do something a bit different and as we have never done an escape room before we thought we'd give it a go.We did both the medieval and Armageddon rooms and they were such fun.The puzzles were clever and challenging and the staff were on hand to give us hints when we needed them.We completed both rooms although I think we probably took a bit longer than an hour, yet the staff still let us finish which was great.The staff were friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend.

Escape Marathon. We played all 5 rooms that TRAP operates in Budapest and we liked all of them. Still, my favorite remains Medieval room (the setting is very eye-catching), followed closely by Amazon (very original puzzles) and Armageddon. Although everybody praises the Egyptian room (even the game master tried to persuade us to play Egypt instead of Amazon), I didn't like it as much as their other rooms. Not because it is bad, but because it is a theme that has been done and redone and, after having played more than 100 escape-games, you tend to avoid the common themes. Trust me, though, all of their rooms are worth playing, no matter if you are an experienced escaper or you've just discovered this type of games. All games demand not only logic and attention to details, but also skills and, more importantly, teamwork. Also, all games are available in English and we didn't have any difficulty in communicating with or game master.Great name, by the way. Our Team Raced Against Puzzles and won.

their game master was very good. I enjoyed the medieval room with my family. Their gAme master was friendly and engaging, which I have not seen in many other escape games. Thought my kids liked it they were too short for many of the puzzles.

Good escape room. We did the Egypt Room as a 2 person team and had a really good time. The team is nice and helpful if you ask for clues, the room had no locks and good production. Definitely worth a try :)

Great fun. Definitely worth a visit. Myself and my boyfriend visited here recently and had a fantastic experience. We did the Armageddon room and completed the escape with 6 minutes remaining. It was difficult at times but the hints will help you along. We felt like we were competing in the Crystal Maze. Definitely worth every penny. We were sorry we didn't have time to visit the Egyptian room. We will return here in the future.One thing I would say is, it is not very well signposted. It is quite difficult to find and when we did find it we nearly walked past it.

Great Room!. We went a couple in the Egyptian room and it was great!Lot of puzzles - not easy at all but very reasonable.It is our first room ever and for sure not the last one.the operator was very nice and helpful when needed.We highly recommend of the place.

A challenging and fun hour. We were a party of 5 in this escape room. We chose it due to the proximity to the hotel we stayed at. We had a really great time. The puzzles are challenging and interesting. There is enough to do for a group of several people and there is enough space. A lot is invested in the atmosphere and decor. Peter is very nice and welcoming.
Great fun. Thoroughly enjoyable and a great way to test your wits! Recommend the Amazon challenge. You'll want to do all of them!!!

Interesting and unique activity. I recently took part in the Medieval escape room with two friends and we had an excellent time. The puzzles were challenging with some hints and tips available if you need them. We had another group of friends who completed the Egyptian room after we were advised that it would be a better experience with two groups of three rather than one group of six. We would all recommend it and definitely want to sample some more rooms when we come back!

Amazing. Definitely an amazing escape room!!I did several escape rooms, not just in Budapest, but also in another European cities...and definitely I will never forget the Egyptian room. Very diferent from the other, and with an Amazing decoration. Loved it.
Very nice game. We've been 4 people and we finished in 42 mins, the room is well designed and the riddles were challenging! Very recommended
Great fun. We did the Armageddon room and it was great. Scenery is nice and the riddles/tasks are varied & interesting.

Nice rooms, good atmosphere. Recommend the Medival room (Didn't like the Egypt room).. We're 3 friends with an addiction for escape rooms (over 40 rooms each).We've come to Budapest to visit rooms, and decided to visit the Egypt and the Medival rooms by Trap.Both rooms have good strong atmosphere. Almost no locks.The riddles themselves are interesting, but in the Egypt room we've felt like they are more physical tasks than actual riddles (Except for 1-2 riddles which required some math and thinking).If you like escape rooms with such riddles, you'll probably love it.The Medival room have some more "real" riddles, although still - many tasks. Some fun, and some less so...I recommend the Egypt room to 2-3 experienced players (non-claustrophobic).The Medival to 2-3 experienced, or 3-5 new players.Both rooms are family-friendly.

High quality room design. Our family visited as a group of six so we split into two teams of three and played the Medieval and Amazon rooms and then switched over to play the other room. My team really enjoyed the Medieval room - it is the closest thing to the Crystal Maze that I have seen so far - really solid puzzles that require teamwork and skill to complete and some quite tricky maths based puzzles. We have now played 22 escape rooms and this one is my personal favourite. Our team did not enjoy the Amazon room so much, we found it quite frustrating and did not find the host's communications with us very effective. However, our other team really enjoyed that room very much and thought it was one of the best they have done. We took longer than 60 minutes on the Amazon room, but the host left us to finish off the last few puzzles, as they did not seem too worried about timings. He also gave us a discount that we weren't expecting as we had booked more than one room. This place is excellent value for money.

Amazon Room: Nice Design, Just Difficult Enough. The Amazon Room was rather small and thus packed with clues. It's not very difficult but we did use the hints a few times in order to keep going, as we found a lot of items that were to be used much later in the game, meaning the game flow is not "linear" (which is a little confusing but kinda fun in it's way).One thing that I thought could be better was the presentation: usually our hosts get into character and try to make you excited about the mission. Here we were dryly explained about the room and that's it.
Super fun!. My family really enjoyed this puzzle-game. We had a wonderful time trying to solve the different puzzles. For the whole family!

A really Great Escape Room (Armageddon). We really enjoyed our experience in the Armageddon room, our game master named George was really helpful and we have "escaped" using some clues from him in under 60 minutes. I would definitely recommend this room for people who want a unique escape room experience and it is very close to the center / metro in Budapest, we walked there from our Hotel (bo18)

Great fun. Did two rooms in teams of 3 each room. We did the Amazon jungle room first then the medieval room. Thought they were really well thought out with a nice mix of puzzles and practical puzzles. Plenty to keep you occupied as you work your way to escaping the room.

Very fun and interesting game. My first experience of a trap room! It was very enjoyable. We picked the Egyptian team and while I found it quite difficult we gradually (with a couple of hints) became more accustomed to solving the problems. The staff were very friendly and polite

Super fun, more than expectation. It was really fun to bring my whole gang here and see how much we could work compatibly with each other. The games are TRAPS but deadly cool. Highly recommend you to come and enjoy

Egyptian room: cool but nowhere near as fun as I had hoped. Came here with a friend. Possibly it was because we were slightly tired but we didn't really get caught up in the action. Also the handler was not that energetic, which didn't help. So cool riddles but nothing too exciting. Also, we managed to get to a dead end after putting some object in the wrong place and really had to have the operator help us out. Maybe the other rooms are nicer but honestly I'd love to try some other companies next time I'm in town.

Best thing to do before hitting the baths. A great adventure not only inside the rooms but also outside since finding the place wasn't that easy. It was well worth it thought, the rooms are excellent. Quite challenging I have to admit but this place has a really fun way to give you clues.

This Mummy had fun!. It's always a challenge going away for the weekend with 'kids' aged 18 and 13 and finding something that everyone enjoys and wants to do. We struck gold with TRAP, and to be honest it was the ONE thing in the whole weekend that we all did together and all thoroughly enjoyed (apart from the obligatory weekend eating and drinking of course!) We did the Pharoah's room and it was much more sophisticated than we thought it would be ... Crystal Maze eat your heart out! We thought we were doing really well when the door slid back ... only to reveal another two areas to crack after that! Delighted to say that we made it out in 50 minutes with minimum input ... and it was a great lesson in group dynamics. My poor husband doing it with 4 females! We would love to come back and explore more rooms at the TRAP experience. Thoroughly recommend.

Escape Room Marathon. We have been to 2 TRAP rooms in both locations during our long weekend Escape Room Marathon ... the rooms were great, clues given at right time. We heard Egyptian room is even better than Amazon and Tomb where we've been guess will need to try it next time we visit Budapest :)

A great escape room. We have played two escape rooms at TRAP, the Egyptian room and the Amazon Room. We have enjoyed both of them. We even set a new record for the Amazon room! The themes are well carried out and the member of staff was very friendly. The only thing we have missed was a locker to put our stuff in.

Great fun and experience! . 6 of us really enjoyed our experience at TRAP. We googled what to do in Budapest during the day and this popped up first and now we know why. The guy who runs the place was really friendly and helpful. He explained the get up and let us crack on with it but made himself available if help was needed. We highly recommend this place. We managed to crack the code with just a couple minutes to spare!!

ESCAPED!. We did one zone as a group of 4 (rhe Egyptian one) and needed a small helping hand with one puzzle, but the rest we managed and had an absolute blast. Then we were joined for the second puzzle (Medieval) by two more family members and we smashed it. We had some very strong personalities in our group and I feared it would go the way of previous family board games - uber-competitive - but actually the puzzles made us work together as a team and we all thoroughly enjoyed it. Everyone got to play their parts. Very highly recommend this as a fun couple of hours in the stunning city of Budapest. Now waiting for someone in the UK to launch a Trapped!?
Great Fun. Great place for people who like games. We had so much fun as a group of 4 trying to work together and figure out. We did 2 rooms but would have liked to have done them all.

One of the best Escape The Room game's that I have had the pleasure of experiencing!. I've played escape the room games since I was a kid (The online version). Ever since Escape games have been popping up in real life, I've been trying them wherever I can find them. I've done probably about a dozen at this point, and I must say that this has been one of my favorite escape room experiences. The puzzles were logical and interactive; sometimes a little tough, but always made sense in the end. On top of the room being amazing, I had the nicest guide/helper that I've ever had in one of these places. You could tell he really enjoyed what he did and that made it all the more fun.

Annoyingly clever but great fun!!. Our first visit was to the Egyptian rooms, which was full of well-hidden clues all interlinked. Help was appreciated a few times. Well thought out problems in near authentic looking tomb like rooms. All in all an hour well spent with friends and family as a birthday treat.

Brilliant! . We did this game as a couple and it was so much fun. We were in Budapest for a long weekend and it genuinely was one of the highlights - when we came out we were tempted to go and do another straight away! I'd highly recommend TRAP - it was a fun challenge and a nice thing to do as a couple team.

great escape games. We played several games at Trap, the riddles were challenging and fun, most of the locks/effects were really great and the staff was always very friendly and helpful. I personally enjoyed Aramgeddon the most of all rooms at Trap (not that the other rooms were bad, but just my favourit amongst all the good quests at trap...). I even dare to say that Armageddon is amongst the best escape rooms I've visited so far. Definitively a place to go if you like escape rooms.

Best escape room sofar. Me and my boyfriend were really excited to do an escaperoom in the hometown of escapes: Budapest. Since we were only with two, we searched for 2 other detectives in the Instant(Fun club) the night before.This was definitelly the best room i have done (4th). We did de Armageddon, the room was amazing and had really cool techniques to solve the puzzles!I would highly recommend this one! =D

Great fun for a family. Did 2 rooms with all the family. Saved the world in 50 minutes and the spent an hour in the Amazonia. We needed clues in both...though... but it was great fun. I'll recommend definitely.

Great surprise experience to take my Partner to. Gave my partner the choice of one of the 4 themes on the flight to Budapest, without telling her what it was all about.After spending the day exploring the city, I took her out for an evening stroll. She knew we were doing *something* but not what, until we arrived at the inconspicuous location a few blocks from our Hotel.We proceeded to complete the challenge, and we both really enjoyed the experience.Would definitely recommend it to any couple that enjoys puzzles or a bit of light-hearted fun.
Excellent!. We went to the Egyptian room, it was very fun and challenging. We had a great time, the room is very recommended!The staff in the place are very nice :)

We might be a little addicted. We did our first escape room, TRAP Amazon on our first full day in Budapest. It was so good and we enjoyed it so much that we went back and did Secret of Tomb the next day. We did our rooms in a pair, which worked well for us, but I can see how larger groups would be ideal. The two rooms were very different in feel, but we loved both. They were challenging and engaging and an excellent way to spend an hour. Although TRAP is a little pricier than some of the other escape rooms around Budapest, it was well worth the money.
AWESOME. Great fun even though that we got some help from the lady. We were only two doing it, but still made it in 50 minutes(Egyptian room). Would def do it again.

Great Experience. I played in other places and I can say that this is a very good escape game.Be aware that the game has 2 different addresses and if you follow the address in Trip Advisor you might find yourself in the wrong room (as I did). The Medieval Room has some great details that really puts your brain to work.
The best in Budapest. I visited most of the escape rooms in Budapest and by far Trap is the best one, great job!Armageddon from my point of view is the best.

Had a great time.. We were looking for something to do before another place we wanted to visit opened, so we went to this escape room in Budapest. As soon as we came in a guy checked if no one booked for this time and let us in as soon as he saw no one booked for that time. Wasn't very expensive considering the price is for a group, and we were 4 (split the price in 4). It was a great experience and we did both rooms in the location, second one was with a discount! Very good and challenging place. Had a great time.

Recommended for the beginners. We were in Egypt room and the best thing about it was that there were no digit codes or puzzles with letters or lockers with keys, that are so common in other escape rooms. It was something new and really interesting for us (we were in 30 escape rooms before). Though some of the tasks were illogical and not obvious (ergo could not be done without the operator's help), but there were also really interesting tasks which implemented using the found objects not as hints, but as tools! That was great :)

Two different rooms. We were 4 friends doing two rooms of trap located on the same place. (BTW you'll get a discount to the second room).Most of us had experience with few rooms. Trap Medieval was great, not easy, a lot of thinking involved. Finished after about 45 minutes without any help. Trap Egyptian was weird and I cannot recommend it. Even if we solve something it wasn't clear enough to understand the clue. Finished after 50 minutes with 2 hints.
Great fun. Excellent game and quite challenging. I wasn't the best at solving them..luckily I had great team mates

Great fun. First room we tried arriving in Budapest.Staff was efficient and the rooms are clearly well worked.We kinda use a shortcut with some luck but it didn't spoiled the fun.You should try itBTW we tried the secret of the tomb.

The Medieval-room. We booked this game (The Medieval-room) simply because TRAP was the #1 rated espace-room on tripadvisor in Budapest, but I have to be honest and say that this is not really an escape-room, more a puzzle-game, and of the 6 escape-games we visited, this #6 on our list. Don't get me wrong, it was still fun, but not the one in Budapest I would recommend.

Antipathetic staff. Initially, we were planning to go to another escape room, but we ended up here. There were 6 of us and since we didn't book it in advance, we didn't know the price. At first, the man saw only 5 of us, said a price, but once the 6th person of our team showed up, he suddenly changed it. Afterwards I checked the price online and regardless of the number of team members, the price was the same.The room itself (Egypt) was nice, though some parts confused us as for example the workers failed to restore the parts previously damaged by a team. Once we got out, we were still confused whether it was over since we had so many things left over unused.

lack of details...room could be improved. I went with my girlfriend in the Medieval room and we were both missing details and the love to create a nice room. If you go for an escape game for the first time, than it might be OK but the rooms could be much nicer. The riddles were as well only OK and there were only a few. We thought about doing another room but the first one was not convincing and as we saw the other 2 rooms from the outside, we decided not to come back.Nothing special but when you have nothing to do in Budapest, why not.
Vacation . Our family was on vacation and wanted to do the escape room they were very accommodating for about large group and got us in last minute. it was a fun experience " saving the world"

Got over excited and ended up doing three of these in a weekend!. Myself and some friends visited Budapest for the weekend. We did the Tomb game early, really enjoyed it so we did Armageddon, which we enjoyed so much we then booked in for Egypt. For a group of friends in their mid thirties to spend three hours doing these games in one weekend probably says more about it than my limited writing ability will.These are really fun games, even with a hangover. Personally I enjoyed Egypt less than the others, there is much less obvious progression to the game; this may just be our group's opinion, as a result of doing the game after a long day so don't be too put off. Have a go, if you've never done games like these before this is a good place to start.You don't need to take anything special, just try and feel as fresh as you can so your brain functions better than mine did. Each game lasts an hour and all are located centrally in Budapest. Go with an open mind, and communicate with each other (it's easy to forget to share some info you have), and you'll have a good time.Enjoy!

Great Laugh. Both myself and boyfriend did this when in Budapest for the 1st time - we had never done anything like it beforeWhen we came to the door (which you could easily walk by) you head down stairs into a basement TBH I was a little apprehensive - we were met by a very friendly guy named George who put me at ease somewhat (I am easily scared) Without giving too much away its great fun - The electricity went half way through the game which frightened the life out of me :) Definitely a good hour of fun and nothing to be scared of

If you're in Budapest, Do this. . Booked based on a recommendation from a friend. There are two sites, we went to the one on Maria street. Bit hard to find, not sure what your walking into... But so worth it when you get started!! Won't give anything away but the scenarios will take you a full hour - we tackled the Secret of the Tomb as a double act. Nothing is too small to notice!! Look everywhere. Will definitely go to the other sites across Europe. Need one in london!!

A good hour of fun. We have never experienced anything like this before. Think Crystal maze! Solve puzzles to escape the room. The first 10 mins we were completely lost, with just randomly moving things but we soon got the idea of what to do. It was really good fun and calls for different styles of problem solving skills. If you do get stuck the attendant will help you over the camera and microphone system in the room. Expensive for 2 people but would be good for a group of 4 or 5
Great fun . We loved this so much. We did the Medieval room and it was excellent. He guy who worked there was really kind and helpful. Can't stop talking about it

Egyptian and tomb rooms -both awesome. I highly recommend both of these. You think you've solved one puzzle and then it gets a whole lot more challenging!WE were quite pleased with ourselves getting out the Egyptian room in the time allowed with minimal help from the friendly staff, but the next day we tried the tomb room (different location) and found that a lot harder but just as fun. It definitely wiped the smugness of the day before off our faces!

Great experience. This was the first time for both my friend and I doing this type of game and thus we have found it a little bit challenging. We have done the Armageddon escape game and we were only the two of us, hence we knew that this will take more time for us to complete this game. Once we were in the game we were really focused and sometimes little hints were given in order to complete the game in time. Furthermore, once ready we were really happy that we have managed to complete it.

Egyptian room. Was an exciting room, riddles were difficult but amusing. After a first room i thought it is the end of the game, but when i saw the next room i was very excited, but the third room was the best!The staff were very friendly and helpful, and i recommend it to everyone who would like to try it.
Armageddon Room. Challenging room, full of enigmas. Great for 4 people. The stuff was extremely friendly, the took care of our luggage for two hours, even before our escape game. Strongly recommend.

Brilliant fun, but you may require family therapy afterwards!! . Had these escape games recommended to us by Hungarian friends and as this one was literally 5 mins from Hotel Palazzo Zichy where we were staying, we decided to give it a go. Yes, it is in a dodgy looking basement, but don't worry, the staff are extremely friendly- it's your nearest and dearest you need to fear! Locked in a room with minimal clues and the knowledge that Armageddon will ensue if you don't solve the puzzle can cause people to react in strafe ways. Once we'd worked out the initial clue, the feigned disinterest of the teenagers disappeared as they became hooked on solving the puzzle and saving the world! Much fun was had by all and the staff won't leave you hanging if you're struggling to find the solution. Of course we had no help at all and finished in record time

Armageddon better than Amazon. We have played other rooms and had pre booked Armageddon and Amazon before arrival via the very easy to use website. We did Armageddon first which we thoroughly enjoyed, it had a good variety of clues and challenges and had the 'wow' factor. The host was also excellent. If we had only visited this room this would be a 5 star review. We then went to the Amazon room, our host was very pleasant but appeared rushed as he was controlling other rooms as well. The room itself was nice visually, but, without giving things away, several of the clue 'hides' were similar, and one element relied on what appeared to be slightly malfunctioning technology. It was still good fun, but lacked a little excitement generated in other rooms.

Really good fun! . We played the Amazon room and just about managed to complete it! We did have lots of help from our host. The room was well designed and we had a great hour. This was our first trap experience and would certainly do it again. Good value - about £30 for the room for an hour. Trap has 2 sites in Budapest, so make sure you go to the right one!

Great fun.. Must do in Budapest. This is now our 4th time doing these 60 minute escape games and Trap Budapest was different to all the others in London / Prague. They are great to do in couples / friend groups.Trap Budapest were extremely helpful as well as we were 45 minutes late due to taxi issues and they still allowed us to play. We booked out all 3 rooms and played the medieval, Egyptian and Amazon. All groups got out within the time frame and everyone had a great time.
SO MUCH FUN!. Really well organised, creative and fun games... and staff are great too - super friendly, helpful and fun!
Fun for all ages. I went whith my family. We solved the puzle in 57 minutes (we got a few hints). Decoration is wonderfull. Staff is great and helpfull.
Armageddon . It was our first ever TRAP game and we absolutely loved it. The armageddon room was great and we went back for another one to next day we enjoyed it so much.
Very good rooms!. If you like escape rooms with amazing decor, well thought-of puzzles and challenging brain teasers, this is the place to go in Budapest! Loved every single one of their rooms!

Good escape room. I've played over 25 escape rooms all over the world and have to say - TRAP, Budapest is one of the best so far.We played two room - Amazon jungle and Egypt. Amazon I've liked less, but Egypt room is really cool and hard. Recommend to visit this place to all who loves escape quests or just want to try first time.
Great family adventure!. It is a good location with easy access, polite staff, who speaks excellent English. Great game, good experience! You should go there!
very funny. it was a very good experience, so good, that in the next day we came back to play the other room. it´s a good way to spend some time in budapest

Fun Change of Pace!. We really enjoy doing Escape Puzzles when we travel to different cities, and we were very pleased with our experience at TRAP. The Egyptian Room was very challenging to get started on, as it is set up a little differently than other rooms we have done, but we had so much fun solving all of the puzzles. If you're tired of wandering the city, or want a break from the colder weather, this is a great way to spend an hour. Book in advance, as they do fill up quickly!
Egypt room was fun. We were a group of 4, with mixed experience and we asked for one clue. The operator was nice (no key search). Recommended for puzzle lovers.

Extremely funny. This attraction was a very good dicovery, lots of fun after a long day visiting the city. 4 times less expensive than in Paris, it is worth to try. Book online to be sure to have your slot reserved. I personnaly prefered the Medieval room, but Egypt was nice too. The organizers were really helpful.

Something special to do. It was a great experience. We played the game in 2, but we could do it very well. The mysteries were tricky, it was a big fun to find the solution. Nothing was obvious, so the adventire is guaranteed. And this was something we have never done before. We will definetely go again.Thank you!
Awesome experience!. The puzzles were challenging and we had a great time! We did the Egypt Room and really had to focus to solve the puzzles - we even needed some help at times!
Fantastic experience! . We tried with my wife the escape room for the first time here in Budapest. Well I can say that this was a superb experience very funny and challenging. Totally recommended!!

We escaped in 42 minutes from the medieval. Budapest actually is the birth ground of escape rooms that now conquer the whole world. TRAP is one of the nicest places, with escape rooms in different themes. There is an Egyptian room and we did the Mediëval room. It was GREAT and you can try to beat us (we managed to solve all the puzzels in 42 minutes).

Fun 1hour experience for groups! If you have time for a visit, do it!. Were in Budapest for a week over New Years and went there the second day. Booking is extremely easy: We went on the homepage the night before, you can see all available times for every room, booked our time in 2minutes. Gotta look closely to find the entrance, but the experience is amazing!1 hour armageddon room after a quick introduction. Awesome to see how you and your friends go from "we can do it easily" to "sh**, time is running out" in just a few minutes :DIf you're stuck for long time on one puzzle, the hosts will give you hints via phone or fax, but they don't solve it for you.Simply put: AWESOME! 1 hour well spent, we had a good laugh the whole day talking about how we panicked

Just perfect . This is was the first time that we go to this kind of games , we try medieval room and we love it , then we try the amazon room and it was perfect to , just to say this experience was our first experience but after a week we have visit vienna and there we have try 2 others places that have exit games too , this place is level off the other places the room design perfect clever puzzles and they are related

best fun in years. We did 2 of the rooms at different locations during our visit, defiantly worth it, great family fun. The Egyptian room was an eye opener as unsure what to expect. We then did the armageddon room and thought it would be a breeze, no such luck totally different.
Fantastic Experience!!!!. We took the armageddon challenge and it was great fun. You should definitely visit this place if you're around. Peter was an awesome host. Great guy :D

Egyptian Puzzle Fun!. Booking online was super easy, location easy enough to access (through a small door, so a bit difficult to miss, but definitely starts setting the mood!), and the price was reasonable. Fees can only be paid in cash. We showed up early, but the friendly game master let us start ahead of schedule. The Egyptian room was very lovely. The clues revolve around signs and symbols rather than locks and numbers like in other escape rooms. The clues were of good quality and complexity, and only a few times did the game master need to help out when we couldn't understand or work a particular item. He was friendly when doing so. We only had two adults in our party, but we were able to finish with only 3 minutes overtime. I think a larger group could easily finish within the limit. After finishing, the game master gave us some ideas for what else to do during our visit to Budapest. Simpily, the establishment was friendly and welcoming, and we had a lot of fun.

The best escape rooms in Budapest. We have been to four of the trap rooms and all were really great. Egyptian was the best in scenery and design, but the games were also great - can be a little scary for small kids. In medieval the scenery is also nice and you need skills not only brains. Amazon was full of great ideas and the design was nice - not everything looked like in the Amazonas but still very nice. Secret of tomb was one of my favorites as the puzzles vary and here also you need more than just brains. The design again great here. The only negative was the strong odour of "cellar mould".

Loved it!. Loved the whole experience we had booked the medieval room it was our first time playing an escape room 2 adults and a 10 year old. It was more difficult than I had expected but the game master is on hand to give you hints. Great fun had by all all 3 of us were so engrossed in the game we forgot about anything else! Would highly recommend

Awesome fun, brilliant quality. We completed 5 of the 6 games and absolutely loved them! Each room is a different theme but all with fun puzzles and challenges. The rooms are finished to a very high quality with many aspects specifically hand made. Friendly and helpful staff. Highly recommend.

Brilliant fun in the Amazon. Firstly be aware that TRAP has two locations in Budapest, each with differently themed rooms so just be sure which one you are going to. We went to the Paulay Ede venue which has the Egyptian and Medieval rooms as well as the Amazon room which I'd booked for my party of four. Someone else has said the room is small for four people but we didn't find it cramped at all. I was with my adult son and daughter and my son's fiancee and it was the first time any of us had played an escape game. Before leaving us to it the chap who locked us in explained a bit about the different type of padlocks we'd need to find but without giving anything away. To be honest I wasn't much help at all so mostly contented myself with taking photos, although I was able to see a number that seemed to be invisible to the others. The room is monitored by the operator, who speaks excellent English, and if it is obvious you are struggling a bit a hint pops up on the TV screen in the room. Luckily my family were pretty good at it and found the final combination number to open the main door with 8 minutes to spare. We all really loved the game and would probably have tried another room afterwards but had a dinner reservation to go to. Highly recommended.

Awesome, all the rooms!. We did five rooms of six in two days!have to say we have experience of 6-8 rooms but here it was so different from what we did, every room is amazing.We had the rooms as couple.The Amazon - the easyest room mostely lockes, I think 2-4 people it's enugh for this room or for people with out experience.Secret of tomb - cripy and awesome! so awesome! it was little difficult for two but we made it so it's possible.Armageddon - I think the level of it is medium, it does not matter if you have experince or not, you will love this room it suits for everybody,Egyptian - this is the hardest room, it's different from all the rooms we did, finnaly room without locks! very hard room, need to think differently. it was very hard for two people.I have to say good words on the service too, the guys who handle us were amazing too.So if you are in Budapest - go go go!

Not the best one they have . Four of us (two couples) took part in Amazon. This is a new game that they have just started offering. Compared to the others they have 2 of which we have done this one was poorer. It felt very cramped for 4 people and it was annoying that we got clues,hints without asking. We would have tried a bit longer to look for the clues. As a room the clues were as good as the others and the standerd was as high as the others. Without giving anything away the one part with the gloves was poor as the gloves were no good for trying to grip what you had to grip. I liked the way the room flowed and the padlocks with colours and words made a nice change to the numerical ones. We have had worse escape games but just felt the cramped small room and the help without asking let it down. Still had a fun time though.
unique experience !!. it's not just "find the key" it's a sophisticated game in one room with lots of details .we've tried the Egyptian room and it was hard but fun .

Fun! We try one & hooked & sign on next immediately. Fun! We try one & hooked & sign on next immediately. The family was interacting with full of excitement & screams & chaos. From puzzle to puzzle, room to room. A must try for all

Great room- bad service. Being over 10 escape rooms around , I'm in a state where I can really appreciate a good room. This was a great room: high level puzzles and clues, great theam, nice effects.But the operator was buisy with other rooms and was not available for our questions. As a result we did not finish on time and he opened the door for us, leaving us with a bitter taste about the room. But I still recommend- this is indeed a unique room, but it requests more opretors during parallel games.Important note: not all of the rooms have microphones! So if the operator is not responding, try another room.
50th Event in Budapest. Organised a couple of puzzles for 16 people for my 50th Birthday event. Everybody had a wonderful time. Can highly recommend this.

Too much fun packed into one room! . We visited the TRAP games during our visit to Budapest. We picked the Egyptian room and we had such a good time. Once we got going we had so much fun trying to solve the puzzles and figuring out what to do next. The gentleman who was taking care of the place was very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend trying out the TRAP games. I had more fun than I thought I would and will definitely be going again in other countries I visit!

Majestic Medieval. Two of us played the Medieval room and thoroughly enjoyed it. Good puzzles with plenty of variety and good production values. Well themed. Would definitely go back and do other rooms.

A touch of the crystal maze. We'd done something similar to this in Warsaw and thought we'd try it in Budapest. We chose the Armagedon room and we were challenged by a reasonably interesting collection of puzzles. We felt that there were maybe a few too many combination locks, we didn't like the way the hint phone rang with a recorded message every time we hit a particular switch and most annoyingly of all we missed one part for which we were given the hint with five minutes remaining. They should have built the tension and let us try and solve the problem, or given us the clue with 30 seconds to go. As it was we exited with 4 and half minutes left. There were four of us and for this size group it represented good value for money.
Awesome. Beautiful evening spent in egypt trap with my family (2 adults and 2 kids (8y & 13y)). Very kind stuff, we enjoyed in everything. Best regards

That Amazing Trap Game. Fun, Fun, Fun and more fun. We booked through an agent in UAE however, for some reason the booking was not showing up when we went to the place. They still accommodated us. The game was so engaging and we had so much fun that we booked a different game for the next day. I think this is a "must" while visiting Budapest.

Adrenaline packed fun. Friendly staff, great experience highly recommend. May be a little difficult to find as the entrance is a small door down a few steps, however signs outside are easily distinguishable.

New experience, felt like a game show activity. I was there with a group of friends, and we all chose the Amazonian room. It was so nicely decorated, and there was tv that would help you out if you got stuck. Great activity to try.

Hugely Fun Experience!. My friend and I booked the Egypt room for our last evening in Budapest and couldn't have chosen a better way to end our trip. The experience was amazing, the room was challenging and the supervisor (Puzzlemaster?) was very helpful in moving us along our way within the room whenever our brains seized up. The puzzles and settings were very impressive and made for a fully immersive, flowing, entertaining and unique experience that we will never forget. Highly recommend for any group of people looking for something different to do in the city, and would definitely come back to try out all the other rooms at some point!
