Great flow of the game!. Everything was great! We loved the puzzles and the flow of the game – it swallows you and you notice nothing beside the game itself. We played 2 games of that kind by other companies before and this one was the best.

Want fun but running out of stuff to do?. helpful staff, inticratr puzzles and an hour well spent. We went as a couple and it was definitely one of the most fun things to do in Budapest! Not one of those places where people jump at you or scare you, only puzzle-based and room-by-room clues.
Budapest Holiday. An absolute must! This was one of the most fun things I have done since coming to Europe. Even for groups of friend, old and young.

Brilliant. Myself and my boyfriend visited here to try the Egypt Ian themed room. Upon visiting we were greeted and given instructions. At first we did not know what to expect, and we didn't really know what we were doing. When we realised we had so much fun. The decor and the layout was amazing! We finished in just over an hour. Upon finishing we were given a coupon for a return with a discount. We enjoyed it so much that we returned the next day to try the medieval room. I would highly recommend this, and will definately try the other rooms on our next trip to Budapest!
Good for first timers only. We have done about 8 of these in the past and TRAP is average. It is great if you have never done an escape the room, but there are better ones out there.

Do not skip!. Egypt room is so great, so interesting and creative. I totally recommend it to everyone who don't like locks in escape rooms :D no locks here! Secret of tomb was good one also. There was bad smell of moisture so it influenced the overall raiting.
A must !. The games are excellent and the staff are spot on friendly..Me and my better half were hooked ! Would recommend armegeddon as the finish is real experience ;)
Enthusiastic host!. Very nice Medieval escape room and good service! 1 hour experience and the host took the time to review the room with us.

Totally worth it!. As one of the first escape rooms in Europe I thought I should have a look at this one and it is totally worth it. It was one of the best escape room I have visited and a very nice story. I totally can recommend it as there are several puzzles and riddles which are extremely hard to solve and find. Even though I did not escape in the first run, I did in the second one and still had that much fun with my friends. Thank you very much for this experience.

Amazing. We visited TRAP on our city-trip to Budapest. We wanted to do something different with our teenage-children (ages 15 and 17). It was the first time we did an escape-room and we were very enthusiastic. We booked the Egyptian room and it was a lot of fun, the room was beautifully decorated and the puzzles were great. The guy who welcomed us (I think his name was Ben) was very nice and friendly. We liked it so much, that we booked the middle-age room for the next day. We had a wonderful time at a very reasonable price.
So much fun. I have been to 3 of the escape rooms by TRAP and recommended my brothers too. Had a great time. It is a nice bonding experience.

best room escape!. let me preface this review by saying i spent some time in budapest in early 2014 and did two other room escapes in the city because they were cheaper. since then i've done a couple in the new york metro area before returning to budapest with a better budget and tried TRAP. all i can say is, WOW.TRAP is by far the best room escape establishment i've come across on either continent. first off, in my experience the staff is SO friendly and accommodating. it's always frustrating to be in an escape and come across a lock you may know the combo for but because you're not used to using it you can't properly open it - in the one room with combo locks i tried (amazon) they were clearly explained and demonstrated by the game master beforehand. second, the two games i did (egypt and amazon) were moderated by the same person but he was great - above and beyond. very friendly, helpful, and so enthusiatic about the whole place. made us excited to keep playing, which is NOT something i've experienced in other escapes (actually, quite the opposite). it was so refreshing!the games themselves, should go without saying, are so well thought out. having done two i can say that they were very, very different in difficulty and style. egypt was very dymanic and stylized while the amazon room had you really thinking and calculating a lot more. perhapss i'd say egypt was more friendly for first-timers or groups with children but both were so great and had me scratching my head hours after. looking back there is nothing in either game i could complain about at all. i felt quite challenged in both, even having many other escapes under my belt. they were so fun and interesting and when you manage to get through a tough bit without a clue you feel on top of the world!i would completely recommend this game to just about anyone who is interested. my first trip to budapest i let the price dissuade me but i urge you - if it's even slightly in your budget - try TRAP first before the others. it just sets such a high standard that others i've done have yet to match. we were happy just to finish, not even come in early! truly, these games are expertly designed and the attention paid to detail is parallel to none in this city. i would happily repeat many more times!

Came for a romantic weekend, spent it all doing puzzles. I can't recommend this place enough to anyone that visits Budapest. My Wife brought me for my birthday and we stumbled upon this place by accident. They have 2 locations and we have done 4 different rooms in the past 2 days.
It will bring out your inner loser and you will love it!

It was a great experience!. We booked it through our hotel. We went there and met the guy who works there. A great guy, polite and helpful. We played the King's Arthur room. It required lots of thinking and calculating, so if you don't like maths better book another room. It was quite hard and in some cases the guy who works there gave us some help through the speaker. Definitely we would it something like that in the future.Give it a try!!!

Great fun. Highly recommend . The two of us were on a long weekend holiday to Budapest and visitors TRAP not once but twice! Friendly staff and great fun for couple or groups. We did the Egyptian room one day and the Amazon one the following day. For more of a challenge I would recommend the Amazon room.

Funfunfun. We've played more escaperooms, but these were really good. Armagedon had a few unexpexted ways to find the next clue and the next rocketroom builded up in a nice way to the final. Prices are cheap (€9 p.p.), since we are used to Dutch prices (€25 p.p.). Very enthusiastic stafflady and if you are hungry afterwards: do visit Matroesjka restaurant at the nearby square.
Saved the world (with a little help). Went with the family, kids aged 9 and 13 year old twins. Booked online. A little pricey, but we all had fun. The clues and help all came in English.
Armageddon room - Hard but very fun :). It seems like a lot of effort was put on the decor and electronics. The room was hard but possible for 2 people.

Awesome fun!. I booked this as a surprise for my husband's birthday as I'd read a lot of great reviews and it sounded right up his street, and it was so much fun! The man was friendly and helpful, gave us clues when needed and we are now hooked on escape games! Would do another game again in a heartbeat (hoping to find one in London soon!)

Great fun!. I visited Trap escape room with a couple of friends. It was very challenging and fun. There were a lot of puzzles that we had to solve by using our mind. Sometimes they were difficult but we got help from the friendly lady working there. I can recommend it to everybody!

Absolutely Brilliant!. We booked to do the Egyptian room as a family of 2 adults, a 16yo and an 11yo with no experience - and we absolutely loved it! We had no idea what to expect, but we quickly got into the game and the puzzles and with a couple of hints we made it out! It was a great experience to have as a family .We loved it so much, we went back the same week to do the Medieval room and then Armageddon and were not disappointed in the slightest!We booked slots on-line for all 3 without any problem (one before going on holiday and 2 while we were there) - we found the staff friendly and they explained everything really well including how to communicate with them if we wanted help, and though we had worried about the language barrier, there was no need as most puzzles used symbols or pictures.I would recommend TRAP to everyone - such a great experience that we still haven't stopped talking about!

So much fun!. Me and two friends booked the Egyptian Room, having no prior experience of how to play or the concept of escape rooms, we were a bit confused, but with a little help from the staff member Daniel (who is an amazingly cool person!), we got the hang of it and figured out what to do. We had so much fun, working together and playing up our strengths to escape the room. It was a perfect way to end our last night and it completely made our 3 day trip in Budapest! A must do people! ohh and it's so much cheaper than doing this sort of game in London where they charge per person and not per room like this place!

A fun filler. After reading a bunch of reviews and recommendations from friends, we decided to check this out. We forgot to book a slot online but decided to wing it and turn up as our accommodation was fairly near and wasn't too much of a walk. If you're keen then i'd book online as it does seem popular. A really friendly and welcoming guy on the desk told us we could come back after a couple of hours if we wanted one of the locked room games, or that we could go in to the Armageddon room which was available there and then, so we went with it. 12,000 huf per team of up to 5 people which is a good price for a bigger group, but maybe a little pricey being just the two of us. He spoke good English so instructions were explained well and throughout the game he helps you by telephone and a printer inside the room where he sends hints and clues. Really good fun. He even extended the hour as we couldn't get out in time (although embarrassing for us haha). Some parts were tricky but with hindsight everything was actually fairly logical - I won't go in to detail as it'll spoil the game. If you're in the area and there's a group of you it's definitely worth it, especially if you're looking for a filler in between other activities and plans as it's only an hour or so long.

Great couple of evenings!. We went along to try the Medieval room first. Not being sure what to expect or how hard the challenge to escape would be, the host was fantastic giving us a few instructions & reminding us to check everything for clues. I'm pleased to say that we managed to escape! We loved it so much that a couple of nights later we went to the other site and had a go at the apocalypse room, this was great as it was completely different to the medieval room & we managed to save the Earth from an asteroid hit. Would really recommend this to anyone. We went as a group of 3 but you can be in groups of 2-5.

Made our holiday!. We found TRAP as a recommendation online and booked the medieval room early on in our trip. It was so much fun we ended up booking the Egyptian room for the next day. That was just as much fun so we booked another room (Tomb) for the day after that!! It was such a creative, team-bonding, super fun experience! I went with my boyfriend and we definitely grew stronger as a team thanks to TRAP haha! Thanks guys, keep up the great work!

Superb! Well thought of and great fun . We played the Egyptian room and it was excellent. Well thought of, a bit too hard to solve in one hour (but the operator, who was very nice, gave us hints and some extra time), we had great fun here.

The best escape game. I have been in several escapes games in Prague but this was the best. Really nice room, puzzle had right difficulty and really cool personal who speak perfectly English. Awesome...

Enjoyable hour of fun. Having done 4 escape games in England we knew what to expect, however the effort that has been put into the setup of these rooms was impressive. We had booked to do the Armageddon room and we had such a good time we managed to book the Egyptian room later that day. Staff were very pleasant and spoke English. The games were also in English however most clues are in pictures so can be enjoyed by everybody. We definitely recommend this game.

Best time!. Went with just me and my boyfriend, so was a little tricky as just the two of us. Chose the medieval room and had the best time trying to solve all the clues. Man who ran it was great fun and made us feel welcome. Would 100% recommend and book early as it gets busy, will be going to another soon in London as loved it that much!!

Great for groups/teambuilding. Traveled with a group of students and had them do TRAP as part of their "scavenger hunt" in the city. They found it challenging but also had a total blast doing it. Only takes 1 hour (maximum) and is in a very central location; everyone should do this if coming to Budapest!!

Tomb and Armagedon. The two of us were already in the Egypt and Medieval room in Budapest so when we planned the trip to Budapest with our friends we booked Tomb room and we were so excited about it that we booked Armagedon for the next day.

Egyptian and Amazon escape rooms. So much fun trying to solve some rather abstract puzzles in time to escape the room that we immediately went back and tried a second room. There are 5 scenarios available across two locations in the city (both close to district VII) so plenty of variety. Probably best to play as a team of 4 but can have slightly smaller or larger groups. Took a while to get into the mindset but once going it was really addictive. I'd reccommend working together in as structured way as possible rather than just hitting buttons at random but don't panic as you can rely on plenty of hints if you're struggling.

Amazing!!! . Went with a group of friends who we all have previously experienced something similar, so we knew what to expect. Was greeted by an extremely friendly guy who quickly led us to our room (Egyptian theme) We spent the whole hour and just escaped in time! All of us were so proud of ourselves for escaping and we had am amazing time!!! Recommend to all people of all ages!!!
quite easy but entertaining. we did the egyptian maze. it was not too hard for 5 people. the price like most things in budapest was very friendly for tourists.

So good we went back for seconds. Good fun, especially with a group of friends. We did the Tomb and Egyptian themed rooms. Challenging but not impossible and well priced in Budapest compared to others we have read about.

Do try it: it's great!. Back then it was our first escape room and found it absolutely amazing. My opinion has not changed although the setting of the tomb room is somewhat inconsistent. The puzzles are wonderful and challenging, solving them took the appropriate amount of time we came out completely satisfied. Nice staff as well.

I Never Wanted It To End!!. I have wanted to do an Escape Game since first hearing about them but held off until going back to Budapest (we visit often) because I wanted to make sure to experience it for the first time in the place where they were born. TRAP does not disappoint, not in the least. If I had any complaint at all, it would be that I was sad that there was a Congratulations rather than another room. I could've stayed all night. I could go every single day and never get bored (assuming that there were different puzzles, of course). I am fiercely competitive and took the clock as a competitor so I was thrilled. These games are truly designed for everyone. We had a team of four very diverse people with very diverse skill-sets and they all were very useful: Three monolingual English speakers, one native Hungarian speaker fully fluent in English (as well as functional in several other languages - show-off!) but the language does not matter at all as long as you understand numbers. We had degrees in physics, microbiology, business, and a high school diploma with some college. Hairdresser, software engineer, sales rep, screenwriter/script supervisor. Not one person was more or less useful than any other.I will be back in Budapest in three weeks. I will be back at TRAP. Guaranteed!

Great concept. We tried Armageddon as a couple. It was nice with alot of technical ridels . We also enjoyed that there wasnt that many padlocks. Some of the tech didnt worklike the walkie talkies that was suppose to help us. The game instructors english was kind of rusty so that took a little steam out of the experience

Fun and challenging. I've tried both the Medieval and the Egyptian room. The latter one seemed a bit harder and I believe it was a bit more developed as well with several new rooms opening from the first one. The place is nice and the atmosphere is good. However, I didn't have the urge to get out, there was no pressure on us (which usually increases the excitement).

Unusual but a lot of fun . Visited on the 26th of August where we played the Egyptian game. We found the game challenging but the facilitator (tall guy) was extremely helpful and very patient with us. Fun for all ages and a very different (but amazing) activity to do whilst in Budapest. Less than £30 for an hour, a third of what I have paid for a similar game in London! Around a ten minute walk from Daek Ferenc square.
Really good fun. We took part in the Armageddon, it was a lot of good fun and we all really enjoyed ourselves. We all really enjoyed ourselves.

Well done!. I wanted to show this kind of adventure to my family, although I was not sure if they will like it. I thought that an escape room in the country of its origin would be nice. I have tried it few times already so I knew how great this activity is. I chose the medieval room - as many people here suggested it as the easiest one and the best one for beginners. The room was well made, we made it and my whole family simply loved it. I hope they will come with me again soon.The guide at the spot was very helpful and kind and made our experience even nicer. I would recommend TRAP to everyone.

Excellent way to spend an hour with the family!. Had a fun family bonding experience doing the medieval trap game. Took us about 75 minutes and they were encouraging with appropriate clues. Would definitely go again.

Did not know what to expect, but understand high rating now. We were a family of 4 visiting Budapest with the kids' grandparents for the first time. We had never done a Trap room, but found reviews on Trip Advisor and the children 14 and 11 love puzzles. We found the place, met by a very pleasant employee( sorry forget the name), led into a room (Egyptian themed), asked if we had done this before, and when we replied "no", told " see you in an hour or so". When I asked " no more explanations?" He replied, "I've said too much already". An hour and fifteen very challenging and team building minutes later, with a very few well placed hints we were out, and understood what all the fuss was about. This is a trend that will need to catch on in North America. A great way to spend a family evening.

Fun!. It's good fun. You'd be strange not to find the fun in these analog challenges. In a world of smartphone apps and video games, it's great to work with real objects and work together towards a common goal. It was our first escape room experience and we are glad we did it. It's pricey for the room so try and go with more people and split the cost. We met a friend in the city who joined us and we split the cost by 3 instead of 2. And make sure to reserve online! It's easy and you can cancel online and rebook at any time. Don't expect them to be able to serve walk-ins. And be careful: 2 of the rooms are in one location and 2 in the other. Use their website! The tripadvisor page only shows one location address (which was NOT the one for the room we chose [medieval])

Good escape room, not like others. I really liked all 3 of the escape rooms we did. The medieval one had almost no locks but some nice 'things to do' before you can continue. The Egyptian room had some really nice puzzles as well. We also did the forest room that was by far the most difficult one. The layout is less then the other two rooms, but the puzzles are a lot harder!All 3 rooms had their own good part and although it was by far not my first escape room i'd liked them all. Medieval is a good one for starters, the Egyptian room as well, but you don't know if you are on the right track for a long time and the forest room was really a hard one, but more from puzzle to puzzle.

Loved it!. The other reviews on Trip Advisor prompted out visit and we were not disappointed. We opted for the Egyptian game and our team comprised Mum, Dad, and our 15 & 13 year old daughters. The venue was easy to find (big signs outside) and the fact that you had to go down the steps into the basement added to the excitement. Our host was friendly, spoke excellent English and very encouraging (especially useful during the game when you occasionally have to plead for a pointer!)The game itself is brilliant funThe biggest challenge was the start when you first enter the room and the door closes behind you and we found ourselves looking around the room thinking 'Well, what do we do?' You literally have to work out what is a puzzle and what you have to do with it. After a while we asked to guidance and after that we were motoring.The great thing is your host is there to help (via a speaker in the room) if you want it. There is no interference if you want to carry on, on your own. We found that there was a good balance of challenges and the girls suited some better and the grown-ups others. We succeeded in getting out in time with no family arguments with a great sense of achievement! SuccessFantastic fun and our only disappointment was that we didn't get chance to go back

Great family time!. We did the Medieval room one afternoon and loved it. We worked together to solve puzzles and we all had fun. My 12 and 9 year-old kids liked it so much we went back the next day to escape from their new room, the Amazon. The staff was friendly and helpful. Anyone can do these; you don't need to be a trivia buff.

Very fun. I did this puzzle with my adult daughter. We had a great time doing it and the gentlemen spoke good english and therefore we understood everything well. This game was challenging but very creative and fun to solve. We did 2 different games at 2 locations that day. This was the better one.

Medieval Quest!. I booked the evening before and there was plenty of time available. We had a group of 4 which is probably the optimal number of people, although 5 would definitely be the maximum.It wasn't as busy as expected so we were given the time to solve the clues and ended up being in there for a wee bit over an hour. The hints and clues given were helpful but not specific. We thought we were doing well when some other 'unexpected' things happened.In all, well worth the 5* rating and I would certainly come back to do it again!

Families can work together in a super-fun environment. My family and I went to the Trap on the recommendation of our 12 year old son. We did the Medieval Trap. Our other children are 7 and 10. We had a fantastic time and all were able to participate. Everyone rated it a 10/10 and we will definitely be back the next time we are in Budapest.

Discovered a new kind of fun!. Did not know what to expect, but looking for fun family activity with two teenage/young adult kids. We love games and puzzles of all sorts, so it seemed like we would all enjoy this new-for-us twist. Found it to be really fun, a great team challenge, only takes an hour (actually we finished Secret of Tomb in something like 46 minutes). So enjoyable we actually did a second room two days later. Host suggested the Egypt room as it is more difficult. Loved that one, too! Reserve ahead online for no cost and try it.

Awesome time, nearly 5 stars. . Great way to spend a spare hour if you have one! Second time after also trying an escape game in Prague and loved it. Attempted the Tomb room and really enjoyed the challenge. Even went for a third in the Aztec room just before we left. Really gets the brain going and tests the teamwork skills out. Such an accomplishment when you reach the goal. Only negative, although may have added to the virtual reality, is the mould build up under the carpets in the tomb set off my allergies. Needs cleaning or replacing.

Save the world. It's been a nice experience choosing Armageddon. We were only in two, so had to work even harder, but still enjoyable. I would say it is recommended to try and would like to try other puzzle games.
Fun and challenging. First time trying something like this. Very challenging, but also very fun! The host speaks English quite well and was nice.

You must try escape games!. Locked in a basement? In a foreign country? You have to solve puzzles to get out? At first I was a little skeptical. I am so glad we tried this. It was a blast for the three of us (two adults and one kid). Daniel (self-proclaimed "hardest working man in show biz") was really great. He provide just enough info to get us starting without spoiling anything. Each person could contribute with their unique skill set to solve the series of problems. And he was very friendly and had a positive spirit. We loved it so much that we went back later the same day to try to escape from another room.

This is a must do!!. Spent a great weekend with my daughter in Budapest and we finished it off by completing one of Traps puzzle escape games (Secret of the Tomb).FANTASTIC!! No other word for it.I had the usual thoughts of "What if we can't escape"???Don't worry........if you do or you don't, you will have so much fun in the process it won't matter.Don't be frightened to ask for clues. It's not easy!!Thank you TRAP!
Armageddon and midevil rooms . First experience with trap rooms, both of these were excellent experiences. Difficult but not unfairly so. Friendly staff. A great way to spend an hour with friends

Great fun for adults and kids as well!. I played the Egyptian room with two teenager boys and had a great time exercising our brains in solving the puzzles. The boys absolutely loved it and found it a nice break from sight seeing. Highly recommended.

Perfect for exercising the brain!. For the first ten minutes, I wasn't sure I'd made the right choice in coming but I stuck with it and had a very good time. Fortunately, I was with people that have far greater maths skills than me, something that is needed to escape the Egyptian room. It was a quiet day so we played the Medieval room, which was more physical and my sort of thing. We did have to rely on the man who worked there to give us some hints sometimes and he was very helpful. Each room takes about an hour so it's easy enough to fit into anyone's itinerary.

Fun activity that's a little different. We had a great time at TRAP. The premise of solving a series of logic puzzles to escape from a themed chamber is well documented already, so we just wanted to add our voice to the weight of recommendation. The staff are friendly and helpful. Just to explain us giving four rather than five out of five, as a pair this was a relatively expensive 45 minutes, and the Egyptian theme was starting to show signs of wear.

Great puzzle! . We did both the Egyptian room and the Medieval room. The Medieval room was my favorite. Challenging yet logical. The Egyptian room was a bit more outside the box but also enjoyable. Host was very helpful and welcoming. Great place to spend an hour of fun!

Great fun. This was our first experience with escape rooms and we loved it! The Medieval room was really well done. The Egyptian room was also good but needs some repair and maintenance. Staff was kind and friendly.

Fantastic fun. Had so much fun in the trap room, will do it again when I return.
I would recommend this to anyone.
Brilliant.
Lovely staff and great price

Trap Race - Awesome Family/Group Activity. Our family tried the Medieval Trap Game and loved it. It was unlike any game or activity that we had done before. The tasks that we had to find and finish were both fun and challenging. With five of us working at it we finished, but just barely. We all enjoyed the experience so much that we did the Armageddon Trap Game the following day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. And the price was great. We definitely recommend Trap as a great family or group activity.

Loads of family fun. Perfect entertainment for my family - two young adult children and my wife and I. We were able to book same day online (you pay cash there but you can reserve a spot online). We did the egyptian room. Puzzles were challenging enough but not too hard. Only got stuck once or twice and the game controller is watching you to help if you need him. Finished the room in 48 minutes. A great way to spend an hour for only $12,000 HUF.

Very difficult, but lots of fun. This was our seventh escape room and we liked it a lot. The Secret of Tomb was enough tricky and had very different clues than other rooms.Because of heavy rain the room was a little wet and smelly and not so clean. :(
Secret of Tomb - Awesome room!. Very clever and requires both good mental and coordination skills!It's a must for everyone in Budapest.

Last minute visit and definitely worth it. We went as a two as a last minute thing to fill our evening. We chose the escape from serial killers basement. All the puzzles and mind games were well thought out as well as creepy and exciting at the same time.Although we needed little hints but overall we finished within 50mins as we got stuck on some maths questions.

Fantastic fun!. We went in two groups of four and competed against each other - would recommend as this only heightened the feeling of time pressure and competitiveness! The room kept us absorbed for the whole time - we made it out in under an hour feeling very pleased with ourselves - and enjoyed the variety of tasks we had to complete. Everyone was raving about it and we were sorely tempted to go back and do each others' puzzle rooms again! We would all definitely recommend it - one of Budapest's hidden treasures (but not for long!)
TRAP Team Race Against Puzzles - Medieval Room. Loved the Medieval room in Budapest. Well thought out and interesting. The first escape room we exited in time.

Best escape game. Wow, it was a fantastic game!!! The Secret of the Tomb room is great! Our team had so much fun. Thanks for the great entertainment! We are so excited to try the Armageddon next time!

The best Escape room I have ever played. My boyfriend and I are from Canada, and we visited Budapest last summer. We checked out Trip Advisor for recommendations on what to do while we were there, and we stumbled across TRAP. We had no idea what to expect when we came to TRAP, but we left feeling SO EXHILARATED! It was one of the coolest experiences I've ever had. I can't believe how much fun we had being locked inside a room.

SO MUCH FUN. This was so much fun. We had 12 of us and they allowed us to go into two teams of 6. Both the Egyptian and Medieval games were brilliant, I highly recommend them. The guy who was running TRAP that day was a great guy too! Very friendly and a lot of fun.

Brilliant!. First escape game we's ever done so we weren't sure what to expect but it was amazing. We chose the ancient Egypt themed room and it was so much fun, the staff helped us just enough without it getting annoying. Loved that it was quite challenging but that we managed to complete it. Great value for money, especially if you go in a bigger group. Easy to find and a really good way to spend an hour.
Trap escape game. Great activity to do for an hour. Would recommend to anyone who likes puzzles, riddles etc. Requires much more thought than some of the other escape games in Budapest

So much fun. We Tried it 2 couples and had so much fun. It Was hard but quite original. The gamemaster helped alot (to much) but we made it with 11 minutter left. A little dirty but good fun and one of the Best in town.

Great time . This was our second visit to this company so decided to invite another couple along for their first game. We booked Armageddon. Upon arriving we were told that the game was broke (would have appreciated a text or call) and he offered us the tomb game which we didn't want to do. He then made a call to the other game and we were told we could do the Egypt game if we wanted so off we went. We were warmly welcomed by the staff member who actually regocnised me and my girlfriend from before. We entered the game and got on with it. The game itself is fun and at times tricky. It felt authentic and when we needed a little help the staff member helped us with clear advice in good English. I really enjoyed the two games we have done with this company and will go back to do Armageddon when back. Both games have been fun and authentic. The price is a little steep for 2 and is the same even if you take 4 so maybe a reduced price if it's just 2 people but that's my only grumble.

Great fun! Both adults and kids were challenged, but loved it!. We did the Egyptian Room at TRAP with a last minute booking - loved it! The guy that welcomed us was really helpful and friendly. We have never done an escape room before so we were a little slow in getting our heads around some of the puzzles. It was an interesting exercise to do as a family - a few arguments early on before we all ended up working really well together and making it out in time. The room and equipment is a little tired, but I imagine this will happen when so many people have enjoyed this game. We were so pumped when we got out!

Great fun. Four of us competed the Egypt escape room and really enjoyed the experience. The staff member was friendly and helpful. With just one small clue we managed to escape in 52 minutes. I wish we'd have had more time so we could have tried another game but we had a plane to catch... Try it early in your holiday... Booking experience was very easy as I made a mistake initially and had to cancel my slot. This was done using a link from my confirmation email and then one easy click.

All-ages excitement. TRAP is one of many escape rooms in Budapest and it was the only one we visited. Our host was excellent as he prepared us accordingly for our Ancient Egypt escape room and guided us when necessary. The setup was incredible and the experience was so much fun. We enjoyed the escape room experience so much that we booked the Medieval room on our way out and completed it in the evening. Fun for all ages.

Entertaining game, but poor mastery and ambience.. The game was fine. But the smell of damp was really disturbing. The master gave too many tips too quickly so we finished in 40 minutes. Why? Let us at least finish in an hour?

Fun Fun Fun!!!. This was one of my favorite things that my family did in Budapest! We did the Armageddon room, where your goal is not to escape the room but to save the world. Obviously you are reading this right now meaning that we did succeed! The puzzle was challenging, but the attendant knew just when we needed a little hint in the right direction. The attendant was very nice and seemed to really love the game. We finished with 7:44 seconds left so we were never under that much stress but I can see how it could get intense if the time was ticking down. The clues you find all flow together but it wasn't always crystal clear which kept it interesting. This room did have a basement which would be tricky for disabled, pregnant or anyone who would have problems squatting pretty low get into. Also remember that Armageddon and the Egyptian are in one location and the other two are in another!

Just Awesome. Our family of four with two teenagers attempted the Armageddon room and it was like nothing we had done before. We had so much fun attempting to save the world because you really become immersed in the game. We actually managed to save the world, but we still found the game challenging enough for our capable group of four. This was our first time doing anything like this and the Armageddon room was definitely a good fist room to start with. Unfortunately we did it on the last day of our trip so we couldn't try any of the other rooms. We had previously looked at doing something like this in other cities and the hour price at TRAP was the lowest of everywhere we saw. Make sure you reserve ahead of time because the slots fill up and it's not to hard to find and is closest to the Kalvin metro stop. Also, don't be worried about language barriers because it is all in English. Would recommend for everyone.

so much fun! romantic bonding experience. We did the Medieval one, and while it was a little difficult, we figured out all the puzzles before the timer ran out. Super rewarding! All of the puzzles were really well-made and easier to use (unlike this other one that we did which looked like a child made everything)

Fantastic, exhilarating fun and a very memorable experience!. My girlfriend and I did two rooms, Medieval and Egyptian. Both were brilliant in their own ways :) Medieval had a lot of more physical puzzles, requiring moving objects into the right place or manipulating various devices. It felt fun and engaging whilst still requiring logic and puzzle-solving. The Egyptian room on the other hand had a lot more logic puzzles, and I personally enjoyed that a lot more. They were cleverly designed too, with no use of numbers (as fits the setting) and lots of use of Egyptian symbols.I was really impressed qith the quality of fittings and decorations in the rooms. The puzzle set-ups were amazing! Lasers triggers, pressure sensors, giant magnets, etc. So cool!I wish I could erase my memories so I could do this again :D

A great afternoon. My wife and I had a spare few hours before we went to the airport for our flight so we decided to try TRAP which was near our hotel. We tried the Haunted House(?) and really enjoyed our hour. Even better, with a bit of luck and a couple of judicious clues(!) we managed to escape, so we ,left on a high. Highly recommended if you have or haven't done this type of activity before.

Medieval room - Excellent!. If you like puzzles, mazes and stuff like that, this is an unique experience that you can't miss! It was the first time for our group and everything was great! Very nice people receiving us, well-elaborated rooms and a real medieval environment to get in the game! We left the place with the will to try other TRAP rooms!

First time and it was great. we were 2 couple on a weekend break and I booked from home before we left, a good idea, you pay when you arrive. Trap has 2 locations so take care to go to the right one. We did medieval and needed some help to get finished in the time. very friendly staff and very good value, in London it cost £14 a person. We will definitely do another one again.

A true brain testing game !!. My 15 year old son & I arrived feeling confident & excited for a game with a difference. We had a lot of fun although our egos were slightly dented that we took longer than the 60min time limit to solve all the clues . Definitely recommended to get your brain thinking outside the box. It is quite tough but the guy was great at giving hints & very friendly. Excellent for this who like to find an activity with a difference .

Fantastic game!. What a fantastic idea!! Unexpectedly, we were actually quite good at this given we had had 4 hours sleep and a huge hangover! We played the Egyptian game, and had so much fun! The puzzles were brilliant and really made you think. Would definitely play again!

Great fun in Budapest - highly recommend!. My sister and BIL had been to Budapest earlier in the year and had a great time at TRAP and recommended we do it, especially since it was so inexpensive compared to other countries. You pay 12,000 Forint for 2-5 participants...so the more people you have, the per person charge goes down. After my work team did it on Wed night, we enjoyed the challenge so much, 3 of us made reservations again for Friday night and invited 2 Hungarian colleagues (two members of our team had already flown out so weren't available). Each time we did it, they gave us a business card for a 2000 forint discount for the next visit (so net cost of 10,000 forint or $36 USD for our second visit). We gave the two extra cards to our Hungarian colleagues so they could take their friends. It is an game where you're locked in a room and solve puzzles to get access to other rooms and eventually escape. The two games we solved were Secret of the Tomb and Armageddon - both at the Maria Utca location. There are two other games at another location (Egyptian and Medieval). If you're having a lot of difficulty they will give you clues. We had a problem with one of the items in our room and the attendant had to come in and fix it. Overall, we all agreed that we would highly recommend it to others. They give you an hour to solve it...and despite having a very smart group, it took us about 55 minutes the first time and 50 minutes the second time.

Great family fun.. We booked the Armageddon room for our last night in Budapest. The three of us (my wife and son) enjoyed it a lot and were just sorry we didn't have time to try the other rooms. Highly recommended for the whole family.

Hour of Pure Fun. Great way to spend an hour! Fun, exciting and challenging! Me and my girlfriend thought it looked cool and it more than met our expectations!
It was 12,000HUF for the two of us, a bit pricey, but well worth it!

Great fun . Me and my partner wanted to do something fun and non alcohol related for once and decided to book a puzzle.We chose the armageddon mission were we had to activate a launch pad which released the rocket to destroy the huge asteroid hurdling toward earth. You have one hour to complete the puzzle. You do however receive helpful hints to help you on your way.We had so much fun and had not laughed so much in a long time. Would definitely recommend it.

Great fun. My boyfriend and I booked the medieval room before we arrived in Budapest due to the great reviews and it was a highlight of our trip! We'd never done anything like this before and were not sure what to expect but the whole thing was really engaging and a lot of fun. Would definitely recommend it, we'll be on the look out for these games in other cities!

Great way to stretch your mind intellectually for an hour. My friend and I just did the Egyptian room (we're both 25). The room looks great and is well-laid out (I actually spent the first few min taking photos).The Egyptian room required quite a bit of logical and spatial thinking. We only got stuck in one part (we refused to ask for clues). Took us 51 minutes in total. The price is a bit steep at 12,000 forinths if there's only two people, but the price would probably be more reasonable for 4 people.

Very Unique. Had a blast with 3 friends doing this in Budapest. Our group managed to finish in 45 minutes and then were walked through all the tech afterword which was really cool. We were 21 & 22 and we all really enjoyed it so I would highly recommend it to basically anyone who likes to be challenged intellectually. Planning on doing another before we leave as well.
Loved it!. Heard about these escape rooms and had to experience it myself. It was the big surprise of the citytrip! We talked about this experience hours after completion.. That means it was awesome!

Fun new experience - Must do!. This was our first escape game experience and we so loved it! The puzzles to be solved were interesting ( not too difficult but that was fine since there were two young children with us) and the rooms itself were done up well.. Great for first timers, since I heard Budapest had about 200 more of such rooms.

Amazing fun . Myself and two friends attempted the Egyptian room whilst on a city break and I have to say it was the most fun we have had in a long time. Very challenging and brilliantly thought out, the staff are very friendly and on hand to give helpful hints (we needed a fair few!). Although they say you have an hour, within reason they give you as long as you need to get out (we took an hour and 15 minutes). I can't recommend this enough.

Really good fun and challenging. This was a really great activity and was well thought out. It was a great level of challenging but not so frustrating that we gave up. The staff were on hand if needed as well. The rooms are really well thought out and intuitive.Would definitely do another one in the future.

Love Room Escape Games.. Heard about the escape games and seen them on trip advisor.Called to the one on Maria Uta as near by and the host said he could fit us in a few hours so we called back. **book in advance highly recommended we tried a few and all booked up**We did the armogedden room and was four of us and the first room escape we had done. It was fun and challenging. 56minutes it took us. We booked for the next day for the other room and had to have a couple clues which most people seem to need. 55 minutes for this room.Enjoyable and deffo worth a visit for something different.

Awesome! Great fun. Trap was great fun with really friendly staff. We played a couple of ‘Escape Games’ whilst we were in Budapest but for overall experience Trap was the best. We played the Egyptian room and the Medieval room (equipped with tunic!:)) .

Great game!!. Me and my girlfriend did one of the mazes together. It was great, the staff were so nice and did not interrupt too much during the game. It is highly recommended to take 1.5 hours break from the city tour and challenge your minds. It is located in the center so its a walking distance from almost any interesting spot in pest.

Great Fun. We did the Medieval escape room, and I have to say it was quite fun. Also, the staff member who was there at the time, Peter, was very kind and personable. He gave us a nudge in the right direction a few times when we needed it, but otherwise he let us figure it all out for ourselves and enjoy the game.

It is a must!. We were a group of 6 (2 adults and 4 kids from 12 to 16). We devided into two groups of three. One group tried Armageddon and we girls tried Secret of Tomb. We loved it so much that we had to try the other room so after we were done we simply swap rooms for another go. Guys likes Armageddon better but we girls loved Secret of Tomb. I believe a group of three is optimal since everyone must be involved into solving puzzels. Anyway...it is a MUST in Budapest!

Worth every penny. It was loads of fun. If you have time, dont miss this in Budapest. Good thing this is open late in the evening, when other tourist places are closed. Location is very central. These are group activities, so go as a group of friends or family.We had fun, especially my kids. Great way to bond together as a family and have some nice, clean and energising fun.Must do! Experience it!

Excellent, much better than expected. My partner and I visited Budapest in April 2015. She really liked the idea of doing an "escape room" type experience, and I just went along with it for her sake. But I was surprised at how much I got into it.We did the Armageddon game room, which is a new one. Apparently only around 20 groups had done that game before we did it. The story is that there's a meteor heading towards Earth, so the participants of the game have 60 minutes to enable and launch a missile to smash the meteor before the Earth is destroyed.I'll try not to give anything away so as not to spoil it for anyone thinking about trying it, but as an experience think Crystal Maze, but with lots of interconnecting puzzles in a room instead of just one. There's an array of puzzles to do which involve some mathematics, some steady hand movements/ skill, and plenty of logical thinking. When doing the puzzle, you are watched by an observing staff member who is able to communicate clues to you via a small printer and later in the game, a phone (don't worry, I didn't give anything away there, he told us at the beginning there'd be a phone :-)The cost is reasonable, at 12000 HUF (around £30) for the room, and you can have up to 5 players at once. We turned up quite late at night and were able to just walk in and play, but it's best to book in advance on the website. We were slightly concerned that the game would be in Hungarian, but we needn't have been as there wasn't much in the way of text, and the clues were given to us in English.It's quite exciting being against the clock, with some very atmospheric music, and is a great way to spend an hour. There's a great feeling of satisfaction on completing it. A highly recommended attraction.
Well worth a visit!. Our family did the escape the tomb room - it was incredible! It was inventive, creative, challenging thrilling. Definitely go. Would recommend.

loved this game. This visit to Budapest we tried the Armageddon and secrets of the tomb gamesBoth great fun, we managed to solve Armageddon in time but the secrets of the tomb kinda beat us...but only justThe Host was very friendly and helpful It's a little pricey, but i have to say, it was the most fun thing that we did while in Budapest and i would definitely recommend it....but possibly only for a team of two or three...i think any more than that would make the experience less enjoyable.With only two of you, you get to solve all of the puzzles...providing you don't end up throttling each other

Fun, but would not do in a team of 8!. Loved this, I went in a team of 2. The host gave us a good introduction, explained what we needed to know and locked us in. As it is a timed challenge, (1hr) there will be a point where if you are not given a hint (assuming you are behind the clock) you will be unable to finish. Our host displayed excellent judgement on making sure that he did not give the hints too early or late.

Must Go!. It was very fun and interesting. I really recommend to go here and play in this crazy room :)
You must know that each address have different kind of rooms and not all of them together.

Challenging, spooky, frustrating but lots of fun!. This was such a fun experience and something that is out of the ordinary. My friend and I went to the secret tomb and wanted to kill each other by the end of it! This game would be suitable for larger groups as there was a lot we had to do in each of the rooms. The guy in charge was also super friendly.Would highly recommend it.

Awesome time. We had such a great time doing the medieval room that we booked to do the Egyptian room later that night. Both were absolutely fantastic and enjoyed thoroughly by everyone in the group. Peter was a brilliant host and gave just as much or little help as required and was also great for a chat afterwards. Would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Budapest!
Fantastic experience!. Very friendly customer service and such a fun experience. Loved the Egyptian room! Thank you very much ☺

Pleasantly Surprised. Wasn't sure if it was going to be my cup of tea but it was great. My partner and I did the Medieval themed room which was well designed and kept us interested and intrigued to get from clue to clue. Nice as a break from sightseeing and also to get the brain working.

Awesome experience. My friends and I are in our early twenties. It was great fun. Very enjoyable and quite challenging. Help was given when we were stuck (which was quite a lot). They were patient and very helpful. I would recommend to anyone. It was so good, that we then booked to do another one with another company!

Quality setting and quirky puzzles. We were a team of 5 with varying ages from 10-46 and completed the Egypt room challenge. We had an excellent combination of multiple and varied puzzles, requiring good time management, working together and having FUN !Certainly recommend it to anyone ! We are definitely planning to go back to explore the other challenges !

Great fun!. This is a great activity to do while in Budapest. As first I wasn't sure if it was something I would like but once we got started it was so much fun, you really get into it. My girlfriend and I played Armageddon, it's harder with two people but it's possible. Really good fun and gets you thinking. Make sure you go to the correct location for the specific challenge you are doing as there are two different locations (about 20 mins walk apart from each other) I just followed the directions on Tripadvisor but we ended up going to the wrong location. Check the location in your confirmation email.

Fantastic hour of fun in Budapest. My partner and I did the medieval room based on some suggestions from other trip adviser reviews. It was fantastic, we had so much fun. I am a fan of escape game apps so was excited to try it in reality and it didn't disappoint. The room was well designed with lots of different mechanisms, puzzles, etc.We were told they generally take between 55 and 65 minutes to complete so happy to give you a little extra time if need be and if you are a bit stuck you will be given a hint to nudge you along. The staff member on the day was welcoming and helpful.Wish I had stayed long enough in the city to try another.

Good fun for teens and adults. We enjoyed both the Medieval and Egyptian games - our 2 boys, ages 12 and 14 were in their element! Lots of lateral thinking challenges kept us on our toes. Lovely welcome by Peter enhanced the experience.

Saving the world with my family!. We had a fantastic time solving the clues and working together in order to stop the meteor from hitting the earth and destroying mankind!
This exit game was so much fun! If you are thinking of going, definitely do!! The staff is super helpful and makes it very fun!
Room escape. A little bit harder room escape. Google if the concept is unfamiliar. Egypt theme didn't have locks which was nice change.
GOOD. Played Medieval and loved that unlike most other rooms I played it didnt involve too many locks and there was a lot more teamwork involved.

Budapest Trap Rooms. Armageddon. We went in a group of 3. My sisters and I had an amazing time! We were the first group to try this new game and it exceeded all our expectations. It took huge amounts of team work and a combination of physical and mental skills to complete the game. It was a very technical game and we loved it. The staff were really friendly and offered us help when we needed it. We would highly recommend this game to everyone!

Fantastic Team Game...great night out!. The bride to be on our hen weekend organised this for all the girls to do late one evening and advised that it was a little 'surprise'. I must confess I wasn't looking forward to it when we realised what it was. However,we divided into two teams there were 10 of us in total and half went into the Egyptian Room and the others went into the Medieval Room and it was a race against time. Well, what an absolutely fantastic hour we spent, trying to solve all the puzzles in each room. Think of the TV series the Crystal Maze and you will be quite close. The puzzles were challenging and for us getting to know others on our hen weekend it was a great icebreaker as we all had to work together. We all left wishing we could spend another hour in the other room! Whole heartedly can recommend this activitiy. Its perfect for team building events, like ours and family challenge events but I don't think it would be suitable for very young children or those frightened of the dark.

Fun for all. We went with a group and divided ourselves into four groups, so we could try all four rooms. Everyone had a great time, and enjoyed the experience. 2 rooms at each location by the way. Definitely something different and worth trying while you are in Budapest. Friendly guys at both locations.

What a game! such fun!. We booked two rooms, the Medieval and the Egyptian room. We were so excited! And we all really loved itl! The setting in every room is realistic and mind blowing! It's very nice to do it with your friends, you get to know your friends even better. I truly recommend this place!

Fun, fun, fun!!. Tried for the first time in a trip to Budapest with friends and was really amazed by the amount of fun it provided to us!! The puzzles are really well structured, it is hard, but not impossible. I recommend to anyone traveling to Budapest.
Trap team. It was an awesome experience and I wish I could go back to complete the rest of the rooms. I thoroughly enjoyed it and i would recommend it to those who visit to give it a try.

Fab for all ages. I recently took a group of 21 students to Budapest and we did this as one of our evening activities, they were very accommodating of our group and the students loved it (ages 17+). I would highly recommend it for anyone visiting Budapest, Peter was very helpful when we did get a little stuck!!

Definitely do it!. This is a must do for anyone traveling to Budapest, definitely one of our main highlights! We had never done anything like this before so were a little sceptical about if we would like it or not! Now I am already looking up ones to do in London! Just something different and interesting to do! We played as a couple however I can see how it would be good for families and groups! Peter who worked there was amazing so friendly and helpful! I don't know if we would have made it out without his hints! He also recommended where we could spend the rest of our afternoon! We did the Egyptian room which I would recommend doing! We would definitely go back and do one of the other rooms if we were out in Buda again!

Good Family Fun. This was our second escape game and overall, it was fun. My reason for giving it an average review is because there was a malfunction in the room which the guy tried to cover up instead of just admitting that he forgot to put something together so that was a bummer. It cost us a lot of time for nothing so we didn't escape in time.It didn't deter us from having fun but it did put a damper on the game.

Fantastic, very tricky but good fun!. Really enjoyed the medieval trap. Puzzles were intelligent and had us going for a while. Peter was very friendly and helpful if we got stuck. Thoroughly enjoyed the hour and 10 minutes, stuck in the two rooms. Great activity for all! Thanks!

Great time!. Heard about Trap through co-workers, and certainly was pleased! My friends and I recommend this to anyone traveling to Budapest! The puzzles were challenging, fun and made you think... But not too difficult that you wanted to give up. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Two thumbs up!

Amazing team building or family activity. The TRAP escape rooms were the first escape rooms I ever did. I had heard of it before, but I didn't expect it to be THIS cool. The rooms look really awesome and the games and clues are really good. I've done several other escape rooms (in Budapest and Rotterdam) after these but the TRAP rooms are still my favorite so far in terms of the games and the design of the rooms. Perfect for a family or team building activity!
5/5. Had a blast! Would deffinitely recomend. Took us 38 minutes on 'egypt' :) staff was friendly android helpful.
Challenging!. The price/quality was excellent. I went with 4 friends, and we were too excited so our focus was a little bit off. We did manage to finish it with help from "big brother".

A great way to spend an hour in the evening!. My boyfriend and I went here after reading about it on trip advisor. He's really into all those puzzle type games and quiz shows, so I thought it would be something he would really enjoy and I was not disappointed either. We played the Egypt room and found it really fun, apart from not really knowing where to begin and feeling like we were going to spend an hour sitting around, we quickly got the idea and were solving puzzles for almost the full hour. We escaped with 5 minutes to spare. I really enjoyed this and would definitely do it again! At a set rate per team, it's definitely very affordable for larger groups (up to 5 I believe) but we felt that for the two of us the price was about right too. Would recommend this to anyone coming to Budapest!

Different to other escape games we've done. We did the new Armageddon room on our last day in Budapest. We've done several escape rooms in different cities before, and this one was a bit different (for a start you didn't have to 'escape' - instead you had to stop a missile within the time limit). Some of the puzzles were very different to what we've seen before, which was great to see.However, when we booked this we didn't realise it was a new game that very few people had played so far, and there was some refinement needed. We did it as two people (the smallest team so far) and completed the mission quicker than any other team so far (with 20 minutes to spare)! Many of the things in the rooms were not used in the puzzle, and afterward the game master told us these haven't been developed into puzzles yet. I think once these have been incorporated into the game it will be an excellent experience. I only wish we had been aware of how new the game was before we went as we would have picked a different room.The owner was very nice and gave us a discount as we completed it so quickly. He also asked for our feedback and any recommendations to make the experience better - so it's clear they care about developing this room into something great. I'd be really interested to try the other well-established rooms if I went back to Budapest.The price is fixed at 12,000 HUF no matter how many people take part. We're used to paying around £30 per person so this was very cheap to us!

Armageddon - worth of 5 stars. we took Armageddon with my boyfriend and it was great! We would recommend this to everyone! one thing I really enjoyed was, that this was not so spooky and there weren't any scary moments in this game (like many escape rooms have..) :)

Would have given it more than 5 starts if I could . WOW!!
This s just awesome!
1 hour of games and riddles, just like in the computer games.
I took my wife there and she thought she'll just hang back and let me enjoy.
She turned out to solve half the puzzles, and we both enjoyed it tremendously!

loved the egyptian room. This was my second escape game. I rate it as my favourite. There were just enough puzzles and a few little surprises along the way. Crawling through the tunnel was so much fun and there are some really coool tricks along the way. This is my favourite games so far. It was very good value too.
One hour of challenge and fun. Great team orientated challenge and an unusual way to get you mind working. Awesome fun! Can't wait to do it again.

First time, not the last. This was our first ever exit game and certainly won't be our last. We had an absolute blast in the Mediaeval room, and whilst at times we can wanted to pull our hairs out trying to solve different puzzles we had such a huge satisfaction completing it. Innovative, interesting and so much fun! Must do for all!

Great end to the night. At the last minute, we booked the last of the evening slots and weren't disappointed. We didn't know what to expect, but it was fantastic. We even got help, because we were terrible puzzle solvers! You don't have to be a genius to do it either. A must in Budapest.
Friends Teens. My daughter had a farewell party we took her with friends to the place they enjoyed a lot , thank you for a boy how was work there he help them , and he was very helpful

Great fun. We've been there with company. Suits very nice as a team-building event. There are two rooms in one location so we had two teams competing against each other. I'd say it's good to have at least 3 persons per room. We had 4 and 5 which made things a bit easier for us.Tasks are fun, time flies very quickly. In case you get stuck they'll give you hints. Imho it was just in right proportion for us - not too many hints (so it's still challenging), but does not leave you desperate either.

Must-do for adventure game fans. We went to the Egypt trap as a group of colleagues, who didn't know what was waiting for them. All were really excited. As the challenges are so different to each other, it is good to have people with different talents in the team. Everyone can contribute to solving the puzzles. I must admit we got some help when we got a bit stuck, but just so much that we could continue on our own. The guy spoke fluently English and was very friendly. I can recommend this to anyone! And don't be scared of getting claustrophobia. You can get out at any time in case you should feel 'trapped'. Our other team did the Medieval trap and it was fun to see how different the games were to each other. I'd definitely come again to try out the other traps.

hysterical fun. we visted here in February and it was fantastic. they werent too busy so they let us stay in the room until we had finished. The guide was english speaking and helped us (quite a bit) we were rubbish! it was hard though. Brilliant and wanted to do another room but ran out of time. We did the Tomb

Fun time . This was new for us. After walking by it a couple of times and reading about it here, we booked it spontanously and had a really good time. Nice koncept, we will certainly try it again another time.
More people - more fun. My advice, take more people with you, you will need more hands and brains :) Thank you, for great time. It is so much fun.

Great experience!. Myself and two friends tried the 'Secret of the Tomb' challenge and we absolutely loved it! It was the first time we'd tried an escape game and are keen to do another one already! It's hard to explain what's involved as I don't want to ruin it but you have various challenges and then you unlock new rooms with padlock codes that you have to work out etc. It involves maths, logic and teamwork! We escaped with 1 minute to go but did have some hints! I would highly recommend this to anyone - a great, unique experience.

Amazing experience!!. I did the medieval room, there were 2 of us and at first we thought we needed more people but no matter how many people are in each team it's still a fun experience and something so different!! I would definitely recommend it to absolutely anyone! The staff are lovely too and helpful without giving the game away! Best activity we did in budapest by far!!!

What an experience!!!!. Went to Budapest for my 30th birthday celebrations with friends and thought this sounded like fun- one group member had played the following year so knew a bit about it. What can I say really other than we had booked for one room and ended up doing 3!! Throughly enjoyed them all in different ways, very well done and the people like Peter (at pauley road trap) was really lovely from the minute we got there, advising us where to go for lunch and booking the other games! There were new rooms being created and I cannot wait to get back to test them out!!!

Medieval room. My girlfriend and I visited trap room while we were in Budapest and had a fantastic time. The puzzles were very creative and varied in the was you need to adapt your thinking to complete the puzzles. We needed a few hints and completed the take but it took slightly longer than the hour. I would highly recommend and if I go back will certainly try one of the other rooms. The host was very helpful.

Try it . Trap is such a fun, unique way to spend a few hours - something you have to try at least once. It's an excellent bonding experience if you're in a group of new people. After visiting the trap in Prague, this one was the better/more fun one. Staff were great.

Class. Mint. Pap. Secret tomb trap room was amazing, enjoyed all the puzzles from start to finish! Really recommend that you visit this when you are in Budapest. Great value for money and staff friendly and helpful when we struggled to work some bits out. Carlos Moya.

This one is a real challenge!!!. Our family of three, including a teenager, have become drawn to these escape rooms over the last year or so, and have completed a few in different cities.TRAP is definitely the best so far - much more professional than others, and all very much about applying logic and working things through. We did the Medieval Room first, and then a couple of days later did the Egyptian Room. For us, this was definitely the right order as we found the Egyptian Room much more difficult. These two rooms are in a basement on Paulay Ede Utca, which is easy to find. The set-up is friendly but business like - we dealt with two different members of staff on our two visits and both were exceptionally helpful.Not going to lie - we did need nudging in the right direction on a couple of occasions, but that help was given in a way where we weren't provided with the answer, rather that questions were asked which made us see what we'd missed, so we were able to still feel lots of satisfaction when we finished.Make sure you go with people who like to be a team - you really need to be able to work together. You'll love it!!!!!!!Tip: Tell them if you're planning on going back to do a second room - they'll give you a discount card for 2000 forints (app. £5) off....every little helps!

Highlight of our holiday. Over the course of five days in Budapest we tried three room escape games, two of which were at TRAP. We pre-booked the Egypt room for our first day in the city and haven't got a single complaint. All four of us loved it, to the extent that we soon went back to book the medieval room as well. The staff were very nice, welcoming and helpful, and offered us a discount on our second game after completing the first. Both rooms were very different, inventive, and well decorated. I would certainly go to TRAP again!

Complete by faith, not force. . This was our second one. We did secret tomb. It was fun! It's difficult, but we were able to finish. Many puzzles to solve. 2 or more recommend, 3 is best. The staff was great and helpful when we needed a nudge. Highly recommended!!!

Best we've tried so far. My friends and I did Medieval and Egypt. We've done quite a number of room escapes so far, and TRAP games seem to be on a whole other level entirely. Now we're feeling depressed about possibly not being able to find something of comparable quality. Really, the 11 stages we went to before TRAP hardly come close. If it's your first time doing an escape room, this is a safe bet that you'll have loads of fun.
I love escape rooms!. Well worth a visit. 2 of us played the egyptian and medieval rooms at the Pauly Ede site and they were very well made rooms with good puzzles and friendly staff. Alot of fun.

Tougher than Prague but still fun. Visited with my fiancée and did the lost tomb game. Having escaped the Prague TRAP we were excited to give it a go in Budapest.The idea of all these games is you are locked in a room or series of rooms and must defeat all kinds of logic style puzzles to escape. Think Crystal maze. This time we didn't make it out in the 60 minutes alotted, so I write this review from inside having been trapped for 2 days now. In all seriousness these are good fun but can be a test of a relationship. I recommend going in a group to this particular escape room as it required some maths skills which both my partner and I struggle with under pressure.Still fun and worth the time and money as its different to anything else out there.

100% recommend!. First of all, I wasn't entirely sure about this as I thought I'd feel literally trapped but my partner wanted to do it so I gave in and we went on down.When we arrived, the staff there were truly amazing people, so nice and asking how we was, where we wwere from and stuff and instantly put me at ease. It was extremely reasonably priced and was soooo entertaining! The rooms are expertly devised and up to such a high standard. If you need clues they will help and can get let out whenever you feel necessary. We completed it successfully after a couple of little arguments! As he was wrong a couple of times but regardless, we did it! Honestly, if you have a spare couple of hours, definitely do not miss this out, was such a fabulous experience!

Amazing time, spent in TRAP. WOW, this was something! The Egyptian and Medieval rooms are just fantastic! If you are in Budapest and you like playing escape rooms this is definitely your choice. Great game with great puzzles and tasks. Very well done design! Great atmosphere! Esciting story behind the game! Supportive staff! High level overall and tons of positive emotions after playing in TRAP Budapest

Super experince. It was our third visit to Budapest, and every time we booked one game in TRAP. The Tomb Room was fantastic, we had really very exciting experience. The puzzles are very interesting and exclusives. Must to visit in Budapest.

Great fun. Went with two friends and did the Egypt room. The puzzles were well thought out and good fun. Would recommend no more than 3 people as this way we could all get involved in every puzzle. With more than that you may find that you split up and tackle separate things. Would highly recommend as a good way to spend an hour in Budapest.
Loved it!!!!. Me and my husband did the Egypt room- it was a wonderful experience and I wish we could do more rooms- we had a lot of fun and we recommend it

Brilliant Fun. Done my first trap in Budapest (2013) with 2 teams of 3 Blokes and went back the next year with my wife and 3 teenage kids. Both time utterly fantastic time your blood races and your heart beats faster. Great fun for all the family and the people were Very helpful. Would not hesitate to recommend these people.
Fun workout for your brain. Medieval room was lots of fun. Room is perfect for 4 person teams. All quests are handmade wood & iron in a proper medieval style. Definately worth a visit.

We Stopped the Bomb!. Four of us, aged about 20 to 60, did the Bomb Trap. One of us was reticent to join, but the welcome from the guy running it, and the immediate challenge to the grey cells soon got everyone really enjoying it. A lot of red herrings, so it is east to discount a real clue - fortunately the camera observing guy offered a few small clues at just the right time, so we got to the bomb with seconds to spare when one of us had a brainwave and typed in the right codeword! It was exciting, great fun and since we managed it, gave a good sense of achievement. We were lucky there was nobody waiting so we were allowed to go just a few minutes over the hour as we were so near to solving the final puzzle. I recommend it to almost everyone!

So much fun!. Because of the group limit we split up in to 2 groups. I went in with 2 other friends in to one of the original rooms and we went in not knowing a thing. Admittedly it took us a while to get the hang of things but after a while we got stuck in and had a blast.We only needed a few hints throughout the same, a lot of it was skill and sheer luck but we managed to get out in the time limit with seconds to spare!It's a fun and challenging game, a lot of red herrings to put you off and make you over-analyse the place, but it's all part of the fun. I'd definitely go back again just to play in more of these rooms as the price was very cheap to play for the experience you get :)
Great fun. This was enjoyable with a good mix of easy and very tricky tasks.Took us a while to get into the mindset.

great experience.. Me and my wife went to the 'Trap' attraction on our visit to Budapest in December 2014.We had a great time.Kinda resemble a mission taken from the amazing race.You have few puzzles and for each one you solve you get a clue/key for the next one.There are 2 rooms, the medieval room and Egypt room. We did the medieval room.If you have time, i suggest to go through both rooms. If you are riddles lovers, It is highly recommended.
Good fun day out. Great time at TRAP. Not sure what we expected but it was fun, the theme wasn't too strong though. Would like to try a different one some time!
Very fun. We were group of four and played mediaval game. It was really fun and challenging but no too complicated. It was very interesting design of rooms.
Fun but expensive. The trap race was fun but the price/quality is disproportionate. When you are with 4 people you have to pay around 10 euro per head.

Egyptian TRAP - excellent.. Visited on a cold Sunday afternoon - nice guy In charge and we did this room as a couple - eventually worked out several clues and with a little help managed to find our way out and work out the puzzles. Think .... Crystal Maze meets Indiana Jones and you won't be far out ! .... It does involve much moving of blocks / pieces and enters into hidden rooms and passage ways but all done very well.A good hour spent and tested the old brain cells for a bit !

Amazing idea and experience. No where else in the world does escape rooms like Budapest, I have been here twice now, and completed the Medieval and Egyptian room. Well worth the money and can't be explained in words. So you have to see it for yourself. I was curious how it would work but it is completely safe and achievable you just need to think logically. Suitable for all ages I took my 8 year old brother to the Egyptian room and he loved it. A must do to break the monotony of sightseeing.

Medieval Trap. Reasonably Priced activity, got us out of the cold. Not too difficult but complicated enough to be challenging. Well decorated and imaginative. The guy is lovely who runs TRAP, he gave us hints when we were really stuck and gave us tips of where to visit during our stay. There are three rooms all together, we'd definitely try the others if we returned to Budapest. We'd also look for other TRAP like activities on other trips.
Very nice. We did the bomb room. The puzzle were very tricky but if you are stuck the employee is there to help you out. It was a very nice and fun experience.

Escape rooms.... We ended up doing 2 escape rooms on our first day in Budapest and that set the fun tone for the rest of the trip. They were fun for a 13 and 19 year old plus some adults. We recommend them!

Fantastic. Have never done anything like this and it was an hour well spent! Though it was not physically demanding, we were totally exhausted afterwards. Very ingenious devices that had to be solved. Liked the idea of being locked in a room without any instructions and from there try to solve a number of riddles and ingenious devices to get the key and get out! RECOMMENDED and fits 10-80 years!

Lots of fun. One of the best thing our trip was this game. We played "bomb room". So excited, interesting puzzle. we were two family with kids. Kids also loved game and sometimes really helped us. Unfortunately we didn't try other options. If you have time and go winter season try all games. Really good..

good fun!. Went as a family of 4, age range 13 to 49. This was our first time playing this sort of game so we didn't know what to expect. The staff were helpful and the puzzles themselves interesting and varying in difficulty. There was enough variation in the types of puzzles to keep us all involved and amused. We managed to complete it just within the time allowed with a lot of laughter and teamwork. Great fun and we would definitely go again to try a different game.
