What a blast!. 5 of us went here on a whim and it turned out to be the talk of the trip. I highly recommend trying the Tomb! Good luck!!!
great escapes and having fun. It was just a fun time, a fun time to share the puzzle with my children then talk about it often later in the trip

Amazing fun. Went with our family ages 10-50 and all participated and had a great time! The clues are not language dependent so language not an issue at all. All left feeling we wanted to solve another mystery! Great fun!

Crystal maze in the middle of Hungary. This was a christmas present for my boyfriend but we both had a great time. It was do much fun and a real challenge. It was a brilliant way to spend an hour and we felt really chuffed with ourselves after. The medieval room was brillusnt, a real recommendation.The place gets really busy so book up as soon as you can.Definitely find time in your Budapest schedule tovisit TRAP.

Escape rooms - where it all began. We had experienced escape rooms in other cities and were keen to do them where it all began. We were not disappointed. We played the Medieval room and the Bomb Room and enjoyed them both. There was not much of a story line - a bit more with the Bomb room, but both had good puzzles that required team work. This is a favorite activity for my teenage sons but something we all enjoy. Also very well priced compared to other cities.
Awesome!!!. That was one of the best hours in Budapest. Great way to have fun with friends and use your brain on many different ways.

Great way to spend an hour (or two). Lots of fun and quite challenging. Must work together as a team (which of course can in itself be the biggest challenge depending on team composition), and help is given if necessary (a real love-hate relationship develops with the voice on the loudspeaker..). Great break from video games and everyone can contribute as the logical solutions are arrived at in various ways. Accent is on thinking with some trial and error. Cant find better value for time and money. Nice staff.
Crazy fun!. What a weird, wild, wonderful experience!! We solved the tricks within the final 30 seconds, by some miracle. I want to try them all!

Great way to spend an hour. What a great attraction! We decided to book the Egyptian Room, you need to book in advance probably before you get to Budapest. The room was great fun and we were only given help when we really needed it and then it was just enough to progress in the game. Myself and my husband solved the room in just about hour. As a child of the eighties, this was all my childhood dreams of the crystal maze realised. Would certainly reccomend it to anyone, families, couples, friends and I will look forward to visiting other TRAP locations in future city breaks. Amazing.

Awesome!. First time and what a great time we had! We were 4 and completed the medieval game in 52 mins! We really had a good time and a good laugh. It's a great way to use your brain and have fun at the same time. If you visit Budapest you should definitely try one of those games.

Great fun. We did this activity twice because it was great fun for the family. It was very interest trying to guess things and having to work together as a family. The staff are excellent and make the experience fun.

So much fun!. Great puzzles and really makes you get your brain into gear! If we had been staying longer we would have gone to the other room the next day. Can't wait to go back. We were only two and almost escaped :( . A group of 3-4 would be better.
Best escape game. Trap has been the best escape game which i tried (I tried a lot). We were in room Bomb and Tomb. It's not too hard but not easy either. Very clever. We have a lot of fun there.
The Trap. Was tons of fun. Great for first timers. If you're a curious person you'll love it. If you're in Budapest for a few days I recommend it.

Worth the money. Having never done anything remotely like this, we went in with no expectations, and even with some trepidation! However, once we arrived, and were in the room, it took us a little while to figure out what the first step would be. Once you solve the first, the others begin to fall into place. We had one or two hints from our guide Rudy (they can see and hear you through AV equipment) and managed to get out in 58 minutes. I think this is a clever idea and would be great for families to develop team-working skills. Two thumbs up! (By the way, I have a fear of closed spaces, but this was large enough to not bother me at all)
Fun!!! . We had a absolutely fun time! This is a must if you want to do something fun while in Budapest! I wish we had more time because we would like to do it again!!

Various challenges in a nice setting. The decoration of the place is very authentic - attention to detail is good. We were constantly monitored and helped where necessary, although the challenge is really manageable with little or no help. Interesting and various tasks, kept us busy for 50 minutes. Our teenage kids enjoyed it as well. (Not just math and logical puzzles, needs creatity and other skills too.) Really would recommend for anyone trying an escape room for the first time.
Awesome. Had a really good time - just my mother and I. Good fun mad value for money. Will certainly come back or open up in Copenhagen!

Brilliant way to spend an hour. My partner and I visited TRAP Budapest in December 2014 and I couldn't think of a better way to spend an hour than to take part in one of the puzzles they have available. We did the Tomb puzzle and thought it was excellent. Very difficult in places however Peter, the host, was very helpful in giving us tips and clues to help us escape. I would definitely recommend it to people of all ages and only wished we'd had the time to go back and do one of the other rooms! 10 out of 10 from us!

Went down a bomb. We found the easiest way to locate the Trap , was take the blue line to Kalvin Ter. Then along Baross , turning left on Maria U. It is about 20 metres on the left after crossing Krudy Lane, there are some nice little Pubs on this lane.We arrived on time and our game, the bomb; was ready for us. The game was to disable a bomb in 60 minutes, finding clues and performing tasks in the correct order. With four in our team , thirty minutes just flew by; urgency was of the essence but we were starting to get the hang of the designers mindset after a couple of prompts from the organiser who plots your progress on cctv .Once we had disabled the bomb our second task was to decipher clues to enable us to leave the room , in total the game took a extremely enjoyable 90 minutes and at £20 for a team of four was great value for our money.Due to being a group of four, We spent quite a bit of time in the bar afterwards working out the order of the clues , who had found what and how we had completed the tasks.Well done Trap for a great afternoon !

Great fun!. We had a fantastic time in Trap. We did the Medieval room and enjoyed it enough to want to go back.If you're in Budapest there's plenty to do hut please find an hour to try out an escape room.

Great fund with young or old. Done both rooms with the family and can only highly recommend it! The guys looking after us were friendly and helpful, we had a great hour (and a bit more as we couldn't solve the puzzle within the time limit)..

Our Second Visit!. We have done both the Egyptian and Medieval puzzles and enjoyed both although we preferred the Medieval one. Really sorry that I can not remember the name of the guy who looked after us but he remembered us from earlier in the year and he tracked our previous experience and organised a discount for us. Great value for an hour of fun and frustration. Well worth a visit! Thank you! Jason & Julie x

Really good fun. There were only two in our team and we did the Egyptian room. Had been recommended by our nephew who had completed one of the other rooms on his visit to Budapest a few months earlier. Got off to a bit of a slow start as we had never done it before but once we got into the swing of it we did pretty well. There is help on hand if you get stuck but so long as you remember that pretty much everything is there for a reason you should be able to get on okay. It was really good to do something different. The price you pay is per team so the more you have the better value it is. They also give you a special price if you want to come back and complete one of the other rooms. Just a note of warning that it is built into the basement level so the wooden steps go down into the building and are a little steep if you struggle with stairs. Really good fun though.

Nice time. We had no idea for this kind of games and we found it by luck in tripadvisor .We was not expecting much but at the end we found out that is a very funny way to spend one hour .Very good for people that like puzzle and adventure games
We did it!!. Superb! Loved the puzzles but most loved that we solved them!:) very friendly staff,and very efficient hints. Would deffinitely recommend to visit!

really nice and different !. really surprised by TRAP it was really nice, really closed from the city center. we did the egyptian and medieval rooms, the 5 of us prefered the egyptian room, go for it !
their web site is reallz easy, book in advance.
all explanations are in english :)

Loved it. Would recommend to anyone. We played the Medieval, Egypt and Secret Tomb games within our 3 day stay in Budapest.
What a great way to spend an hour!

Great fun, something different, highly recommend it!!!. Had a great time trying to solve all the puzzles in the Bomb Trap room. Staff were very good talking us through everything at the start then giving us a wee help when we got a bit stuck. Highly recommend giving Trap a visit, good value and will only take just over a hour of your time in Budapest.

Don't miss out.... My friend and I decided to do this during some free time we had in Budapest. Their website was extremely easy to navigate to make a reservation. It was a bit creepy walking down the street at night but there was no need to be scared... we were greeted happily by the team that was running it and their english was excellent. The rooms were clean, safe and well laid out. The puzzles completely doable but still challenging. We were laughing and giggling and thinking and problem solving. It was really interesting out we worked together as a team.. my friend was excellent at some things I wasn't and vice versa... I would HIGHLY recommend TRAP and their escape rooms!

Best entertainment. We visited the Trap Team Race in Budapest in November, and we have ordered the medieval-game from home. This is important as it is difficult to play this because of many reservations. Just be aware that there are two adresses. We showed up at the wrong address, but a 10 minute walk from there is the other one, and they waited for us.The game lasts an hour, but you hardly don't notice that. You are very well entertained, and there are plenty of tasks to solve, so that you have to be sharp all the time. The staff are also very good to help, if you need that in order to get to next case.We were only two, and we finished the game in one hour and 2 minutes. This was one of the funniest things we did in Budapest - so if you need a break from sightseeing, this is the perfect idea.
Simply Awesome. Intense and good. Play tricks on your mind and work it.Reminded me of the movie "Saw", minus the gore.
Great Fun. Us four 50 somethings decided to give this a go for some fun. Well, we were totally useless, but it was great fun and we did finally get out!!!. I would recommend TRAP to all.
Budapest City Central is a lovely place!. We liked almost everything. The location and the staff are nice. Its an optimal variant for the couples without children.

Good but Frustrating!. We really enjoyed this attraction as it was different and made you really think about what you were doing. It was a great team work builder even if my boyfriend and I disagreed on our approach to the tasks sometimes!! Well worth a visit, good value for money and an enjoyable way to pass an hour in the city

A must to do in Budapest. We went two in to the Medieval Room. It was so funny and full of positive emotions. We solved all puzzles within an hour, but got some good hints from the staff.
Next time will definitely try another room (or maybe two) - they have 4 different one currently.
Thanks for everything for such a good experience!
Really fun way to spend an afternoon!. Ths was a great experience, the whole game was really well thougth out, and the staff were really helpful. Highly reccomended

So good we did it twice . We booked this after seeing on trip advisor and loved it. It was completely different to the usual sight seeing attractions on a city break and was fun for a group of friends. We booked quite last minute online and had good communication via email to confirm our booking. Staff were friendly and helpful and helped when needed without giving the game away to easily.We did the medical room first which took us the full hour and then had that much fun we decided to come back the next day and do the Egyptian room which we found more challenging. We would defiantly recommend to others and would go back to do the others and plan on visiting a similar escape place here in the uk shortly.

A fun activity for group of friends. We visited the medieval room and it the decoration was amazing. We were a group of four and everyone had to help a little to find our way out. I liked that the stuff wasn't interfering unless you asked them to, which we didn't :).We managed to escaped and we loved the puzzles. When the game was finished they let us take a lot of pictures using the props of the room.

Good laugh . I went in the summer with some friends and we had a go at the bomb room which we did terrible at! Was good fun trying to think outside the box, you see the true side of your friends in there haha!
Well done!. There are less good escape game places in Budapest. I have tried several and it was my favourite one. There are tasks that require your logic and some physical skills, too.
Best Team Building Activity Ever!. The TRAP in Budapest is sooo cool and definitely recommendable! Perfect as team building, would always do it again!!

Good way to spend an hour.. Haven't been in one of these before. Good feeling when we worked out the clues. Four people in room. Took one hour fifteen mins with just a tiny bit of help. Usually our long but there was no one waiting to go in so Peter let us finish the game

Great fun for friends, family, etc.. My friends and I, all postgraduate students in our mid-twenties, decided to try TRAP on our last night of holiday in Budapest. We had SO MUCH FUN doing it! The staff was incredibly helpful and welcoming. They gave us tips without pushing us along or ruining the game. It was difficult in the beginning but we quickly got the hang of things. Not only was this a fun way to give our livers a break from all the drinking we had done but we also bonded and learned a lot about each other. Definitely suggest TRAP for your visit to Budapest!

Fun little attraction. Wasn't expecting this at all.. It's quite slow when it starts and you do think you don't have time to get out but once you work out what to do it becomes fun!We spent the whole hour in the Egyptian room and had lots of fun. The two men there were also lovely and they were there if you got stuck at all.Highly recommended would definitely go again
Intense fun. I rarely focus for more than a moment but this was fifty minutes of intensely focused puzzle-solving. Really clever challenges and unnerving atmosphere. Try it, it's awesome!

Traptastic!!!. I went to TRAP with my boyfriend in November. I had never done anything like this before and was a bit unsure at first, but quickly got into the spirit (even wearing the medieval robes for the medieval-themed room). The rooms were quite difficult and we got stuck a couple of times, but staff were really good at giving helpful tips that did not give it all away and we were able to complete it in our own time (as there was no one playing straight after us). It was loads of fun and really exciting when you got the puzzles. I felt like I was in a real-life Crystal Maze! I would thoroughly recommend this to anyone who is in Budapest, it was one of the highlights of my trip!

Had a great time!. This was our first time doing a puzzle room and we loved it. It was only the two of it, so it was difficult. The staff was great though--giving us hints and not rushing us. No one was booked in the time slot after ours, so they let us continue playing for as long as it took to get out of the room. We would definitely go back and try another room--we did Egypt but would love to try all the others!

Secret of The Tomb - A Great Time Was Had By All!. While spending Thanksgiving in Budapest, my wife, our 15 year-old son, and I visited TRAP - Team Race Against Puzzles, and had a really great time! We attempted The Secret Of the Tomb at the Maria Utca location. Peter, our host, was very polite, friendly, and thorough; the establishment itself was clean and well cared-for. The puzzle room presented just the right amount of challenges for the hour-long quest, and each element of the puzzle called for different types of skill and reasoning. In the end, with a little bit of help from the voice in the wall (Peter), we escaped with just 30 seconds on the clock. Because of the way the puzzles were built, each one of us had ample opportunity to contribute to our escape, and we all had a blast! As proof, we are here for just three days, and have already made plans to back again before we leave, to try our hands at another puzzle room... perhaps the Bomb Room. Enjoy and Good Luck!NOTES: Great for families and small groups of friends. Peter mentioned that businesses bring employees here for team-building - what a great idea! There is some low-ceiling duck/watch your head area, but for the most part, any reasonably mobile child or adult should have no problems.
1 hour of fun!. our small team (2) had great fun in the medieval room, not that easy to start but then you get into the game and would like even more ! I would really recommend it.

Try the Egypt Room. This is the second puzzle room I have tried. It's a ton of fun, definitely worth the 12000 forint. My only caution is that the Egypt room is not appropriate for older adults who have trouble bending down/crawling. You have to go through a tunnel to complete the puzzle - which is a bit close quarters.
Great time.. For a group this was a great way to spend some time. We had a ton of fun, and laughed lots. If you are looking for something to do when in Budapest, I recommend TRAP.
A must in Budapest. Only when you try it will you understand why it is the top attraction in Budapest. Thats all i want to say.

THE THING TO DO IN BUDAPEST. If you have one thing to do in budapest on your trip you must try it if you are with a group of friends.We enjoyed it thoroughly as it was our first puzzle experience it was not that easy to solve but very exciting really

My first room escape! and not my last one :). We were a few days in Budapest with 2 friends and I follow TripAdvisor on the best atracction to do in the city. What a surprise !!! This is so much fun working together to escape the room!I really recommend it ! We had so much fun escaping the Medieval room that we booked directly and did on the same day the Egypt room! Lots of surprise awaits you !

Great fun!. Me and my group of ten friends visited this event and tried the Egypt and the Medieval trap rooms. We had a great time, the puzzles was difficult enough to give us a real challenge, and the hour flied by before we even knowed it. We would absolutly reccommend this!
Cant wait to go again!. 3 of us had a great time solving the puzzles and working together. It was a fun adventure! The people working there were very friendly

Really good fun. Myself and my sisters travelled to Budapest for a short break. We saw the reviews and thought this was something that would appeal to us. We did this on the first day we arrived. We did escape from the tomb. It was great fun. The host there was very friendly and helpful. The games were fun and a bit tricky to work out but gave a great sense of satisfaction when you got one. The host also gave us a help at a few stages were we were a bit stuck. Would certainly recommend as an activity.

Brilliant!. I booked the egyptian room as a surprise for my parter for his birthday. It was difficult but manageable within the hour for just the two of us. Brilliant stimulating fun. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Definitely will go again the next time we visit Budapest.
Out of the box good time. Had a wonderful time at Trap2. Went with my friend, it took us an hour to get out, Peter was helpful when we needed it . . . .would certainly go again and recommend.

Do something a little different. Great fun. We reserved this event for our last day in the City which fortunately was the only wet day and so good to do this indoor activity. Just two of us played and we had no idea what to expect but you really get to work as a team and the joint satisfaction when a puzzle is successfully solved is very gratifying. If you love puzzles you will be in your element but if you struggle the organisers give you hints to help you progress through the game. You have one house to escape a room by solving the puzzles.

Great fun . I definitely recommend you try at least one escape room if you are in Budapest. The medieval room was brilliant and so much fun. The puzzles are well thought out and the excitement of completing a task and getting the next clue is ace. Me and my friend completed it in just over an hour and we loved every minute. Ruby, our guide, was lovely and only had to give a couple of hints :-)
Very nice experience. A nice overall experience. The staff was very friendly and the game was interesting, difficulty mediocre, we did the medieval room

Super fun!. We were a group of 5 friends and we had a lot of fun! We did the medieval game, the puzzles are challenging but still doable. Really good way to spend one hour, really recommend it! And if you get stuck they will give you tips :)

Excellent experience! . We went for the medieval rooms and was so amazing! Just like being on the crystal maze! Had so much fun and we completed it (with 2 people) in 52 minutes! Can't recommend it enough, if we were in the city longer we would have definitely done another! And I will be coming again whenever I manage a trip back!

Absolutely delightful. Group of 8 guys we did the Egypt and medieval rooms and all had an excellent time, we found the puzzles highly entertaining and very stimulant of the mind, even slightly arousing. Recommend this to anybody visiting the city.

Best experience and highlight of my trip to Budapest. What a great way to spend an hour in Budapest, though they were very kind and extended my game both days until completion. Loved the Medieval Room, so much fun and really flowed, was less keen on the secret of the tomb as struggled with the codes and the fishing hook task, which i found frustrating. Myself and friend needed some hints which they were happy to give. Can't wait to attempt the Egyptian Room on my next visit. Brilliant.
Great activity for all. Brilliant way to spend an hour in Budapest! Really good fun, reminded me a bit of the Crystal Maze activities, and would definitely do something like this again.

Probably the best so far. I've tried a lot of room escape games in Europe but this is the best by far. It's very nice that you need to work as a team and it helps you bond with your colleagues / friends. They also have two separate games so you can go in two teams and race :) try to see who gets the best time.

Wow. We visited after reading the rave reviews on Trip Advisor - something different on a day of sightseeing in Budapest. Won't give anything away but this was a really fun and interesting experience that really gave us an adrenalin and fun packed hour. It's very well ran and the owner explained everything to us before as it was out first time and then took done time after to chat to us about how these rooms all came about. Great

Fun fun fun!. We had a group of 4 and booked the Medieval, it is not too difficult and was lots of fun. Highly recomended. Iwould go again (different room of course and something more challenging for next time!)

OK but easier than expected and quite costly. This was our first time in this type of thing. We went in the medieval room, there was just 2 of us. We got out in 40 mins and could have done it a lot quicker if we had a better understanding of the whole concept. If there were of you it would be over in 20/30 mins. At £40 I found it a bit easy / short and costly. It certainly made us want to try others, but maybe I would look more closely re the difficulty and cost in future.
Oh.....that's great.. If you have 1 free hour in Budapest, you must visit trap immediately! We've been there in Egypt room! Next time we'll try our best in medieval room

Great experience. We went there as a couple and didn't know what to expect. The TRAP-experience in the tomb room was great and challenging with absolutely amazing puzzles. I can recommend it to people who like being challenged and love solving puzzles and riddles. I would definitely do it again!!
good fun. good fun for family or with a small group of friends...was located within the city and the staff was very friendly and helpful...can be costly if only 2 or 3...

Great fun!. Trap room was really great, we did the medieval room, and found it very challenging, but we still got out!
The staff were great too :)

Enjoyable, but very hard!. This was our second escape room in Budapest, and we did enjoy it, but it was very frustratingly hard! Clever ideas again, but a note to the organisers....the first thing that you should get 'guests' to unlock ought to be a cabinet with a torch, a pen and paper in....because there is maths involved and also lots of dark corners where we simply couldn't see the clues. We had to use a mobile phone to give light and use the calculator, so an improvement would be these items to find in the room. The guy running it was very nice, but when we did Claustrophilia(also on Trip advisor), it was much more sinister because you let yourself into the flat and see no one, the clock starts on it's own and you have no interaction unless you press the help button. It all adds to the curiosity!! We enjoyed the tomb room though, but we failed on time...and luckily we were given an extra 10 mins, which meant we did find the code to get out....eventually!!

Budapest City break . Fantastic attraction, just like the cyberstalking maze. Good team building quests with lots of fun. Would definitely recommend a visit if you are in Budapest. If you are stuck, the staff will kindly help you.

Quite interesting. I saw it ranked as no. 1 attraction and booked Egyptian room. We were not disappointed. It was our first attempt on this type of escape games and we enjoyed it. We managed to get out in a little under 1 hour which we were told is pretty decent. However, we needed some tips in the first room which is most difficult. Once out of first room we could manage independently and quite quickly. I would have preferred if the difficulty builds up slowly. The first room is indeed very difficult. And I expected several rooms but there are only a couple. But overall it's worth and would definitely recommend to families looking for something unique and fun.
Fun!!. It was a brilliant experience .. its a must try !! we had lots of fun solving the puzzles .. the guys there were very nice ..

Fun for the whole family. We, a family of four (children 12 and 15), had a great time at this place. Our host was very helpful and only said enough to get us going - perfect. Everything is a little worn, but as soon as you get started you are "TRAPEd" in their universe ;-) Everybody contributed to solving the "puzzle", and all had a blast. Remember, it's cash only.

Interesting way how to spend more then hour. It was interesting and exciting. The most difficult is the beginning if you have not done that before. We needed an hour an 15 minutes & several tips. Funny for family attraction. But still I think that 40 EUR is a little too much to make it one more time.
Unusual and fun. Great activity for a family or group of friends. We did the Medieval Room and got out in 45 minutes, which was respectable. I would definitely go back and try the other ones.

Fun indoors activity for the morning. We booked the Egypt Room after seeing that it was ranked highest on Tripadvisor. This is the first time I did an activity like this so I wasn't sure what to expect. The two of us were able to get out in an hour, with the first room being the most unclear. I suggest this activity for groups who are looking for something fun and pseudo-intellectual-- especially after a few days of sight-seeing and lazily hanging out in the baths!

Great experience. Me and wife went twice, we had a lot of fun. Recommended. the guys there a nice and kindly, we think its better with just a little help and not much because then its feeling a bit of disappointment

The best in Budapest and so far Europe.... Great "escape" in Budapest, the best escape game I ever played, great rooms we tried both Egyptian and Medieval, the guys that guide us are great and the place is cool, five stars, higly recommend!!

Very Good game!. We have been in the tomb and the bomb, enjoyed them both. The host was extremely nice and had very good English. However, the maintenance needs to be improved (the rooms and bathroom). Overall, we had fun. If you have to choose, go to the tomb room.
Enjoyable hour. We had some spare time in Budapest and thing was rated no.1 so we had to try. Very enjoyable time, interesting idea and very involving. Well worth the visit!

Fun activity to do as a family. We are a family of 4, with 2 teenagers aged 14 and 16. We really enjoyed the Egyptian and the Medieval rooms. Puzzles and clues were challenging but not impossible. We could all contribute and we all had a great uime!

Amazingly fun and a good brain work out. I was quite nervous about this as there were just two of us so I thought it would be too difficult. Rudi was a fab guide though & reassured us that he was on hand if we needed him. Thankfully we didn't need him much- just one clue and we managed to solve the rest! The room was so entertaining- such a wide variety of challenges and puzzles to work out. I would REALLY encourage you to have a go. One thing I would suggest that would get more repeat business from me, have a discount if there are just one couple playing. We loved it but can't really justify the price for doing another room because the price is aimed at a group of 4 or 5 really.Thanks for an entertaining hour though!

Fantastic brain workout. Had a blast! The puzzles were cunning and rewarding. Our guide Rudi was brilliant and made us feel comfortable and explained everything brilliantly. 10/10 would try another one

Egyptian room. Having experienced some escape rooms in the Netherlands, we had to experience one in the home country of escape rooms. We weren't disappointed! We managed to escape from the Egyptian room. Although we still rank one Dutch experience #1, this room was really nice! The puzzles are tricky, but no Hungarian is needed and tips will be given in English.
Amazing!. Do it folks, great fun and well worth the money! An hour well spent, pity they were booked up so we couldn't try another room!

Great night out. We got here at 10:30pm after a day out enjoying ourselfs the only problum when we got here we were well on a little oiled you'd say but it was a good time in there but try to get early appointment as we were in there for almost 2 hrs lol so don't got there full of bevy this is something you must do when your in Budapest thanks for our night
Great fun!. 2 teams of 4 solving 2 different rooms. Although the boys beat the girls and solved their clues first the Girls had so much more fun!!

Great fun - Give it a go. We were staying in Budapest & someone recommended trying out the Trap. We did the Medievil one & can thoroughly recommend it. Its all done in good taste & isnt physically challenging, just mentally. The puzzles are designed so that there are no language barriers, therefore can be enjoyed by visitors as well as locals.We were a team of 4 adults & in a fun kind of way showed our strengths & weaknesses, bonding our team for the better. Afterwards we went & celebrated with a well deserved pint of beer nearby.My one tip is pre book on line as it seems to get quite busy.Would I do it again? You bet I would :)

Fantastic fun. We had decided before our visit to Budapest to try one of the escape rooms and decided to choose TRAP and we were extremly happy we chose them. We had a fantastic time, lots of laughts . We chose the Egyptian room and we would defiantly recommend it. We wish we had more time as we would have loved to try some of the other rooms TRAP had on offer. We did manage but we did need a little help . We will defiantly return to try out some more rooms
Great experience!. It was lots of fun and laughs. It was a little bit difficult to realize what to do, but we reccomend. And would be happy to try again another room.

Amazing experience!. First we solved the secret of the tomb and came back the next day to solve the bomb room also. It was absolutely worth the money and even us engineers appreciated the brilliance in the puzzles. The place to visit in Budapest! Go there and experience it, you won't regret it!

THE escape room experience in Budapest!. If you're going to choose 1 escape room experience in Budapest, choose TRAP. We wish we tried some of their other rooms as well instead of trying some other escape rooms elsewhere. But when we do come to Budapest again, we sure will try the other rooms!

Well executed - even a nerd will appreciate it. Tons of reviews on this attraction already and you can read those for the hyperbole. Just wanted to add my .02 that this is not a dumbed down version of an escape game for tourists. I was in town on business and did this as a team building exercise with a group of engineers and we all found this to be intriguing. The operator monitors your group and if you seem to be stuck they will give you clues to keep you moving forward. Of course we didn't any help - wink, wink, nudge, nudge.

TRAP Team Race Against Puzzles, Budapest. Really fun way to spend time and something completely different to the sightseeing we had been doing to-date. We chose the medieval puzzle room and weren't disappointed. So much to try to solve and in what seemed so little time to do it. There were only two of us and some of the games were for more players but we managed to bumble our way through the clues and challenges and escape eventually. Our host was brilliant and really helped when we were wandering around like headless chickens not getting very far. Thoroughly recommend and would definitely go back to try the other rooms

Fun!. My sister and I made a reservation online with ease after reading reviews on TripAdvisor and had a great time trying to escape the room! We received help when we were stuck (many times!). Great activity to try in Budapest!

Amazing & must do!. We had great fun as a family of 3 as we just about made it (59 mins)! The host was amazingly helpful! Without his hints we would probably have took about 2 hrs! I really recommend it if you are at Budapest or going to Budapest and it would be a bad choice not to go! We took the Secret Tomb and it was great! Our longest one was the first one and we were gobsmackingly stupid in most of them as we were missing out on obvious clues! It costs 1200 Ft per person/group I'm not sure. Well worth it! Goodbye!
Unbelievable experience!. Perfect level of difficulty, great fun for backpackers! We did Secret of the Tomb and it had good problems for everyone to solve.
Great experience. We went there to do the tomb puzzle. It was a lot of fun with friends. Not too easy and not too hard. Great experience and good value for money.

Puzzle Solving Real Life Experience. It's like the computer games we used to play such as "Monkey Island", "Maniac Mansion" or "Sherlock Holmes" style but in real life! The game is designed very intelligently, the puzzles you solve are very logical but you have to think wisely and concentrate. When you get stucked, the guy helps you from speakers. It's just an amazing experince you should try if you're in Budapest.

Time flies! . We were three girls and booked the tomb room. It was really fun even if at some point you felt a bit frustrated as you couldn't find the next glue. But the guy who worked there always saw if we needed some help and gave extra clues. Next time we'll do another one!

Fun, Fun, Fun. My family and myself have done the bomb room - which is their hardest room. Indeed it was hard, but using the hints we got we managed to solve the puzzle. It was so much fun to all of our family - from 9 years old boy to 60 years old grandpa and grandma.This is a must when in Budapest - and don't settle with only one room - do as much as you can, since the fun does not stop

A great experience!. Me and my girlfriend went through as a team of two, we went through the medieval and Egyptian rooms. It took us longer than average as it was jut the two of us but we had a great time trying to get out of the rooms, cracking the codes & puzzles!So happy we made it to TRAP. Only wish we had more time to do the other two rooms as well!The people there were really nice and welcoming too which made it all a better experience.

Amazingly fun experience!!!. We actually wandered by the entrance to TRAP - knew what it was after having read about it on tripadvisor. We hadn't booked ahead of time- but went down and talked to George- the employee that morning. He was awesome- actually fit us in "on the fly". I very roughly knew the concept- but not in any detail. We had a BLAST. I don't want to give anything away- but it was so well designed and technologically amazing the way the game proceeded... Let me say who I think it would be fun for- no kids under 12 but 13 & up. A group of friends - 3-5 is ideal, we were 2 couples. A pre-wedding party, birthday friend party, grown kids with parents... You get the idea. Strongly strongly recommend.

Great fun. We spent like two hours here, first getting know with man working there, very cool guy also very good English speaker, then we spent about hour and half playing the game. Great experience and if you want to have fun you should try this one.

Fantastic fun!. We were a group of five women on a city break and decided to give this a go. We were not disappointed. It is so much fun and the hour you are playing the game for goes over so quickly. There are several games to have to "unlock" within the room and you really have to think outside the box and work as a team. If you get stuck, the organisers are very good to give you clues to enable you to work out the puzzle to move on to the next one. We would certainly go again!

Crystal Maze Meets Point-And-Click Room Escape Game!. Visited earlier this month after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. Was expecting it to be good, but it was even better.Had a long weekend in Budapest, so booked this for the Saturday to escape the Bomb Room. Managed to escape (with a fair bit of help). Spoke with the Dungeonmaster afterwards, and couldn't stop talking about it for the rest of the day.... So much so, found some WiFi in a bar on Margaret Island, and booked up to do the Secret Of The Tomb on the Sunday, on the way back to the airport.Without giving anything away, the rooms are intelligently designed, and some of the puzzles are quite challenging, so you certainly get your money's worth. The more in your team, the easier it'll probably be, but we had a team of 2, and did alright.Highly recommended, and will soon be checking out the similar ones in London, although these in Budapest look as though they're £60 cheaper!

Very cool experience!. Something you have to experience in order to fully comprehend. It was an excellent afternoon despite not knowing exactly how things were going to unfold. Without spoiling things, all I can say is you will have a fantastic time...definitely recommend it.

Fantastic experience. This is a great attraction, we did the bomb room and just managed to get out in time! The staff are really nice, and it is really well organised. We went as a group of 4 and it was great working together, it's something really different to do. It was challenging but do able which made it very rewarding! Something you must do in Budapest

Such a great exerpeicen. We wait as a group of 8 and did the medieval room and the Egyptian tomb. Was really good fun and would recommend it to anyone who wants to do something different. Wish the rooms were in the same building as we would of def done all 4 if they were close by! Loved it!

Great experience!. Visited Budapest with family and came across TRAP on Tripadvisor. Decided to give it a go and it was brilliant! Highly recommended for all ages and no, language is not a problem because the puzzles are not related to language. Try it!

Coolest new thing in Budapest. These ruin escape games have only been around for 2 years, but they are popping up everywhere and they are so cool! They really make you use your team-working skills to solve the puzzle. I walked out of there excited to experience more of them. The clues are really clever. They're definitely challenging, but a lot of fun! It's something I do when I have friends or family in town!I highly recommend this on your trip to Budapest!

For puzzle lovers. It was a great entertaining activity. One hour was the right time for a couple with puzzle solving background, but we found it also appropiate for families looking for fun together. Previous experience is not required as nice staff is always available for hints. Don't miss it and enjoy later ruin pubs around to kill some neurons...

Great Change of Pace.. We had been traveling down the Danube river for a week. We saw amazing churches, towns, architecture, and historical places. This hour was one of the high points of our trip. Trust me, that is saying a lot. My 75 year old mother even enjoyed it once she caught on to what we were actually doing. Got out in an hour. Made us feel pretty smart for a bunch of old women! We enjoyed the Medieval Room and wish we had had time to come back ad try the Egyptian Room as well. Try it out you won't be disappointed!

Great fun!. We did the secret of the tomb puzzle. It was a lot of fun. We would certainly do it again. There are some fairly easy clues/puzzles but some VERY difficult ones as well! The best part though is as you get through each one they all make sense. It was a great time and especially worth the time on a rainy day!

Had a blast in the Medieval Room. My husband and I spent an hour in the medieval room while on vacation in Budapest and we had a blast. The room was very well done and it was fun to be good at certain puzzles myself and my husband being good at certain puzzles as well. We really complimented each other. What a fun way to spend an hour in Budapest. And yes, we made it out (with some help from the walkie talkie of course).

Fantastic group activity. 6 of us went to TRAP, where we split into two teams of three, but were effectively racing each other to escape. We did the Egypt and Medieval rooms and had an incredible time, despite having had one too many beers the night before. If you get really really stuck, the staff can give you clues, but I'd recommend trying to keep going until you crack it.The guys there were great too. Would massively recommend for any groups looking for a slightly more unique experience than normal tourist stuff. Good value for money too!

Amazing Fun. We had SO much fun in the egyptian room - a great thing to do in Budapest that differs from the typical city trip activities. It really challenged our minds. Staff will give you auditive hints if you struggle with the puzzles. We got out in 55 Minutes.The staff was very nice and friendly, even took our picture in the room afterwards. We also got to see the observation room and were explained how the observation in the rooms work. We will definitely come back for more trap experiences when we return to Budapest!

Awesome fun. You can spend an hour trying to solve puzzles (like the Crystal Maze). we were in the Medieval Room, don't want to give anything away all I can say is if you are in Budapest this place is defo worth booking in advance. You pay at the end of the time if you have got out of the room..... lol Awesome way to spend an hour!
Such good fun. We had an amazing time trying to escape the room in TRAP. The whole set up was so clever but we still managed without hints in 47 minutes!! Well worth a visit when in Budapest!!

Bit of fun. a great memory to take home with this unusual game. you have an hour to find all the clues and get unlocked from the room. they will let you have longer if you want. would recommend this for 2 or more players

Such a good laugh!!!!. My friend and I had read about this puzzle room and were so excited to give it a go, even though we are 40somethings lol we ran around like headless chickens laughing the whole time, there is a guy who stays outside and watches your progress and give hints and tips if your stuck, the hour flies over so quick, it wasn't till we came out and went through it wondering how we did certain bits coz it goes by so quickly. It costs £30 for upto 5 players. But definitely worth every penny, only tip I would give, is definitely book.
Amazing!. Pretty nice and thrilling game!! Went with friends and loved it! If you are in Budapest you should try it.

Must try!. Tried this on the last day before we were due to leave; it was excellent. But you must book, as it is quite busy, so don't make a journey there without booking or you'll waste your time.The place we went two rooms, we were in the bomb disposable room, which we were told was the toughest. We had an hour to work through the clues, puzzles and exercises to in order to get to the bomb, in order to diffuse it, before it explodes.It was only my husband and I, and it really tested our team work, communication skills as well as patience. Lol It was very challenging, we needed help in places, and we're only a few tasks away before we ran out of time. : (However, the staff member there gave us extra time to work through the rest of the tasks, to see how they would work, so we are able to escape. It was great, if you like problem solving, challenging team activities as well as working under pressure, you must give it ago. : D
Quite interesting experience. Had fun with the Egypt game. Will definitely visit the other ones whenever we visit Budapest again !

AWESOME!!. It's an awesome activity. I'm pretty sure it is a must-do activity at Budapest. One tip: Make reservations, because the schedule it's always full, so it's really important to make reservations a couple days before.
Loved It!. What a choice experience! We were TRAP virgins before Budapest so didn't know what to expect but we really enjoyed it and would definitely recommend it to anyone!

All had a great time. We were part of a large group so we actually used the two different locations they had. We chose the Egyptian game. This as well as other puzzles were great. The location was easy to get to, the rooms were comfortable, there was suspense but no one had nightmares! The time ( 1 hour) was just right. We want to go again
MUST DO. We had a great time. Lot of fun and interesting tricks! When in Budapest, it is a must do :) Its great for kids and also for kids in heart :)

Money well spend!. Great experience! Money well spend!
This is a unique oportunity to test yourself and have a great time!

LOVED IT!. Don't miss it! It was fun and exciting and special! never been to anything like it!
Great attraction, I definitely recommend it !

Escape the Room real experience. If you enjoy playing games like "Escape the Room", that`s the perfect option for you in Budapest. With a very good location and affordable prices the place is a "must go" for the fans of the game. Also very interesting for those who are looking for new experiences spending time with math, logic games.The Staff, in our case just a guy, which unfortunately I cannot remember the name, was extremely nice with us. When you get stuck in any part of the puzzle, he can give you hints, however not solving the problems for you, just in case that's what you want.I recommend you to make a reservation at their website, especially because the timetable isn't so wide and the demand is quite big. In our case we had a bit of lucky regarding availability. We have made the reservation for the Medieval puzzle but after this one we were so excited and we ended doing the Egypt as well.

Believe the hype. TRAP deserves so much more public awareness than what is has. Our group of 3 had an absolute grouse time doing the Bomb room and are no doubt returning to do more. I will be telling everyone to do this. So much fun! So exciting! So worth it!

Fun way to spend an afternoon. We did the medieval room and wished we had done the other rooms as well! There were four of us - a good number in my opinion as we were able to use all of our different skills to get out of the rooms without any help. Good time had by all.

Great fun!!! A must while on holiday. This had good recommendations from TripAdvisor so I thought I would try it out with my girlfriend. And we were not disappointed! We had so much fun here as a quirky quite random excursion while on holiday. We had to diffuse a bomb in an hour and had to find the code through so many clues. We did it within with 5 mins to spare! If you are in Budapest, go try this.
Love Love Love it!. I'll keep this one short as the less said the better. It's the Crystal Maze meets Mad Max. A room, an hour, a bunch of clues, now get yourself out.

Absolutely Brilliant - Challenging, Engaging, Fairly Baffling, Always Exciting. Having never tried a room escape style game before, despite having seen them rated highly on Tripadvisor in almost every other European city we've visited whilst interrailing, it felt like Budapest was finally the place to try it.My brother and I arrived 20 minutes early for our booked appointment, for alledgedly the hardest room - The Bomb Room. As the room was already set up, the guy running it let us in straight away to get started. With some occasional tips from the guy outside through speakers, we managed to disarm the bomb and escape the room in just under an hour - I have to say, without some external tips, there is no way we could have possibly finished that particular escape game in less than a few hours.For 12000HUF (around £30) for a team of 2-5 people, I think it's an incredibly unusual and exciting experience that is more than worth it, even if you are only trying it out with a group of 2 like my brother and I. Upon escaping and before leaving, we were presented with a voucher knocking the price down to 10000HUF if we wanted to come back and try another room. I have to say, I'm very tempted to go back again tomorrow!All in all, TRAP is conveniently placed near the centre, the chap running it was both very accommodating and helpful, it's an unusual experience if you haven't played a room escape game before and I would highly recommend anyone in the area to give it a go.I'll certainly be trying out more room escape games in the future, after my first experience with TRAP.

Much Better Than I Expected. We wanted to try something different than the usual walking around looking at the city. This popped up on Trip Advisor and had a bunch of great reviews. I must say they are well deserved. However, I must say that this would not be for everyone. If you are a puzzle solver you are going to adore this place. Or, if you are with a few friends, it is really fun to work as a team to solve your way out of the rooms. We were 3 people. We didn't quite know what to expect and I think they intentionally don't give you too much info. Once you get the hang of it, you start to become aware of everything in the room. Actually, even after we left TRAP we were still doing it with everything outside. If you like a mental challenge, by all means give this unique game a try. As a tip, they are located in various venues around the city. When they email you the confirm, check the address you go to. The different rooms are located in different parts of the city. We got out in about 1 hour with 2 hints through the walkie talkie. Have fun!

So much fun. Really clever puzzles that make you have to really think hard. We did one puzzle on one day and liked it so much we came back the next day and did another. Definitely worth a visit if you're in Budapest. Great way to spend an hour.

Super fun mind blowing puzzles. Super fun activity in the heart of Budapest. We came here with our friends and with two groups of 5 we did the medieval and the Egyptian rooms. Very challenging puzzles and super fun time! Highly recommended.

Good fun. Egyptian room
Some good puzzles, mostly logic.
The rooms were a bit worn and could do with a lick of paint.
Fairly expensive but an enjoyable hour.

Great time!. We initially solved The Secret of the Tomb and had such a great time that we returned the following day for the Egyptian room. It happened to be a rainy day and the Medieval room happened to be available so you guessed it, we completed that as well. You might say we really enjoyed the experience. FYI - our favorite was the Tomb Room and the toughest was the Egyptian room. This is a must do for anyone who enjoys puzzles.

Great fun. We had wondrefull time, it was fun for all our family ( boys 15 and 8). I will recomend it to everyone looking for som other type of entertiment. The staff is great and they will help you if they see that you're stuck.We will certenly try the Egypt room tomorow.

Excellent way to pass time. Went here with my girlfriend and her family. I think the premise of escaping from a basement seemed suspect at first but this was definitely a great way to spend an evening. We did the Medieval Room and went slightly over the 60 minute mark. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. I wish we had time to do another room.

Great fun, best part of the holiday!. We saw this on trip advisor and thought we'd give it a go so four twenty something's did the medieval room first. We absolutely loved it so we did the bomb room the next night. Again loved it so much two of us did the Egypt one the day after. All the rooms are completely different, they really make you think and work together. The staff are really friendly and helpful and you get a discount card after doing the first one. An absolute must do in my opinion.
Brilliant idea. Was something very different than i've ever done before, so much fun and very clever. would definitely go back and do it again!

So much fun!. It was so much fun. Tried to rooms - Secret of the tomb and Medieval ind Budapest (They have two places). We were three persons, and made it out within time. So it is possible, but Secret of the tomb, was harder than Medieval. Get into the spirit, and then it's a lot of fun ;)

Great Experience. We really loved eat.. We (me and my two daughters) went to TRAP twice. The experience was great. The crew was very helpful. We did the Egypt and on the next day came back for the Medieval.

Fun but wanted more!. Four of us did the medieval TRAP room this August. It was fun, very accessible but over far too quickly! What was advertised as an hour only took about half that and rather than feeling accomplished I mainly felt that I wanted to carry on. There was a sign saying that they are adding an extra puzzle to the first room but I feel that it needs more than that.That being said, it was a fun experience and something different to do in Budapest.
Very nice game.. Helpful staff. Very good location (in the center of the city, near metro station). The game is fascinating.
Exit Games. Tried this place twice with family of 5. They have 2 room in the maria street location. 1 we ran out of time and the second we got out. Fantastic fun, definitely 1 to do.

Fun for all!. We went to Trap Team as part of an Escape Room Day we spent in Budapest (we did 5 rooms) and we tried both Egipt & Medieval. We enjoyed them a lot! Egipt is quite challenging and is focused on puzzles whereas the Medieval one is mostly focused on using your hands and mind at the same time :). I highly recommend both rooms and if you never been to such a game, the Medieval room is an excellent start!
Egypt Room. TRAP is a great way to spend an hour in the afternoon. There are two separate locations with multiple different rooms. Very cool concept!

Great time!. We had such an awesome time doing this (we were five mid-20s law school friends). We had done a similar thing in NYC, and the Budapest one definitely rivaled the NYC one. You should definitely check this out - its not expensive, its really unique and fun, and it gets your adrenaline going for pub crawling through ruin bars afterwards!

fantastic experience. i think everyone must do something like this experience. a the begin you feel lost and you don't know what to do , but after you go into the game e you really enjoy. Very nice to do with your friends because you collaborate with them !!! i will come back certainly !!!
we had so much fun ;D. we did the bomb room, and had really a lot of fun. we will definitely try the other rooms too. i just can recommend if You have time to spend
Great Fun. Great experience. Enjoyed the challenge. A definite must do if you have time to spare.We did the Medieval Room and would gladly have tried our wits at the other rooms if we had time.

Such a fun activity!. Scheduled an hour to do the Egypt Room on our last morning in Budapest and had an amazing time. This activity is unlike anything I've ever done and would definitely go back to do different rooms if i'm back in Budapest again.

Don't leave Budapest without doing this!. Even though our 22:30 slot was double-booked when we arrived, they offered to open up early for us the next day with a discount! We were a first-time group of four 20-something-year-olds without expectations and we were impressed! The rush of solving puzzles and codes as team was strangely addicting! Definitely recommend this to people of all ages who have an hour to kill (though we solved it with 20 min to spare, boo ya!). Four people was a good size group as someone was always finding another clue; any more would have felt crowded and any less maybe too slow. You don't need to be brain smart to do this, so get off your butt and head to Trap!

Highlight of our holiday. Found this place on Tripadvisor by accident and so glad we did! Booked the Egypt room and loved it so much that we did the Medieval room afterwards (which was equally as good). Staff were brilliant and enthusiastic/friendly and keen to hear feedback on the puzzles. Hints were helpful when needed. Much better than could have hoped. The time flew by.Couldn't recommend it more - did it in a group of two which worked well.

Definitely a must-do in Budapest. The people there are very welcoming and have perfect English.The game itself is exactly as expected and unexpected at the same time. A really good surprise.I wish I could erase my memories and go again

Highlight of the trip! . I went with my sister and a friend and the 3 of us had such a good time! Joe was great! He seemed to offer hints at the right time and offered to take pictures for us afterwards. It was so much fun and I'd totally suggest it for anyone that likes puzzles.

Go teamwork!. Was there earlier today. Was so much fun. My girlfriend and I did the Egyptian puzzle by ourselves in about 40 mins. For that puzzle about three people is probably best. Peter, the guide was really helpful and chatty. Definitely recommend this as an alternative way to spend an hour in Budapest!

So much fun in one hour. It was our first ever escape and we had a blast doing it.Although we weren't expecting much (we really thought we wouldn't like it), it was very fun. We needed some help because we couldn't brain at times :) but at the end it was super rewarding.The staff there was awesome and super funny (I think Robert was the name of the guy, he was hilarious). If their boss reads this, a really big kudos goes for hiring such good staff, it really makes a difference.I highly recommend visiting them, super fun! We are sorry we couldn't visit the other location too :(

No doubt the best Team event I ever spent. Maximum Fun!. Playing Maniac Mansion, Zak Mc Kracken, Tomb Raider, Thief ... on computers and consoles for almost 30 years now, I could finally get the real excitement of solving puzzles, following trails, cracking codes or picking locks in real life. It was thrilling and incredible fun.As a team, we had to search for clues and solve them in a dramatic race against the time. And we got so into it. We forgot all about the world outside, as we proceeded from room to room.It was my first contact with that type of 'game', and I can recommend it to everyone. It really was more fun than anything that comes in my mind.Kudos, guys, and thank you very much!

the most entertaining test I have ever taken.. Went with a group of six. What a great experience. I had read about TRAP in the NY Times. It did not fail to disappoint. The challenge was challenging, yet all the clues whee were we least expected them to be. We finished the time in 54 mins... And like most were kicking ourselves in the but afterwards for not having escaped sooner. Using clues in various rooms you race against the clock (1 hr) to find the escape code for the door. There are two challenges to choose from. However...Book in advance and arrive on time. Spaces fill and you don't want to make the next group late for their reservation. We were a group of six. Big mistake yes the game was still challenging however with six people it was " too many cooks in the kitchen" type of deal. Try and stick to the recommended group number of 4- 5 persons. Keep on mind the rooms are improved upon, challenges are made harder, clues are altered based on participant feedback... I wouldn't say that you could repeat a challenge because they don't alter the rooms enough to make them a totally new game...Just go! You won't regret it.
Excellent and interesting. We had this experience all the family together this summer and we had great time. It was very interesting and tough i would say. Highly recommended

Mind baffling fun! . Had a great time! Luckily there was only us booked that afternoon since the weather was really good. We got 15 minutes or so extra and when we got stuck we got help from the staff through the speakers. I felt a bit stupid at times but it's a completely different mind set you have to use to get through it. Maybe we'd done better if we'd been more than just the two of us. :)Great fun! We'll do one of the other rooms next time.
Fun!. Loved it, had so much fun.. Wish it lasted longer than 60min, it goes fast! If you play "the room" app you will be ahead of the game, if not it will be super hard to figure out

So good we did both!. Apologies to the boys for not reviewing this sooner! My boyfriend and I literally stumbled across this while wandering around lost in the centre of town. We grabbed a flyer, were intrigued enough to look it up on TripAdvisor and ended up booking ourselves in for the Medieval Room the next day due to positive reviews. We weren't at all disappointed.It was so much fun attempting to solve all the puzzles and escape the room, lots of adrenalin flowing as my boyfriend and I sprinted about. At one point I was so entertained I actually fell into hysterics leaving him to complete the task at hand. The atmosphere is maintained throughout and the puzzles are hard enough that the game would be suitable for both small groups of friends and families.We had so much fun, we booked ourselves in to do the Egyptian room the next day - also just as awesome as the Medieval room but with differing styles of logic puzzles. Next time we're in Budapest we'll be trying the Bomb Room for certain. Thanks for the fun guys!
Really cool. The egypt room is fantastic! You need to try it out!!! It's tricky and we had a lot oft fun! Thumbs up ;)

Medieval Room. Completely worth a visit! First of all, they allow you more than an hour - which is nice as it took my partner and me 75 minutes. This availability is nice for those doing it in smaller groups. It is 12000HUF regardless of how many of you participate and it is entirely worth every penny! It is just off one of the main roads in Budapest so easy to get to. I really wanted to do one of the other rooms afterwards but didn't have too long in Budapest but 100% recommend it! The medieval room has a mathematical element while I believe the others do not, I love maths and thrived off this personally!

"A must" for teenagers and adults. We (2 adults and 14yr and 15yr old girls) had read all the reviews on Trip Advisor and decided to book the Egyptian game (Pauley St) and Secret of the Tomb (Maria St) and we were not disappointed. The girls loved it and so did we! Our first game was the Egyptian room and we did need a bit of help to complete it but we did it! Going into Secret of the Tomb we knew this was going to be tough and it took us a bit longer but again we all had a great time, so much so, we decided to book the Medieval room - this was slightly easier, still challenging and we still needed the odd clue but we did complete it within the hour - just! The guys at the games were fantastic and thank you for making it such a memorable part of our visit to Budapest.
great experience. the bomb room is fun and chalenging and i recomend it for every one.dont forget to use the web and order in advance....

Unique experience. I went with a group of 5 friends and had a great time. The puzzles were challenging, creative and fun!! The decor/ set up of the room was also excellent. Staff were incredibly lovely and helpful.

Exciting, difficult but so worthwhile!. Amazing trap game, very high tech in comparison to others we have done. Pretty easy to find. Helpful staff who will give you a hint if necessary. Some of the puzzles were very tricky but satisfying once you work them out.

Great fun and really tests you. Me and two of my friends did both the bomb room and the Egyptian Room, both well set up and great fun and made us think in different ways :) Would highly recommend to everyone of any age.

Different and amazing. I went with two friends (we're all early 20's) and absolutely loved it. The puzzles/riddles are challenging yet engaging! We managed to escape with a minute to go and got to writ our names on the wall. Would definitely recommend as it's quite cheap as well. 10/10

Such great fun. I have played escape the room games on the computer, so when I saw these in Budapest, I was excited to try it out. And I was not disappointed. We had to work through clues & solve puzzles ( with a little help from the host) to disarm the bomb ( & hopefully save the world) in an hour. This should be a must do in Budapest
Awesome fun. My 12 year old daughter did this with her 3 friends and they had a blast. Staff were super friendly, all spoke perfect English. Will definitely be returning.
Amazing place!. We had a blast! a great break from the city, lots of thinking and planning...a wonderful experience..

Great alternative activity for a city break. We happened upon Trap and was so glad we did. Had a great time in the medieval section and booked the following day for Egypt. Robert and Rudi were on hand when we were suffering too much, but we really enjoyed it. My son, 9 years old, absolutely loved it. We will definitely try the other location next time.
Real Team Game. Very good experience. We played Egypt and "old-school" bomb game. Exiting, one of the best ways to spend 60 minutes, especially if it is rainy day...

Trust the reviews and try it out!. Went to the Maria Utca location first to try out the Secret of the Tomb with two friends, it was so much fun that we decided to visit their other location the next day and and did the Egypt version also.Both were very well thought out and organized, still completely different from each other.They also give you a voucher after the first visit (a small discount for the next one) , good marketing cause this really gets you addicted :)One star goes away because of the warmth, both locations were so so hot.Maybe invest in a good aircon, Budapest summers are a killer.

Must do in Budapest. We tested Egypt trap last Monday after formula1 weekend. It was very good experience and I can recommend it for everyone. Very friendly staff is helpful and knows the name of the game. We did not need much help, but got one important hint.

Team building at its best. This was a fab experience for our family of five. We each participated and had so much fun. My 8 year old son was the panicked time keeper!!! I can highly recommend this as a game for all the family with extremely friendly staff and a very well run place.

Just made it out!!!. Booked this because my kids had begged to visit Trap after seeing it on the internet. The 5 of us wife, kids 14,11 and 8 myself arrived and were locked into a room and had to defuse and escape within an hour before the bomb went off. My wife was probably the most sceptical about this attraction but once in solved the most puzzles and had the most fun. I don't want to give too much away but we all enjoyed it immensely and if we were staying longer in Budapest we would definately have booked another room. Go you won't be disappointed.

The Best (Family) Game. My kids arranged this game and I walked in without any expectation. I was a bit nervous as I never enjoy staying below ground. There came a guy who was just like some standard tech geek in Hollywood movie and he even talked like one. In no time we were shown(locked) into a room with stuffs..... I don't want to tell too much in details but the fact is right after we finish ( our kids did 80% of the work) the first game we started another one unplanned. Fortunately after the warm up both my wife and me started contributing and this is just exhilarating!! We talked about the game the rest of the trip.Looking forward to the next game!

An interesting experience for the whole family. It was different and interesting experience. The whole family enjoyed it very much. Required teamwork. We laughed a lot while attempt to solve the puzzles.

trap team adventure. we were in Budapest with three college age adults and tried this game, we had so much fun trying to figure out how to get out of the rooms it was well worth the time and $40 euros to play with five people we all agreed it was fun and challenging.

fantastic experience. it was something unique, very unique and addictive, as we ended up doing two rooms in two consecutive days.medieval and egyptian that was.exciting experience, if you are into this sort of games on the pc, i think this is the real deal, much much better.a must do if you visit the great budapest!

Trapped in a Medieval Dungeon. My boyfriend and I did the trapped, medieval room a couple of weeks ago while away in Budapest!! Overall we had a great experience, the staff were friendly and the room and puzzles were challenging... definitely putting our minds to the test!!! For any UK residents it definitely allows you to fulfill any dreams you may have had about competing on the 'Crystal Maze'.The rooms contain a mixture of riddle, logic and mathematical based tasks, if you have some spare time in Budapest I would most definitely recommend you take on TRAP!!

Great, but not so dependable. My family of four (including two teenagers) absolutely LOVED the "Secret of the Tomb" room (Maria Street location). It was one of the best things we did during our entire 18 day trip through Europe. The puzzles were fun, creative, and required teamwork. The employee was helpful with hints when we got stuck, and took pictures with us at the end. So, this part of the review is a 5-star. Actually, we liked it so much, we booked another session. This next part of the review is a 1-star. Not only did the employee (at the Paulay Ede location) never show up, we didn't get any notification (email, text, etc.) what was going on. So, we waited in the rain for 45 minutes, then left. Very disappointing. Two days later, I got an email apologizing that the employee had a bike accident. They offered a free TRAP session and a bottle of champagne the next time we're in Budapest. I get that life is unpredictable, and no hard feelings. But, improved communication would help. Bottom line: I would book TRAP again, but also hope that TRAP figures some way of ensuring the doors open on time.

Caught in the dungeon. This room escape adventure involved completing tasks that lead to an eventual exit from the dungeon. A great indoor activity that takes an hour or less. The facility was cash only and seemed like good value. The challenges are solvable and professionally made. Put on the costumes and see if you can escape!

Easy to do something different for an hour! . Went with a group of 4, interrailing around Europe. This was a perfect way to do something a bit different to the norm but on a student budget. We did the bomb scenario which was challenging and we needed a few hints, but definitely worth the 12000 HUF we paid for the whole group. Would definitely recommend this as something to do, particularly if the weather is bad!
Highlight of Budapest. Had an absolute blast at the attraction at TRAP. Highly recommend this to anyone, it's one of the highlights of our Budapest trip.

Great alternative fun!!. Went with my girlfriend and did the medieval room. The puzzles were fun, varied in genre and difficulty and the set was excellent. The staff were very friendly and offered just the right level of a assistance when necessary. A thoroughly enjoyable morning just wish we had more time to do more rooms.

Great Team Builder. I have brought a team for a mission trip to Hungary every year for twelve years. The last 2 years we began our trip with some team building time at TRAP. We have visited both facilities and worked through all 4 puzzles. This experience is unique and creative and VERY good for helping a team come together for a common bond. I HIGHLY recommend this for any group- even families- to play together.

Best riddle game. We visited Trap this July. We have heard many great reviews already so we had high expectations, who were fulfilled. The guys who set this up are geniuses! It took as 5 minutes in order to be absorbed in the game and start acting out like wannabes Sherlocks.

Unique and amazing. Brilliant, would recommend this to anyone. Sometimes it can be quite frustrating as you have no idea whats going on but it makes it so much mire rewarding when you finish it. Staff were also so friendly and didn't intervene in your game much which was perfect!

Like 'Saw' but with a happy ending. Its amazing how the most simple of things can go out the window when your locked in a room and 'YOU' have to work out how to get out....Brilliant will definately be doing it again when go back in Jan 2015

A fabulous time!. This turned out to be a lot more fun then I expected!
My team managed to get out of the room with 15 minutes to spare despite making some really stupid mistakes.
The game is really well set up and the puzzles are very very clever.
Honestly we all walked out with such a feeling of accomplishment! I

Really fun (but beware of dust!). The experience is super fun and highly recommended, but the rooms we tried (secret of the tomb) is in a dusty and moldy basement. It might add to the atmosphere, but not really the ideal conditions if you are allergic to dust mites...

A fun place to spend your time. If you're into puzzles and games, you're going to love this place! It's a bit pricey for two or three people. Better for groups of 4 or 5 people. Staff was really friendly and when you get stuck they try to help.We go into the medieval and the egyptian room. Both were fun, but if I had to choose, I'd go with the medieval room.

60 minutes of fun!. It is a very fun activity which is really enjoyable after visiting normal touristic areas. the price is 12000 HUF, but it is absolutely worth. We tried the "secret of the tomb", and the puzzles were interesting to solve. not too difficult to make you frustrated, but some hints are necessary in some places.We were only two, but I think it is more interesting and easier with 4 or 5. if you visit Budapest and have some extra time, you should try it!

Fun family event. We just completed the Egyptian and Medieval rooms and thoroughly enjoyed both. We are a family of five and found the Medieval room to be a bit easier, but still recommend both. Our youngest child is 6 and was a bit bored, however, he was still able to participate in a couple of the activities. Our teenagers had a blast though, as this was their first "escape" game. Great time and worth the time and money.

Unique. It was a very interesting experience. We were a team of two and we did the secret of the tomb. There is nothing scary about the whole experience. We got stuck at the begining but the vary helpful man gave us a hint or two in order to be able to continue. Highly recommended

Most remarkable moment in our Bucharest trip. It was great to solve puzzles with friends to make our way out. We were racing against time and you need to be very clever combining the clues! It's a great fun for any age. Highly recommended. Only problem is toilets were dirty. Use toilet somewhere else before coming to this place.

Trapped in the best way possible!. Was so much fun, my friends and I decided to play back to back games. The proprietor gave us hints when we were stuck on a stage and needed it so we were able to keep it rolling and having fun. Was hard enough that it was challenging but not too hard that we would get frustrated. Definitely recommend it!
Good fun! . We were 6 friends who diveded into 2 teams of 3. We did the Medieval and Egypt and both were great fun! Will definitely try another course next time in Budapest.

If you do one thing, do this!. We heard about this on the flight over and found it on our first day. Luckily we did because it was already booked up so we arranged to go back the next morning. I was apprehensive as it isn't normally my thing (and we were on the cusp of raging hangovers) but it was excellent! The time flew by and the whole experience was really good. The staff were really friendly throughout. Since then I've looked up other ones in the city and plan on going back just so I can do more!

Brilliant fun. We had 2 teams (of 4 and 5) visiting on a company away weekend, and did the 'Bomb Room' and 'Secret of the Tomb'. The games were perfect for us as you have to work together to solve the clues, so plenty of 'team bonding' can be done!Most of us weren't sure exactly what to expect (apart from me who booked it) but the very nice chap running it took us through it and then locked us in our rooms. Both of the games turned out to be sufficiently challenging and really well put together, with different types of activity/clues/puzzles to get through, some getting a bit physical!
