And, if you do get stuck, the nice chap gives you little hints, which is great for avoiding frustration and keeps it moving.I think it is a very good sign that we all went to a bar after and proceeded to chat about our game to the other team for ages, having a right old laugh at ourselves, going through the clues and what we got stuck on, and what we nailed - it was great fun. We almost went and booked to do the other two games the next day but ran out of time.Definitely recommend it as something different to do in Budapest!
Lovely Place to be. Very nice place , requier team work , some brain storming.We did the trap /Egypt and a few days after trap / bomb.Bothe were great and fun.

Super fun. TRAP is a 60 minute long team escape challenge set in a small dungeon-like series of rooms. Teams can have anywhere between 2 and 6 people in them. At the location I visited, there were two different challenges available, ‘Bomb Room’ and ‘Secret of the Tomb’. There are two other challenges available at a separate location.My friend and I did the ‘Secret of the Tomb’ challenge. We found the puzzles in the dungeon to be somewhat challenging, and had to get a few hints from the nice man who ran the place. I found the diversity of the puzzles to be very impressive, and some required coordination and physical skill rather than just the mind. Since there was no group directly after us, the man was kind enough to afford us a little bit of extra time so that we could finish the challenge.We had a fantastic time at TRAP, and it was a nice change from sightseeing in busy tourist areas. If you do the ‘Secret of the tomb’ challenge, I recommend bringing a pen and pad or a phone. It will make life a lot easier for you.

Can you solve it?. Walk inside a become a sleuth with 3 or 4 of your friends. Your mission is not complete unless you can solve the mystery in 60 minutes. The game surrounds a multitude of twists and turns. You are given a handful of clues that leads you through a goose chase of your own. Can you come to the end with success? Try it.... A super fun thing to do in Budapest. Remember be patient and use your mind and eyes to conquer all.

Overpriced and overrated. We had done both Claustrophilia rooms before we did Trap/Egypt and came out rather disappointed. The room was quite small, some of the puzzles were not functioning properly and the price was rather steep. We paid 12000ft (family of 4), whereas Claustrophilia was more fun and only 5000ft!
Awesome. We went there with a group of 4 boys (16-17) and 2 leaders and we had such a great time! If you have an hour to spare you have to go!! We did it in 47 mins try to beat us! Cheers
Great hour puzzle game!. We went here as a family and it was a lot of fun! You want to take pictures during the game but you are also racing the clock. Highly recommend if you like games or puzzles!

Great game!. Some girlfriends and I went to Budapest for a fun weekend - and the city is just great! On Saturday, we went and played TRAP! We had a great time! It was challenging yet super fun! I would recommend this game to all!

Great family fun!. My family (two adults, one 14 year old and one 10 year old) did the Medieval game room and had a fantastic time. It was a good family activity since we had to work together as a team to figure out the puzzles. We all had something to contribute, which was particularly nice for my youngest child. My only regret was that we waited until our last day to do this since I'm sure we would have gone back to do the other puzzles if we'd had more time. I'd definitely recommend this for families with older kids.

Want to play a game?. TRAP is a great way to stretch your mind, if you like puzzles and riddles. This would be great in a group, I went with my partner at the time and to begin with found it hard to get into but after messing around and noticing things we began to figure it out. The guy there was brilliant, spoke great english and was lovely. He even took pictures of us in the room we were in. There are about 3 different puzzle rooms I think. I wanted to do another after we finished, even better we managed to escape with 15 seconds on the clock! Need one of these in the UK. Absolutly loved it, so thank you kind man!

Great fun!. This was a fantastic way to spend an hour or so in Budapest. There were two of us and we managed to escape from the Egypt room, after a few helpful hints! Would highly recommend this, it lived up to my expectations and I wish we'd booked onto some more rooms.

Fun experience!. We had never done an escape before and it was amazing! we will definitely recommend it and cannot wait to do one again. We did the bomb room and would definitely recommend it. It cost us approx. 40 euro and worth every penny and more. Make sure to take cash as it's cash only. Highly recommend!
Favorite part of Budapest. The four of us did all 4 puzzles available. Each were different and challenging. If there had been more puzzles (rooms) we'd have done more. Truly a fun hour.

Great experience for Kids. We had 5 kids ages 8-13 with us and found the experience to be a great value. Kids had fun and was one of their highlights in Budapest. Highly recommend! Peter was awesome with the Kids...

Great Fun. 5 of us did the medieval room, we didn t escape in time :( but still alive. i would offer this game to everyone who s got a free hour in Budapest, if u want to try yourself in different challenges! The staff, games, rooms are so pro! Thx ladz, great fun!

Fantastic Game!!. If you are a fan of "escape game" you can not come here! The puzzles are well made, not too easy and every single detail is useful to solve the game. We were a couple and it was great fun! If you want to spend an hour different from the usual and test yourself this is the place for you
great fun. a fun way to spend an hour or two. No we did not get out alive but still had fun trying and we are 60+. good for any age

Fun and different. We love puzzles and were tired of castles and churches so this was perfect. A little pricey but tons of fun- great for older kids! Challenging but doable- we started with the Egypt room and loved it so we went back to do the medieval room - prefer medieval room - seems to be a thing in Budapest and so glad we had the chance to try it.

Great fun for a group.. I booked 2 of the puzzles for an 11 person stag group in early June. We split into 2 teams and had a great time trying to make sure we were the first group to beat the game. We found the games perfectly paced; just as you felt you were stuck we would find some small clue that helped us progress to the next set of challenges. I imagine the activity is more fun with groups of 3+, but we had a really excellent time. The location is about 20-30 minutes walk from the river/central square and we managed to visit a number of the cities famous ruin bars on the way back to our accomodation. Having never experience anything like this before I would highly recommend it.

good fun, even though it's not my normal cup of tea. not the kind of thing i'd normally pick, but the missus said she wanted to try it, so i indulged her.turned out to be good fun, and got the old noggin working away to find solutions to the puzzle.met the owner there.. lovely guy. very friendly.would recommend if you have a few hours to spare.

One of the best. We have seen lot of escape rooms in Budapest, but these rooms are one of the best. The puzzles are very creative the implementation is demanding and very professional. You can see that they spent lot of time to make these rooms perfect.There was a really good choice to spend time with challenges and brain training. We will try all rooms soon. Thank you very much.
Well spent time, Great fun. It took us 57min to get out. The room was well designed and was hard enough for a complete hour. I highly recommend for close groups. Cost 12000 HUF (about 40€)

Simply loved it. I have tried many escape games - what a surprise those are runs by Hungarians as well - in 4 countries and I cannot bore them. This medieval thing and atmosphere thing made this a bit special but I think just because this activity is getting more popular around the world. Visited by friends and only advice I have: do not use experience if you have played escape game before.Well done guys.

It was so nice we did it twice!. We were looking for something fun for our kids to do as we dragged them through museums and churches. This more than met the expectations. In fact we enjoyed it so much we booked another time for the last night of our trip.

Medival, Egypt, secret of the tomb. I went to all of the rooms mentioned above. The games we're owe some! Coolest Designs and a tricky puzzles did my day! Thanks to you guys, a meet some cool people:)Honestly, I'm TRAPaddicted)) Good luck!!

Great fun!. My boyfriend and me visited in June and it was the most fun we had in Hungary! It was really good being able to solve the riddles in the end, though we were given a few hints occasionally. The staff were also really nice and polite. The only problem is that some of the hiding places are a bit dirty.

Unique and Creative!. What an excellent idea they had when creating Trap! I went as a group of 3 people and we had a fantastic time in the Bomb room! You're given 1 hour to find and solve a series of clues, puzzles, and brain teasers in order to 'defuse' the bomb and escape from the room. I would recommend this place to any travelers looking for a new and different experience to have with friends and family. For the Bomb room, I would suggest having at least 3 people in your party, as one of the tasks would be nearly impossible without at least 3. Inside TRAP, you really get to see how quickly you can work and you have to learn how to work together as a team to solve the clues. It was a blast and I'll definitely try another room the next time I'm in Budapest.

It's fast, it's furious, frustrating and fun. It's fast, it's furious, frustrating and fun. They lock you in for an hour and before you know it If your lucky your escaping with minutes to spare...
would have loved to do the medieval challenge after completing the Egyptian one.
Thanks guys for the great entertainment.

Claustrophilia WAY better..and cheaper.. Me and my girlfriend did the Medival "trap". Nothing authentic about this place. It says on the webpage that it has best "design" of all the traps. Still I didnt find it much medival atmosphere there at all. Pure tourist trap ripping 12000 forint (~40?) out of your pocket for one our puzzles which uses both magnets, electricity and other modern methods to solve the puzzles. Much of it is a pure ripoff of the Claustrophilia puzzle which I find tragic.. The last door also uses a codeboard (like in ATM's) which collides with the whole medievil feeling of the room. You dont feel trapped at all actually..Try Claustrophilia - half the price and the real deal instead.

Extraordinary Experience. If you have a group of friends you will have one hour of fun and sometimes even adrenalin! You have to solve several creative riddles to get to the next step. If you work well together you can make it in one hour. We needed a fiew minutes more but finally made it out.

Low-budget decorations. The Egypt room represented a good team building activity to challenge our (group of 4) lateral thinking and communication skills. Friendly ‘guide’ can give you hints (if asked) and an indication how well you did against other teams. However, it is set in a highly dusty environment (not pleasant for a contact wearer!) with a low-budget decorations. Basic toilet facility is provided and I recommend taking a bottle of water as you may be ‘trapped’ for an hour.
Amazing!!. Had a fantastic time solving the puzzles and finding the clues! We had such a good time in the Egypt room that we stayed and did the second Medievel version!

Simply Brilliant!. We had so much fun here that we ended up going to 2 more of their rooms. It's a brilliant concept. The rooms, props and hints are nicely decorated by theme. Some rooms are a tiny bit easier than others, but all are awesome and lots of fun. The staff in both locations were so nice and helpful when needed. This place is HIGHLY recommended.

A must in Budapest!. Absolutely recommend this for everyone to try when in Budapest, we have nothing like this at home! (Our group was three couples between the ages of 22 and 25.)It was great value for money and George who worked there was a great help! Especially when we called him up to check availability before turning up (which I would recommend!) he then helped us with directions to get to him.We split our group into two; girls v boys and we had a great laugh! Especially when the boys finished first and watched us girls on the monitor! Such clever and well thought out games, would recommend to anyone going to Budapest!
Fun, clever and interesting entertainment. It was an excellent location, easy to find, very friendly and helpful staff, really clever puzzles that we loved solving...Definitely want to try all rooms!
so fun!. This was a fantastic experience. I would love to do it again. It reminded me of locked room computer game puzzles but was even better because it was real life.

A definite must do if in Budapest!!. Heard about these puzzle houses before I went to Budapest and I was not disappointed with the experience. From the moment you try climb down the stairs and for the next 60 minutes you are having a great time. The staff were very friendly and the puzzles were brilliant. If I ever go back to Budapest I would definitely come here again and try one of the other rooms!! Very good value for such a different experience.
Amazing and super fun!. It was great! Challenging at times, and def worried that we wouldn't make it, but it was awesome! The guide was great! Definitely worth the money and the time!!!

New and Exciting Activity. I found out about TRAP, and Escape Games in general, from TA and decided that my fiance and I would give it a shot. We went early in the morning, the guide said that since we were the first ones we could take our time if we needed longer than the standard hour to complete the challenge. He was very friendly, spoke English well, and explained everything clearly.We choose to do the Egypt themed room, I believe the other was a Medieval setting. The rooms themselves were very fun to navigate through. There are no instructions at all which is a bit daunting, but if you are a fan of puzzles or certain types of video games (think Legend of Zelda or Lara Croft) you can pick up clues from symbols and objects hidden around the room and inside of locked doors or chests.There were a couple of times that we were pretty stumped about exactly what to do next. The guide was able to watch us via security cameras in the room and communicate through a PA system. He didn't tell us what to do, but gave vague hints that were just enough to put us in the right direction. We ended up finishing the entire thing in 55 minutes which really impressed the guide since it was just the two of us. He sais that most groups of four or more struggle to finish on time.Overall this was a great experience. I'm happy we checked it out because there is nothing like it in the US yet. If you go be sure to think outside of the box and most importantly do not get frustrated at the game or your group!
Amazing and unique. A really fun hour spent in budapest. Skill required but they help if you get stuck. Really we'll put together and lovely people who run it. Well worth an hour

Amazing!. My boyfriend and I tried the secret tomb room and it was so so so so fun! The puzzles were very interesting and clever, definitely made you think! Worth every penny. Even though it was just the two of us we still managed to figure it out with help from our guide, who was very very friendly and even let us continue playing even though we were over by 4 minutes! Anyone who visit budapest should definitely try out trap. Good hour well spent!

Fun and challenging!. We did the Egypt room with a group of 4 and it was a great time. The puzzles and clues were actually pretty difficult, and it was fun figuring them all out together. Our guide was super friendly and helpful too. Would definitely recommend!
Definitely a must do when you're in budapest. We managed to get out of the trap in less than one hour, not bad for a bunch of newbies :)...We had a fantastic time!

Unique and simply amazing!. A friend of mine advised to try one of these "escape games" while we are in Budapest.Trap was close to our hotel and it got very good review on TA so we gave it a try.Me and 2 of mine friend booked for "The secret of the tomb" game.This game located in a basement and although it looks ruined, it just creates a more authentic atmosphere for the game. Staff were very friendly and they explaining everything before you start.The game is very exhilarating you jumping from one clue to another and the time running so quickly there:), took us about 60 minutes to get out with the help of some handy clues received from our host.We got addicted so much to this activity we booked another session straight after finishing, for the Egyptian game for the following day.This game located in their new location and from the start you can see that they put a serious money and effort to create an Egyptian (and Medieval) atmosphere for these game.You start inside a pyramid and crawling your way out:), very nicely made with tricky puzzles.We didn't have the time to try the other games but next time I'm in Budapest I definitely will.So overall Trap games are very well done and highly recommended!

So much fun for a unique tourist attraction. We went into this having never played an exit game before and thinking we were going to be absolutely useless at it. We left the bomb game after having an incredible amount of fun, giggles and feeling a sense of achievement. We were surprised at how well we worked together and complimented each other as a team and (perhaps with a few handy clues from staff) we managed to diffuse the bomb within our allotted time. It was a very cleverly, quirkily put together and I would recommend to anyone who fancies a different kind of experience. If I am ever in Budapest again I would 100% return to play the other games. Our only slight criticism is the price. For 2 persons it was very pricey for one hour in a room with second hand charity furniture. They must make a killing on profit in this business. I think it should be paid by person rather than per game, to make it fairer, or at least buy one game get the next half price as there was no way we could have afforded to fork out for another game. Or at least there should have been some kind of incentive to completing before the end, such as a 10% refund perhaps.

An Hour of Fun in a Great Location. This puzzle games have taken hold in Budapest with many different options. I haven't tried the other ones but this one is fantastic. First off, the location of the medieval trap is perfect. After you finish you can go get something to eat or a beer in the nearby pedestrian street, or walk to the Basilica. Now about the game. It is downstairs in a damp and dusty cellar, so be warned about that. The host is very nice and speaks English well. The game is a lot of fun and more involved and longer than I thought. You will feel a little slow at first but after you catch on and get comfortable it gets easier. If you really get stuck the host will give you hints(He is watching and by camera and listening to you the whole time). It is a great way to spend an hour or two with friends and family. The fee might seem high at first but remember it is for 2-5 people and when you finish you will consider it a very fair price.

better than anticipated. A lot of people were talking about these exit games, which seem to be very popular in Budapest. First I went to see Claustrophilia and it was a disappointment - as I have already written about it a little while back. But I wanted to give the exit games another chance, so I decided to visit TRAP, also with a few friends (and my girlfriend). All I can say that it was much better, worth every penny (forint) that we have spent there. We liked it so much, that not only we have tried the medieval challenge, but the Egyptian, too, a few days later (the latter was slightly better), and we are planning to visit the other location as well. The rooms/tasks are well built, the challenges require a lot of thinking, the staff is great, so the altogether experience is: FUN. The only negative thing was that it is located in a cellar, but who cares if it is this good. Among the best experiences I've had this year so far.

Medieval Puzzle Room. TRAP was great fun. First my lady and I went to the wrong location, though. The Medieval Room is at their new location, so double check which location your reservation is at beforehand! They're about 15-20 minutes away from each other, so it's not too bad.The place is very well done, employees left us alone to solve except when we asked for help. Most of the puzzles needed teamwork and were very interesting. Some math related, some a bit harder to describe - all fun. We were able to get through the room in exactly an hour, which is how much time they give you. Great group fun. 12000 HUF per room, split up among however many people you have. Very affordable.

Great experience. We were a group of 4 and had a great time with TRAP...so much so that we went back the next afternoon for another round. We enjoyed the medieval course better than the Egyptian...though both were fun. The staff is great. Both Rudy the first night and Peter the second. Helpful, nice, and didn't intrude or give away the puzzles at all. I would highly recommend this activity while in town. It's a deviation from run of the mill travel activities and is well priced.

Great Fun - Nice People - Recommended. This was well done and not a bit intimidating. Your mind is too hard at work sorting out all the clues so the hour goes by very fast and you have to keep going to figure your way out. You can ask for help as much as you want or not at all. Staff is super good and helpful but not intrusive.

Great fun.. A bit of a random thing for a group of five 35 year old to be doing, but a great activity to mix up a stag do weekend. We did the Egyptian room, which took us 45 minutes to escape from. Didn't have time to come back the next day, otherwise we would have. Do it. It's great fun!

Fun and Exciting activity. During our challenge in the Egyptian room, we were keen finding new challenges in the different rooms, but we were hungry for more. It's really addictive! Too bad we don't have this in my home country

A great challenge for the mind and lots of fun. Honestly had no idea what to expect when our group of four showed up at TRAP. What I will say, is that the this attraction gets great reviews on Tripadvisor for a good reason. We ended up trying out the "Secret of the Tomb" room and had an absolutely great time. TRAP was interactive, challenging and fun, and the guy working at the office was incredibly friendly and allowed us a few extra minutes to finish up since past the time limit since we were so close. A lot of the challenges are tricky and will force you to truly think, for a lack of a better term, outside of the box. If you get stuck for some reason the employee who is watching your progress will point you in the right direction so you don't get too frustrated. Would highly, highly recommend trying out TRAP. Our group would have come back for one of the other challenges except that it was our last night in Budapest when we did this!

Great!!!. Visited TRAP november 13 and it was so much better than what I expected. It was difficult, But so much fun trying to find our way out.First we tried one Trap, But we had to come back departure day to try the second Trap.You can not go to Budapest without trying TRAP!!

Good use of an hour. Me and my husband went and did TRAP medieval and we had a great time. The hour went past so quickly - it felt like about 20 minutes. Some of the puzzles are ingenious and none of them so hard that you could never even think of them. There was a bit of frustration when you get stuck but the guy was really helpful and didn't make you feel stupid when giving you the clues. I would recommend - it's interesting and unique!

Loads of fun. We were travelling through Budapest and tried the Trap Egypt and loved the experiemce. You have to make your way through 3 rooms to escape within 1 hour. Unfortunately, we just came up short. The design is really good and the clues are quite challenging. The host, Peter, provided additional clues if we found ourselves completely stumped. Even though there was only two of us, it was Well worth the price and will definitely try another one in the future.

SUCH FUN!. I visited TRAP with my two teenage children.I had read reviews on Trip Advisor so I had a rough idea what to expect. Originally we intended to visit one of the other attractions similar to this - but we found it to be fully booked around the times we would have wanted to visit. TRAP was next on the list (and it was only because I had read a few negative reviews) - but I can safely say it totally exceeded our expectations. It was money well spent and probably the highlight of our trip.We had so much fun and it kept us occupied and engaged the whole time. It tested all of our thinking, logic and maths skills. Between the three of us we were all able to contribute and add something into the mix of puzzle solving. We managed to escape in 1hr 8mins with a small amount of prompting by our guide.It's so hard to review the attraction without giving too much away! I wish we had more time in Budapest so that we could do another room.TRAP is easily accessible via public transport and has clear signage outside.

Simply amazing. Me and my girlfriend went there and we had a great time and the staff is really nice. At first we weren't sure if we want to go because if there are only two people going the price per person is a bit high, but we are so glad we decided to go, because it's really an amazing experience. We keep talking about it :) It's like you are inside of a video game and it's a must see!

Great fun, especially when you are tired of museums. This was just what the doctor ordered. We were on stop 4 of 5 cities through Europe and needed a diversion from the normal sightseeing agenda. We were fortunate to get a spot in Secret of the Tomb and had a blast working out the puzzles. I suppose that someone who is claustrophobic might feel a little uneasy, but none of us felt that way. There is a fair bit of logic and some lateral thinking involved. We were able to get out in about 50 minutes.

Different!!!. Read about it went and did it.... Confusing to start but different for sure... The area it's in is not great tho went past stinking roads smells like urinals and human toilet deposits not nice

TRAP. At first I was unsure if we would keep our TRAP appointment as our schedule was jam-packed. I was traveling with three girls (ages 11-13) and another mother. The girls absolutely loved it. And so did we mom's! We had such a good time that we went back two more times on our trip! I don't really believe in repeating activities while travelling as there is so much to see and do but we just could not stay away. We were addicted to TRAP. It should not be missed if you are in Budapest!

Mid fifties couple succeeded (with help) MUST VISIT. With no real experience of gaming but based on reviews we decided to give it a go. The guy was brilliant and explained what was required. We opted for the tomb and had a fantastic time (arguing mostly) over the clues and their meanings. You have to work together and think outside the box at all times but it is constantly entertaining and you actually never know when it will finish. I suspect that younger people will have more capacity for this kind of game but do not let this put you off trying. We were given a fair bit of help AND a load of extra time but still felt a sense of achievement and have talked of little else since. I suspect that the guy helping us via audio and cctv must have felt that he was watching his parents bumbling around a strange planet and I hope that entertained him as much as the trap entertained us. Perhaps 4 minds would be better than 2 but we would not hesitate to go back and try a different game. Thank you to everyone that reviewed trap as without you we would have missed this gem.

Must do!. We checked TRAP on tripadvisor recomendations, and decided to give it a try. None of us 3 knew this game existed in real life, and it seemed challenging and fun (plus we got a semi-rainy-dark day) so we decided to give it a try. Two words after he experience MUST DO! All and all you will spend 1h30 including getting to the venue, conversations, and so on, so if you like challenges do not hesitate. We did the first room in the Medieval TRAP, managed to finish it and had so much and found it so addictive that had to do the bomb room the next day (we were close, but failed the 60 minutes). The staff was friendly, the riddles and puzzles very good and they will give you discount for further times.

fantastic fun!!!. We did both rooms and enjoyed every minute of it! Basically you have to solve puzzles in order to exit the room. Quite difficult in parts (plus there was only 2 of us) but they give you help if you ask for it. We worked very well together and had a laugh! Well worth the money!

Loved it. Had no idea what to expect but it's essentially a point and click puzzle game in real life. Solve puzzles to get combination lock codes, open doors and the like.The puzzles are challenging and satisfying, I had great fun and would highly recommend
Trapped!. One of the most interesting things I have done, simply to visit Budapest and not try this will be a regret! Go!

Amazing. We tried the rooms Thomb and Bomb, and it was amazing. Not too hard, but it was not easy at all. It's pure fun, and the guy there was really kind and gave us good advices. The puzzles are tricky and interesting.

Such an Amazing Time!. SUCH a fun experience! My friends and I had this recommended while we were in Berlin so when we got to Budapest, we got our hostel to help us make a booking. Briefly in case you haven't heard of TRAP before, you are put in a locked room and have to solve puzzles to get out within an hour. I believe the recommended number of people is 3-5 - our group rolled up with 7. We were warned we might finish it quickly but LOL to that - still took us 56 minutes! We had so much fun trying to solve the puzzles, lots of group thinking and so many laughs!I cannot say how much I highly recommend TRAP. I wish were had enough time during our visit to do all of the rooms!
Worth the visit. We enjoyed it so much. It was a fun and hilarious experience for us. We are recommending our friends to go here when in Budapest.

This will become a new "thing" all over the world! GREAT FUN!. Don't want to spoil the fun - just go! We wanted more, and we'll be back if they have new rooms next time in Budapest!! Recommend you to book both rooms :-) Have fun!

MUST see. So much fun. Girlfriend was hesitant about going at first and probably didn't expect to enjoy herself so much but we liked it so much we wanted to go again (but didn't have time). Advise anyone going to Budapest to try this (any age, gender etc).

so much fun!!. My boyfriend suggested we did this and at first..i wasn't really excited about it. Then one day we didn't have much to do, so we decided to try it- it was awesome! one hour of pure fun and surprises! There was just the 2 of us but i think it could be cool to go as a bigger group (makes it easier to solve the puzzles)

Awesome Time!. A group of 4 of us did the Egypt Trap while in Budapest and it was great. We tried the mindmaze one in Prague, and while that was great as well, this one was slightly better. Their website does a great job of rating the 4 different types of rooms, and the Egypt one was pretty difficult with a good production value. We were able to solve it with about 10-15 minutes left but we definitely had to work for it! If you're looking to have fun for an hour with friends, I highly recommend it. Great time!
Good fun. I came with people I didn't know from my hostel and it was a really good way to get to know people and have fun, the challenges were difficult without being impossible.

Tricky stuff but good fun.. I arranged for 6 friends and I to go to TRAP as part of a stag do and we all had a great time, all though the games were harder than I expected. We split up into two groups and ran through each of the games. Both were sufficiently different to keep things interesting and the guy running the show was very helpful when we needed some assistance (at the beginning basically). Overall we were impressed and would definitely recommend this as a fun and slightly different thing to do in Budapest.

great experience. it was very funny, medieval scenario is very atmospheric. Puzzles are not hardcore, so it was really pleasant to scan all around. A little bit more expensive than other similar quests in Budapest and no discounts for couples, but worth it anyway! :)

In the words of my son.... the best thing he did in Budapest. I had read about TRAP before going and was really keen to do it, though my wife 18 year old son and 16 year old daughter were less enthusiastic. However, once we had done one room, we HAD to do another and ended up doing all four during our stay. I think we enjoyed the Egyptian themed room the most, but maybe that was because it was our fasted time.The Egyptian and Medieval rooms are the newest and therefore possibly more polished, but both the other rooms at the older location were also very enjoyable.This is a definite 5 star rating.

tough but fun!. 2 adults and 2 children locked in the Bomb room! All you have to do is get out! Not as easy as it sounds! Everything and nothing looks like a clue!! We had a great time but despite lot's of help we were blown up! You must go and do this if you like a challenge and something a bit different.Afterwards there are some lovely bars and restaurants in the neighbourhood. (Come out and turn right then first right)We'll try the Egyptian one next time!

fun but difficult. We were threee adults trying to solve the problem in the egyptian room. We found it quite difficult, but very fun and thrilling. We got out in the end, but would not have managed without some good advice from Peter... :)
Great fun. We loved it so much we went back and did a second game!My husband and I did the bomb one then the next day did Egyptian one.I highly recommend it, it was great fun.

This game is 'da bomb'. My partner and i recently had a holiday to Budapest, what an amazing place. We had previously read the reviews on TRAP and we weren't disappointed! We did the Bomb room it was really clever with lots of well thought out clues. It was so much fun working together trying to solve the puzzles in the one hour. Its definitely a unique experience that i thoroughly recommend

Very Very Cool. This was one of the best experiences I've had with my closest friends. We could not stop talking about it. We did the tomb room and it was beyond our expectations. Business or vacation it's worth spending an hour in this kind of activity. A+

Innovative and bundles of fun!. This is a fun and unique activity. Had my friends over in Budapest and wanted to do some out-of-the-ordinary activities and this fit the bill perfectly. We tried 2 out of the available 4 puzzles and enjoyed it immensely. Highly recommended for team building.

Brace yourself, the quest is coming!. We've done 2 quest out of 4: 1st one was the bomb one, and medieval was the 2nd. There were 3 people on our group. We've spent almost whole hour to solve the puzzles both times. Bomb room is more tricky with more stuff inside (probably the hardest room of all, as we were said), meanwhile medieval room has more authentic atmosphere. So both times were awesome.If you have time to do more than 1 quest, leave the Bomb room for the dessert.
A must do while in Budapest!. This was such a fun and exciting experience! I definitely recommend this for couples or groups! So much fun!

The highlight of the trip!. I thoroughly enjoyed visiting TRAP.To describe it is difficult, but think Crystal Maze style puzzles in a more atmospheric location. You pay your entry fee, and the owner puts you in a room and locks the door. The only way out is to finish the puzzle and find the code to get out the door! Each puzzle you complete will give clues onto what is next, and you will work through multiple rooms before you can finally leave!You have an hour to finish the puzzle, which makes it a nail-biting race against time.The entire experience was fantastic, the staff were really friendly and made us feel very welcome. The site we visited had 2 different rooms, and a group of us went in each. All of us were talking about our challenge for days afterwards!!!In short, if you like a challenge, and something different, don't leave Budapest until you've tried TRAP!
Superb! . Absolutely superb fun. Did a themed room and enjoyed it so much we booked in for the other one the next day.

Very cool experience!. Highly recommended if you want a unique experience. I did the Egyptian Room with one partner, which was really cool. It would have been better with more people on my team- more minds working- but it was still fun with just 2 people. The guys running the place were really nice and helpful. Don't forget to tip them! ***Be advised that there are 2 locations. This was unclear when making the reservation, and the confirmation email does not tell you at which address you are supposed to show up.

Too easy/short, lacks atmosphere of Claustrophilia. My girlfriend and I played the Templars room in January 2014. It was allright, but much worse than Claustrophilia.We found TRAP too easy, since we solved it in half an hour. There are very few things to solve and most of the time is spent doing the same action over and over, so it's a bit repetitive.The atmosphere is nothing special, everything reminds you that you are in a custom-built room with custom-built furniture and you're playing this sort of fake game. When we played Claustrophilia, instead, we really felt like we were in someone's "authentic" apartment and got really immersed in the game.Considering that for a couple Claustrophilia costs half than TRAP, I would highly recommend choosing that instead.

Going back for room two!. Highly enjoyed the first room! We had changed plans so we could go back for a second room on our last day and in sure it won't disappoint! Got speaking to one of they creators afterwards who showed a lot of passion and pride for his work - would recommend to anyone!

good group fun for 4-6. The original one. A bit like having 25 crystal maze puzzles in one room which have to be solved in a specific order to escape. 1 hours fun for 12000 Huf (about £40) compared to £110 in London
Great Activity!. A group of 3 of us took a little over an hour to get out of the trap! We had a great time, we are still laughing about it.
Fantastic team work - and a laugh!. Had a great time at Trap - didn't get out in time but had fun trying to. Had a bit of help....Enjoyable time had by all.

Great fun!. Very close to Palazzo Zichy. We were 2 and needed just over an hour to get out. We got a little help from the friendly staff. If you have an hour to spare in Budapest, just go and check it out!

Great fun!. Would really recomend, I did this with my mum and 2 sisters .... We failed to get out within the hour but enjoyed every minute. Staff good fun and did help us .... Just a little as we were so rubbish

Best part of our trip!!. We had so much fun in the first TRAP we ended up doing the second one later in the afternoon. As a group who love puzzles we found this to be so much fun! The staff was great, positive, helpful and accommodating for our larger group. A great way to spend a day in Budapest, we would have definitely gone back for the other 2 rooms if we had had another day.

Best way to spend an hour. We had only booked the egypt room . We were three people, which were a good number, because then you feel like you are part of solving the puzzle instead of larger groups where it is easy that one or two dominates the game. This was the most fun thing we did during our stay in Budapest. Well worth the time and the money.

TRAPped in a Hungarian basement. As the title suggests, I was actually quite nervous about doing this at first HOWEVER, when we turned up,the owner was extremely welcoming and talked us through what we needed to do. There were only two of us and we got stuck a few times, the owner gave us some handy tips to help us along and we defused the bomb with two minutes to spare! Great fun, definitely recommend it and well worth the spend.

Just like the Crystal Maze. If you ever wanted to go on the Crystal Maze as a child, this is your chance. Myself and my wife had a great time solving the puzzles and the time absolutely flew by. The puzzles were cleverly thought out and each one seemed like a mini-triumph when it was solved. The staff there were great and gave just the right level of prompting. Such a unique experience.

A Great Surprise!. Like many other reviewers, we visited Trap without knowing exactly what to expect. Actually it was a business after-dinner activity, and we all thoroughly enjoyed it! We did the Egypt room, and our other group did Medieval. Both were lots of fun, and of course we had to compare how many "helpful hints" we needed from the guide in order to solve the rooms. Lots of fun for groups of 5-6 people; we'll be going back and taking our teenagers!

Best way to spend an hour. Such good fun, would recommend it to anyone! A chance to lose yourself in a game for an hour and make sure your brain is still functioning after all that cheap hungarian beer.

Amazing game ! so new, a must to do.. funny. 3 days in Budapest with our child 10 years old, we wanted to make something diiferent for him. It was really amazing and eventhough he doesn't understand English , he played completely with us trying to find solutions to get out this room..It' s really something to do there ( eventhough not in the touristic guide) as i have never see this somewhere else ..!

Well done. Excellent team work and treasure finding....so much laugh and fun,,..Super for adults....and pls just use simple imaginations....especially with the Egypt room...heheAmazing time and we did within an hour....

Fun entertainment!!. My boyfriend and I did the original room. We solved the puzzle with seconds to spare, it was a lot of fun! I definitely recommend going to TRAP if you are in Budapest, it's a unique experience!

Excellent rainy day entertainment. Having loved the crystal maze as a child I thoroughly enjoyed the hour I spent locked up in the puzzle rooms! We did trap 2. It is a bit rustic inside but I think that added to the atmosphere. You had to solve logic puzzles, complete teamwork exercises, use some common sense and have a very inquisitive nature! Book online first to reserve a time slot for your group- you pay cash at the end. You can always shout for help if you need it and the guy can nudge you in the right direction as he is tracking your progress via cctv. We had a few hints but managed to 'escape' by the end of the hour. You have to have a very good eye for detail and be incredibly thorough to solve this without help- Great fun- if a little expensive for just two people.

Something totally different. My girlfriend and I visited TRAP on a whim, not really knowing what to expect. Peter, our guide, explained the rules of the game and set us going. We were initially really challenged and it felt like we were going nowhere, but after a few helpful hints we seemed to pick up a bit of pace and were able to solve the puzzle.Great fun, something totally different and new. Highly recommended.

IT'S A TRAP!!. This genuinely is the best fun that you can have locked in a room! Very Innovative puzzles that keep your mind sharp and you'll be amazed at what can be achieved with teamwork! Set a pretty good time of 49 mins with two people. The staff are friendly and will offer hints over the speakers if they see much head scratching going in. If you are in this great city then this attraction is a MUST !!

Real Life Adventure Game. As a gamer you'll love these clever room escape games. We liked it so much that we even did two traps. Both were made with much love to detail and all puzzles were fun and not too hard to solve. While the original trap offers harder puzzles the Egyptian themed one is crafted extremely well and the ambience is capured spendidly. Must do, so do it.

lots of fun. We family of three, we choose to do the trap 2. We had lots of fun, the only comment I would make with this game is that it is quiet linear. By this I mean you really need to do each clue in order,so you really only need 2 people to play this game, being the third person I often found their was not much input I could have. In other escape games, for example clastophilia, there was plently of different things to do all at the same time so was easier for three to all be engaged. Having said that we all had a great time and I would highly recommend trap.
Challenging. It was awesome to see how we worked together as a team. Went with three adults and 2 older kids. We all had a blast and the employee was great!!

Unique, fun and totally...captivating!. Our team: Two scientists and a management consultant. (Or put another way: My husband, his colleague, and me.) We were fully immersed in our 3-room trap. The setting causes you to suspend belief and fully engage in the challenge of getting out! Groups of all sorts will love this multi-dimensional game that allows individual strengths to be put to good use. You bond as a team and build momentum towards solving the puzzle and escaping. We had the hardest trap and indeed needed a couple of helpful clues from the "overseer" who watches your progress via security camera. We finished just on the hour--totally thrilled by our ultimate success. Makes for a great evening. Don't miss this very cool attraction in Budapest!
Great fun. Went there with my girlfriend not sure what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised and I found it a great deal of fun. Especially when (if) you get to solve the puzzles!
So unique and fun. Went with 3 friends not knowing what to expect and we were really amazed at how unique and fun this place is. Definitely recommend - you won't be disappointed. Good luck...
Fun hour. 3 of us had a really fun hour. It was challenging and some of the puzzles were very clever. It was a little pricey compared to other Budapest attractions.
Trap for the family. We were on holiday with 3 adult kids,,, we had great fun at Trap. Six minutes over to exit the room...will do better next time
Great family fun. We enjoyed doing this as a family. Great figuring out the clues together. The guy was very kind and helpful and spoke good english.

Great fun. Having grown up with the Crystal Maze we saw this and had to give it a go. We did this on our last day (3/2/14) in Budapest and had a really good time. We didn't complete this in the hour given, but the host allowed us an extra 8 minutes so we could. He was very helpful and spoke perfect English, a real asset to the company. I would definitely do it again.
Not to be missed!. One of the best attraction in the city , wonderful game with 2 types of rooms where you must use your logique and intelligence to win !
Very entertaing. Nice game. Recomended to all. Both the medieval room and the egyptian is fantastic. Next time we're gonna try the two other rooms!

A must do for your holiday. We had only booked the medieval room, but after completing it we were so excited we had to do the egypt room as well. We were three people, which were a good number, because then you feel like you are part of solving the puzzle instead of larger groups where it is easy that one or two dominates the game. This was the most fun thing we did during our stay in Budapest. Well worth the time and the money. Will definitely complete the other two rooms on our next stay!
Amazing!!. First time I've ever done anything like this...myself and my boyfriend did this on our last day in budapest and it was so exciting..would highly recommend!!so much fun!!

So much fun, make sure you do it!!. While visiting Budapest we heard about these game rooms and had to give it a try. This is the best one we did!!! A team of 3 is perfect and it's well worth the money. It's nothing scary, it's all a mental challenge and if you like puzzles you'll love TRAP. Make sure you visit them!

Don't be put off by the obscure entrance door. We were so excited to do this so we booked online which was easy. We found the place down a quiet street expecting a large sign and reception area to sign in. What we found was a small door with 'trap' written on it that leads into the basement! We were a bit nervous but had read reviews so were confident it was safe. The door merely added to the atmosphere and experience. When inside we chose to do the Egypt room. We had a team of 3 (which is a perfect number) and found the room really challenging, exciting and fun. Although we couldn't finish the puzzle independently, the man working there really helped direct us. 1hour flew by! Definitely recommended!

Good game. This game was a real pleasure to play. However, the Egyptian one was a bit easy to solve. Decorations are very good and the very good point is that you don't need to speak any language to solve the game. It's about tricks, signs and hints.Very good game !

Loved it!. My girlfriend and I played TRAP, it was our first "get out of the room" game.Although it was a bit expensive, we loved it! I won't say too much because I don't want to spoil it, so the only thing I can say is : GO !

Into the computer.... I had no idea rooms like this even existed until I planned a romantic getaway to Budapest and scoured trip advisor for recommendations on things to do. Being a heavy adventure gamer in my youth, I simply couldn't resist trying this out and so glad we did! My partner and I played the first level room and found it challenging but not impossible - exactly the way you want something like this. Being a new concept in the physical, we only completed it in the allocated time thanks to a little bit of help. I'd have loved half an hour more so that we could have figured it all out without prompts and get a complete sense of achievement. Definitely do this for something different. After, you'll feel like starting another room!

TRAP TRAP TRAP. We discovered TRAP on tripadvisor. It was probably the best thing that I did with my friends during the entire two weeks in Central Europe. We were basically put in a room and our only instruction was to "find clues and diffuse a bomb." We had some help on the way but we managed to do it under the time limit. I would definitely highly recommend this to crime/mystery/detective fans. That said, everyone should try TRAP.

Excellent attraction. Discovered TRAP was close to our hotel, and also that they had booking slots available. We booked not really knowing what to expect but our entire group came out buzzing. Although we didn't break any records for time - don't be overconfident! - we still really enjoyed the challenge. Would definitely go back and try the other rooms if we return to Budapest.The guy running it was helpful and accommodating. I would thoroughly recommend this attraction.

Great fun for a group of friends. We went to TRAP for my husband's 30th birthday and were not disappointed. The game was tough but not frustrating. The staff were helpful but didn't give too much away. We went with the maximum number of people and thought that it was great. I would recommend TRAP to anyone who loves a challenge and wants to try something different.

Best activity in Budapest. Count the reviews!. We walked past this place as we were staying at the Hotel Palazzo Zichy. We'd heard about Claustrophilia already so knew these puzzle games were popular here.After checking TripAdvisor I saw TRAP had 190+ reviews (at the time of writing.) And Claustrophilia had 90+, both had 5 stars, yet TRAP was listed at no.3 and Claustrophilia was no.1. I don't understand the logic of this. We enjoyed the game so much on Friday that we booked In again to play another room on Sunday. If you ever liked The Crystal Maze (UK 90s TV show.) You will love TRAP. It's been the most fun thing we did in Budapest. The guys who run it are very friendly. We'd love to come again.

Best game ever!. Heaps of fun, really gave the brain muscles some much deserved workout (after travelling around for weeks). Wished I had more time to do the other rooms. Have been raving about the experience back home, don't give it a miss. Great experience, well done guys!

nice escape game. we were on a business trip in budapest and played both new rooms of TRAP.Both are very well crafted and the "riddles" were much fun.But thats also the problem...the "riddles" are not really riddles but inside games.So in the end both rooms are more like an arcade than an escape game.But it was fun playing...

A fun thing to do in town with teenage kids.. Finding the place is the first part of the game. Once inside, you spend close to an hour (trying to) solve puzzles to progress in your quest : finding the exit ! Fun, I would recommend being 3 or 4 people.

Great team challenge. What an experience!! Basically you get locked in a room and you have 60min to figure out a way out. There are clues and challenges you need to do in order to proceed and get out of the room. If you get stuck, the employees do help you out over the intercom. VERY interesting and fascinating. We got out about 3min before our time was up. but we made it!! Great for a 2-4 people in a group. Must try in Budapest!

A fun challenge for puzzle maniacs and first-timers alike.. My girlfriend and I are big fans of 'Doors and Rooms' and other such escape-themed puzzle games so we booked this before we arrived. We didn't manage to get a booking at Claustrophilia, as we wanted to try both, so I don't know how they compare but I would highly recommend TRAP. Both rooms are challenging but possible and we escaped them in the allotted time. We did them on two consecutive days but the staff were different each time and the amount of prompts you get does depend on who is in charge at the time but I'm sure if you asked they would give you more or less, depending on your preference. Looking forward to coming back and trying the two new rooms in due course.

Amazing. Amazing! My favorite thing that we did in Budapest. My boyfriend and I were a little confused when we were first locked in the room, as we didn't know what to expect but you soon start to figure it out.Would highly recommend.

Nailed it - best time. What a great place. Did not know what to expect. The friendly man explained all to us and settled my nerves. I went with three people (probably the perfect number). The puzzles were challenging but definitely 'crackable'. I recommend this place - two thumbs up and a smiley face :}

Best team adventure!!!!. We had a team building activity here with my colleagues/friends. We have done various games and activities over the years both in London and Budapest, but this was by far the best!The puzzles that you need put together are very clever and you really need to act like a team and cooperate (talk and share the things that you find!). Individuals cannot solve the game, also please be warned that this is not an easy game, it requires everyone to look and think creatively! You need to open every box, read the signs on the wall and check every single item that you find to look for clues.Absolutely recommended for small teams!

This was great. I'd never heard of these puzzle games before.....I was so impressed with TRAP! We had so much fun...I'd highly recommend it: the game was so well thought out and the staff were really friendly and helpful.

VERY VERY COOL!. Definately one of the coolest (and different) places to go in Budapest. The only thing that made me mad was that I could not get the puzzle done on time. Probablly it is best to go with at least 4 people. There are lots of puzzles to solve and not that much time to do it in only two people.
TRAP FOR TWO. Very good fun. It is not so easy as I thought, puzzles are well-designed. I will definitely do it again.

Fun, but a bit disappointing. My friends and I were really looking forward to this experience after reading all of the good reviews online. Overall, the idea and set up was fantastic, and I would probably recommend it to others. The downfall came with the staff. When we arrived, the owner/worker was a bit awkward and did not really know what to say. He told us very little and locked us in the room. Without giving anything away, I think a clearer explanation would have helped start the game. Then, throughout the game, he was confused about what steps we had already figured out and gave us clues to steps we had already finished. Finally, he wasn´t paying attention at the end, to let us out once we had solved the puzzle. We kept attempting the final step, and after several tries the door popped open and he said we had won. It was a bit anti-climactic in my opinion.

Brilliant fun!. This was awesome - so much fun! I only wish there was something like this back home. We did room 1, with two people, and it was so enjoyable. Using logical and lateral puzzles to unlock padlocks, doors etc. Definitely recommend for anyone - friends, family, stag dos!

A fun and challenging hour. This experience was so intense it actually changed my way of thought. After we went out of TRAP, I kept looking for clues all around me, noticing every little detail of my surrounding. Needless to say, it was interesting, to say the least. the trap itself was challenging. Very challenging. We were 4 puzzle-loving-geeky-people, and still we needed quite a lot of hints to solve some of the puzzles.Still, it was an hour well spent. Personally I thought it might have been better if it were a bit longer than an hour, but my friends disagree with me, so it's probably just me.Anyway, if you have an hour to spare in Budapest, this should be your first option. Actually, even if you don't, you should clear an hour of you schedule to do this, it will be worth it.

Best attraction ever. My friends and I had a blast at Trap, it was such a fun time. The new room is huge, the puzzles are very well thought and combined. We all highly recommend this place. The team was also very welcoming and helpful when needed ;)If, by any chance, i go back to Budapest I will definitely try another room!The price is a bit expensive but it is worthy.

hour of fun.... It was our first ever experience with a 'real life escape game', but what a fun we had! You totally go up in the game and forget about time and place. Apparently these games are popping up all over Budapest and the rest of Hungary. They'll probably become a success in other cities too. Great for an hour of fun...

Brilliant fun!. We went to TRAP whilst on a family holiday in Budapest - it was fab and well worth a visit.The team that ran it were brilliant, really helpful and managed to squeeze us in at late notice. We went with adults, teenagers and a 10 & 8 year old and it was suitable for us all.It was really easy to find and we managed to find other places to visit in the way too!All In all its well worth a visit and far more professional staff and establishment than some other 'live escape' experiences offered in Budapest.
Best memory from Budapest. Reliving childhood memores... I felt like I was on the crystal maze. Such good fun! I'd love to do room 2!

Wow my kind of fun. We had the best time! We went back and did the 2nd game the next day cause we liked it so much. Wish their could be more of this in every city!! Great service! Creative mysteries! Really fun!!!!
Worth the time. It was fun and definitely worth the 12,000 HUF for the 4 person team. I would recommend this to anyone with time to spare.

Interesting. A good way to spend an hour. You get locked in a room and have to solve puzzles to get out. They don't always link together but there is someone on hand if you get stuck -just have to think outside the box.

Quickest hour!. Did this in a group of 2 people, very tricky but enjoyable. Managed to finish with a few helpful tips from the owner over the intercom!
Great fun would recommend

fastest hour ever!!!. Excellent idea, excellent spent time.
Nice puzzles, not to heavy, just musn't overthink, and if you sre n Budapest, you shoud visit TRAP.
One hour seems long, but it passed like five minutes...

Challenging and fun!. We went to Budapest for a long weekend on 8th November. This was probably one of the pricier activities we did - they charge by Team so the more people you have in the team (up to 5 max) the cheaper it works out. But it was such a great experience and totally worth the price! We couldn't stop talking about it afterwards, the puzzles are very well thought out and just the right level of difficulty. I can totally relate to the computer game but it is so different when you are trying to get out of a locked room in real life!Go try it! *You get hints as well if not on the right track so you won't end up sitting in the middle of the room pondering for 60 minutes*

AMAZING, EXCITING AND CHALLENGING!. We went to Budapest on 15th Nov for 2 nights for my sisters 30th Birthday. We wanted to do something different on our trip so turned to trip advisor.TRAP was rated 1st place for activities so we looked in to it. The concept seemed very interesting and something completely different to anything I'd done before so we decided to book up and give it a go. We had 7 people in our party so booked both rooms at the same time (max of 4 per room)When we arrived, the guy was straight to the point and told us we will be locked in the rooms and we have to get out. I'm quite claustrophobic so I was a little wary of what was going to happen, but as soon as the door closed on us, I forgot about everything and just wanted to find our way out and got well in to the spirit of puzzle solving.The whole experience was amazing and really well planned and thought out.Thankfully, we found our way out after 54 mins and the best time was 46 mins so you do get your monies worth!The whole party had a brilliant experience and wished we could do it all over again.I would recommend this to anyone who visits Budapest,It was one of the best activities I've ever done!!

Brilliant. Really good fun!We booked 2 rooms as there was 7 of us (4 in one, 3 in the other).It was a great experience, and we all couldn't stop talking about it afterwards, so much so that we wished we'd booked it again to try each others rooms out.Definitely recommend a visit.

superb panicky fun!. This was the best thing we did on an already excellent trip. Just such a great idea, and typifies the sensibility you'll find in Budapest's "ruin bars" - making something amazing out of very little budget, but lots of effort and imagination.Don't read too many of the reviews in case of spoilers - just go and lock yourself into a room and work out what you have to next!

Innovative and fantastic. My girlfriend (28) and I (26) visited TRAP due to the great reviews on here. It was truly an amazing experience. We were a little worried that it may be too simple as we are both keen puzzlers and thought it may be designed for kids. However, the difficulty is spot-on. With an hour to get out you will definitely be pressed for time - in fact we didn't quite make it. The owner will give you clues if you get really stuck, but he has clearly thought about how to word them without giving too much away.The puzzles were excellently designed, testing various skills (logic puzzles, physical games, riddles and more). There are also a lot of red herrings in the room - purely serving as a distraction, but simultaneously adding to the complexity and overall experience.After we left, we couldn't stop talking about it. If we had more time in Budapest I have no doubt we would've also taken a stab at room 2. It isn't a particularly cheap attraction, especially if you go as a couple. However, please don't let this put you off. It is a truly unique experience that really shouldn't be missed.

WOW!. If you make it to Budapest, this is a definite must do! We had 3 adults and did room #2. We made it out with 6 minutes to spare. The staff will provide little extra clues if you get stuck, and you probably will, which proves to be most useful. You have 1 hour after getting "locked" in the first room and then you must decipher codes and clues to find your way out of each room until you make your way back into the first room and enter the code to get out. It's a great time!

Think Simple!. Awesome experience, very challenging but you`ll be surprised from the simplicity of the game once you finish it. Costs 12.000 forints for a game, so the more people you are the cheaper it is.

Big fun!. As we were just two people, it was quite difficult to solve the puzzle in time and we didn't. But nevertheless, it was big fun and I was really surprised when I saw all the traps and the good ideas they had to put it up like this!

Entertaining but not worth the money. Was really disappointed with this if I am honest as I had been looking forward to it after reading Trip Advisor before going to Budapest. Two of us did it, it was a little bit creepy going down into a basement with a strange man who hardly talked to us and when we started it got a bit annoying when the guy kept pointing out what to do if we didn't get it straight away. Good way to kill an hour though I guess. I think I would have enjoyed it more if it wasn't so expensive. The price is the same for the activity as a whole, so the more of you there are the cheaper it is. Since there were only two of us, I left feeling a bit ripped off to be honest.

FUN FUN FUN and again FUN. 2 couple (37-45) with kids (age10/12) we had so much fun that we are stil thinking to go back to Budapest just to go to second room :) we were all stuned after we get out just because it was so interesting. some of us were little affraid that it will be spooky and claustrofobic but it's not, or at least you don't have that feeling because your brain is working in completly different path, so you don't have time to think about something else.we like it mostly because you have to use your brain 100%, and all of you, even kids can help.i guess we all just like challanges :)
what a brilliant game. So much fun, if you think you are clever....... think again, we finished both rooms but have to admit with a little help at times :-)

Was so good that we went again the next day!. If you have played any kind of adventure/room escape video game in your life or you like putting your intelligence to test, this is the ultimate deal. The game is for teams of min 2 max 5 people. Me and my best friend were thrilled to try this after reading the reviews. We did the first stage and we couldn't resist and did the second stage the next day. The best decision we have made. The second stage was longer and more challenging. We solved both in time. Asking for less hints in the second one. I would suggest doing the first level first to get acquainted with the concept, then trying the second one with less hints.There are a lot of distractions and things to be occupied with, so for a team of 2 its hard to do it in 1 hour. I guess 3-4 people would be best for this.Both stages have riddles that needs codes, keys, practical use of physics, some maths, a lot of thinking out of the box, speed, concentration and communication. This is the ultimate team building exercice and is the best game(real and video) me and my buddy have played so far. The owner is a genius and a great guy! Thanks for everything and we will come back for the future stages you will design.Greetings from Istanbul ;)

Think outside the box. This was great fun , language was no barrier, very friendly staff who give you a few hints along the way, was not easy, but that's half the fun , would be best to do it in pairs I think. Would definately like to go back and do the 2nd room . 5 stars

A great "Trap". This was so much fun. Not easy to solve but loved every minute of it. Enjoyed it so much we came back and did the second puzzle a couple of days later. Did it as a team of two and it was no problem not to have 4 people.

Too good to miss. Me and my mate gave trap a go after hearing all the hype on tripadvisor. It was easy to book and find. We went for room 2 which was really challenging, just make sure you don't over think things.
Highly recommended

Think outside the box!. I did this with my husband and we both loved every second of it! We only had time for room one but would love to come back and complete room two in the future. Great twists and challenges. Language was no barrier! A great way to spend an hour! A must do if in Hungary.
Great fun!. This past summer, I took a small group to this. Definitely a fun experience. It's challenging and exciting and I would definitely recommend it if you have a free hour one night.

Great fun!. We had a fun experience with our family. It was our son's 11th Birthday and he chose this activity for us. We loved it! Something different to do while travelling and the whole family worked together as a team. We recommend this warmly :)

Do it, ask later!. So much fun! Went with my mother and while we were waiting we teamed up with a brilliant couple so we were 4 players (a recommendation _ the more the merrier!). A great call, as we enjoyed it immensely with our new team members and everyone got at least 1 clue for everything. Was a total blast. A new experience as they kept it simple in attitude and technique...but complicated enough mentally for everyone. Go. Just do it, you wont regret it!
SO MUCH FUN. We had a great time here, and it was well worth the cost. So much fun, and not exactly easy to figure out. It was a lovely way to spend an afternoon, I would definitely do it again.

Definitely worth a trap...I mean trip. Worth a trip.. It's strange that the number 1 attraction in Budapest really has nothing to do with Budapest, but just happens to be in the city. But it is absolutely worth going.There were three of us to went, and we found our way out fine (with a little help). It would've been next to impossible I think to do a couple of puzzles with only two of us.It took a few minutes to get into the swing of things, but once we did it was a thoroughly enjoyable hour. I obviously won't go into any details about the puzzles themselves, but on the whole they are well devised and brilliantly executed.If you're in Budapest, find TRAP and enjoy it.
Do NOT miss. Brilliant idea. Wish they made another trap attraction... In every major city in the world. Owners of this place are pure genius.

Never seen nothing like it. This was a great hour of mind game. It looked a bit lame at first but it wasn't at all, the hole time we were there we were thinking in different ways. Really original, go go go!!!!!!

There's a reason it rates so highly!. Visited here with my brother & brother-in-law. Really fantastic challenge that got everyone involved & great fun throughout. Highly recommend to anyone; these are the kind of activities I'd like to see more of. Completely different & totally engaging. 5 stars.

Fun. Trap team is a fun activity conducted in a room where you must find clues to get to the next stage. My wife and I did the activity, however, for a team of two this is a very challenging activity and I suggest a team of four or six would be ideal. Once you solve a clue it will lead to another clue and eventually you will be required to perform a final task, a pleasant and fun way to spend an hour.
mind-bending fun. We went with our two kids, ages 11 and 8. They LOVED it. We survived, but did require a few hints. It's not cheap, but very, very memorable.

lots of fun. My husband and I did this while we were in Budapest. We did Trap 1. We weren't very good at it but we had alot of fun trying. It might have been easier with more than 2 people. The puzzles were very clever and difficult but they will give you clues if you get stuck.

unique experience! highly recommended. the goal is to escape the room and defuse the bomb in under 1hr. just like the flash games but this one is in real life which makes the experience simply astonishing. for the people who like a mental challenge it is the absolute right place. the team can be from 2-5 people but from me and my friend experience 2 is not enough (3-4 is the best).there is 2 rooms and i tried the first one .. next time i'll be in Budapest i'll try the next room .nothing more needs to be said other than : GIVE IT A TRY !p.s. it costs about 10 euros for a person in a team of 4 and it's better if you make a reservation before arriving

unique experience! Great fun!. Very clever maze! Really enjoyed this and is a very fun, hands on experience! I went with my boyfriend, and we didnt complete it unfortunately. We asked for very little help and there was only two of us, so i reckon more people would be better, but nonetheless i had a great time there! We did trap 1 and would highly recommend it!

Surreal..... TRAP was an amazing experience for me, as I love to play room escape games online! My sister & I chose to do Trap room 2 as it was more of a challenge. It was difficult, creepy (3rd little room in Trap 2), great fun and a must do while in Budapest. Best thing we did in Budapest....we will definitely be back to do Trap 1..and 2 again! :)

A must do!!. I definitely think this is worth a go, a lot of fun, some tense moments when you are stuck on something and there's a potential to get trapped in a room or have a bomb blow up (although, you obviously don't get trapped!)There are a lot of things to think about so take group of mixed intellect.Only thing I would change is the music, definitely think it should be scarier to get your heart pumping that much harder!!

Why see a movie when you can be in one?. Great fun for an hour. Challenging: escape from the world and enter another reality to exit a room or turn off a bomb. Very well thought out and worth the money.

Musty dungeon, but clever puzzles. We found this place on tripadvisor as the second-best thing to do in Budapest. Since we had children who were bored of looking at palaces and museums, we decided that this was a must-do in our itinerary, and boy was it a good decision.First off, I should mention that the location leaves a bit to be desired. It is in a very tiny and cramped dungeon with some obvious air quality issues, and this is the only reason I'm taking off one star. However, one could say that it adds to the atmosphere of the game :-)The TRAP game is all about solving a series of very creative puzzles to diffuse a time-bomb and escape. The puzzles come in all varieties, some of them may look familiar and others could totally stump you. There was one cryptogram which I couldn't decipher, but my 9-year-old immediately identified it as a standard math puzzle that she does in school :-)Be prepared for things to get very exciting, because one hour is not a lot of time, and there are a number of puzzles, and if you haven't seen a puzzle before it could stump you for precious tens of minutes. However, the person running the place does speak into the microphone and help if you are obviously stuck.At the end of the game, we were all thrilled and exhilarated, we will do the next puzzle when we visit Budapest again.

Just addictive - fantastic.... OK this place looks like a very strange place when you arrive, and the reviews struggle to describe what it is and how good it is, but it's a total gem!We pre-booked on the web, no payment needed, and did Trap 1 first. You literally go into a room have the door closed behind you and start looking for clues. To what?! We looked for a minute or so and then one of us noticed the start point - very clever.It's a basic set up, but so clever and totally enough to keep adrenaline pumping, you are so buzzed up to find the next puzzle. The whole team loved it (4 friends) and everyone was needed to play their part - whether you are blessed with lightning reflexes, brains, brawn or a logical mind you all need to add something to mix to fly through it.We diffused the bomb with 20 minutes to spare - and loved it so much did the next room too.Costs about £30 per team in the room, well worth it for an hours entertainment. We talked about it for ages afterwards over a cold beer, and just wished there was more of them round the world, we would be booking in...So if you have an hour to fill this is a great place to go and test yourself and play as a team. Great fun!

Unique family fun. We went with our 20 and 17 year old sons based on the positive reviews from Trip Advisor. TRAP lived up to the reviews. We very much enjoyed our experience and it was one of the most funs things we did in Budapest. The game takes about an hour, requiring good communications and teamwork. Our family did the "defuse the suitcase bomb" room. When we were stuck and needed (a little) help, the employee provided it through a speaker in the ceiling. We highly recommend.

With no doubt the best thing to do in budapest. Although we didnt manage to defuse the bomb, we had a lot of fun! Highly recommended next time we are going to try the 2nd room. We were 2, i think its better to be 3+

And don't worry, you'll get out alive.. Go with people you enjoying being around and this'll be great fun. The girls in our group were scared that we had gotten ourselves into a "Saw" like situation where in the best case we'd get robbed and in the most likely case, get killed. This made this even better. A grown up version of childhood treasure hint games. Loved it.

Excellent family fun. We went as a family group and had an excellent time in room 1, so much so that that we came back for room 2 the next day. Highly recommended. However if you family IQ is quite low (e.g. You are from Swindon :-)) then don't go as you will be there next year!

The closest you can get to being Sherlock. Searching for clues, figuring out codes, neutralizing a bomb in a suitcase...TRAP is like being a real detective in a video game brought to life. You have to have an analytical mind to figure out the clues, but more importantly, you have to have patience and not panic (because you are under a time limit!). This was a great bonding experience since you have to work with your teammate(s) to accomplish your mission. We would've done the second game (two options: we did the original bomb-in-a-suitcase game) if it weren't for the slightly steep price tag (of 40 euro). It was definitely worth it one time for the unique experience, but not something we wanted to cough up the money for a second time. It did fulfill some long standing fantasies we had about saving the world and being a hero.

Fantastic fun!. This is amazing. We went as a group of 8, and split into two teams of 4. My team did TRAP 2 while they did TRAP 1, we both got out of the rooms and had an amazing time. I cannot explain how good it is. Just wish we had time to both! DO IT!

The most confusing hour of your life. I hadn't had an experience like this before, it is something a bit different. You have a very logical mind for this although you don't need to be good with numbers.
