To solve the trap you had to complete a wide range of challenges which prevents it feeling repetitive.The only downside is the cost, it is £36 for the group for the hour and you can have upto 5 people in you group. As there were only 3 of us we got charged £12 each which I thought was quite expensive.

Great. It was a great experience and it`s worth it! Congrats` to them for thinking of it! I recommend it for anyone, it`s relaxing and fun! if you like solving any mysteries and if you like movies with detectives and putting your mind at work this is the perfect place.Good job!

Something a little different. Myself and six friends decided to come here, expecting something a little different, almost akin to puzzles from the Crystal Maze, and we weren't disappointed at all. The atmosphere is a little more intimidating and horror film-like, but the essence of solving riddles and puzzles by working as a team is the same.We split into two teams, with one doing Trap 1, the original suitcase bomb disposal challenge, and and the other the newer Trap 2, trying to escape the room. I did Trap 2 - I don't want to give anything away, but we were immersed into a room with codes and numbers splashed everywhere, and with various objects littered across the room. After exploring the room for clues, we were faced with several puzzles and challenges leading from one to the next, all of which eventually leads you to the end result (if you get that far!) of getting the code to exit the room.Thankfully, we were successful at escaping the room and the other team were successful at de-activating the bomb, but easy it wasn't. If having trouble or getting stuck, the host will give you nudges without giving the game away. Your ability to communicate, work as a team, think outside the box and discern valuable information from useless information will be tested.You might think 12,000HUF for an hour game is expensive, but it is totally worth it for an experience that is something completely different.
So much fun". My husband, 16 year old son and I had a great time with this! I think this is a greatt activity, especially if you have teens, who are "done" with the museum and history scene!
Reviews aren't lying. We went to TRAP based on all the positive reviews here on TA and we were not disappointed. Fun activity for all ages and the level of difficulty felt perfect.

TRAP Made a great trip even better. We walked down a backstreet of Budapest not quite knowing what to expect when we came across an innocuous staircase down to a basement.We were made to feel very welcome by our host who took us through the basics of the game. We were a party of 8 who split in to groups of 4 each on doing trap 1 and the other Trap 2. I was on the team that did trap 1 where the overall objective was to deactivate a time bomb within an hour.The puzzles that we encountered were very challenging but we found if we worked as a team it was possible to progress through the game. I can happily say that we managed to De activate the time bomb and our friends in trap 2 successfully manage to escape.I would recommend this to anyone visiting Budapest and hopefully Berlin (When TRAP Berlin opens!). In fact have gone as far as to plan a trip to Berlin just to visit!!

Unique Fun Not Worth Missing. This was probably the coolest thing my fiancé and I did on vacation. One warning: The game is located on a somewhat residential street so I would recommend taking a cab. Our taxi driver looked at us funny when we asked to be dropped at the address but it was there with "TRAP" written on the door. When we went in, the gentleman working the rooms was very accommodating. He looked disappointed that we didn't have reservations (so, make them in advance) but was able to get us in within a half hour. They kindly ask that you wait outside so that you don't get any clues. We were then locked in a room and given an hour to find and deactivate a "bomb" and then escape. I was worried about the language barrier but everything is in English and you don't actually need language. The game uses a lot of symbols and numbers. Anyway, we got stuck a few times but the host of the game gave us hints without giving away answers. We made it out with literally :56 seconds left. It was exhiliarating. Don't be swayed by the cost of 12,000 HUF per team. Totally worth the experience.
Really fun!. Great experience! You have to coöperate to disarm a 'bomb' and escape a room. We managed to disarm the bomb 20 seconds before it would've gone off.

Exhilarating. The adrenaline rush my friends and I got from TRAP was amazing! The puzzles were difficult but if you work as a team and put your heads together it's fantastic when you work out the clues! The guy who runs it is really helpful and gives you clues if you're really stuck.
Great geam. we really enjoyed the hour in the basement. Great ideas and totally friendly staff.Next time will definitely do the second room too.

mind bending fun!!!. Amazing and unique activity that made me feel like I was on the Crystal Maze! 4 out of 5 because we went as a couple and I think 4 would be a better team size. Having said that we were one minute off beating it, much to the annoyance of my boyfriend who wasn't bothered about going until we got there, the clock started ticking then became an army sergeant!! Definitely recommend to couples, friends and stag parties as a great change from sightseeing!
SAW without the gore. A group of four of us did Trap2 on a short trip to Budapest. We all loved it, a very different experience to standard touristy stuff. Could rate it more highly.

Challenging, creative and a little bit creepy. When you're in Budapest, you've gotta get TRAPpedI Imagine a cross between the Saw movies and puzzle video games, but in real life. Located on a quiet street, this attraction is easy to miss. It is not advertised well, but thanks to my fellow TripAdvisors, I knew to book this in advance. On arrival the rules were explained, and without any wait time, we were quickly locked into a small room. The puzzles were tricky and extremely engaging. There were only two of us and at least two people are required to solve the puzzles. The puzzles were all unique and required some brain power. When we were stuck for a few minutes, help from a few clues was quickly offered. Although we were able to complete the 'quest', we ran out of time to figure our way out. The only disappointment was not being able to complete the activity in the one hour time frame. Instantly as we walked out, we were already considering coming back to complete the second room.

Out-of-this-basement fun!. TRAP is *exactly* the kind of unusual vacation experience that some people are going to love. We conquered TRAP 2 (with three minutes to spare, w00t!) and we will be telling animated (spoiler-free) stories about it for a long time.In fairness, TRAP isn't going to be everyone's cup of tea. But: Are you a puzzle person? Brain teasers? Cryptograms? Adventure games? Did you play Myst as a kid? If so, do not hesitate. Book now. You will have a blast. :)
Mind boggling. 4 of us went for Trap 2. Very well designed, harder than we thought but had lots of fun! Needed a few hints, managed to get out within the set time!

Pretty cool, but a little too much help from the instructor. A very cool alternative thing to do in Budapest. Quite cool well thought out puzzles. The only disadvantage was that the instructor was a little too quick with providing hints through the speaker in the room, because of this we finished room 2 well within an hour.

trapped. If you want something else than the traditional things you do on a citytrip and you like to solve puzzels then this is the thing to do. We did both rooms, the first one we did noty make it but the second one we did.
Fun activity with friends. Very nice and helpful personnel. Good activity with friends and highly recommended if you want to try something different.

Great Fun. Had been to a similar attraction in Boston but this one was better. We turned up and managed to get a booking slot for the following day. The puzzles are pretty difficult and well thought out. A team of 5 seems to be the ideal number but there was three of us. It was great fun and everyone got really involved. There was no way that we were going to solve all the puzzles but we were being monitored for progress and got help via speakers when we struggled (which was pretty often). Would recommend this to anyone and especially families. There are two different puzzle scenarios so a second visit is a real possibility once you are hooked.

A real life escape the room game. We had been looking forward to this activity for our entire trip. We reserved online and arrived a little early. We had to wait a few minutes for the guy to finish setting up the room. We nervously sat on this dingy old couch. The rules were simple, "I am going to lock you in the room and you need to find the code to get out. Once you have the code punch it into the door code lock. Okay?" Sure. Then we racked our brains trying to find keys and codes for locks. So creative! A real life escape the room game! For $50 cdn it was worth every penny.

Just when you thought nothing could get you enthused....... went to TRAP after seeing the rave reviews with my partner. Both of us thought we where pretty smart and would nail it in minutes!! Incorrect. TRAP has been devised so well and uses every sense to keep you engaged and involved.I wish there was a TRAP in every major city. Genius!!don't go if you like things beige.

So much fun!. Absolutely loved this activity but trying to explain it to friends since we got back home is a bit difficult...it usually goes something like this: "We were locked in a room with no idea of how to get out at first and had to look through a variety of items to find clues. Then with only a couple of minutes to go I put in the wrong code and blew us all up."Not your usual tourist activity but most definitely worth it. I really wish that we had gone back the next day to do the second room, but we just didn't have enough time.There were four of us in the room and it made it a bit easier for some of the clues since four brains are better than two.Would I do it again? In a heatbeat!

So much fun. We were looking forward to TRAP all holiday and it didn't disappoint. We did the first room which was difficult but we managed to complete it in time, and had so much fun that we booked to come back to do the second one straight away. If you like those escape the room games, or ever enjoyed things like the crystal maze, then this might be the best thing you can spend a holiday doing.

Absolutely Brilliant - Devillishly Designed !. My group split over the two rooms - room 1 failed, room 2 got out. Very ingeniously put together alot of thought required. A great way of spending an hour or so !

Genuine mind boggling fun. If you're looking for a different thing to do while you're on holiday, than an hour at TRAP is surely a must. You are locked in a room and have an hour to solve puzzles which will get you through different rooms and finally to the exit. Was great fun both for us and our kids. Definitely recommended.
Highlight of our trip. What a fun and different thing to do. Was very challenging, but not too hard. Would of loved to stay and do the next room.

A brilliant, different way to pass an hour or two!. Brilliant fun! I went to Budapest last weekend with my husband and another couple. We had looked around for things to do and this popped up, looked fun so we thought we would give it a go. Basically your group gets locked in a room for an hour and you have to hunt for clues, crack codes and solve puzzles to find your way out. It was brilliant fun! We had to have a little help along the way, but managed to work our way out in the end. There are 2 different rooms/scenarios to choose from, if we had not been short of time we would have gone back and done the other one too. Great laugh, well worth a visit!

Amazing! Out of the box activity!. If you like to solve mysteries and find clues and all sort of detective work this is the place! We had an amazing time! We saw some posters in our hostel about TRAP and made a reservation online, they responded super quickly even when I send an enquiry there was no problem with the reservation at all and Elizabeth (member of the staff) treated us super fine! We had tons of fun and managed to deactivate the bomb and escape :)

Great fun, challenging and unique. I had read about TRAP from other reviews and thought it might be interesting. I knew my son would be excited but was skeptical about my wife and daughters. We went and had a great time. So much so, that we went back a second night and played the other room. TRAP is a fascinating fun teambuilding type experience where as a team you try to decipher clues to solve puzzles and either escape from a 4 room maze or disarm a suitcase bomb.I think my kids 17, 16 and 8 would probably say this was the highlight of the trip. The price is fair and costs about $55 per room for an hour. It is incredibly well conceived and challenging. If you are comfortable doing something a little different, TRAP is for you.

Different and fun!. Me and my boyfriend tried out TRAP this july 2013. It was definitely worth both the time and money. Though it was a lot harder than I had expected (but you get help from the staff when you get stuck). Unfortunately we didn't manage to disarm the "bomb" in 60 minutes, but still it was awesome. I think it would have been a bit easier if we would have been more than 2 people. Budapest all in all was a great city and I will definitely go back there, especially since I haven't tried room 2 yet.. :-)

Unique. The experience of TRAP was definitely something new and lots of fun. Some of the puzzles are challenging but the staff will help if there's need. There are two rooms to choose from. Next time we visit Budapest, we'll definitely try the other one as well.It's not too expensive since more people can share. It's best if there's three of you; at least two. Anything more than four is just too crowded because, on the one hand, the rooms are pretty small and on the other, some of you just wouldn't have anything to do if there are too many of you.

Great Experience. So good that we did the seemingly common thing of booking the second room for the next day. Great fun and the staff are excellent in helping when necessary and very friendly. Would definitely recommend for all ages.

Different and fun...even if you explode at the end. Great escape from all the traditional touristy stuff. Perfect for small groups. Look at a map and find the place, that is the first part of solving the puzzle...The place looks like a regular apartment building, take three more steps and you will see the sign to the basement where TRAP is situated. Reserve your time slot because there are only two rooms to go through.

awesome. the most fun we had all week! challenging and well designed puzzles. highly recommended. away from the main streets but totally worth it. dont miss it. great staff alsi, giving clues when you're stuck.

Good fun!. Went with a large group of friends after seeing the rave reviews on Tripadvisor. Really different to other tourist-y attractions and lots of fun, even if we were rubbish at solving the clues. Word of warning - it's not as easy as it looks! Well worth a visit.

really fun!. exciting,fun,the owner was really nice :) he gives you extra clues if you're lost. and we got a little gift because we solved the case in time.
I recommend it!
book in advance.
Very fun and full of suprises. After playing one room, we immediately agreed to play the other as well. Had a great time - I was even inspired to start building a room escape of my own!
Great. Booked online, cheap and really enjoyable. Absolute must for anyone wanting a different type of activity to do in the evening!

Best time ever while defusing a bomb. We enjoyed TRAP so much we came back the next day to do the other puzzle room. Everyone would enjoy this - use your brains on vacation. They will give you hints if you get stuck.
Highly recommended!
Awesome!. Definite must when your in Budapest. 10 minute walk from blue metro station, about $60AUD. Book in advance because they do full up quickly.
Incredible. So much fun. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and only wished we had more time to go back and do the second room. A definite when in budapest!

Fun and more Fun. We booked online before our trip to Budapest. TRAP is brilliant. Four of us spent an hour trying to solve a puzzle. It was great fun, thanks to the style, layout and challenge. Staff were super, giving us the odd clue to ensure we kept moving towards a solution. We would recommend it to anyone and suggest you book well in advance. It was worth the money we paid. Hope to do it again.
Excellent. If you like the old Crystal Maze TV show this is brilliant! Definitely worth a visit and never seen anything like this before!

Brilliant Time. We booked this before travelling to Budapest and what a brilliant time we had we were 2 coles and its the best hour we have spent in ages, we laughed we creid and it was ace. The staff were brilliant and we thought it was worth every penny. Highly recommended

Best fun ever! (If you like puzzles). Our hotel was nearby and we got curious walking past. If you've ever played platform games or enjoy puzzles, you'll love this. Not cheap at 12.000Ft but great fun. Quite challenging to do in an hour, we needed a couple of hints but felt so pleased with ourselves when we worked it out.

So much fun!. Like everyone else, we found out about TRAP through Tripadvisor while doing research on Budapest. We were so happy we did, because it was such a fun experience. We booked our time online, and found the place without a problem. It is pretty centrally located just a few blocks away from the Jewish Quarter.I don't want to give away too much about the challenges, as the mystery is part of the fun, but needless to say that it is really a great experience, but it will probably be even better the more people you have in your group.
Great Idea. This place was really cool. Well thought out and good fun. We did both challenges and spent around 2 hours. Highly recommended.
Very clever and different game for the whole family. Do not judge the poor interior, the game is Fun and different.I would certanly try their traps again.

Highly recommended. We booked TRAP based on the tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. Such clever ideas and a completely new experience for us. We found the service very friendly and welcoming and we have even looked into whether there are similar experiences in London now we're back home! One note is to ensure you take cash as they don't accept card, it cost us 12000 HUF, all in all highly recommended.

Very fun!. I would definitely recommend doing TRAP. We did one room and if we had had time would have gone back and done the other one. It is really fun and challenging and we found the people there very nice. There was only 2 of us but we managed to complete it within the time. It might be easier with more people but it is definitely still possible with 2.

the place to be! ;). excellent service! good atmosphere, tons of fun! I highly recommend this place to everybody! although we had to wait a bit, it was 100% worth it! the puzzles are challenging and as they say: that is really the 'unusual' way! cheers! ;)

DONT GO TO THIS PLACE!. From TripAdvisor I saw that TRAP was ranked high and was interested to give it a try. I visited their website trap.hu and made a reservation, where they sent me a confirmation over email. The next day, when we made our way over to the location, we were met with this guy at the door who showed us a huge amount of attitude, and told us simply you can't go in. We were like Why? Is it because we are 15 minutes early? We don't mind waiting.. But he was like No, you can't go in. He was highly evasive about it until upon further pushing did he admit that he let another group in. Then what was the reservation online for? He was not apologetic about making us make a wasted trip at all, and whilst smoking, just kept telling us you can't go in. He made half hearted efforts by offering us slots 5-6 hours after the slot we booked for, which completely defeat the purpose of a reservation! They obviously don't care about online reservations, and only want to maximise profits by entertaining walk-in despite the time clashing with reserved slots. No integrity in doing business at all and Worst customer service ever. TRAP completely spoilt our holiday. Don't visit it!

don't miss it!. We did room 1 the first day had a great time. It was hard but so much fun. For this room need a minimum of 3 people. Went back next day and did room 2. Loved it, room 2 can be done by 2 people. Was definitely a highlight of our trip to Hungary. Well worth it

So much fun we went back again the same day!. We did this as a couple and had such a great time. After reading previous reviews we were thinking of trying to find two others to join us, however in the end I'm glad it was just the two of us. In fact, we enjoyed the challenge of trap two so much that we went back in the afternoon to complete trap one. Some of the puzzles are really challenging and force you to think outside the square, whilst others can be solved through a logical process. We would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Budapest!!!

Great fun, wish there were more of us!. We did this as a couple and although we had brilliant fun we were told after it was designed for 4 or more people and I can understand why. Very clever puzzles and lots to do but we struggled for time with just the two of us figuring things out. Would definately go back to do the second room with friends. A brilliant activity for friends or family!

Best Time Ever!. SO FUN! Sort of hard to find, but that will just warm you up for the puzzles inside! Did this with a team of three, may be easier with four people. Also - scan the room BEFORE you start jumping into answering all of the puzzles!

Good fun, though could perhaps do with some updating.. Did this last week with a team of three. Finding the 'beginning' point wasn't very intuitive, and some of the earlier clues/puzzles were a bit dated. Overall though this was great fun when we got the hang of it and managed to diffuse the bomb even with only one of us being any good ;)

Very clever. Such an inventive and clever puzzle, I can't recommend this enough. The amount of work and testing that must have gone into every aspect of this is staggering. The little humorous touches and attention to detail make it a fantastic activity and a must if you have any time in Budapest.
Great place. you have to come here, won't regret it. a lot of fun, helpful staff :) we made a reservation online. only played one room, hopefully we'll get back and do the second one too

Mind blowing fun. When we saw Trap while browsing on tripadvisor, we knew, that this should be on our "to do" list. We booked it online, about a week before we went to Budapest. It took us some time to find the place, but of course it was worth it. We played Trap 2, where the main task is to deactivate the bomb, but to fulfill this task you have to solve numerous riddles and problems. We both loved it, as the idea is really smart and so are the problems, riddles and hints. I had never done something like this before, and I think that this is something you should do, if you are looking for some smart fun, while you're staying in Budapest.

Great place, Wrong Address!!!. This place was a lot of fun! Good challenge, great atmosphere, really creative. Highly recommend it!But the tripadvisor address will send you to the wrong district! Make sure you confirm the district ahead of time! (We nearly missed out on it completely because we drove around for an 45 minutes recovering the time we lost)

Trap...fantastic must do. We found trap whilst on trip advisor and booked online. It was easy to find and the owner was very helpful. We did trap1 and had an hour to deactivate a bomb. It was fun exciting and a brilliant experience. We have never done anything like this before so it is a must do whilst in budapest
The best.. It was really fun :)definitely try it. Some of the puzzles are not easy and you need a small hint to proceed.

Awesome, but incorrect location on TripAdvisor. This place is great. The puzzles are not easy and team work is key in overcoming challenges within the given time. The address mentioned in TripAdvisor is wrong. I do not understand why it hasn't been changed yet. The correct location is Maria Utca 19 in Budapest 8th district and not the Budapest 16th district as mentioned here. Its better to follow the GPS or just ask for directions. Trust me its worth it.

Fun but not scary!. This was a really fun place. It reminded my boyfriend and I of a militia type Legends of the Hidden Temple (any 90's fans?). My title says not scary because I was afraid that it was going to be creepy or scary looking. I can at least say that door one is not scary, and I am a chicken so I would know. Tips: It would be more fun in groups bigger than two. Wear something you're okay with getting a little dirty as you might have to crawl or get on your knees so your pants might get a little dusty. Don't bring a purse or valuables as there is no where to lock them up, which made me paranoid.

Fun and challenging!!. I saw this attraction from tripadvisor and we decided to go with a team of four.First we went there to see the place and in first look it was preety scary:)we made our booking for Sunday (which is a almost full day by the way) so i advise you should make your booking a day before .We played trap 1 which you need to deactivate the bomb in one hour.Unfortunately we did not had enough time to complete the mission but it was so fun :)you need to make some combinations with the items in the room and some items are tricky(just useless but it takes your time to figure out)but you will not know which step you need to take and thats the challenge and fun :) the owners can see you from the camera and if you stuck in a level they help you with little hints.A little math and a little comman sense actuallty gets you to the final step.we had a lot of fun.(it is mind challenging).It is preety different and outstanding experience that you should do if you visit Budapest.

Different and fun experience!. We went to Trap after reading about it on Trip Advisor. The guy who worked there was friendly and helpful. We were in the first room. It was nerve-wracking and exciting at the same time. Would definitely recommend coming here!

Great experience, nothing else like it!. TRAP was found whilst browsing TripAdvisor, and it immediately went to the top of the Budapest to-do list. It is easy to book online - website is available in Hungarian and English, and we received an email reminder on the day too. It is located just past the apartments at Maria Utca 19, down some steps. When we arrived, we were greeted by the owner, who asked explained how TRAP worked, and showed us into TRAP1. We weren't really sure what to expect, so it was so fun trying to figure out all the puzzles. If you ever got stuck, the owner was on hand via camera to give you a little clue. I've never been to anything like it, and would recommend everyone to try it! Sadly, we didn't have enough time to do TRAP2, but will definitely do it if we return!

extremely original idea great fun. we went as a varied group and we all really enjoyed itI think of myself as fairly kopped on but the puzzles were devilish thankfully peter was there to guide us towards some clues but I reckon if I went again to the same room I would still struggleexcellent for children aged around 10 and overproper secret agent stuff

This is a must do activity!. I would never insist on anyone doing anything, and I shall not do so now. What I will do is say that having visited TRAP it was the single most enjoyable activity of my trip to Budapest and since returning home I have booked up the equivalent in London. Having read what little information was available on-line me and my girlfriend had very little idea of what to expect really. This was absolutely no hindrance to the level of enjoyment we experienced. What I would say is as a team of (2) we realised that an extra person or even (2) more would have been very welcome. Some things you simply will require a little help from the controllers if you lack the knowledge. However, that said almost everything is solvable from clues within the rooms or from applying your mind outside of the box. I would describe the overall experience as both incredibly stimulating and exciting at the same time. It brings out a sense of competition and team building with you needing to work in unison with your team at the same time as being open to allowing everyone a chance to put their thoughts on the puzzles in the open. Having completed the first puzzle we immediately booked to return the next day to complete the 2nd room. We enjoyed it thoroughly despite running out of time and not escaping, whereas the 1st room we managed to escape albeit we did receive some help, being complete novices to this type of experience. I believe the cost was around £12 each however, I really am not 100% on that as it was paid for in Hungarian Florints and we didn't hesitate to pay what was asked. Also I am unsure as to whether the cost was per person or per room. I think this would be suitable for almost any traveller, whether you are a young couple, an elderly couple an adult family unit with teenagers etc. However, this is probably not suitable for children due to the thought processes utilised, however, perhaps a childs mind would be of benefit. Happy escaping!
Great place to come. We came to Budapest on a stag doo there was 13 of us great fun trying to find the puzzles and working how to get out of the room I do recommend coming here

Brilliant fun!!. Great way to spend an hour. We went on our last day in Budapest, it was rainy and we were a bit hungover so nearly didn't go. We went without a booking and he facilitated us immediately (although it was a Wednesday so I'd say book at the weekends). We weren't sure what to expect and were very slow to get started. It was like a puzzle treasure hunt. The guy watches on CCTV and gives hints over a speaker when it was obvious we were going no where with the clue. It took us so long to solve the first one we felt pretty thick but we quickly got in the groove and were really buzzed by the end of it. Had we stayed in Budapest another day, we would have gone back again to try the other room. Great way to spend an hour!!

Unique, fun experience!. Went as a team of 2 to try this out and were really unsure what to expect.. We loved it! A really unique experience and a great way to spend an hour! We did room 2.One tip: don't arrive too early before your start time. We arrived about 15 minutes before and overheard the people before us shouting out the final clue. It was no problem for us because we just did the other room instead as it was available too. Definitely recommend going to this place!!

Great Fun!!. We saw this acitivoty and thought we would give it a try. There were only 2 of us in the room trying to solve the puzzles which was very difficult so I advise taking 4 people. Very clever and really made you think, something unique. Although not scary, it was eerie! It took us a little time to find the location but when we go inside we were greeted well and set to work! I recommend this as a must do in Budapest.

One of a kind experience, heaps of fun!!!. Never had anything like this before but it was definitely lots of fun. Rules are you have to find your clue and then figure out how to unlock certain things etc. Groups of 2-4 and it cost HUF 9000 per group but worth it the 60min!! You can book throughout the day and all the way til night time so some good fun before you head out for the night too. A highlight for my budapest trip for sure!!

Challenging but good fun!. Just back from a trip to budapest and trap was Definetly one of the highlights of the trip! There was only 2 of us so it was a little but more difficult but probably even more fun. The manager helped when we were really stuck but bar that left us to our own devices! Fully recommend trap to everyone a must do when you are in budapest!

Great fun and interesting challenge..... We were just the two of us, my husband and I and had a great time (almost didn't argue :) , but you can be four peopIe I think and they have two traps you can try if you're more. Call or write in advance to make an appointment. Think out of the box when you go. But definitely recommendable as a different thing to do in Budapest, it's central, good value for money and it only takes an hour ... if you get out alive that is......

Highly recommended!. I saw this on tripadvisor and thought that It could be a great experience to give it a try and have to say it was amazing! We never did anything like this before so it was a great experience for us and we solved the puzzles with some hints from the friendly host.

May not seem like the standard tourist attraction, but it's great fun! DO NOT MISS!!. TRAP is quite a hidden attraction. Not very obvious from the road, but just follow the address and you won't have much problems finding it. They have 2 puzzle rooms currently and my husband and I had a great time in both TRAP 1 and TRAP 2. Basically you have to solve the puzzles as a team by looking for clues (physical, mental) within the given time. TRAP 1 is to find the password to the bomb before it detonates. TRAP 2 is to find the code to get out of the room before time is up. We went as a couple, manage to solve both puzzles with the help of the crew who gave additional clues if they sense us getting stuck at a particular point for longer than usual. I think it will probably be even more fun to go as a bigger group.It's a very unique experience in all, somewhat like the flash-based Crimson Room game (created by Toshimitsu Takagi in 2004) but more awesome as you can play in REAL LIFE! We've had a good variety of puzzles, some are even quite challenging. Won't go into the details coz I don't want to spoil the fun but it's great for everyone in the family. The way the guys design the puzzles are really quite creative!Yes, it's not your standard tourist attraction (museum, cathedral, river cruise, etc) but it will definitely guarantee a great time out with friends or family. I hope they will create more rooms soon, can't wait to try more puzzles from TRAP! Our weekend trip to Budapest was a lot more interesting because of TRAP. Highly recommended. Do not miss!!!!Some tips:- Cash payment only.- Book in advance - they do get very busy in the weekend.- As you have a booking schedule to meet, do allow more travelling time to tram + walk over as budapest is a big city and it takes time to get around

Amazingly fun experience in Budapest!. This adventure was the highligt of our trip to Budapest. We solved one of the rooms, even thougj it was hard wit only two participants. We did need a bit of help to solve it but we did so with 6 minutes left on the bomb timer. Coincidently, the code was the same as the door code for our hotel! What that is, will take to my grave...Seriously, you MUST visit TRAP if you go to Budapest. Next time we go back, we will try the other room.

One of the most unique and best things I've done thus far. Visited Budapest for a short weekend last week and having looked for things to do decided to try out TRAP. Simply put it is a must!!!! We went as a group of 6 and split into 2 groups this worked out at roughly £9 per person and boy was it worth every penny. The staff are very friendly and are more than happy to guide you if you miss the mark. Don't want to spoil it for the rest of you but please, please, please do go and experience TRAP (book in advance)

A fun, exciting, entertaining experience I would recommend it to anyone and everyone !!!!!!!!!!!. Do not be deceived by the modest building and exteriors, it was probably my best experience in Budapest. The staff are extremely friendly, helpful and welcoming. TRAP is perfect for all age groups and is a world class experience full of surprises.

fantastic and unique. dont miss this!. this is great, and ive never seen anything like it. dont miss it.the experience involves a group of you (between 2 and 4 people although we did it with 2 and we struggled) being locked in a room with lots of props around. the idea being to exit it within an hour or face death...there are clues (if you can find them!) and puzzles to solve, both mental and physical . the level of detail of the clues, mechanisms and the misdirection and sheer left-field thinking that has been put into the design is absolutely fantastic.we had to get a few clues from the room director (he watches on a web cam and can offer clues vocally over a speaker if you have been stuck for ages) - it would be better with 3 or 4 people.think S.A.W. (but its child friendly )we did the first one (we didnt make it out though!) and immediately booked to do the other room it was so good. we did get out of the second one which we were very proud of!!its just a shame that there arent more rooms to do - we would have done as many as they had!DONT MISS THIS!!

My students loved this!. We were in Budapest for a school sports competition and had a day to spend in Budapest before our departing flight home. After reading about TRAP on tripadvisor we decided to bring our student group for the morning. They LOVED it. We had 19 children aged 12-16 and they all enjoyed themselves. They really enjoyed the challenge and didn't stop talking about their experience for the rest of the day. Each group sent between one hour to one hour and a half and not once did they get bored or complain.I would recommend this activity to anyone and know that my students are now planning to visit other TRAP sites around the world. There was excellent communication between myself and the guys running TRAP and everything went very smoothly.Thank you for a great experience!

Fun hour while in Budapest!. I decided to book up TRAP a couple of days before we flew out based on the reviews I read. We did room one and although we didnt manage to exit the room in the hour we still had lots of fun! I would definately recommend giving this a go, as its definately something different to the usual sightseeing etc while on holiday!

something never seen before. I knew about the place a few months ago and I thought that It could be a great experience to give it a try and I was totally right. I haven´t seen anything like this before, an "exit game" but it seem now is very popular in Budapest. It is really interesting because this is the perfect way to prove your skills solving puzzles in a fun atmosphere. I truly recommend it, if you have the chance to visit Budapest. ;)

A genuinely unique experience!. We've done a lot of travelling, and have experienced a lot of new things but this is certainly something we have never come across before.Imagine the crystal maze, but an hour long version where you're all involved finding, discovering and exploring. The owner has done a fantastic job at creating an exciting environment that has you feeling excited about finding clues every step of they way.There are two 'puzzles', and the first one was so good we went back the next day to do the other.Make the effort and visit this if you have the chance, you won't be disappointed.

Had to do both rooms!. I had my family on visit and felt to do something fun before one of our dinners. I found TRAP here on TA and decided to give it a try. We who went was my sister (age 21) and her boyfriend (21), Me(31) and my Dad (49). We made the reservation on the webpage for one of the rooms (room one).The guy in the lobby just said that we could start whenever, even though we were 15 min early. We entered a strange room with a lot of things and the door closed behind us.In one hour we were supposed to disarm a bomb in a suitcase and get out (I won't reveal anymore). We had such fun!! The puzzle was quite hard, but since our every move was watched by the personal outside we got small hints anytime we were stuck or very off target.After completing room one, we just wanted MORE so we ended up doing room 2 as well!This was 2 hours of complete fun, and If there would have been more rooms to do we would have done them as well!Everyone in our group found it to be very fun regardless of age and gender.Unfortunately you can only do this once since you will know the solutions, but I will keep an eye on the place (if they ever make another room, I will go again :)I think this is a perfect thing to do with your family or close friends, but it could also work as something you could do with your co-workers as a team-event.I think you need to be at least 10 or something to understand some of the puzzles, but If I was here with my parents as a kid I would probably have loved it anyway (if my parents managed to solve the puzzles for me :).Conclusion - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
Simply amazing. This is a totaly unique experience where your mind is challenged with really ingenious tricks. It was simply one of the ebst things we did on the city.

Great place. I had the opportunity to visit Trap on october and I found it great, the best part is the place has been designed for people from all over the world and not only for hungarian speakers, and the people who runs the place can speak english which is a plus. I definitely recommend it.

TRAP is an unique thrilling must in Budapest.. TRAP is not an ordinary tourist attraction, this is something I’ve never seen before. The name TRAP stands for ‘Team Race Against Puzzle’, and that’s exactly what it is. You’ll get locked up with between 2 and 4 friends in a room and your team has to puzzle themselves out of this room. This is not scary or spooky, but just a lot of fun! You’ll feel yourself like a kind of Sherlock, getting clues and use these to unlock a box or a door. At this moment there are two ‘traps’. This means there are two different rooms you can play with your friends. For both rooms you’ll have 55 minutes to finish. Me and my friends played both rooms, and failed with room 2 completely. Don’t think TRAP is something easy, your brains will be triggered. The room 1 we succeeded and we can now proudly say we survived TRAP! Unless we were not able to finish both rooms, playing them filled a big part of our day with a lot of fun. I can’t say much more about the rooms, because I would spill too many secrets you don’t want to know yet. TRAP can be found near the centrum of the city. The closest metro station is Kálvin tér on the M3, from there it’s about a 10-minutes’ walk. You can also take tram 4 or 6, from tram station Harminckettesek tere it’s only a few minutes’ walk. Just type in the address on Google Maps and the location will match exactly. There is no big sign at the entrance, but you’ll recognise it by a poster at the entrance door.The guys that run this place are very friendly. One of them speaks good English, so that’s no problem for tourists. Their website is also available in English. On this website you can make a reservation for the room(s) you want, so you will be sure you can play at the moment you want. It’s not the cheapest attraction in Budapest, but worth every cent. And in the cold months of the year, it’s also great that the attraction is warm inside. So if you want to do something unique and thrilling in Budapest, going to TRAP is a must!
Must see it. This place is an amazing opportunity to spend an exciting hour with your mates. Full of many great and suprising ideas. Great fun!

So Much FUN!. Our group of six friends did the Mafia Mission. I won't post any spoilers but there are lots of fun surprises. The whole puzzle was so cleverly thought out. A great group activity. I would even go just with a partner and slip in with a smaller group. Thanks for having us!

Great puzzles in an authentic atmosphere!. Our family (4) did the Mafia Mission room, which was very good! we've done a few escape rooms before so we had experience, and this one wasn't easy at all! had to work in parallel. they got the Maffia atmosphere down perfectly :) the puzzles and problems we faced had some very originals. The staff was nice and helpful. the area it is in is wonderful with a lot of restaurants pubs and bars

Excellent game. This was my second game here, and it was great, again. We were seven in the White Room, White Mission. Interesting logical challenges, nicely done! We had two game-masters, both were friendly and helping.Thanks for the experience! I highly recommend it!
Professional place, professional team. My favourite escaping game-place in Budapest. The team is welcoming and professional. The rooms are well-equipped, the game is organized very well.

great fun classics!. As an important part of our vacations in Budapest the two of us started with breaking out from the cosy prision cell - just in time and having lots of fun. Our great Game Master (it was the cool and very sales talented girl) convinced us to return and solve the Mafia Mission even though we were just two players. The decoration is also great and we got out of the room in the very last second. Very friendly staff, location in the city center, very funny games. Greetings from Barcelona to you guys!

White Mission is a must. If you are a team with experience and love escape rooms, the White Mission room is a must for you. Very challenging, but awesome. Great puzzles, theme, decor. We loved everything and we are very proud that we managed to solve everything and escape in 51min. If you play for the first time, maybe it is better to choose another room or you could still try this one with some help from the stuff. They are very nice and they told us that they even let teams finish their game after the time is over, which is very nice.

Excellent. As we were staying in Gozsdu we thought we would have a go, simply went on there website and booked a slot for the prison puzzle. The puzzle was excellent and took some time and thought to work through. The people running the puzzles were extremely helpful, very friendly and had a great sense of humour. Would recommend to all.
Great game!. The Prison room is wery funny and smart game. We liked very much. Great puzzle and right interior make this room very good.

Go play Mafia Room!. We played the Mafia room in a team of 4 and it was really really good. We've heard about the White room as well, but unfortunately it was booked at the time. Nevertheless, the Mafia room did not let us down one bit, it was a very good experience!

Excellent visit . Popped in without booking, really friendly staff. They talked us through the rooms and we decided to do the prison, managed to complete it just in time. Really well thought out room and if you've never done one like us I can recommend this one, will definitely go back and try the mafia room before we go home. Don't hesitate go play you won't regret it.

Grey Cell Exercise. Having been educated by Hercule Poirot and Miss Marple four of us decided that we should use our powers of deduction in an 'escape room' experience. The one we chose had three levels of difficulty so we chose the mid level (9 out of 10). The room from which we had to 'escape' was in character with the theme, instructions given to us were clear so we felt confident that we would be able to get out of the room within the time limit of 75 minutes. We did get out in the end having solved the clues, I will admit that we had to call for help to finally solve the last clue. Great fun, try it.

One of the best. We have done about 10 rooms and the ones here are some of the best. Beautiful, varied puzzles with clear paths through, no annoying false leads, rooms well maintained and set up, very nice staff, good prices. We (2 of us) did mafia then white room. Both excellent. Beginners should avoid white room probably but fine for av reasonably experienced group. Thanks so much!

White Room. As part of an entire weekend of doing escape rooms in Budapest, the White Room at Gozsdu Mission was our last stop. It was actually recommended by one of the gamemasters of a previous escape room game. The White Room is a 10/10 difficulty and the only one we know of, that gives you 90mins to get out. The room is entirely white with just one key hanging from the ceiling.The riddles were demanding, but solveable and really, really awesome. One of the best rooms so far and a definite must-do for experienced escape room fans.

An excellent room!. We did the White room - their hardest one! We did it as a couple, would recommend at least 4 people for this, there are several puzzles which require time so you need more players, Some very intriguing puzzles which require some real thought! A very well thought out room! Would definitely recommend even though we didnt quite break out!

Good escape rooms!. We did 2 escape rooms here, white and maffia. Both were really nicely decorated and the gameplay was cool and exciting. If you like to be challenged a lot do the white mission, if you like some excitement do the mafia.

Recommended escape game.. PRISON MISSION: We were three people to do the prison mission (M/24, M/24, M/26). With the two of us only been doing escape games one time earlier.The game were constructed with a fixed "timeline" which were different from what ive tried before.We were able to book the room a half hour prior to our visit. which were perfect.Would recommend to friends, family and others.

Very entertaining . Had a brilliant laugh doing the mafia mission, 8 of us went into the room and we found it surprisingly hard to complete the mission. It felt quite real whilst in the room and set out brilliant, good for a rainy day.

A hidden gem we found unexpectedly. My family and I, four of us with a daughter (19) and a son (16), were on our way to the Opera house and happened to pass by this on a pedestrian side street filled with a multitude of restaurants and quick bits to eat. We live outside NYC and had heard about places like this before. We only had 3 days in Budapest, and were trying to make the most out of our time. Teenagers can only go to so many churches and museums, so we decided to try something different. The woman who greeted us was lovely and we found out later that her brother and her designed the rooms themselves. As first-timers, we did the prison room, which is supposed to be the easiest out of the 3 rooms. Time limit was 1hr and the fastest finisher did it in 24min.... We took the entire time, but eventually figured it out. It was so intricate, and had a great storyline, the entire family left gushing about it.Highly recommend for everyone to try this!! I think families with kids over 13, friends, and anyone else would absolutely love this.

A great escape. Went to Mafia Room with 3 friends and we're given 75 minutes to escape. The puzzles were fun and challenging and we all could contribute. Great location, though it is tucked back from the street near some bars.Oh yeah, we escaped!

Out of the ordinary activity. I went here without knowing where I was, best thing ever. They have three different missions, each one with a different theme/story and difficulty. I did the prison mission which was quite thrilling and really puts you into thinking your way out of your prison cell. If I ever visit Budapest again I'll try to complete the other two missions (white mission and mafia mission).

Absolutely one of the best. The white room is challenging, but everything has a purpose and the puzzles are great. One of the best rooms I have ever played. Nice to have more than an hour for a change. We have splitt our group in groups of 2 and 3 and played the different rooms simultaneously and then switched.

Great puzzles, but had a old man leering at girls entering. Puzzles were a lot of fun and were definitely solvable while still presenting a challenge. Experience was diminished by a older man sitting at the entrance leering at female patrons, gave a generally unsafe and unwelcome vibe.
Prison Mission Escape Room. A very well-designed escape room, with logical problems and puzzles. Brilliant setup and story line as well. Highly recommended.

White Room - Different Escape Room Experience. We did the white room which was quite different from previous rooms we done before. It's scenery is very "clean"/"white" focusing on the various puzzles rather than on a story as common in other rooms. We really liked it and found it very challenging & fun.I read quite a few reviews here stating it is for groups of 3-4+, but we did it as a couple and managed to get out on time so I think it is worth doing even if you are a couple (especially if you have a little escape rooms' experience or if you are just a clever couple ;).

Brilliant. A great escape game and the best of the two we did in Budapest. We played the mafia game as a couple and completed it with only a slight clue! Well put together, lovely lay out of the room, really testing as a couple but solvable. Perfect.
A true Challenge . We have done pæne escape Room before in Denmark. This Was a lot harder, did the prison Room. Nice stadig and cheap prices 9000 fh for 60 min/2pax.

The best escape rooms we did in Budapest!. We did two of the three rooms, White Mission and Mafia mission. Both rooms were absolutely superb - well thought out, logical, good flow to the puzzles. The decor was absolutely fantastic and everything was in keeping. It was very easy to get lost in the game. A really, really enjoyable experience. Experienced teams will love these rooms!

Try the white room, a unique challenge. The white room has a different logic than any other escape room I've been to.It's a room for three people or more, two people will face difficulties with it because some of the solving and operating processes require more than a couple.It's a 90 mintue challenge, we solved it in 66 minutes.

Best Escape Room so far. Whenever you're into escape rooms, this is the place to go to. We've done two rooms (White Mission and the Mafia room), which were both great. Especially the White room is worth your money. Unfortunately in the Mafia room one of the puzzles was broken. We however had found a way to work around it so it did not effect our experience. In the end we received a discount nonetheless.

Ruined the excitement before we started. We went to two different escape rooms in this place, and the rooms were different and interesting. The only thing that was a bit disappointing was that when they were fixing the rooms ready for the next group, they had the doors open so everyone could look inside, and the excitement was lost. Also we got the whole explanation about rules inside the room, which takes away a lot of the excitement about what the room looks like. Friendly staff.
Great game design and decorations!. Really awesome rooms, challenging and fun at the same time. Lots of different things to do at the same time, so it's great for bigger groups.

great fun. We played all three escape rooms (white mission, prison, maffia) and we loved it, especially the white room. We've never played an escape room that is similar to the white mission and we played a few. It was just awesome. If you like escape quests this is defenietly a place to visit. It's amongst my favourit also with the very frendly and fun staff.
very good!!. It was our first time ever at escape room. We wanted to say that we had a great time, highly recommended! Entered the gorgeous rooms Escape! Have been waiting to go to another one
great escape room. we did the prison room. not an easy one but we managewith little help. the puzzles are really unic and original

Brilliant escape room. We have done a number of different Escape rooms around different cities and White Mission was excellent. A 90 minute room which we completed in just under 70 minutes with no hints at all. A whole mix of different challenges meaning everyone can be fully involved at the same time. Tricky and makes you think. Gregg, the guide was helpful before and after and respected our wish for no help. Great fun. Fully recommend this!! The total cost was only just over the individual cost of one person in a London Escape room. Fantastic

First time and great fun!. Did the mafia room with wife and teenage daughter. Great fun and challenging enough but not impossible with a couple of small hints. Staff very friendly and a great way to spend a bit of time away from the crowds. Afterwards plenty of bars to choose from for a well earned celebratory drink!

great fun. Our first go at an escape room. We chose prison room and thoroughly enjoyed it. It took us a while to understand the thought process and we asked for help a bit, but the staff were very friendly, not giving too much away. It's a great way to watch your husband tie himself in knots because you know how men are at asking for help!

Best escape games yet. So, confession, we sort of came to Budapest to do a lot of escape games - and only booked here as it was near where we were staying, but we were really impressed with the rooms here.We did the Mafia Room, and it's great because there is plenty to be getting on with for everyone, so you're never bored. We then came back and did the White Room. Both were the best Escape games we have tried with plenty of variety to the puzzles, clever twists and immaculately designed rooms.The staff were also really helpful and friendly - I genuinely couldn't fault it. If it's your first ever game maybe try the Prison room as that is supposed to be the easiest - but there are always hints to hand if you get stuck!

First time in a escape room. First time in an escape room..was so much fun great way to kill just over an hour. Host was brilliant helped with hints when we thought we were struggling..did the white room and struggled a bit but got there in the end with some help..they also offer you a discounted rate if you return..we will be returning to try the other missions!

White Mission - excellent advanced room. Had an excellent time with my parents (!), very good host and we did need a lot of help wink emoticon Very well built White Mission room, some genuinely original puzzles and people can work on different things at the same time, recommended for 4+ or maybe three if you are experts. If it's your birthday, bring your ID card and your room price gets discounted according to the years old you are turning!

First but not the last. This was our first experience of an exit game and we could not have chosen a better host than Gozsdu mission. Four of us had a go at the prison room this being great value at appx £7 each. We had an hour to escape and with a couple of hints from our host we managed this in about 1 hour 20, there didn't seem to be a problem with us going over time though maybe there was a lack of bookings on the day, I don't know.We all came away with a small sense of achievement and had a really good time with a good few laughs and scratching of heads to boot.An easy to find location, surrounded by bars and eateries you could plan your whole day around your game.Would recommend trying this at least once even if it turns out to be just the once, for families,friends or anyone really.Thanks for the great time.

Verry fun. It was my first escape room, went with two friends. Enjoyed it a lot.We went to the prison mission which was perfect for the first time. Not too hard, but quite sophisticated. I recommend!!!

The Best in Budapest. If you are and escape room addict and you wanna play something really tricky, challenging and entirely different from any other escape room in Europe, you should definitely try the "White Mission". After 45 games, "White Mission" climbed on the top of my list. Amazing!
One of the best Escape Room's. Really liked the White Room, one of the best I've played so far. Must visit if you like difficult and logical rooms
So much fun!. We went to our first escape game in the gozsdu mission and we had a blast! It was tricky and challenging but we got there in the end.
One of the best Escape room in Budapest. It was one of the best escape :) Thank you ! We had 2 teams and used White mission and Maffia room, the both rooms were very good !

Fantastic!! . My boyfriend and I did the white room. It was very challenging. Finding the clues seemed easy, but solving them was difficult but tons of fun! I would 100% recommend doing this when in Budapest. There was only one man there when we went, but he was great. Very friendly and helpful with the clues during the challenge.

First escape game-exceeded expectation!. My first escape game and we loved it, did the prison room, help was at hand and promptly when needed. Only regret is that we didn't have chance to do the other room! Would fully recommend.

Good experience in the white room. This escape game was good because rather than the usual hour, you had 90 minutes which made it much more interesting. The white room was quite challenging, and we didn't complete it, but it made us think, which made it really enjoyable.

First time in an escape room and I loved it!. With a couple of friends we have visited this place and it was my first time in an escape room. We did the prison room and we enjoyed ourselves so much that in the end we decided to do the maffia room as well. In the end I actually liked the second one better. If we did have more time, we would have tried the white room as well!

You really need to work on service!. We took few days tour around Budapest escape rooms, this was our first on that way. The guy that works there was ok when we came, he put us into room with not much talk with us. But ok. The room itself is quite hard, the task are heavy, but callenging, quite good. The game last 90 minutes. We had one light (the other one not working) and it's hard to move with one light. One task was set in one direction, but it was not working, so we had solution on paper, done. You can ask for hint by knocking on the door?! So we knocked...and knocked...and knocked harder...I wanted to get out but there is no Panic button? So we knocked more...and in that point you get really frustrated! The team that was waiting in a lobby came to door to tell us that there is no one there, that guy went to clean the others rooms??So if I'm paying you to monitor the game, you need to monitor us! What if something bad happened inside? And there is no one there to let you out? What about the fire? So you lock people without panic button? I played so many games, but never saw that!!After 4 minutes of knocking, guy talked to us, giving us hint to move on. When we came out, there was no one there! So we could just walk out? One guy running 3 rooms? No service at all. After I told him about hint and lamp and knocking he was not so interested about that issue. He gave us a small, too small discount but that didn't fix the feeling we were robbed. No good by, no thank you, no taking pictures, he just walked away. I would even give you a lower grade but the game itself is pulling you up.

All hail the White Room. The guys over at TRAP actually recommended this particular room to us. It's somewhat of a 'cult' favorite amongst escape game enthusiasts all over Europe. Allegedly the 'most difficult game' in Budapest.We are very experienced gamers (30+ at this point) and the White Room at Gozsdu Mission is still one of our favorite escape rooms, period. Without giving anything away, the premise is- you (+ your team) are placed in a 'barren', white room with a single key hanging from the ceiling and you have 90 minutes to escape. It's incredible.The game has a linear methodology, but is very challenging with extremely unique puzzles. (They don't allot you 90 min. for nothing)

Mediocre game with terrible game operator. Let me start with the fact that I am an experienced room escaper (30+ rooms so far) so I have experienced quite a few of them to compare.The experience started off well. We arrived on time and were shown to our room (prison cell), where we received a very basic explanation. I actually appreciated the lack of rules as we mentioned that we have been to other rooms. But the lack of story was a bit off putting. (As neither the room did unfold too much of a story)Minor spoiler: Be aware that you are handcuffed together in the beginning of the game, which is not mentioned on their website.The design of the room is actually quite good, it gives you the feeling of a prison cell. The props on the other hand are very basic, mostly laminated papers with instructions on them. Props are also quite worn, dirty of human grease and used.The puzzles are mostly nothing special, doesn't need much thinking either, and some of them have too big logical leaps There was only one puzzle I liked a lot, around mid game. Most objects you use for the puzzles are not sitting in the storyline either, or have no real meaning why they are in a prison cell. They are just there so you can have an escape room.Up until around mid game I was between 3/4 stars, but that was the point we received our first help from our operator. First of all it wasn't the same person who has shown us to the room, which wouldn't have been a problem if we were warned ahead. And secondly, he clearly had no idea how far we are in the game, so he had to ask us questions first (wasting our precious time) what we have found so far and what have we done. This repeatedly happened throughout the rest of the mission. When we got stuck, he asked us how far we are, and gave us pretty direct instructions what to do. There goes the satisfaction of figuring out the puzzle for yourself... At this point I was at 3 starNow, in the last 5 minutes, our operator wasn't paying full attention, and although we did great throughout most of the mission, his lack of focus on our final minutes cost us a successful escape. We still made it in the next 40 seconds overtime and escaped, and then I learned why he had no clue about our progress. He wasn't paying attention to our game at all, he was actually dealing with payment of another team.Also when we escaped no one greeted us at the door, no photo no chit-chat. We high fived, and celebrated for a minute, (we were a team of two btw.) and then waited a good 2 minutes hoping that someone will pick us up and chat us through our experience. But the operator was dealing with another team, and the other operator was resetting a room. So we finally grabbed our coats, paid and left.The room was 9000 HUF which is extremely expensive for 2ppl (this room was advertised for 2-4 ppl) especially considering the experience you get. (The operator is running 3 games at a time.) At this point they were clearly between 1/2 stars. I'll give this a 2 as the room set-up was nice, and there were a few enjoyable puzzles which saves them from a 1 star review.Might be an okay/good experience for first timers, but avoid if you are looking for a great experience, and a good service where they actually care about your escape.

Great value but one thing to work on. We enjoyed this escape room and found the guy running it to be friendly but having only one person manning both the rooms and front desk is a bit problematic. I held off on asking for help for as long as possible but when we did really need help about 30mins in, he must have been farewelling another team - in all, we probably waited 5 mins for help. It doesn't sound very long but when you're really stuck and know you have an hour, it kind of adds frustration to frustration. A second person to check people in and out would go a long way to streamlining the experience.
Do this if you visit Budapest, wholesome fun. Mafia room - 4 of us struggled with this but it was great fun and enjoyed the theme! Staff are nice and location is very central for good bars

amazing experience!. wow!! this escape room made our trip to budapest, we were a couple and tried the prison mission, its was so fun!! a little bit difficult and we finish the mission after 1:20 hour... we were the last couple in the night so the nice guy gave as more time. i really reccomand this game one of the best! just go!

First escape room, great experience. My wife and I had a great time trying to escape from the jail cell. The tasks and riddles weren't too hard, but they weren't easy either. We got through about 90% of the tasks in 30 minutes and then got stuck on this one thing from the whole rest of the time!We were just watching the time tick down to 0 in frustration when the attendant came in and asked if everything was ok. I said that we were stuck on the last piece of the puzzle and couldn't figure X out. He asked us what we knew, and we told him everything. His response: "So all you need to do is figure out how X is possible" and we were like "we know, that's the problem!" and then it dawned on us. We forgot about one thing, and were able to get out of the cell in under 45 seconds.If only we thought of that 30 minutes before!

Brilliant escape room. We did the white room, a very well designed escape room, lots of fun solving it. For us 90 minutes was barely enough. Importantly: we took our children (ages between 10 and 16) and they also enjoyed this adventure tremendously. Highly recommended.

Difficult, but amazing!. We walked past this place accidentally on our way to a different escape room, so nipped in and asked if we could come back later and give the room a go. There were 3 options - there's a prison room which is a 60 minute game, a mafia room which is 75 minutes, and then the White room, which is 90 minutes. We've never done a 90 minute room before so naturally wanted to do it. The guy said its for groups of 4 or more, but we wore him down and convinced him we could do it! I won't spoil the room, but it was absolutely incredible. Without a doubt, the hardest room I've ever done. It's based more on solving a series of puzzles rather than following a puzzle "storyline", so you can do different tasks at the same time. This was really hard with 2 people, but we managed it!It's hard to find an escape room that remains challenging when you've done a lot already - rest assured, this is difficult!

Perfect moment, everything you need to use your brain while having fun !. In a basement in Goszdu, this escape game is the first i've ever been, but this will definitely make me want to try again ! There is three different missions, with increasing difficulties, so you can have fun even if you are two people. It is really well balanced, I really enjoy my time ! (we were two).Perfect for families (not with small childrens), friends and couple.

Excellent introduction to this game genre. Was so impressed by this place, went twice. I took my mum along and we failed on both attempts :). But don't let your failure on these games put you off, they are challenging and even after failing...eventually limped over the line, you leave feeling brain fried.This place isn't the easiest to find, but one of the better ones in budapest. Highly recommend.

Our "Maffia Mission" experience.. As soon as we (friends) learned about new mission in Gozsdu, we just couldn't miss it as we visited other mission earlier. This time, the room had Maffia in 30s theme.Our first positive impression was that they treated us with free beverages the moment we arrived, which is very nice of them as it was a very hot day.As in case of "White mission," it was longer than 1 hour (75 minutes). It was just enough for us to escape almost in time. The room was decorated in a very realistic way, and we almost felt like we traveled in time. The was atmospheric Italian music playing during the game.The difficulty level was quite high and the riddles were quite complex. All in all, we definately reccomend you to visit the Maffia Mission because you will remember it forever!

Recommended!. We tried the white room, while staying in budapest. We were not disappointed. The escape room was amongst the best we had done during our trip, and among the one we will remember the most. Try it if you like logic puzzles performed simultaneously.

Fun, never done this before. Me and the wife stumbled over some "escape room" reviews and thought this could be worth a try. We just walked up since we were close by and all rooms were available at that time. We were recommended a first-timers room and got locked in after a short brief. We needed 1.5 hour to complete the 1 hour task with several hints, but this was still very fun to do together. Staff speaks functional english. Recommend this activity for someone who never did this before. Problem solving with the spouse!!! Fantastic :)Soft drinks are available for purchase and there is a locker for your stuff so no worries there.

Try the white room!. Unfortunately the other rooms were unavailable to us due to flooding (these escape rooms are underground) but the staff did a great job of keeping the white room open and fit for business. The white room truly trumped us and we needed help to escape - would recommend the £8 to try this whilst in Budapest!

Great to get the brain working!. The White Room was the second Escape Room we did during our stay in Budapest. We did it as a couple and I can honestly say it definitely tests out your logic, communication and strategy skills. It was an awesome experience - a lot of fun and good to get the brain working! You get 90 mins to escape from this room, but we did need some help. Staff were friendly, great prices and great location. Highly recommend it!

Very recommended . Did 2 rooms, enjoyed both very much.prison cell - even 2 people can solve it in time, the riddles follow a route so you mostly solve one clue at a time.White room - for at least 3 people, a lot of simultaneous riddles.
I recommend it. The guys are cool, the prison room was really fun. We were 2 and needed a little more than one hour to finish it. Would be my pleasure to try the other ones !
Great Prison Break. We have tried it as our second escape room game. Great game, friendly stuff, really need to move your brain. Next time will surely try the other ones as well.

The Escape Rooms in the heart of Budapest. A fun experience for the whole family. You get locked into a room that has many clues. Each clue leads you to another clue.. The last clue will give you the code to the safe that contains the key to unlock your room. Not to worry. the rooms are monitored by camera and the staff can hear everything you say. So if you need help or need to leave the room they are right there.

My favorite so far. We were a group that had played 2 escape rooms before, and travelled to Budapest just to play some more. Passed this one by accident, white room looked good. Went inside, we could play right away. Intresting gameplay, different from all the others we've done. Asked the kind hostess not to give clues unless we explicity asked for them. From the look on her face, she thought we were mad. Managed to exit with 39 minutes on the clock but it was hard. This was a 90 minute room BTW.Small detail: we could store our bags in locker and take the key inside the game. Nice addition.

Adult with two kids. Reall fun to do the prison. First time for this type of game, and even with small kids (9 and 5 1/2) we had a fun time. With some help from the staff we solved it on overtime. The kids wanted more after, but the staff helped us find a place more suited for kids. Really recommend this place for firsttimers, and do the prison first.

Staff were friendly and game exciting. With two rooms this is a few hours of fun. Went with friends and I thought this was the best one we went to in Budapest. The games were engaging and fun. I would highly reccomend these games and by the looks of it they were making a third and fourth room. I hope that they are as good as the previous two. :)

Excellent Escape Room Experience. Having only tried one in London before, this was our first try in Hungary, and was brilliant! 2 of us did the White Room and was equally surprising and challenging! We had 90 mins and with a few tips we got out about 5 mins over time. Was very clever and some of the best 90 mins we spent all holiday! You've got to try it while you're here...!

Lots of fun and surprises!. My other and half and I have not done an escape room before but we stumbled across this and had to give it a try. We did the White room which was lots of fun. We completed it in a little over the time with a few tips from the games master. We both loved it! Give it a go...

Best escape room so far - tried two rooms!. My girlfriend and I tried the Prison and the White Room at the Gozsdu Mission. The white room was probably the coolest and most innovative of all the escape rooms we tried so far(6 in total). Definitely try it! We made it out of the prison on time and out of the white room in 15 minutes more than the time limit. The price was really nice too compared to other places in Budapest.

One of the best. Played the White Room with 2 persons for the price of 8.000 HUF and had a very positive experience.Due to having 90 minutes you get a lot of time to think about and find clues without feeling rushed compared to other escape rooms.Game Master gives only clues when we asked for them (on our request), and when he gives hints they steer you in the right direction without immediately providing the answer.Puzzles provide a good challenge without being too difficult. A lot of nice surprises within the unique room. Top escape room, would highly recommend.

Our "White Mission" escape.. Our friends and us (a couple) desided to challenge ourselves at the Gozsdu Mission escape room. We thought it would be nice to try out the "White Mission," since it is 90 minutes long.The escape room is located inside the Gozsdu courtyard, underground. It was not hard to locate it since there was a big sign with the logo showing the way.The price for a team of four people was 11.000 HUF (for the whole group). The White Mission was very challenging with a high level of difficulty. The clues were very smart and well designed. We only wish there was more interraction with the "game master," so we could have some extra help and more feedback during the time of our game. The 90 minutes we were given were exactly the ammount of time a group needs in order to escape.All in all, the whole experience was very positive and we had a great time with our friends escaping the White Mission (a few seconds after our count-down was over).

No idea what to expect!. Amazing experience to "escape". As a couple Who have not done this before We were concerned what would happen if we were unable to get the hang of it, however if we got too stuck the staff were very helpful with suggestions/hints to keep us going in the right direction.it is amazing how quickly 90 minutes can go when you are so involved with solving the puzzle! Highly recommended but make sure you book to avoid disappointment.

White room is my favourite so far!. We played about 10 room escape games so far and White room was the absolute favourite so far! Both beautiful in visual and puzzle design. Thanks for a great experience!

Unequivocally the best in Budapest!. I've played over 20 escape the room games in Budapest, and I'm a puzzle designer myself. Without doubt, this company has THE BEST escape the room games in Hungary and easily some of the best in the whole world.
