While many other escape the room games in the city have some great ideas and fun themes, I've always felt that they're lacking in many crucial respects, whether that be overall game flow, poor implementation or maintenance of certain puzzles, or gaps in what's necessary to make for a fully cohesive puzzling experience. Gozsdu Mission has fully overcome all such possible faults and created meticulously thought out, exciting, and well-designed rooms that have amazing game flow and provide an enjoyable experience for nearly all types of people. If you can only play a couple escape the room games in Budapest, ABSOLUTELY make sure to play these!

You have to try it :). This is the first review I've ever written, but I just felt the need to do so this time. We discovered this place by total accident on the last day of our Budapest trip, but it might have been the most fun we've had all week. The woman in charge was very friendly and whilst we were in the "white room" she always kept an eye on us. At one point we were extremely stuck, but she gave us a little hint to get back on track. In the end, we solved the "white room" in a little over one and a half hours, but we enjoyed it so much that we couldn't resist doing the "prison room" as well. I personally liked the white "room better" for it is full of surprises and gets more and more "interesting" as you play the game. But I can't reveal to much. If you like escape rooms or puzzles in general don't hesitate visiting this place.

THE BEST!. Me and my husband had done 3 previous room escape experiences in different countries. We took the "White Room" and it has been the best -and most difficult!- we've done so far. Everything was perfect and the person in charge of the place was extremely nice and helpful. Highly recommended!

Best escape the room games anywhere!. We love escape games, and have done 5 now. When we left we agreed this was the best one we had done. We came across it by accident in Gozsdu Court, but so glad we did. We completed the Prison Room which was so great we decided to go back on our last day and try the White Room! By far the most challenging game we've done, but incredibly clever. Everything is so well thought out, and the guy working there was lovely, and spoke very good English! For us this ended up being a real highlight of our trip!

Really fun 1.5 hours in central Budapest. This was a great way to spend 90 minutes thinking- well designed puzzles at an excellent level for 2 players and friendly staff. Really enjoyed it- we played the White room and exited with 1 minute to spare!
recomend with pleasure. it was really great 1,5 hours in professional exit room. Our coordinator was very sweet and pleasantThanks so much
Both rooms exceptionally perferct and challenging. Sometimes difficult but never imposible! Verygood! Wish they had more rooms for us to expeience :) thank you!

Rad escape room. One of the best in Budapest. Rad story line and fun staff. Looking forward to returning for the other rooms. If you can only manage one in the city, go to this one and then chill at the bars/cafes on Gozsdu.

white room is great fun and challenging. went down the steps hoping for the prison room to be free - it wasn't but we went into the white room and just about cracked it. Unlike anything we had done before.leave your valuables in a locker and you take the key in.Very friendly.90 mins and we smiled all day

Great fun in Budapest. We passed this place in our way to dinner and went down the steps. We played the prison room and had so much fun doing it. The puzzles are not easy, but they are logical. The hosts keep an eye on your progress and will offer clues if you look stuck for too long. We escaped with 40secs to spare. We loved this experience and I would love to come back. We went as a couple, but this would work great for a group too. Highly recommended for an hour of fun brain exercise!

Best Hour in Budapest. We completed both of the rooms in GOZSDU MISSION and they were both amazing! The prison room is very tricky, but very logical, and the white room is full of fun suprises. The owners and staff are incredibly friendly and accomodating and the challenges are fun, difficult and very exciting. We've tried other escape room around Budapest and the world and this one was our favourite. Much cheaper than the others too, great value for money. Thank you so much for a brilliant experience! Highly recommended to all!

Amazing Experience. The White room is a fantastic escape room and a must do whilst in Budapest. Lots of hidden surprises and challenges, a very memorable experience. Exceptional value for money and the owners are brilliant. Thank you for a great experience.

Group Challenge!. We managed to squeeze in a trip into the Surgery... all a bit spooky and the 6 of us worked together to try and escape. Great level of challenge for adults, and the staff were great. We are very stubborn, and don't like asking for help, so was quite good that they didn't keep butting in with hints! We are all a bit obsessed with these games now and wish we'd had more time to do some more!

Great fun! . A group of 4 of us booked in all being escape room 'virgins'. We really didn't know what to expect but booked in for the surgery! Well we had laughs and bickering between us but managed it in 53 mins! One hint when we needed it too so they are there to help! We enjoyed it so much that we booked in the next day and did the serial killer! That was very difficult but we agreed was our favourite! The day was so miserable that we decided to do the motel an hour or so later! Great price and great fun! Do it!!!

Great fun. Really enjoyed this challenge. It was the first time that either of us had been to an escape room but we managed to get out in time. The whole experience was great fun and the team were lovely. Would thoroughly recommend Locked Escape room to anyone. Thanks all!

One of the better escape rooms.... We opted for the serial killer room. We have been to a number of escape rooms and after the one in York I would say this is one of the best. It is well thought out & designed with a realistic atmosphere. We did however get stuck for too long in one place after a really good start and this set us back and just at the end we got stuck again! Staff are very helpful. We would try one of the other rooms next time in Budapest. Highly recommended.
Great fun :). One hour (or less if you make it :) ) of good fun. We went for the serial killer one but would have tried the others if there was time. Definitely recommend!
what a gem. Had a really nice trip to Hungary, and we decided to play a famous escape room - and we didn`t disappointed at all! Nice game, friendly staff, try it!

The most fun ever. We did the Motel and the Surgery with 6 of us and it was just pure awesomeness. We even got a little bit more time because we were so close to the end. I enjoyed it very much. It wasn't too expensive at all.
Great Time. We have spent a great time at Locked Budapest, creative rooms, and more challenging than we expected! We will definitely do it again!

Exciting adventure!. We were in Surgeon room, and it was quite fun! There are some riddles that I didn't see before, which is really hard to find if you are experienced player. It was challenging and fun and will go again to try other rooms!

Great fun! . Our group of three did the Serial Killer escape room. It was great fun and we all really enjoyed it. The staff are super friendly and helpful and the rooms are very well designed. The bar also serves excellent beer for afterwards. Highly recommended!

Nice room, busy staff. Our family (4) did the Serial Killer room, which was nice if you like not only logical quizzes and riddles but to actually do stuff and can also see well in the dark. We've done a few escape rooms before and we prefer other types. The room was OK but the staff wasn't always there to follow what we are doing and respond to our calls. It's located in a nice area though. bring something to clean your shoes after this room :)

Awesome!! . I was with my boyfriend one week in Budapest! It's so beautiful and it was a lot to see!! It was one of the best trips I have ever done!! Not only because of all the amazing views.. We decided to visit an escape room game. The best decision we've ever taken!! We played 4/5 games and absolutely want to come back soon!!
FUN FUN FUN. Very fun experience. We were a group of 6 and we all really enjoyed both "The Motel" and "Sergary Lap". The rooms are very well done.

Nice try. It is a nice try for an escape room, but as I can tell from experiencing the Motel room, they are pretty far from making it an adventure rather than the frustrating and inconvinience experiense it is now.There was only one operator for 3 different rooms so we had to shout and wave to the cams in a desperate hope the operator will hear us and give us some hint. In some part we had just to sit 10 minutes untill the operator notices we have some trouble and offered us a hint.One of the missions asked us to do 2 different things in 2 different rooms but with no written guideness. We were expected to guess what to do.After having fun in more than 4 rooms in Budapest and more than 30 worldwide, I can say this experiense do not worth the prise(or the rediculus demand for a deposit).
Fun!!. First time we tried an escape room! We did the "motel", it was difficult but still very fun. We defenitely recommend to try this when in Budapest

Amazing experience! [Room: Surgery]. We are a group of 4 and we have been to several escape rooms before, both easy and hard.Personally, I find this one of the best rooms I have been to! The atmosphere is just stunning! Great attention to detail, well thought-through riddles and intriguing twists! It's far away from "just locks and codes". It is a great way to spend some time with your friends.I would highly recommend Locked Escape Game! We will definitely come beck next time we are in Budapest.

Great staff. I recently played the serial killer escape game with my partner. It was both of our first time at an escape game and we didn't know what to expect but we were not disappointed. The game was well set out with an interesting story line and the staff helped to set the scene. We both had lots of fun and would definitely recommend this!

Escape game is strong in this one!. Great fun! The rooms are really authentic, and the puzzles matches the authencity. Made us scratch our heads several times as we plowed through the rooms. Can you escape the secret lab?
Great fun. Great fun for a great price. You should give 3-4 hours and try 3 or 4 rooms. Start with the medium and finish with the very hard!

The best escape game we've seen. We have actually been to a lot of escape rooms, by many companies, and this is definitely the best one.We have been in the Surgery, the Motel and the Serial Killer. The last one was not too difficult, so if you are beginners, this is the one for you.The Motel and the Surgery were for experienced ones.

Awesome experience!. As we love escape rooms, we decided to go for the escape room experience in Budapest. This was one of the best we already did! Challenging for two people, but very creative, and very nice!
Highly recommended if you are up for adventure!

Addictive!. A group of 4 youths - went to try out the surgery first and got hooked! We ended up doing all the 5 rooms.. including the Very Hard Secret Lab ;) Very friendly staff aswell!! Definitely recommended!
Serial Killer. Absolutely awesome, just walked in and easy booking, you will not be disappointed when you come here it's very cool and fun for everyone - staff were great too

Good challenge but not a stand out . We did the bank job escape room. We have done a lot of escape rooms now and this one didn't really stand out. It was still mildly challenging. The staff were friendly enough. We cannot comment on their other rooms but overall we preferred other providers in Budapest and elsewhere.

Never felt so accomplished. . Challenging yet satisfying. Great bonding experience as myself and a friend did it with a few people we met on our travels around Europe. Great activity to do in the evening in my opinion. I thought the Game Master was very helpful and seemed to know exactly when we needed his help. Loved every minute. Definitely recommending.

Challenging but great fun!. Came here with 3 friends aged around 23 and we tried the bank heist for our first attempt. Safe to say we should have tried an easier one as we struggled but I still had a great time trying! The puzzles are all really well thought out and entertaining, with help given if needed. Even the tiniest things in a room can be a clue! Overall these are fun for all the family, could not recommend enough. Also a lot cheaper to do it here than in the UK.

First escape games experience. On our one rainy day in Budapest we stumbled across this place. Unfortunately we were unable to book on the day as it was pretty busy so we booked for the next day - this was ideal as we were able to leave our luggage is lockers before heading to the airport.The group of 4 of us had an absolute blast of a time. It was difficult enough to make us think but not too hard that we lost interest. Would 100% recommend doing this during the trip. There's also a really good street food place nearby!!!

Great game. Our group of 5 had a blast solving the challenging puzzles of the 'serial killer' game. A few of the devices inside didn't work perfectly (thinking of a switch that wasn't working properly straight away) however it didn't really stop the game flow. It was our first time for all of us in an escape room, but we just about managed to solve the game in time (one small hint you get in the very beginning resp. with the instructions). Anyhow, it was a great experience and we'd all come back again for another riddle!

Great place to spend an afternoon!. We recently visited the Locked escape rooms with a large group of 26 people. The owners were very accommodating, opening up early for us and allowing us to choose which rooms we wanted to do. The rooms were very well thought out with plenty to keep you thinking throughout the hour. We liked it so much we went back again the following day to have a go at some of the other rooms! Would highly recommend.

Great puzzle game that I absolutely recommend. Challanging puzzles, but very entertaining. Great staff that will are there for support.Very well thought through process and is something I would recommend for almost anyone (except children).

Mad Scientist. Don't do this one if you are a novice. Start with something simpler if you have young kids like the Motel. We had a blast and escaped with some help. My 12 year old son came twice with his mentor and encouraged the family. He was so psyched we escaped. It takes a team effort and cooperation. A perfect corporate team building event. Tons of fun.
Hen do fun. We visited as part of a hen weekend and my group did the bank job. We had so much fun even though we failed to escape!I would recommend this to everyone it was so much fun
So much fun!. The place was easy to find and was in a great location. We did the Bank Job, which was so much fun, quite hard but doable! I recommend it!

Great fun!. Recommended as a fun activity by our oldest daughter, who has done similar in London, we had great fun working our way through the Bank Job. The time flew by & we completed more or less bang on time's up. What was really great was that everyone contributed, from youngest to oldest, which we didn't necessarily expect. We are all quite competitive, so there was no way we were going to give up or give in and we booked a "hard" task because of that. Everyone thought it was good fun & I think we will definitely do more of these! If you're a family that enjoys puzzles, I'm sure you'll love this!
Very fun. Fans of the TV series Trapped will enjoy this game, but beware the saboteur! Very fun game which led to lots of amusement, recommend a harder difficulty level though.

Great idea!. There are many of these escape games in Budapest. We tried The Motel. We got a scenario and were put into a room for an hour. We needed to work together to figure out the clues, which were pretty hard at times. We really enjoyed this escape room and would definitely recommend it to others.
The motel. My first escape room. Really compelling, creepy in parts, nice staff. We went with 2 old hands and they said it was the best one they'd done.

We made it!! With our friends from the Netherlands!!. I went with my sister and with my two friends from Netherlands. It was their first experience of an escape room and they loved it so much that they could only speak about it for 2 days. The staff was very friendly and the guy spoke english very well. A little dutch as well.

So much fun!. I went with my brother and father and we loved it! Lots of problem solving, with logical thinking to find codes. After having tried two other escape rooms, this one was definitely the most professionally set up. We even ended up coming back the next day to try a different theme!

We were unstoppable!. Initially we booked the bank job, which is a nice room with a lot of cool stuf to do. A bit of a dejavu at the end because we expected yet another challenge but the cool thing was we managed within time without help. So because of the dejavu we were still thrilled to do the secret lab. We heard only 3 teams managed to do it within time without help of 400 teams that tried. We wanted to be part of this group and we managed. So in the end we had a great time and the escape rooms were really great! One of the best in Budapest.

Amazing puzzles. If you like puzzles, adventure, thinking in weird ways then this is something not to be missed. Like a puzzle game in real life, it is very immersive. The work and thought gone into this is incredible.

A must do!. We did the Surgery Room adventure and it was great! The staff was friendly and they went out of their way to make sure we had a fun time! This escape room exceeded our expectations with its well made-up scenario. I recommend it to anyone visiting Budapest!

Very entertaining activity in the centre of Budapest. The Locked Escape game is a must-do when you're an adventorous type of person and like to have some fun with friends or family. The rooms aren't very easy, so you will be tested. The organisation is very professional and fluent in English so don't hesitate to ask any questions you have. It isn't too scary, thus perfectly fitted for those people looking to be challenged!
Great escape room. Lots of fun, and with more interesting challenges than previous escape rooms we have done. Would definitely come back to try the other rooms!
Serial killer, an game to die for!. Excellent escape room, challenging but feasible - we loved it! I would strongly recommend it if it is your first escape room, and even if it is not your first ;)

A lot of fun!. We went here a few weeks ago. It was our first escape room. It was a really good bonding experience for us as friends having to work so closely together.We had so much fun we even decided to do a second room right away :)

Fab Activity. We did the 'Bank Job' and 'Secret Lab' escape room. It was exciting and thrilling experience. It bought out the competitive side in our group and the challenges make you think about a situation in lots of different ways. We enjoyed it so much that we booked another game, thankfully they had space for us.Fab activity!

A classic escape game with lots of locks and keys.. We played the Serial Killer room. We have tried a few other escape games but found this one really good. Very logical, and great set-up. The game was a bit to the easy side (we solved it in only 38 minutes without hints), but challenging and great fun. The game master was very nice, and during the game he asked if we wanted help or not, which is good, because it's annoying to be given clues before they are really needed. We can warmly recommend this game.
Serial killer. It was a real exciting game, we had a lot of fun :) a worth experience, we chose the 'serial killer' and it was a bit scary (for me) not for men
A new thing to do as a tourist. Very funny and very professional. A great way to do something different as a tourist! We will must certaintly try it again.

Great place to have fun with a group of friends. Went there with about 8 friends we challenged each other, 4 people in 2 different rooms and saw who came out first, it was a lot of fun and the staff were wonderful. Highly recommended.

Exciting and challenging experience. Our time in the locked escape room was unforgettable. We accidentally booked the "surgery" for the wrong day but they were nice enough to let us do it then. We ended up trying the hardest one (science lab) and did okay-with clues... It was a great experience and I would throughly recommend it. Thank you for such a fun night.
Escape Game. Great experience! Really fun puzzles and helpful staff that made the experience really fun! We loved our first game so much we booked a second one right there for a few hours later!

Stimulating and exciting. The Serial Killer escape room was fantastic! It was the first escape room game we'd ever played, and we'll definitely be doing another after this. It was challenging in the best way, and not too difficult either. The game master explained everything clearly and was very helpful - not to mention he was cheery and generally very pleasant. We had a great time here, and would absolutely recommend it! Especially The Serial Killer if it's your first escape room.

Creepy!!. We did "The Surgery" and the room was really creepy! Which was good because that was the intention! Many nice puzzles but the helper had more than one room to give clues to so sometimes it could take a while to get help if you got stuck....

Very well done!. My boyfriend and I played a room here durinf our trip to Budapest. It was very well done, felt almost real. We've done several escape rooms before and this one was one of the best ones!

Really great experience. We came 2 groups of 4, 1 group per room (I wouldn't recommend to be more than 4 per room). First time to do an escape game, we all enjoyed it a lot. The rooms' challenge were tough but the help of the manager is perfect to move on and enjoy the game.

The best escaperoom i ever play.. We were couple and we had a great fun. The room was the best room i ever play and the host was so nice. For couple it was little bit hard beacuse the there are many puzzles but it took us 2 hours to relax affter this amazing advanture!
Excellent loved it. Great way to pass an hour, really fun, went back the next day and did it again. Recommend anyone to go and give it a try.

First time with an escape room game and loved it!. We did the "Bank Job" room with 4 people (ages 21-64) and had a wonderful time! For 3 of us It was the first time for doing an escape room game. We found it challenging but the staff was helpful and checked in with us just enough to keep us going. Our conversations after our success were also enjoyable and fun! I would definitely recommend it!

Fun depends on your flow. We have done the rooms in several teams, some with the whole group of five, some in groups of 2 and 3. First game was my favourite, the serial killer. In other games the opinion in our group was sometimes divided. The fun definitely depended on whether you came in the flow of the room or not.

Best Birthday ever!. My friends insisted on coming here on my birthday. Tbh I'm not a fan of these games, but I had the time of my life! The room was amazing, the tasks were really challenging and the staff helped us excately when we needed.Moreover, there's a small bar as well, with loads of local beers and cocktails named after the games, they were brilliant!Thanks guys, see you soon again! :)
Great variety of rooms very well designed. We have tried all rooms of this place an each one was amazing. The staff team was kind. I recomend this place.

Game was average, game master was pretty bad. I usually don't write bad reviews however after being in over 50 escape games around the world this has got to be one of the worst experiences I've had. We played the room "The Serial Killer", the room itself is average, and has pretty basic puzzles. However it's advertised as medium level so I guess it's ok.One puzzle had us stuck for about 15 minutes. Any attempt to call for the game master for help didn't work. We tried waving at the cameras, shouting, in the end we knocked loudly on the door and that worked. After a few minutes we then tried calling him again but no response.All in all we wasted about 20 minutes basically looking at the wall, shouting and waving. This was very frustrating. At the end we decided to just quit the room in the middle, we've never done such a thing before. After some convincing we went back in and finished the game.Bottom line, the room is pretty average but the game master kind of ruined the experience for us by not being attentive to our progress.

Loved it!. This was our first try at an escape room ever! We tried the Serial Killer escape room as it was considered the lowest difficulty, but by no means was it easy! Definitely a great challenge but a very fun one indeed! Really interesting puzzles, and really had you thinking! Very clever, and extremely fun. Would highly recommend this game to beginners and those with greater experience of escape rooms. Would love to try it again! :)

Its a great brain teaser. Things might not be as they look. Its a great way to have fun while challenging yourself. The hosts are very friendly and are always on the look out to offer help. Its up to you to take it or not.
Great fun!. Got our adrenaline pumping! We had great fun, and the staff were awesome :) Really recommend this for everyone wanting a good time in Budapest!

If logic and puzzles are your thing, you must try this - such great fun!. Myself and two friends took part in the bank job task at locked while in Budapest for a long weekend as we wanted to do something a bit different and had heard they were great fun! It was our first ever time doing this kind of thing and although we didn't complete it, we had a great time trying! If you are taking part in an escape room game for the first time I suggest you try one of the easier simulations as the bank job one was a bit trickier but it was the only time that worked for our schedule.. The only comment to make was that the first element of the task was a bit too fiddly, while we had figured out what we had to do it took too long to actually do it and as that's not the point of the game, I think something a bit less fiddly would be more appropriate. However this was just an observation and didn't effect our enjoyment levels and I would highly recommend locked to anyone visiting Budapest as something they really must do. I can't wait to go back and try one of the other tasks!!

Disappointing. I feel bad giving this a poor review, because the guys who run it are really nice. Unfortunately, my friend and I did not enjoy this activity. I came to Budapest really excited to try an escape game, especially one that was so well reviewed on this website. We booked the Secret Lab room because we thought it would have to do with a secret lab mystery of some sort. When we arrived, he gave the backstory of what our mission was, and sadly that was the most interesting part of the game. We paid 20 euros each plus a 7 euro booking fee to be locked in a cold room for an hour. The game itself was so difficult that it was not fun. It made no sense to American logic, because we tried everything we could think of and constantly hit dead ends. He eventually had to just walk us through it because it made no sense to us. And it was creative, but we would have never thought to do any of those things to get to the next room. We had no idea what we were doing (the briefing beforehand could have also been much more detailed). I ended up sitting on the floor and waiting for the next hint because it was that impossible. I left feeling like we wasted our money and part of the last day of our trip that could have been spent doing other things. I wanted to ask for my money back but did not know if that was okay in Hungary like it is in the U.S.

Good, but at times extremely frustrating. My group has done our fair share of EscapeRooms between us, and we did The Serial Killer, Surgery, Secret Lab and Bank Job in that order over several days. Overall, the rooms were fun, challenging, look really good, had a great variety of different props/puzzles combination/code locks etc. The Serial Killer also had a really cool storyline.So the negatives. First of all, the use of "Do not touch"-symbols. I think that the symbol brings down the overall feeling as it would've felt more genuine without them. There didn't seem to be enough justification for using it, so I would've preferred the added difficulty of not knowing what to use.Second of all, badly executed puzzles... I really dislike puzzles that aren't hard because you can't figure out how to solve them, but instead are hard because the logistics doesn't work... Now some people might say this is a part of a puzzle being hard, but when doing something correctly didn't result in the correct answer, I believe it was only frustrating...I think Locked could be an awesome escape experience, if you give a little TLC to the puzzles that makes banging your head into the wall feel more productive that trying to solve them.

Fun and very challenging. Me and my friends went to the Surgery room,it was a great experience, we had a lot of fun, and it was really difficult. The staff are very friendly and the price is good. The only thing that we didn't like is that one of the devices were a little bit broken and we were doing in the correct way but because of the broken parts it wasn't working so well and took us precious time.
It's a long way to the top if you wanna scout a lab. Basically the tasks were brilliant, except the one what needs too much practice handling an unknown equipment.

Brilliant. Absolutely brilliant experience. The games were so well put together, really clever. The main guy was super helpful, and give us more time that we should of had! Would seriously recommend if visiting Budapest!

Challenging escape room. The Serial Killer escape room was quite challenging, because there were only two of us. Really good puzzles but at times felt a little too difficult. I would recommend this escape room for a bigger group of 4-6 people.
Some of the best escape rooms in Budapest!. Very well-designed escape rooms, with original puzzles to solve. Beautiful setup as well. Great fun! Highly recommended.

Team Building Fun. I've recently been there with some students of mine to release some stress and build/tighten the student-teacher connection before the final exam and it was fun. We even solved the case of the Serial Killer in 59 minutes ;)

So fun we went back for more!. 4 of us went to the Locked Escape game on the first full day of our stay in Budapest and played the Serial Killer game which was excellent! Managed to complete in 53 minutes (with a couple of hints!).Enjoyed it so much, and was such good value (approx. £5-6 each) that we re-booked for the final day of our stay and returned to take on the Surgery game which too was excellent! Would definitely recommend!
Excellent!!!. We had such a good time in these 4 rooms that we booked for the Team building. The hosts was very kind and service minded. Recommend this to everyone to try this!

So good we did it twice!. Great activity to do with friends, and had a great time. We did the Secret Lab first up, and then the Bank Robbery the second time (which we decided to do on a whim because we'd enjoyed the first one so much).

Great fun game. We were 6 friends, the 1st time for the most of us, who played the Serial Killer and we managed to escape right on time. A vibrating and exciting game where you need to resolve some clues, a great activity for team-work. Also the staff was very friendly.Good luck with your escape!!Cristina.

Thoroughly enjoyable. Visited this Locked room escape game on a whim with my girlfriend and had a great time. Puzzles where challenging and engaging, the mood was really nice. Thankfully no jump scares. We managed to escape with seconds to spare.Only negative was some minor technical issues with one of the puzzles that cost us valuable minutes before we figured it out.Highly recommendable!

really good place to start your party-night. The staff is totally friendly and the 4 offered rooms are really challenging but fun!I can recommend it totally and it won't be the last time I get locked :) The location is also perfect, because you can easily go partying afterwards! Nice!

Good value for the price. I and my friend looked for an unusual free time activity and we decided to play an escape game. After reading some reviews we've choose Locked, and it was awesome! It's easy too book a game online, and you can pay by PayPal, it's also possible to book a game by phone. We didn't complete the Serial Killer game in time but it was still a great fun. I recommend to play this game with a group of least 4 people, than it's easier to escape.

always new equipment and ideas!!!!. we did the following rooms: the serial killer, bank robbery, the secret lab, surgery and the first one at locked.hu. each time we have a great fun, the scenarios are always interesting, logical and exciting!!!the equipment in the room Surgery and The secret lab is VERY cool!!!!the team is very friendly:))))thank you!!!we are waiting for the coming new room-MOTEL!!!!

Awesome experience, even for experienced escapist. We went the secret lab room with a team of 4. The quality and atmosphere of the room was outstanding. The puzzles were fascinatingly clever, non-repetitive and just the right difficulty for us. We got out but with a slight overtime :). The service was very friendly and warm. The place even had a bar where you could take a drink when waiting to get into a room or to hang out after game. Thank you for an awesome experience! Definitely recommended!
A great night out. This is the second time we have been to Locked Escape Game. Both times were really good. It was surprising that they have a very wide selection of craft beers.

Great challenging fun. I'd read about Budapest's escape games online and was excited to see whether myself and my husband would be able to complete the game. We decided upon the serial killer game as it seemed to have the most reviews online and weren't disappointed. The host explained everything to us beforehand and offered help via the speakers if it was needed. We thought the rooms were well themed and the challenges were clever enough to get you thinking without leaving you at a total loss at what to try next. We managed to complete the game with 13 minutes to spare! I'd highly recommend people giving them a go and my only regret is not having a chance to give the other rooms a go.

Excellent!. I have tried almost every room in Locked, and they are the best ones I have tried in Budapest so far. The staff is friendly and they use good time to tell the story of each room, and set the right mood before going inside.

Really good!. We were 6 friends who had a blast in the "Surgery" room! We managed to escape with only 38 seconds left, and our pulse was sky high afterwards! The tasks were hard, but not too hard, and the surgery theme was completed all the way, with lots of medical equipments, X-rays etc laying around. Highly recommended!!

Brilliant. The room is brilliant, we had a great time. We managed to escape using some extra minutes a 2 hints. I would totally recommend locked rooms if you're in Budapest, and I'll try to play some more games if I come back. This was my 4th room in general, and I found ti really really exciting. Very well done

Played twice ! So fun!. Really fun, unique experience. I played twice because I loved it so much!
Very friendly staff and good location. Highly recommended!
Great time!!!. staff is very friendly. the room of the abandoned surgery is a bit cheeky but great for a team work.... lots of fun there... we'll definitely come back!!

It was amazing. We came to locked on our visit to budapest, we booked to rooms in advance , the host was very nice , funny and helpful, ee had so much fun that we even wanted to book another room but there wasnt any time left. It is fun , you get sucked into the action and you dont want to leave. Locked is located in an rasy to get area. If you are in budapest then you have to visit it, remember. To book in advance to ensure a place for you
So nice. We did 2 rooms and felt very welcome at Locked Escape.The rooms are totally different so don t be scared to do more rooms !
Great time together!. This was the first time to visit this game and we loved it very much. We came out in the last minute, it was not so easy, but we did it. :)You must use your brain :)

A must when traveling with friends!. My 3 friends and I had an amazing time escaping the serial killer room. We had to use logic and teamwork to manage to finish on time. Just remember to book a game ahead of time!
Amazing experience!. This was my first time in an escape room and I absolutely loved it! The place was awesome and the staff was more than welcoming and setting the mood right, highly recommend!

Great Time. I introduced two friends to the world of Escape Rooms. The games were great and the staff was super helpful and professional. We were able to do all three rooms over two visits. Very challenging but not impossible. The highlight of my first visit to Budapest. Thank you so much

Excellent! even for beginners!. We visited in January, first couples holiday and this was brilliant! We didn't make it out but we were so close and laughed all the way through! The staff are brilliant and helpful! Would defiantly recommend and will be coming back to try again!
Great games, friendly staff. No hassle whatsoever. Staff extremely helpful. Games were great fun. Had such a good time we went two nights in a row! Must do!!

Great fun!. Had a great evening at Locked Escape Budapest trying to escape the serial killer room. There were 4 of us in the room and although we needed a few clues it was a great laugh! Beware the dusty stones on the floor, my black suede boots looked a little grubby afterwards - don't wear best shoes! The bar is good too.Just one thing guys, you forgot to ask us to pay the balance ;-) we did pay of course, after the game.
lot of fun. One of the best escape rooms in Budapest. Great experience, good service, really kind guides. Recommend it.

Surgery escape room. I did the surgery escape room with three other friends. It was really fun and interesting, and just the right level of difficulty. We managed to solve it with about 9 minutes left :) The staff were great, very friendly and helpful (we had to get some clues). Overall a good experience, and not too pricey.
Very fun and warm experience. We had a very good time and the people there were nice to us !One of the best escape games i have done and i have done 8 :)
amazing. i went with my friend and we had loved this place, the game "surgery" was very interested and funny!

A real "must" in Budapest. Having tried a similar concept once before, I was excited to try this again when I was on a short vacation in Budapest. It was so fun that I ended up doing two of their rooms, instead of just the one that was pre-planned. Both well worth the money! Also: I brought two friends with me, and it was their first time trying "locked in". They were as eager as I to do a second round, and I think that if it had been available, the third room would be next on our schedule. Oh well, perhaps next time I get to go to Budapest. :)Side note: There is a nice small bar once you enter the premises, and the assortment seemed to be really good, even though we didn't buy anything there.

Amazing experience!. I went there with my high school students during our school trip, to change from the regular visits. We had a blast! It was one of the most entertaining experiences I'd ever had, and the students loved it too. We were three groups so they kindly agreed to open the three different rooms at the same time so that we were able to compete against each other. The setting was on point and we had a lot of fun working as teams to get out of the rooms. I definitely recommend it!

Fun and Challenging Escape Room in Center of Budapest. We are a family of five with little to no experience in Escape Rooms, and wanted to try one while in Budapest. The "Surgery" themed Escape Room in Locked was excellent, if a little difficult for us. Advanced players would likely enjoy the room very much.
Great!. We were 15 boys, divided us in 3 rooms. Everyone had a terrific time. Recommend everyone to try out!

Awesome!. It was my first time in an "escape game" so I was unsure at first but the experience was thrilling. We were two and played the surgery and the room was quite realistic and created a feeling of tension. The puzzles were also very well made. I wish I could have tried all the rooms! It's also quite affordable.
Fantastic fun - Serial Killer Room. This is challenging but not impossibly difficult. We managed it in 40 mins and had a fantastic time. Great fun and highly recommended!

Exciting, fun and very realistic game. From the minute we arrived the host was professional, knowledgeable and helpful. We enjoyed the game a lot! The location is easily to find, the room(s) with their equipment is pretty life-like which makes the game very enjoyable. I would say to do this with 4 max 5 people, as having more in the team would cause idle time with some team members. It is a great program for rainy days, team building or just a fun afternoon with friends.
Amazing time!. Did it with my mom, we enjoyed it so much and the operator let us finish the game even though our 60 minutes passed. Thank you!

The serial killer room rocks. We were 4 people who tried this room, and we have all tried several escape rooms around Europe earlier. This is clearly one of the best. The room is big and offers many good challenges and the location is easy to find. We solved the puzzle but it was really challenging. I recommend it :D Have previously tried the surgery room which was also good, but I find this one better.

Frustrated the hell out of us. Definitely going back!. We played the serial killer game. First time in an escape game. Found it challenging and rewarding and didn't end in a massive row which was a bonus. Our host was very helpful, good natured and relaxed. He also gave us some great advice on other things to see and do around Budapest... If you're ever in London for a 2 hour coffee again, let us know!

Really fun way to spend an hour. My friends and I played Serial Killer game, which is easiest of three that they currently have. We stuck at one point but otherwise we solved it. It was paced nicely and the whole team contributed to the solution.The host was nice (HI! :)) and the setting was as it should be - a bit rustic and rough, but that added to the atmosphere.

We had so much fun!. We were entertained from the second we arrived and greeted by the enthusiastic host. Even though the setting felt a bit "unfinished" and was definitely on the rustic side - it just added to the atmosphere.The game itself was the perfect level of difficulty for four amateurs, we were challenged every step of the way (and definitely need a bit of coaxing a couple of times!) but never did we feel at a loss.Would highly recommend for an entertaining afternoon activity - so much fun, would definitely do another.

Good fun. Well put-together, atmospheric escape room (actually four rooms). Friendly staff. Worth doing.We did the Surgery game. But we also had a peek at the Serial Killer game, which looks suitably macabre. I'll do that one too one day.
Great experience! Great game master!. It was my first time in a game like this. Went on for the "Bank Job". Really fun and full of thrill. The bald game master was really nice and gave us great tips!

Fun thing to do in Budapest!. My boyfriend and I did "The Surgery" and enjoyed the problem-solving challenge of it. The room decorations and music gave it a creepy vibe, perfect for the context. It was our first escape room experience and we can recommend!

Sooooooo fun. I've only ever been to one escape game in Oxford, it was plain, expensive and pretty dismal but today me and my girlfriend visited Locked Escape, I can safely say it is completely the oposite. We had so much fun. what i loved was that it really made us work as a team to find the killer the weapon and his victim. It really set the scene and put you right in the shoes of a detective. The game was spit up into different rooms and proved challenging and rewarding. Wanted to go again to try another game but had to fly back home :(

Terrific Escape Game but bad Help from Game Master. I have been participating in many escape games and this one is a really good one.However it is not very good for couples since help is very limited, even if you are stuck for 20 minutes.We played both games (bank & serial killer) and were stuck in each game for 15-20 minutes on the same riddle (difficulty to reset a locker and find a code) and we had no help for all this time from the Game Masters. They have to manage 2 rooms + welcome guests at the same time so they don't know what you have achieved and what you are doing + communication is done through a speaker with low quality.Still a very good experience but more for a group than for a couple since help is very limited and not so efficient.

Great fun, something different!. I booked this experience as part of a break for my boyfriend's birthday weekend in Budapest. I booked a slot and that meant that we had the game to just the two of us for the hour, it wasn't shared with anyone else. I chose the serial killer game based on reviews and wasn't disappointed. We arrived in advance of the time slot as advised, which was good as it gave time to put our belongings in a locker, pay the balance owed and use the bathroom. I was a little apprehensive as I'm claustrophobic and wasn't keen on being "locked" in a room. But after our induction, I was made aware that there was a two-way communication in place if we got stuck or wanted to get out, that we could easily do so.The game was a bit frightening, in a good way, I expected someone or something to jump out on me, which heightened my fear, thankfully that didn't happen!I won't ruin the experience, but will say that it's very challenging and fun, but as a couple and not a team, we did struggle with some parts, I feel it's probably easier with a group of friends.We managed to complete it, but did need a little help in the last room. Was exhilarating and such a laugh, we had to go for a drink afterwards!Wish we'd had time to have gone back and tried the other game.

It was exciting and adventurous at the same time. Great activity with friends.. You and your friends need to be creative and smart in order to find the Serial killer. The stuff was very nice and had perfect english so language doesn't matter at all. You really have to think outside of the box to find the criminal!

Very fun and challenging. The game keeper is super friendly, explains things well in English, and makes you feel very welcome. My friends and I went the first night and did the "serial killer". We had so much fun that we went back the next day to do "surgery". Honestly if we had another day in Budapest we would probably do it again!

Great team bulding experience. Our "small" team of 10+ people needed a last minute idea for a team building and I can assume this was a great choice. The location is central, we got there quickly from the office. Staff was very nice, explained everything also in English so our foreign colleagues got it, too :) We tried all rooms and everyone survived and got out after a strong team work. Later we had a starting point for the discussions during the dinner; everybody was interested and participated actively. I personally went to the Serial Killer room that was great, much more interesting than the escape room I tried before with some high level technical details. I don't want to leave spoilers, so I just say go there and try! Highly recommended for team buildings, classmates or any group that would like to get to know each other better. Also, offers a very good price-value ratio.

So much fun we went twice in one week!. Me and my boyfriend went to do The Bank Job and had such a good time we visited a few days later on the same trip (with a discount card for return visits) and did The Serial killer. Both times we managed to escape with a few hints and an extra few minutes over the hour. Both games were completely different and would definitely recommend if you like problem solving, interactive games, team work and puzzles!

Great escape room. My girlfriend and I did the serial killer room in the Pest location of locked. It was a really terrific room (actually consisting of 4 rooms), very well designed, cool riddles and lots of fun. The guy was very friendly and we had alot of fun solving the case :)

Great experience. Myself and 2 friends visited the locked escape game on 24th October 2015, not really knowing what to expect we were greeted by the host who spoke brilliant English. He told us about how to play the game and if we were ever stuck on one of the puzzles to give him a shout as he was observing and listening if we needed assistance in any way. I won't say much about the game we played as this may spoil some aspects of the game however you really do need to experience it for yourself. It was called 'the serial killer' and the objective was to find clues and solve various puzzles which would allow us to progress through the rooms to find out more information about a serial killer, and to discover information about his victims and eventually (if you complete the game) stop him from murdering any more victims. All of the clues and puzzles were in English some more trickier in difficulty than others. The time allowed for the game is 60 mins which cost 12,000 HUF (approximately £30) however it is possible for upto 6 people in some games. Myself and 2 friends finished the game with seconds to spare. The game will not only test your logic skills but also your team working abilities. All together a great experience but if you wish to play any of the 3 games due to the popularity you will need to book online and pay a deposit of 2,000 HUF (approximately £5) via PayPal to secure a time slot. I would thoroughly recommend this game to anybody looking for a thrill and have some free time available.

Fantastic setup. We played Seriel killer and Bank job with my boyfriend. Above all I was amazed of the amazing decorations and setup detail in the Serial killer, but the Bank Job worked better for us as a game. This doesn't mean that Serial killer would have been bad, on the contrary, but the puzzles in Bank Job were most suitable for us. However, please note: we have played somewhat 10 games and designed 4, so our perspective might be a bit weird. Definately recommended place, best in Hungary. Thumbs up for the staff, espacially for showing us the Finnish-Hungarian version of the Nightwish song :D

Amazing! Fun, unique experience!. We loved this. We did the serial killer experience and really enjoyed it. Having never done something like this before, we weren't sure what to expect - it was so much better than I thought it would be. You have to use logic to try and work out codes/clues to open different locks and rooms. You're limited to an hour but the member of staff was lovely and let us stay in for an extra 15 minutes (we were rubbish). If you get stuck she also helps you by giving you clues over the tannoy (we needed this a lot). Definitely try it! Can't wait to do another.
Didn't even want to escape. Loved the vibe, especially in the serial killer room. Special mention for the top chief who truly encouraged much fun in the bunker. Lots of fun, blessings, teen #magnet
Very exciting!. During our trip in Budapest we did three different roomescapes and this one was probably the most exciting. A big variety in tasks and friendly staff.

Visited twice!. First we did Bank job, and that was super fun! Managed to get out in 45 mins (there were 5 of us). Second time we went, there were only 2 of us, we did the serial killer and that wasn't as great and smart as the Bank Job, also a bit dirty, so don't dress up for the serial killer escape:)

So much fun!. My friend and I read about the phenomenon "escape rooms" on our flight to Budapest so we decided to check it out while we were here - we were definitely not disappointed! I love the idea of games like this where you have to do things IRL and it was great that you could do it together with a friend. We chose the Serial Killer room and it was really well made with a lot of attention to detail and very creative puzzles :) Next time I'm in Budapest I want to go back to try the other rooms as well!
Top thing to do!. The serial killer scenario was slightly challenging but we managed to finish within the hour. This was our first escape room and its definitely one I would recommend!
Great thing to do in Budapest!. We did the Serial Killer Scenario and loved it! It was challenging but we were given help when we needed and we finished with 30 seconds to spare!I's highly recommend!

Lots of fun. Hi,Me and my girlfriend visited Locked escape games and played both he Serial Killer and the Bank Rob. The games are pretty intense with variety of different puzzles. We liked the Bank Rob better than the Serial Killer although it is a great game of its own. I highly recommend you to visit the place if you are wondering where to kill some time :) The game master knew what he was doing and was helping only when we were dead stuck. All in all we had a blast :)
Great moment !. It was the first escape game I ever did.We (my friends and I) did both "The Robbery" and "The Serial Killer", and both were awesome!If you're in Budapest, you have to do this!

I almost died!. Because it was serial killer themed. But it was awesome! The owner was really friendly and would give us hints over the intercom when we got stuck. I would recommend going with 4 people. The ambience of the rooms were terrifying. Really good fun!

Just awesome. We did the serial killer room which was great! the design was really authentic what got us into the right mood, the puzzles were very good, zero technical problem (which could happen sometimes in escape rooms). The host was very friendly and speaks English fluently. The location is also very easy to get. VERY recommended!

Locked Escape Room. We have just come back from a Hen Party this weekend in Budapest. There were around 11 hens in total ranging from 24 - 55 years old. As there were so many of us, we decided to book both the Bank Job and Serial Killer Escape rooms and run them consecutively. Both events were absolutely fantastic! We are from the UK and the escape rooms were designed for a number of nationalities, regardless of their native language. We have done escape rooms before in the UK, but these were in a league of their own, particularly the Serial Killer room, which is the room I was in with the B2B. It's a great team building/ bonding exercise and the tricks, surprises and problems solving made this one of the highlights of our trip. I strongly recommend that if you go to Budapest in a group of 5 of more then you should attend this attraction. It lasts for approximately 1 hour and the customer service and event are absolutely awesome!The Company are extremely hospitable and accommodating and were able to help me book a time slot in advance so I could make sure the hens had plenty of time to get there. We absolutely loved it - 5* event!

Excellent escape game!. We tried the serial killer room which was great fun with some different puzzles and it will definitely get you thinking. The guy on the desk was really friendly and spoke great English. Quite easy to find directly opposite the exit to the metro station - just up the hill a bit to the right.12000 HUFS for the game was a great price and we'll worth the money.Would recommend.

Great fun!. We are a group in our early twenties and loved it! We did the serial killer game which had great scenery in the rooms and the puzzles kept us on our tones. I would recommend to families and people of all ages. This was our second time doing this type of thing and will definitely do it again.

Highly recommended and addictive. I read other glowing reviews on here and decided it was worth a shot. It certainly was! Four of us, Mum, Dad and two teenagers. Went in and did the Bank Job and loved it so much we immediately booked to go back the next day. So glad we did as the serial killer was quite different and great. The guy in charge was so friendly and made us very welcome. People have commented that they would find it claustrophobic but it most certainly isn't and you are way too busy working out clues to even think about that. We managed well working as a team of four and clues were given only if we were really stuck. Otherwise lots of dashing about gathering info. As we came out at the end of the game a group of English girls came out of the other game and like us, immediately booked to go back. We would like to come back to Budapest and try every Escape Room going.

Great fun & value for money.. An awesome way to spend an hour in Budapest with friends. It took 5 of us an hour and 3 minutes to escape the room with just a little help from Eric (our game master) We preferred the serial killer escape game to other escape games we've played as the story/plot really adds another level to the experience. One word of warning - the floor in one of the rooms is very dusty so perhaps dont wear really expensive shoes!

"Serially" good fun.. I came to do this activity with my four friends and we had a great time from beginning to end. We did the serial killer scenario. The decor was great and really affective. It quickly got you in the mood. Nice dim lights and background music to create a spooky / tense atmosphere. The puzzles were challenging and we really had to think outside the box. It was nice that it followed a clear storyline unlike other places that are just a series of puzzles. The person who was working that shift was Eric and he was great at not giving too much away and really friendly. He kindly called a taxi services for us and a couple of pictures. I would come back and do other scenarios and try it in other cities.

Caught the killer and entered the bank. We made both of the missions - succesfully. Both of the missions were exciting and we had to use our heads to complete them. Tasks were logical and interesting.I liked both of the missions. I can easily recommend these games. Refreshing change for walking in the city. Worth to try even if you have never heard about this game. The staff will brief you before the game. And if course gives tips during the game.

Great experience. Quest 1: Track the missing relative, and his heritage: Good for 2-5 member teams but 3 is recommended at minimum. Good mix of technologies. It is like a regular room, Lit suitably. Any shoes can be worn. Ages :6-99+ (children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult). Not too complex, but fun adventure.Quest 2: Track the serial killer. Good for 3-5 member teams. It has darker theme, so I recommend it for older attendants. (14-99+). Good mix of technologies. A bit skill is needed. A bit more complex, very fun adventure. Walking shoes should be worn.

Great for teenagers and grown ups. Totally recommend for a good bit of bonding fun, a bit of light relief from the normal sightseeing experience! Teenage solved it and we thought it was pretty good too! Good value for money !

excellent classic escape room games!. Wicklewood and Voodoo are both great and very entertaining classic escape games. The two of us had a lot of fun playing both places. Both places offered several tricky surprises which really opened our personal gamer's horizon. Very good young and dynamic Game Masters which both should be invited by their bosses to play other escape games themselves with their working mates.Great fun for an excellent price!

Fun with my son. It was our first escape room so we didn't know what to expect. We had great fun anyway.It is quite dusty place,things are old and you do not feel so comfortable touching the things but this is what you meant to do.Maybe it all adds to a weird feeling of the room. It is suitable for more than two,with more people you can solve it quicker.We got stuck once.We talked about the experience later a lot and I was so happy we did it together.

Had fun with friends . 4 of us friends decided to give a try, we did the voodoo tales one, and it was good. We have done many other escape games before, and one thing for sure: for experts it might be easier than expected - but I think it's still fun as you can ask for help if you think you lost your path, or you can decide not to ask for any!We managed to escape with 21 minutes to spare, and it felt good to complete it without additional help.The welcome is "unique" and I think it really gives to the experience especially if it's the first time - makes it a bit scary - but hey! It's a voodoo story after all. :))Might be helpful if the owners would put a small section with some basic short rules in case someone would do escape game for the first time.
Brilliant! . Had a good laugh! Would definitely recommend! Just the right amount of challenge.. We were so so close to finishing when our time was up

OK but not the best . I've now been to about 10 escape rooms. They are great fun but this one (Wicklewood) is now a bit behind the times. It feels a bit dirty and if it's your first one it's weird as no one greets you. We also went to Gozsdu escape rooms when in Budapest and those rooms were so much more modern, clean, clever and about the same price. Go there instead. I think many people rating this one 5 stars haven't been to many escape rooms. I still had a bit of fun here though.

Voodoo Room. Would recommend for others.. Voodo Room: three people did this room. (M/24, M/24, M/26).We booked the room a half hour prior to our visit. Had to be done by phone, since there is no people at the spot, if not booked.Two of us had no tried escape games before, which made it more fun, when there were no real introduction, other than introducing the lifeline (a walkietalkie).We managed to escape. So all good :)Would recommend to family, friends and others.

Brilliant excape room. From the moment we entered the Voodoo room, we were hooked. We've done a few between us, and this one we rank up the top. We couldn't stop talking about it afterwards. A very clever escape room that doesn't just rely on opening loads of locks, there's lots of lateral thinking in there.Great fun. If we're ever back in Budapest, we'll definitely check out the other room they have.

Great escape room. Played the Wicklewood Room and really enjoyed it - particularly the impact walking into the first room. I would say it is medium difficulty as we got out with 9 minutes to go. Lots of collecting items which matched the theme well - 5 stars!
Wicklewood rocks!. 2 years ago, we visited Voodoo for our very first escape room and it was great. Yesterday, we chose Wicklewood and it too was fantastic!!!!
Very good!. We did Vodoo tales and it was really good! Some new puzzles and the room was very good designed. We really enjoyed it!

Family escape. We had a great time here. This was our 3rd escape room and our favorite. The other place we went to had a lot of shock alarms that were very confusing. We did it in 47 minutes and loved it.

It was amazing! . Me and my girlfriend played both of the escape rooms, they were both fun and entertaining. Although the two wasn't together in the same building but very close to each other.
The booking process was straight forward with clear instructions.
Totally need to try this out if you're visiting Budapest for the first time.

Wicklewood heritage: A "Heritage" that is worth exploring. We visited "Wicklewood heritage" and "Voodoo tales" . In both of them, the game started in an unusual and really interesting way. The rooms were highly atmospheric and the game master was really helpful and she spoke good English. If we had to recommend one of them, we would definitely go for the Wicklewood, although it seemed to be easier. It is better organized and has more riddles and items to be found.In Voodoo room, one of the mechanisms consumed most of our time However hard the game master tried to explain , it was difficult for us to figure out what to do. There were also some points that have to be revised from the point of view of safety, i.e the ladder's steps.

Try one out of two games!. Two different rooms in two different buildings close to each other. We did both rooms. “The Wicklewood heritage” room was excellent with really interesting riddles. I certainly suggest it! I can’t say the same about “Voodo tales”. It is a rather poor room with few riddles. There is one riddle that will take at least 50% of your total time. I found that riddle rather boring and not so clever as an idea. Hungary has a very high standard on escape rooms so I expected something better.

Good escape room. Claustrophilia has really good ratings, so it was on our bucket list when we visited Budapest for the weekend. The original room is already a little bit dated, but still very clever and offers a great experience with different types of puzzles to solve - we had a great time. We also tried the voodoo room, which, unfortunately, had two major technical issues that almost prevented us from finishing the game. The game master did his best, of course, but sadly it really affected our overall enjoyment of the game. Still worth a look :)
Best Escape room in Budapest. Great mix of pussels and tasks that require skill, and really authentic and nice interior. Everyone speaks English.
Nice room. We had fun, we finished the room when 17 min left but we were 5 people. Wasn't so difficult but challenging. Nice riddles.

Fun room, lost potential?. This was one of many rooms on a short trip to Budapest. We did the voodoo room. The voodoo theme was great and followed through. Nice variety of puzzles and some I hadn't seen before. The only drawback was that I felt there could have been more puzzles since there was room for it and everything else was so well done. Would definitely recommend but especially for a first time room. Would have liked to have time to try their others.

Great fun escape room. This was the first room we did on our Escape Room binge in Budapest. How the game starts is very novel, and there are some great puzzles. We found the room to be 'logical', so were able to work through it. Worth considering if you're an experienced escape room player looking for a cheap room

Thoroughly enjoyed!. My wife and I really enjoyed it here. Plenty to figure out! We managed to make it out with just 1 minute to spare.
We felt like we really were trapped, it becomes a sort of scary reality and you forget your in a game.
Definitely recommend.

Fantastic brain storming and enjoy for 1 hour long. Very interesting puzzles, logically followed with lots of elements and entourage. Once you enter the room game begins.We have found out the exit after 40 minutes. Definitely recommend-you will enjoy this hour.

Great fun. We thought this was a well-put-together escape game. What more can we say? Wouldn't want to give any clues!
Only thing missing was the "story" that they normally give you as a pre-cursor to the game, but not a big issue

Very nice. This Escaperoom was very good, with loads of different elements. The only downside to it was that we didn't get a good instruction (only a letter) about do's and dont's. It didn't say that the game was started after you signed it and put it in the mailbox, so after that we were expecting someone to come, not knowing the clock was already ticking... But after we found out how it worked we started solving the pieces and puzzles and we made it just in time! So all said and done, we really liked the Escaperoom and we're hoping that we will have enough time to do the second one the same company is having :)
Amazing!. We did 3 rooms in Budapest and this one was very fun!I can't say too much un order not to ruin the game but I would definitely recommend this room to any puzzle game lover .

Fun event - Family fun!!. We have done several escapes rooms over the past year and this one was pretty enjoyable for the entire family. It was different than the others but different in a good way. Really cool clues/challenges - kept the entire family engaged. We finished with only a few minutes to spare! If you need a break from site-seeing, this is the perfect activity.
We escaped!. Great escape game with really interesting tasks. I liked the idea of voodoo, we enjoyed it and had fun. It wasn't that difficult i think.
good escape room. We enjoyed this escape room. some of the puzzles where original. a lot of locks to open. I would recommend this escape room but not if it is your frst one

The Wicklewood heritage - Great escape room (my first time). I went to this escape room with 3 more people, and it was my first escape room ever. As most escape rooms, we had 1 hour to escape, however, we managed to do it in 40 min. We were told that only around 30% of people can get out in 1 hour, so we were happy about it. All the puzzles were well constructed and connected, and it kind of made me feel as if I were inside an actual video game. We are definitely doing the other Claustrophobia room very soon. I recommend it to anyone that might like a challenge.

Excellent game. Absolutely fun!!! Starts from the minute you open the main door. You are basically in a series of 4 rooms with clues, keys, combo locks, and many clues. Whoever created this is very imaginitve. It is well worth the visit and the price.

Best Escape in Budapest for us (out of 6). We tried the Wicklewood Heritage and it was awesome. In the same week end we also tried 5 other rooms but this one was the one we enjoyed the most.The fact you arrive in an apartment with only a piece of paper for introduction is great.You start right away and all the riddles are quite imaginative and also different from the other rooms in Budapest.It's really a must try!!!

Great fun!. We were a group of 3 people that did the Wicklewood heritage one day, and Voodoo tales two days later.Wiclewood Heritage was waay better than Voodoo Tales. At Voodoo Tales a lock was broken, it was very hard to hear what was being said through the walkie-talkie, the helpers english wasn't very good, and we found some of the puzzles to be based on luck, and not very logical.W.H. was much better - everything worked, and I found the puzzles to be more fun and more logical.If you're choosing one - go for W.H - it's excellent !

nice approach with a lack of quality regarding the riddles. I went there with my girlfriend. Actually it is somehow strange, we liked the idea and the way you enter the game. On the other hand side, there were no real riddles. We found some of the keys before we actually saw the riddle which should make you find the key... We did not go for there 2nd room but liked the Wicklewood.Staff was friendly.

Great escape game!. My girlfriend and I have visited quite a few of the escape-games in Budapest, and the "Wickelwood Heritage" is one of our absolute favourites! We highly recommend this escape-game!

Instant fun. We had our foreign friend visit us in Budapest and wanted to do something fun that does not last for hours and still gives something, this is how I found Claustrophilia. I booked only one hour in advance and got answered right away. One may choose from English or Hungarian language so it was enjoyable to our foreign friend as well. The advemture starts right after entering the facility and had an hour to solve all the tasks which were not always as easy as it turned out. This place is instant fun and a unique experience for everyone looking for a casual hour to spend in Budapest.

Better and cheaper than trap!. Firstly we really enjoyed trap, but this place was better! The game starts the minute you enter, sign the waiver and there is no turning back. I can't say much without giving away spoilers. Try it for yourself. The host will help you if he can see you are getting stuck and are behind time. Leave yourself plenty of time to find the venue as it isn't obvious from the main street. You are looking for a private courtyard for voodoo not far from the new york Different sorts of puzzles and rooms. Enjoy!

Fantastic, engaging, adventurous hour. Well worth the money - just 8000 forints per adult! You get an hour and the game starts as soon as you get in. The entrance to the building looks like a generic entranceway to a block of flats, you have to press the right button, go through some doors and to the first floor and it's the first door on the right. Once in, there are some rooms decorated well with lots of puzzles in with good variety. We were talking about our experience in there for ages afterwards, running it through. Very entertaining. Highly recommended. The only thing was that the man running it had forgotten to set something up after the last team and so popped out in the first five minutes to reset it! Despite that (which would have ruined other such experiences) I'm rating it five stars which shows you how much fun we had!
Good old fashioned fun!. I went here with some friends recently. Some of the tasks were really challenging, but that was ok, it really got us thinking. We had so much fun, I would highly recommend.

A really good escape room. We actually booked one of their rooms at the last minute and we did not manage to get in, so we decided to book again next day, it did not dissapoint, it is clear and super thought out escape experience. You have to try it out yourself. Make sure you book in time.

Voodoo tales. I think this room is easy, we escaped in 30 minutes. And we got a hint, I don't really know why, as we had a great time. However, decor and climate was extraordinary and terrific. Puzzles were nice, but not very challenging.

Best one yet. Done 5 in Budapest.. Do it!!!! They're so much fun. We tried the wickerwood and the voodoo room. This was the most fun I've had in an escape room. If you have to choose a room choose the wicklewood
Really good fun!. Even my husband enjoyed it, despite having been dragged along! Great fun and challenging, a very satisfying escape 😀
Great place. My favourite escape room game so far (I've done four). Good clues and puzzles, and four rooms in the game, which keeps it interesting. Good fun.

Really fun and interesting... However nearly impossible to find!. We had heard a lot about escape games in Budapest prior to our visit and booked a session with Claustrophilia in advance. From what I could see, prior booking is essential! We set out in good time to find the location however both google maps and tripadvisor had it marked in two different locations, both of which were wrong. The confirmation email only had an address which was difficult to find however this is of no fault to the game itself. We choose the "Voodoo Tales" and game was challenging, spooking and interesting. It is a highly enjoyable way to spend an hour! Make sure to give escape games a go at some point during a stay in Budapest!

Great job. I was really curious about this place. I own a similar business in another country and i liked a Lot This one.No reception, no scenography...i thought "mmmm....not my taste". Well...they totally surprised me.First of all when u enter the fact to be allready "in Game" is super awesome. Of course i am an "expert" player - so rules, question etc etc was no needed - so i dunno how would be as a first time Game - but for sure for me was one of the coolest start ever. The enviroment: no decoration And theme at all - Well - IT has is own style: the enviroment is just perfect for the situation - any extra decoration would be just "fake" - U Are closed in an old apartament - And This is the enviroment of the Game - And is simply great.Game play: i am not a fan of linear games - but This one Is really nice.We were 2 so We Did not Have any problem linked to the gameplay maybe in 4 Or 5 become too static.Give IT a try guys! IT worth!

Watch out for the uneven steps when you enter. I was the last to enter the game and didn't notice the last small uneven step down in the dark. My friends in front of me blocked my view of the teeny tiny warning sign on the door. I sprained my ankle so badly I couldn't enjoy the game.First rule of business: don't create a situation where your customer is at risk of unnecessary injury. On my way out after the game, we were trapped between the two gates because I couldn't walk fast enough. We couldn't go back up to ask the gamemaster to help us and no one new was coming into the building. The gamemaster only came out after a lot of yelling for help. Even now my ankle is still not recovered.

Difficult and extremely fun!. This was our second escape game ever and it was fantastic. The clues were very subtle and intricate and there were a lot of red herrings which threw us off, but we (2 of us) made it out with just over 4 minutes to spare. The rooms are quite small, so I wouldn't recommend doing it with more than 3 people. The lady who runs it was very friendly and said that around 30% of groups make it out. Highly recommended escape game. Good luck!!

Exciting game, highly recommend. My partner and I loved this game set in an apartment. As escape game addicts, we were delighted that there was a twist to the beginning of this game. The puzzles were well sequenced so we didn't require any clues to get out. We had lots of fun completing the challenges and when we return to Budapest, will definitely check out the other room the company has. Brilliant fun!

Super fun!. Well worth the money, I visited a few different escape rooms during my Budapest trip. I must say that I found Claustrophilia rooms to be the most fun and price worthy. I especially like the "The Wicklewood heritage" room!

Different and VERY good! . I've played several of these games now and this one was my favourite. Perhaps the logic in this made more sense and therefore I felt more satisfied at completing it (just!). Anyway, the price is good. The location easy to find and the room was great fun. I would say two or three is the max for this one. Enjoy!

Such an amazing group experience with so much fun!. This escape room is epic! With up to 5 friends you have an hour to get out of the room. The puzzles are really tricky and we needed all the time and 2 hints to get out. We were first afraid it would be too easy but it wasn't at all! It was quite hard and we were super happy when we made it. We had so much fun and will go definitely go again! If you have 1h of spare time in Budapest this is a must! It's also relatively cheap in comparison with other countries! DO IT :)

A Great Escape game. We were a couple and did Wicklewood heritage and we just got out in time -we have done 7 escape rooms before . . Full of puzzles and locks-very enjoyable. Lots to do but better for 2-3 people or 4 if beginners

Superb. We have never played an escape game before, and saw this has good reviews so we had a go this morning.
