So glad we did, as the three of us had to work together to solve clues, find keys, use objects, etc to move to the next part of the game.Would definitely recommend the Wicklewood game. We solved it in 47 minutes, not bad for a first try.It's not scary...but it's a bit eerie and unnerving, especially at the start when the door closes behind you...

Excellent escape game. Having done an escape game in Prague we had a idea what to expect but this one was even better. If you remember watching The Crystal Maze it's a lot like that - Lots of puzzles to solve in order to get out in the 60 minutes but we managed with about 1 minute to spare. If you get too stuck you can ask for help and clues via the walkie talkie that you are given. This is great to do with teenagers and as a family as it gets you working together. It costs 8000 HUF for our family of 3. It's literally just around the corner from the Boscolo Hotel and New York cafe.

Unreal. Had no idea what to expect. Went to an apartment. Then in the hallway had to figure out through an array of puzzles how to get out. What a great idea. Really made you think. Two of us did it and going against the clock desperate to solve it. Can't tell you to much as the whole experience is to be had by doing it. Next time we go to budapest we want to do all the escape games. I think we did well for our first attempt. If you like the idea of being part of a live puzzle then don't miss out.

Great fun (but escape game newbies!). I definitely recommend this as an activity if you have an hour or two spare in Budapest (and if you don't, make some spare time!). It might be helpful to look up how escape games actually work before going if you have not tried one before...A friend and I stated just around the corner from Claustrophillia. As neither of us had previous done an escape game (but it was recommended by a friend) we didn't know what to expect. This led to a rather slow start in the first room, with little clue of what to do! However, after a little help from (the amused) staff we were on our way. In the end we enjoyed it so much that we returned the next night to try our luck again (there are two alternative games). Give it a go!(One tip is to arrive a few minutes early to make sure you can find the right place - the rooms are effectively set in apartment blocks. As a result it wasn't always obvious where you have to go, and if you are late this means you have less time in the game itself).

Our first win, but quite easy room.. We (a couple) are huge fans of escape room games. Before visiting Claustrophilia, we went to 5 different rooms and never won even that couple of times we were just a second away from finishing. This time, we managed to escape 4 minutes earlier!The price for this room is 10000 huf (for 4 people) as it usually costs in other places. The room was not that difficult. The game master gave us hints only when we really needed it and she was very helpful. The decoration of the room was nothing special comparing to many other rooms (which have put a lot more effort in the atmosphere and decoration). The interesting part of this room is that by surprise the game starts before you expect it. In the end of our escape, we were given discount cards for the next time we want to try another room by the same company.All in all, we are very satisfied with this escape room and we definately recommend you to visit it once.

Ok. . We went in july. The game was ok, but nothing i would recommend. It felt very alternative, but it also lacked something that I'm used to from other escape rooms. Not sure what that is. Let's call it engagement. I'm not sure why this gets such high ratings, as other escape rooms offer a better experience for the same price.

Good game. There were 2 of us in this game and it is our first time. We've passed it for 45 minutes. It was not so difficult as discribed in comments. Moreover yesterday we had a party and today it slows down our mental activity. All in all it is good thing to do if you whant some action and solve some problems.

fantastic escape room!. For such a small price we weren't expecting such a well thought out game. The settings of the rooms were creative and exciting. Having done voodoo curse in the morning, we were hooked and booked to do the wicklewood room in the afternoon! neither disappointed, just about managed to escape with a few hints. Have been talking about the experience to anyone who will listen ever since! Go if you get chance!
best game so far. its a really well thought out game spread over an old apartment. it will take you close to the full hour if you manage to finish it. great value for money.

Absolutely brilliant!!. We did the Wicklewood room and really enjoyed it (although we didn't struggle at the last hurdle and didn't manage to get out on time...gutted) but absolutely great experience and would recommend it to anyone visiting Budapest. We loved it so much we booked onto the Voodoo rooms to do on our last day. Didn't regret it one bit!! I'd say Voodoo rooms is marginally easier but still a challenge. We did get out but the guy let us have a extra couple of minutes which we appreciated!

If you like " Just Connect " you will love this !. Personally, I had never experienced an Escape Room and left to my own devices would still be locked in now. It really helps to go with someone who knows what they should be looking for- great for lateral thinkers !Initially , I booked the Voodoo Room which was very close to our excellent hotel, Bo33. That was great fun - easy to book on line and you pay in cash at the end of the game. We enjoyed it so much we booked the Wicklewood Room and received a discount for a second booking - you enter the code online. Incidentally, the Wicklewood Room is easy to find - straight across the main road from the New York Cafe. The Wicklewood is more challenging and really quirky- great entertainment !
One of the best escape games ever!!!!. Very cool and unique escape game. Definitely makes you think hard to be able to complete it in a timely manner.

Fun, fun, fun (Wicklewood). We were four people and two of us had tried an escape room before. It's very easy to book onlice and the information is straightforward. So many fun tasks and a bit more "hands on" than our previous game, but really a great challenge. We made it in time (or maybe a few minutes over, but the girl let us finish and we were very thankful for that), She said only 1/3 manages this room and I can understand that, because it contained A LOT. I don't think we would have made it if we were fewer than four. I have tried 4 escape rooms in total and I must say that this is my favourite!
Amazingly clever. Great place. We visited the wickelwood rooms. Starts from the minute you walk through the door, quite difficult to do but we almostamaged with just took us. The

Mind blown!. We heard that puzzle rooms were a big deal in Budapest. So we had to check one out. We did the Wickelroom. Holy cow, this was well done. Without spoiling anything it's hard to say much, but there were a lot of very clever twists and turns. So fun. Great environment.

Had a great time!. This was our first escape room ever, we struggled at first but got the hang of it after a while. The game begins the minute you walk in the door. The man that world there was very nice and helpful, and the puzzels was very fun! It is probably easier to solve if you are more people but we were only two and we managed to get through! Really reccomend doing this if you are in Budapest, super fun!

My first escape game. My first escape game was a very nice one. They gave a student discount for students in Hungary, which was very nice. The game was just the right level of challenge for us, and we completed it just in time. The girl working there was a little shy I guess, but all in all good experience.

Nice experience. We played the Wicklewood roomIt was hard but funny and interesting thing to doWe were 4 adults trying to escape this room and we had a lot of fun trying to solve the different cluesVery recommendedPre book your order

One hour of great fun. This had been my first escape game before my "escape game" addiction started. I really enjoyed it. It was very challenging and I loved the puzzles...I really liked the fact that once you enter you are already in the game and the clock is ticking:-) Thank you guys!
Great Fun. I went into it not knowing what to expect but from the get go it was fantastic, you are thrown in right at the beginning. It was very good value for money also!

What a great game!. We looooved this exit game. It was our first ever exit game and we had a wonderful time trying to figure out the clues to escape. We actually escaped just in the nick of time - what a rush.This is a great team effort and I enjoyed working along side my boyfriend to figure out the puzzles. So much fun!

Great set design, needs more puzzles. Having tried a Room Escape game a few days previously and loved it, we wanted to give it another go. We played Claustrophilia's Voodoo room, and managed to escape in just over half an hour. The design of the rooms is impressive, and this would be great for those who like things a little spooky. However, we spent our entire journey home discussing ways this could be improved. You are given a walkie talkie on arrival, but whenever you are given a clue it completely destroys the feeling of immersion. The clues were given a little too freely, and because the walkie talkie cannot be switched off, there is no ability to choose when you do or do not want help. The puzzles are well thought out and implemented, but there are too few to really pad out the hour. This room escape could be really great, but it needs a little more time and care to make it truly challenging.
Good time. Very challenging, great thinking game. We were 3 girls so we were a little bit affraid but it was grate :-)

Just good fun..... Saw some signs for exit games in Budapest and fancied myself as a relatively logical, puzzle-solving type of guy so convinced the better half to have a go. We went to claustrophilia yesterday at 6pm.....just the 2 of us. I went wild mild trepidation as most of the adverts/feedback stated It was best to go with a small group.....but as stated, I fancied myself (.....as a puzzle-solver). Not going to give anything away other than to say we completed it with a few minutes to spare but we're given a few hints along the way. I would recommend this....only takes an hour but that hour just flies by :-)

Unique. This is probably one of my favourite escape games. It is totally unique. You are given instructions of how to enter an apartment and you have to work your way through a series of rooms to escape back through the door that you came out. We managed to escape and we didnt even meet the games master who had been helping us out with clues. Genius.

Great fun!. A friend and I visited the Voodoo room and had a fantastic time. We had absolutely no idea what to expect but right from the very start we were impressed and pleasantly surprised. Solving the puzzles (with a little help over the walkie-talkie) was tricky and challenging but made us feel as though we weren't that stupid after all when we successfully completed the entire game. We were sad when it was over and would definitely have booked the other room offered by the company had we more time. We were also pleasantly surprised by the price. Would definitely recommend for couples, small groups of friends or families with small children.
Too much fun!. Well laid out game. Perfect for an exciting change from sight seeing. We are hooked. We liked the intrigue of the puzzle.

Such a great time!. My husband and I visited this escape room with mixed expectations. It was challenging and fun! Each little discovery made us feel like champions! The setting was ideal for a formerly Soviet nation. The apartment was appropriately run-down, but we felt very safe. I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Budapest! It only takes an hour and you will not be disappointed. I purposefully did NOT give too many specific details because I want this experience to be special and unknown to visitors.

Brilliant fun . My boyfriend and I did this today and loved it!!! We didn't finish the puzzles but enjoyed every minute!! The lady is there over the intercom to help if you get stuck!! Would definitely visit again and do the other room!!

Amazing Experience! . My boyfriend and I have just completed the Wicklewood Room. We didn't escape in time, but we got to the last puzzle. It was so much fun trying to work out all the puzzles from the clues and although we did get stuck a few times, we were able to get a few hints. The rooms were really detailed and it's easy to get so involved! We loved the experience and will definitely be trying the Voodoo Room on our next visit to Budapest! Highly recommend! :)

The great escape. I was quite skeptical about the idea of spending an hour "escaping" from a locked room in Budapest. If was an incredible experience. A challenging and exciting race against against the clock to find and understand the meaning of the clues to solve the puzzle.

Totally Brilliant. My sister and I decide to try our skill for the first time in this puzzle room (Wicklewood). We had a great time. The puzzles were a good combination of mental and physical with some fun thrown in. The hints were good and at the right time. We loved it so much, we booked in the next day for the Voodoo game. A good price and fun environment. Clever puzzles. We've been talking about it all day.

Not too difficult, nice setup!. We went there with a friend and we messed up our booking, but they were super nice and friendly and we could book another slot the next day.The game itself is fun, not too difficult, the two of us got out without any problem. The puzzles are great and it's fun that you are left on your own to explore. I recommend it!

Very fun way to spend an hour. Very fun and satisfying once you get on a roll and find clues hidden around, the host paid attention and was very nice to speak to once the game was over. We were one clue away from escaping which isn't bad going for a group of two either

Escape by thinking outside the box. Very good way of spending an hour After initial trepidation at walking into a room and locking it behind us and without seeing anyone beforehand, it was a great experience. Putting together clues and working between rooms, thinking logically and outside the box, cracking codes and opening padlocks by searching everything in the rooms. We failed to make it to the end, but were rescued by a friendly lass who talked us through how we would have succeeded.There are a number of attractions on this theme now, but we'd recommend it to anyone

Voodoo top / Wicklewood flop. Voodoo Room (5/5 stars)First we went to the Voodoo room and it was really a lot of fun. The room was really well organized and the instructor always paid attention and gave us little hints when needed and everything worked out well. Since it was so much fun we also decided to do the wicklewood room.Wicklow Room (2/5 stars)The Wicklewood room is far more complex than the Voodoo room and is really well structured and COULD be in my opinion better than the Voodoo room (what was in my opinion already really awesome) if there wouldn't be the negative aspects:1. The instructor didn't pay attention at all so after we were kinda stucked after 30 minutes we had to ask for a hint but since she didn't pay attention she had to ask what we already collected etc so it needed really long until she could even give us a hint2. One of the problems that we solved didn't make sense at all (i don't want to go into further details but i can just say you read from left to right) and because of that we lost so much time and then just out of total desperation we tried the combination the other way around and it worked (also there was no hints given)3. Then due to technical issues one of the items stucked in the wall (don't want to describe it further) so we thought we didn't solve the problem properly although we already finished solving it and tried it again and again until we then decided to pull it out with some force. Also here the advisor must have seen that we already solved the problem and tell us that there is a problem but since she didn't pay attention at all she didn't say anything.Because of these 3 problems we lost at least 20 minutes and since we just have 60 there was of course no chance to escape. In addition it's also really frustrating because we were like trying to solve already solved problems for so long...So i just hope for others that you will get an instructor who pays attention and perhaps they fix the technical issues (which could have been compensated too if the instructor would have paid attention).

Great fun!. This was our first experience of an escape room game and we were not disappointed! The atmosphere is excellent since as soon as you enter the apartment, you are in the game (we played the adventurer-themed one). None of the steps are impossible but there is a phone where you can ask for help if necessary. I would thoroughly recommend it to anyone thinking of trying an escape game!

Do it!. This was such a fun evening activity! I was invited along by my hostel mates - all of us not really sure what we were in for and it ended up being the best time. All I can say is that it's a value for money activity that I really enjoyed and I'm sure many other would too.

A MUST do experience in Budapest - Think Crystal Maze!. My boyfriend and I booked the Voodoo escape room and were not disappointed. I had previously done an escape room in Edinburgh but this one was definitely the superior.The game starts as soon as you enter the door - if you are expecting to be greeted by staff you wont be - the game starts immediately!It will get your brain juices flowing and thinking on the spot against the clock, AND test the relationship - who is the clear leader? A must see 5/5

I don't want to tell you what to do, but definitely do this.. Remember those 'Choose Your Own Adventure' books? This is kind of like that except real life and way better. This is probably one of the best things I've done in my life aside from the time I went swimming with whale sharks. If I had to make a top two list of everything I've done in my life it would be 1) Swimming with Whale Sharks and 2) Claustrophilia. I can't put the third best thing I've ever done in my life on this list because it's illegal. But enough about me, this is an experience that should not be missed.

A lot of fun riddles . My wife and I escaped in under 50 minutes, but we already did 2 escape rooms before so we understood the idea. For a new escsper, I'd recommend going to other escape rooms first, to get more explanations. This room is located in an old building which gives it a great old vibe. The riddles are straight forward with nothing out of the ordinary, but still challenging and fun.

If you haven't gone to a puzzle room before, go!. We only had a few days in Budapest and having never gone to a puzzle room before, we were a bit skeptical. But in the spirit of trying new things, we went to the website and reserved a time. I am not sure what I expected, maybe trivia questions or something like a haunted house but what we got was so much more fun- it is really like a mix between Jeopardy and McGyver. We did the Wicklewood room and it was great. Our only regret, and if you want a 'pure' visit, don't read further... it sounds stupid but at first we didn't realize that there was not just the initial waiting room involved (since it is called a puzzle 'room'). In fact , we stood there for a little bit waiting for instructions or for someone to come get us. By the time it ended, we were so close that we lamented that initial lost time. Highly, highly recommend. Makes me wonder when these will become popular in the US...
Fun!!. I went to this with my boyfriend. We weren't sure what to expect but we were really surprised. We had so much fun and I would recommend this attraction to anyone going to Budapest!!

so much fun!. We took woodoo tales with my boyfriend. we both really liked it a lot! Staff was very friendly, even though we're late because of my bad memory. The place was easy to find and not too far from the city centre. We made it in 65 minutes. It would be better/easier with three or four person, but totally doable with 2.

So much fun!!. We were recommended claustrophillia by the hotel staff at buddah bar hotel. We'd previously heard about these games in travel guides and were dying to try them out. The games take place in an apartment in which you are locked that is styled out to be a series of rooms full of puzzles and tasks, each one that you complete awards you key to the next room, has a feel of a real life game show. Can honestly say that this was one of the highlights of the holiday and the most fun activities we have ever done! A must see. We did the voodoo tales game, will be returning to complete the others!

So much fun! - Did both rooms - both great. Went away to Budapest with friends, thought we should try a puzzle room for the firsr time and ended up completing 3 befors we went back to the UKCompleted both Wicklewood and Voodoo Tales with our team of 3. The puzzles in both rooms required good ammount of team work and lateral thinking. The complexity was at a good level for us - did not require any clues.Great starting puzzle room. The owners both fedback in both rooms about our performance as a team and where we slowed down at harder parts Both rooms:Overall experience 5/5Puzzle level - moderate Themes - Very good themes with good use of props, decor and sound trackTean work - good ammount involvedThese rooms seem good with 3-4 people. Our other group of friends of 4 enjoyed it too and thought they had a good number for this room too.Good value for money as puzzle rooms go! Especially compared to the UK. If you are not sure if you should try it then I recommend this is a good place to see.

Wicklewood is awesome!. My two children (ages 13 and 9) and I spent the best hour of recent memory trying to escape from the Claustrophilia Wicklewood logikai kijutós játéka (logic escape game)! The clues were fantastic and challenging. My kids (and me!) were enthralled the entire visit. We have traveled to Hungary many times, and we currently live in BP for year and this is the most fun we have ever had here visiting an attraction in the city including the water parks in the summer! I highly recommend it for anyone seeking to challenge themselves for an hour. We did not escape before the hour, but we were very close as we were trying to figure out the last piece of the puzzle when our clock ran out. We can wait to visit the other room!
Loved it - Wicklewood room. Went with 3 of my good friends and were able to get into the last room. Occasionally asked for help via the intercom. Definitely recommendable!

Great Fun, Hard for 2 people! . Me and My girlfriend came here in January 2014 and ended up having a great time. Mat first we struggled and began to bicker pretty quick, but once we got our head round it (with some help from the woman on the phone) we began to really enjoy it. We didn't make It all the way but did get to the final room. I would suggest doing it in a small group rather than a couple as I think you'd have a better chance of completing it. But we still had fun anyway!

Fantastic and unique. Great fun, tests you as a couple!! You are dropped straight into the game when the clock begins. Every clue was fair but testing. Lateral thinking is essential! Well worth the price and a nice change from sight seeing. We completed it with only 10 seconds to spare!

Superfun mindgame!. This is a real treat for people who love mysteries! I have now done both rooms and both of them was so much fun and well thought out. The Voodoo room was a little bit easier, but both rooms were definitely challenging. We have played two people both times and I have to say that I recommend that if you want to participate a lot you should not be more than that, max three!
Surreal!!!. Half the challenge is in finding the place!!Voodoo was quite tricky with just the two of us but the voice did give us a few tips!! Worth trying it out.
A blast for everyone! . Went to voodoo with my wife and it was a blast. It was a great team building / couple building experience. Highly recommended!

Difficult, but not WAY difficult. Played with 3 friends. This was my third escape game quest. Liked how everything was detailed, and the prettiest staff-girl is really one of the beautiful ones in Budapest ;) Cheers from Ukraine.

A great afternoon!. This was the second escape room we went to( 2 people) and we loved it. The escape room is logic based with tons of locks. We chose the voodoo room as we read it was a more difficult one- it def was challenging! We managed to finish it by ourself in ~48 min ( the really nice girl that operates it said that only 50% actually solve it) Would def recommend it!
The best hour money can buy . We did the Voodoo room, not wanting to give anything away, but it was difficult... You must do this if you are in Budapest.
Totally awesome. Me and my three friends had the most awesome time ever here - can't recommend it enough. So interesting and unusual - we are going to try and book the other one for tomorrow!

exciting and funny. It's hard to describe an escape game without giving away the details. I especially liked that we entered and the game started immediately. Some clues were too obvious, others too difficult but all in all the five of us had a lot of fun. Don't try to escape if you are less than four, we needed everyone's wit and intelligence:-)
Great fun!. Well worth an hour of your time- gets your brain thinking- similar to the crystal maze! You'll need to think about what you're doing but it soon becomes clear

Frustratingly fun!. We booked the voodoo room and glad we did. The rooms are set out really well and you feel like you are in a film. You need to prepare yourself because it is a lot more difficult than you think and we needed quite a few hints from the nice, young lady. The second room we were stuck in for ages then whizzed through the last two. Luckily the lady gave us a bit longer than an hour to complete it. The lady that works there was the nicest, friendliest person we met in Budapest. Highly recommended as it is so much fun!

Great experience at voodoo. We tried the Voodoo game in a group of 4, none of us had done an escape game before. We didn't realise you were not met by anyone at the start which is slightly strange. When you arrive there is only a piece of paper and a radio. I think it would be good to mention that this is the start of the game in the confirmation email they send. The helper was very happy to help if you got a bit stuck but didn't give away too much. We managed to escape in exactly 60 minutes and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it.

Well worth it. Having never heard of this before we didnt really know what to expect but it was an awesome experience and well worth it. I would definitely recommend it for anyone wanting something different to do while in Budapest :)
Claustrophilia escape. Visited this in the autumn. Really enjoyed it. A very challenging hour that got four adult men scratching their heads solving the intriguing puzzles. Highly recommend it.

So much fun @voodoo!!. I went there with my friend and we found it really exciting!! We didn't pass it but it was our first time in escape rooms :) you don't need to worry if you are going there just a two of you because it's enough!
Great fun. Had a brilliant time here, well worth the money. As others have said, be prepared to enter the room without meeting anyone. Can't really say anything else without ruining it.

Awesome!!. Absolutely loved this, we did the Wicklewood Heritage and I couldn't recommend it enough. Be aware that when you enter the room, you wont meet anyone, you need to fill out the piece of paper and get on with it. I don't want to spoil anything but I couldn't recommend it enough!
New experience in Budapest. Amazing! We tried the Voodoo version of the game and we had a lot of fun! The kids (16 and 13 years old) enjoyed it a lot .... an excellent business idea!

Superb!. We did the Wicklewood Heritage and i have to say out of the 6 escape rooms i have done, this topped the lot. They have been very creative in setting up the room and we enjoyed the hands-on approach to some of the problems, kinda like the crystal maze. Went with my girlfriend and we made it out with just a couple of minutes to spare. Place was easy to find based on the photo and instructions given on the website and i cant abide by the persons comment below saying they were annoyed they weren't given more time, the time limit makes it challenging, and thus fun, plus they have a schedule to keep toWas cheap as chips compared to UK and other european cities and the room was the best i'd done, highly recommended

The first time so exiting the second time no!. I went to the wickelwood room with my husband for the first time and it's was so exiting and a fun game, it's not easy for a couple but we almost finish, when we finished we got a 25% discount to the second room- voodo, we decide to book it for the next day, the second room was more difficult and we need to ask for a clues all the time, the rooms is very dark and I donot like to be in dark, you need to use a flash light to see some clue, we didnot finish it of course, we were very dissappointed because 1 hour is not enough for us, maybe for a group is easier. The lady in the first room said that the voodo is easier... I am sorry to inform you it's not!! Anyway if you are a couple go to the wickelwood room is more fun and I recommend.

Very disappointing. We did the other company game the trap and found this very disorganised , hard to find and not much fun. The instructions at the beginning were very poor and you had one hour and we were only about 5mins from finishing the game when they stopped use because we were 5mins over time. This was very disappionting , the other company Trap let us go through until we finished 11/2 hours
Interesting exit game. This game was the first we tried from this kind. It's suggested. With interesting puzzles, not too difficult. Nevertheless, we needed many helps :-) A good one.

Absolutely Exhilarating. Loved Claustrophilia! What a way to spend an hour! Challenged my friends and I and made us work together and think creatively. Very challenging, but in a great way. Staff was delightful too (when we needed help). I would say this is a must visit during any stay to Budapest.
Exciting hour. Fun thing to do with friends and family. The hour passes fast while you try to figure out what to do next. Some of the tasks are easy, and some hard, but they are all fun.

Definitely worth it!. Myself and my partner decided to take a chance on Claustrophilia since the reviews seemed to be incredibly positive and wow was it worth it!We decided on the Wicklewood Room which luckily was easy to find, which is always a plus, and once you get in to the room that's it you're off!I have to say we did need help a couple of times but even so we found it really interesting and fun, once you get in to it you get very excited when you get things right! I reckon it would have been slightly easier with more people (more hands to look, more minds to think!) but we still really enjoyed it and got incredibly close to finishing!We did run out of time but the lovely member of staff (sorry we don't know her name) showed us how to finish off the last puzzle, she was very polite and friendly!We would definitely recommend to anyone who enjoys a challenge, we're definitely considering booking a slot in the Voodoo Room next!

A MUST do!!. This was the first time to do a "room escape" and it wont be the last! We did the Wicklewood room. It was quite difficult to start with but once you get into the mind set of the game it gets a little easier! The whole thing will give your brain a good work out!The hour passes very quickly and we reckoned we needed another 5mins to "escape"! We would recommend to couples but it would be easier with at least 3 people. Make sure you arrive a good 5mins before your booked time!!

Great and fun experience. We went to wicklewood room, me and my girlfriend and it was a great experience. I would definitely recommend it, it was much harder than expected.Didn't crack the hole code but it was worth it, i would like to visit the other room to.
Fun activity!. This hour goes by very fast, this is a fun, unusal activity.You need to think outside the box.I will do it again!

Entertaining Budapest brain teaser. Amazing!! My friend recommended that my partner and I book Claustrophilia as an activity for during our stay in Budapest and I am so happy I took her advice. At jest my partner was very aprehensive about the whole thing but once he arrived and the game got going he loved every minute! Lots of very interesting and mind boggling tasks however we managed to get out in time, vey impressed with ourselves as this was our first activity of this type and apparently only 3% of people are successful! We would definitley return!

Very serious puzzle game. We tried this game as a couple. We went for Wicklewood room.Must say - it was very difficult and we failed to solve all puzzles within 1 hour. We lost about 10 minutes when we realised that the game already has begun. Then except the logical puzzles there was task for sporting challenge (wont spoil details).But anyway there was lots of fun and we enjoyed the game tooo much! I would definitely try another room next time.
Couldn't get out!. This was an hour of light entertainment between bars! The hour flew by and got close to finishing but couldn't quite crack it.Clever concept.

Fun!. So much fun in one hour. We had never taken part in a puzzle escape room before & we really loved it! There were 2 of us. We chose the Wicklewood heritage as it was convenient to our hotel. It starts as soon as you enter... It's so creepy but so much fun! I would definitely try another puzzle game when in Budapest again.

Interesting but difficult. Unecessary difficult. I always play hidden object games and escape room games, but we literally needed a hint all the time, however the guy that works there was cool, he let us in even though we came in late.
wow!!!. The Voodoo was very thrilling! Highly recommended!!! The puzzles were many and varied! We also tried the other room they have, but it was a bit disappointing.

Totally addictive. We chose Claustrophilia because of the high rating on the Tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed. This was our first room escape game in Budapest and our first successful escape, so it's impossible not to give it 5 points, although there are other games equally good (if not better) throughout Budapest. We've only tried the Wiclewood Heritage (too scared to try the Voodoo Tales, I have to admit), but we plan on returning as soon as possible.The Wicklewood room is conveniently located on a main boulevard, Erzsebet Korut 8, so you should have no trouble finding it (especially if you like this kind of games). The game starts the moment you enter the room, so make sure you don't waste precious time. The only minus is that they don't have a toilet, but they let you know about this aspect the moment you make your online booking. Yes, you need to book your place in advance, since escape rooms are all the hype at the moment.

Tons of Fun. This is a great puzzle room. Be warned that when you arrive the game begins right away. There is a form waiting for you and then you just start (no one comes out to greet you or explain). You then have to start searching the room for clues. I kind of wish I had that warning going in as we stood there confused for a bit.

So much fun!!. Our team of 4 did the Voodoo themed one. Very cool rooms, really clever and varied puzzles, took us around 50 minutes to complete (with a little assistance from the friendly helper).We are 2 males, 2 females all aged between 23 and 26, and all really enjoyed it.This would be fine for children - no scary or jumpy things, and nothing too creepy.Would love to try the other one if I came back to Budapest :)

A lot of fun. Claustrophilia was so much fun, an hour very well spent and not too expensive either. I've never come across anything like this before so I had no idea what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised. There were two of us and we got stuck in the first room so we didn't expect to get very far, but we eventually figured it out clue by clue, and in the end we only had one more clue to uncover and we would've finished. Great fun and well worth the money, if you're in the area i'd definitely book it.

Fantastic way to spend an hour. Really surprised how good fun this was, the hour flys by. Is a lot tougher than I expected as well. One tip the game starts as soon as you enter the door after the stairs....don't sit there for ten minutes like us lol.

Brilliant Fun. Myself and my husband decided to try the Wicklewood Room after reading reviews on TA. We had never even heard of escape rooms before but thought it would be a quirky fun thing to try during our visit to Budapest. Well we absolutely loved it. Being our first one, I am not sure whether this is normal, but I loved that we were not met by anyone and just went straight into the game. We absolutely loved the game. It was challenging but we managed to get out with 30 seconds to go. We wanted to do it without help but the woman did come over the tannoy once to give us a hint. I am hoping that escape rooms catch on in the UK because we both loved the game and the feeling we had after managing to escape. Would loved to have tried more whilst in Budapest but we went home the next morning. Would highly recommend a visit if you like puzzles and problem solving. I haven't stopped talking about it. Good value for money.

Enjoyable but frustrating at times.. My husband and I booked both Claustrophilia rooms. We did Wicklewood in the morning which was great fun. We both really enjoyed it. It was laid out very cleverly and the girl gave us great assistance when needed, We proceeded then to the Voo Doo Room later on in the afternoon of the same day. We found this really difficult and I must say I felt extremely frustrated at times. I think to get this realistically done in a hour, you probably need more than 2 people as the clues can be quite complex.

Super Fun!. We booked online prior to arriving in Budapest and we really were not sure of what to expect. We found the place (part of the adventure) and were buzzed in at our appointment time and were immediately engaged in trying to find our way out! Clues were plentiful and help was available if needed, but you certainly had to work fast to get everything solved in an hour. (We didn't make it and had to be mercifully set free by the staff...) We attempted it as a couple, but you may have better odds in a group of 4 - if you can work together!
Highlight of trip. Quite simply - you must do this!!!!!!!! Brilliant. From the second you enter from the second you leave.

A must do!!. This was the first time my partner and I had played anything like this and I would really recommend it as it was so much fun! After reading up on reviews on Tripadvisor I was torn between doing this or TRAP, but ultimately this one seemed like more value for money... especially as we didn't know what to expect. Due to the popularity of the game I booked via the website a couple of weeks in advance (FYI you don't actually pay til after you've played). We played Winklewood and yes, it is challenging! It took as quite a bit of time to get the hang of things, therefore we didn't manage to 'escape' :( The lady was very helpful throughout- she said that for first- timers we did pretty well and that only 30% actually escape in time. A tip for beginners might be to go in a larger group... The more people the more likely you are to crack it. Anyway even though we didn't win, it was still ridiculously fun and I'd definitely go back and do the Voodoo Tales!

Unique and fun hour!. This was such a fun and unique way to spend a free hour! My boyfriend and I did the Winklewood room. It was a perfect level of challenge - it made us use our brains in a different way and was challenging but we were able to unlock ourselves with three minutes to spare. The staff member provided helpful clues when she saw we needed a nudge. I highly recommend this if you have an hour free during your time in Budapest!

Great fun for anyone who likes to use their brain!. In the beginning I thought it might be creepy, but when we arrived I realized that it's going to be a huge fun for everyone. The atmosphere is amazing and you instantly feel yourself into the situation. The riddles are not too easy, though sometimes you see what's coming. Maybe though that's a subjective impression. It is well created and can be done by families with children as well. I advice though to be at least 2 people, otherwise it might be hard to solve some things. Physical strength is not necessary, just brain power and a little dexterity. Don't be worried that your kids might get scared it is not scary at all. Also when you're claustrophobic there is nothing to worry about you will always have enough room not to feel trapped! So go and give your brain some exercise!
Briliance! . Place really good prepared, perfect attraction for every kind of person! Massive fun! I highly reccomend for everyone!

A fun way to spend an hour. This was the first time I've played one of these games and just happened to see the sign when we came out of the New York cafe, it's just opposite. We checked out the website and booked a slot online for later the same day. We were a party of four adults and we all thought it was good fun - if you're a fan of The Crystal Maze you'll love it and know roughly what to expect. The only down side was the lack of toilet facilities - sounds like no big deal but the second the door closes and you're in there for an hour with no loo then it's a certainty that someone will need to go.
interesting. One of new things in Budapest. Better to go with freinds , or with family . It is more fun . There are few of such escape thing now in Budapest . Try one. It is fun !

Best activity for a mini break!. We completed the Wentworth Room in June 2014 and it's been on my mind since to come here and write a review because it was so good. I booked this for my boyfriend as part of his birthday present, we have never tried "escape room" and I purely thought he would enjoy it because we liked "The Crystal Maze" years ago!It was without doubt the most enjoyable, exhilarting hour I have spent on a mini break in a very long time. The room was tough but we managed to complete it without arguing too much :) - the thrill of finishing it within the hour is great! It is slightly errie to start (given that you don't meet anyone) but that adds to the enjoyment of it. I would absolutely love to see the video of us running around for the hour! We loved it so much we would have happily tried the second room but alas we were only in Budapest for three days.Couple of things to note - the road it is on isn't the nicest and the entrance into the building isn't very appealing but it is WORTH it. Also there are a few flights of stairs up to the room so just something to note if you have bad legs!

A real mix of activities. This was the first escape room I have ever done and it took me by surprise. It was set just at the right level where you had to think but everything was solvable with some thought. This one didn't require as much thought (and maybe frustration!) as others and I think is great fun.
Nice to spend an hour.... We went there and had some nice time, if you have a lazy hour we recommend, my friends and I had fun...

A very fun experience. I went, very reluctantly, with my husband and was pleasantly surprised. I had a great time! It was challenging but fun and the lady in charge was very helpful. It was also a very affordable experience.

What a great way to spend an hour. We booked this after reading about it on trip advisor, and we really enjoyed it! We have 2 teenagers and we worked together as a team and managed to escape, it was clever and fun. Yes, it's quite a home made attraction in an old flat, but we loved the clever ideas and having to work out how to get to the next stage. The teens haven't stopped talking about it, and I really recommend it! Had no idea what to expect, but we were very excited whilst in there, and we were so chuffed to crack the puzzles and unlock the door!

One of the best rooms I ever played. The atmosphere is amazing. In the beginning of the game, door just closes and game is on, so it's how I would imagine escape games. Puzzles are well balanced, some of them are a bit easier, some are a bit harder, but it will make you use your brain all the way. Not the first room I've been, but certenly one of the the best so far.

So much fun!. This was our very first escape game and it was a complete blast! We had fun and we laughed like crazy! Had trouble with some puzzles more then others but with a little help we manged to get out :). Recommend highly!
Great time. If you like a little bit of challenge, it's the place for you. I spent a great time trying to solve the riddles and explore the places.
Buda by night. It was juste awesome and so creative ! The difficulty is 8/10 and if you neld, someone can help you by interphone. You have to try it for sure !!!!

Disappointing. As an escape room fan, this is the most disappointing room I have ever visited. The maintenance was very bad in both rooms. The idea of getting into the game immediately without human contact is original but not a good idea. Some of the puzzles were hard to do and not because they weren't solved, just because technical issues. In the wickelwood room the host in the end was nice but had very poor English. The voodoo room was bad. If you must choose from both rooms go to the wicklwood, but there are so many other great escape games in the city.

Exciting and real fun!. Me and my friend decided to do this escape game in Budapest, and being our first time, we did not complete it, but it was so much fun and now we are hooked! Wish we had time to do the Voodoo rooms as well. It would definitely be better and much faster with a larger group of people. More rooms please!

Best escape game ever. A Voodoo room was just perfect! The best escape room I ever played. Puzzles are interesting and intuitive. We hated one puzzle a little bit, but escaped on time! Great great great experience, and best out of 3 rooms we visited in Budapest.

Perfect end of our Budapest visit. Saw this on TripAdvisor and thought why not give it a try on a last day. Well it was a very pleasant suprise, a perfect experience for the last day of our visit. Unfortunately our time ran out on the last puzzle. And the admin girl was very friendly and nice. And very pretty, BTW ;-)If you're in Budapest, definitely a must-see.

OMG Amazing!. Without giving too muuch away, this is one of the coolest things I've ever done!! We did the Wicklewood Estates, just my mom and I. We were so close to getting out!! Budapest is a beautiful culture filled city (which I love), but this was almost even more fun! If you're in Budapest, this is an absolute must!!!!

Was (almost) perfect!. It was the first escape room we visited. Was real fun! Just 2 things : the guy have forgotten to close the doors, so we escaped without solving the last quiz.. Then we went back to solve it, but it destroyed the atmosphere a bit. Also, the hints he gave us helped us a bit too much - finally we escaped in just 46 minutes. Apart from that, was great!!

We were hopeless, but it was good. This was our first time at this kind of thing, and there were only 2 of us, but even considering this we were pretty hopeless. The guy directed us quite a bit, without having to tell us exactly what to do. To his credit, he didn't make us feel too stupid at the end of the hour.Considering we weren't successful, the game was still good. All the puzzles were solvable, and I've spent quite a lot of time considering what we should have done, or where we went wrong. It's praying on my mind, and therefore I've got to say it's one of the more memorable things I did on holiday.

Brilliant- a must visit attraction! . After reading about escape rooms in Budapest online, we decided to book Claustraphillia's Wicklewood Herritage room and were not sure exactly what to expect. We were not dissapointed- the experience was amazing- from the mysterious setting to the puzzles themselves. Booking was easy and we thought the game was good value compared to other similar rooms in Budapest, plus there's a discounted rate if there are only two of you, which was great. The whole experience was brilliant, we thoroughly enjoyed (and managed to escape!) so much that we then booked the Vodoo room the next day. This was also great, but would recommend the Wicklewood room out of the two. Great way to spend an hour!

Voodoo people. This one is the best one I've played so far. Voodoo room is marvelous, atmosphere is great, and just at a time we needed a bit of a help (or we would give up), one-two words helped us to continue. You have to run, you have elements of surprise, you have great beginning of the game ... you have it all. All who haven't played it so far, should do that.

My top escape game so far. First room, Wicklewood heritage. Played already several escapes and this one simply takes the cake. It's just brilliantly done, challenges are so good and so random that they induced a wow moment every few minutes. Being escape veterans, we solved it in 36 mins but it was hellafun. :)

Fun but pery few information. I recommend this game for everyone who is interested to challenge their brain. I was at the Wicklewood room(s) with my husband. We expected a little information about that we would have many rooms to use to solve the task. Even though it was much fun!!

Meh.... The best part of the Voodoo game is the element of surprise at the very beginning as you step into the room. To my team it was a bit of a disappointment since we have solved it in well under 50 minutes without any help. It needs more content, more puzzles, but the idea is very original. There was no adrenalin rush during the play or upon completion, which we do get upon escaping other, I dare say much more complicated and fun rooms. So a bland 2 out of 5 is a fair mark.

Best hour spent in Budapest. This experience begins before you even enter the game - finding the place is quite a challenge. Give yourself a little extra time to get there. We did the voodoo game and I would definitely say book this! It was such good fun and quite clever, really got the cogs working. We managed to finish it as a team of two with three minutes to spare (we were a bit slow to start off). The fastest time it has ever been done in is 31 minutes...

Claustrophilia. We went in the Wicklewood escape room and it was excellent, very good fun, really got your mind working. We didn't quite make it out though! Girl was very friendly and helpful. The only thing I would comment on is it would have been great if you could purchase something at the end, like a CD of you in the rooms or a certificate showing what stage you got to in the game. Would definitely recommend going to this as it was brilliant value for money. Enjoy.

Brilliant room escape game!. We can't say too much about this activity without spoiling the fun, but if you are a fan of room escape games, Claustrophilia is definitely worth booking. We were impressed with the quality of the puzzles and the game was great value compared with other escape games in Budapest.We booked in to the Voodoo room and were provided with a time and address for our 1h slot. We would suggest building in some extra time to locate the address, as unlike some other room escape games it is almost completely unmarked from the street. Don't be put off by this though - in our experience this added to the mystery and enjoyment!The game started immediately upon entering the door. We solved the game, but this took the best part of the full hour, so be prepared to work quickly!We completed the game as a couple which worked well. Coming straight off the street it was no problem to carry our bags / cameras with us throughout.Although you have little contact with the staff during the game, we found the girl who ran it to be really friendly and helpful when we paid. We would definitely recommend this activity and would love to try their other room if back in Budapest.

Fantastic fun filled hour in Budapest!. Don't want to give too much away but trust me if you like puzzles and enjoy logic then just book. The game starts immediately you walk through the door so be prepared to get those old grey cells working quickly.

Brilliant fun!. Found this on a review of our hotel which was nearby and then on Trip Advisor. Brilliant fun and good value for money. Won't spoil the puzzle but if you like a challenge and what to try something different then this is for you! We solved it but only with 30 seconds to spare. Would love to do it again!

So much fun, game on from the first moment!. My husband and I just got back from a trip to Budapest and one of the things that we loved the most was Claustrophilia. Once you sign up you are given instructions (very good instructions) that get you buzzed into the apartment complex where the voodoo room is located. Once you are buzzed in the game begins. Honestly we would not have gotten through the rooms without some help, however the help was given only when necessary. We still felt like we accomplished the puzzles even though we needed some prompting. The rooms were setup so well and we really felt part like we were in a story. I highly recommend Claustrophilia. The price was better than some other escape rooms and I felt that the value for money was really there. Plus it was nice to take an hour out of sightseeing to do something we wouldn't normally do.

Very fun !. My boyfriend and I did the Voodoo-themed escape game. It was appropriately challenging, the decoration was well done and we will definitely come back for more Claustrophilia games next time we're in town !

Great Atmosphere. It's not the easiest place to find as we needed up going to their other venue who didn't really help us with directions to the game we were meant to go to, luckily we managed to find our way and was only 5 minutes away. We did the vodoo game, which was a very well thought out game, the atmosphere was the best we have had for an escape game and I found myself at times getting very scared.

Brilliant fun!. Slightly spooky going in, and as we are oldies (50+) and there were only the 2 of us it took us a while to get the hang of the game. Once we did, though, it was great fun - and certainly very stimulating - and although we had to be helped twice, and then still didn't get out in time, we were told we did ok!!! Would love to go on another one, and we're going to try a room escape game in London next.

good fun. It´s really difficult to solve the puzzles in 1 hour, if you do it only with your partner. I suppose it´s much easier if there is bunch of friends, each of them looking for clues in other parts of the room.
Anyway, it´s a really good fun and we definitely recommend it.
our first exit game. It was our first exit game and it was fantastic. The place looks really amazing. It is thematically designed. The puzzles were great. Even when we didn't succeed we loved it.

Brilliant!. Visited due to reviews on TA - glad we did. Went with my partner and didn't really know what to expect, being the first time we've tried anything like this. It was really good fun trying to work out what everything was and how it linked together to finally get out - although we didn't quite manage it we were sooooooo close to working it out. I love playing games and this is right up there with one of the best. It's a great way to spend an hour. We did Wicklewood and would recommend to anyone. Tip - don't try to work out the mathematical puzzle at the beginning by using the numbers on the bolts - quite expensive at around £15 for the two of us but have to say worth every penny

Very nice!. The theme was excellent! The game we picked had 4 rooms to go through with very nice riddles. The only negative was that one of the basic riddles was just impossible to solve even with instructions. In general though it was a very nice experience and would highly recommend.

Absolute must do activity whilst in Budapest! . My partner and I signed up for this a day in advance not really knowing much about it. Turns out it was the best hour of the whole trip! It's very cryptic and you have no idea what's going on to begin with but as you gain confidence and start to crack the codes it becomes fast paced and a great way to spend time with friends/loved ones. This one is a bit scary at first, but you feel great when you've made your way out! Highly recommended!

Brilliantly Different. We went to Budapest as a group of ten and did this game in two groups of five, one getting 40 minutes with a clue and the better team doing it in 46 minutes but without any clues. The whole concept was completely new to us and from falling straight into the game to getting locked in the corridor after the game finished it was brilliantly entertaining throughout. The game was 10000 forints so about £5.30 each which we all felt was a complete bargain. I would definitely recommend this for anyone looking for something a little bit different - it is also very centrally located and near the hard rock cafe too - so all in all an excellent way to spend a couple of hours in Budapest :)

Great Place - Very Recommended. My friend and I went to Budapest for a Vacation,We heard on the way about the concept of the Exit Games and we tried several of them.In my opinion "Claustrophilia" was very good (3rd place by challenge and sophistication, 4th by design)We had a great time over there. The people who operate it are nice and welcoming.If you are just 2 people, they have great deal for 2 players' team.

Really good fun. We did it as a couple, had a fantastic hour trying to figure out the puzzles, very grateful for help from the girl at the other end of the walkie talkie! Really enjoyable would thoroughly recommend!
GREAT. cool and totally worth it!!! the price is high but I loved it and it was fun and AWESOME!!!Don't miss it :)

Such great fun!. We had a few hours to spare before our train left Budapest and it was a rainy day, so we decided to try out a room escape game. We chose the Voodoo tales and although I was a bit creeped out at first, it turned out to be a good laugh. It was our first time and we were a bit confused in the beginning, but the owner was helpful and gave us some hints through the walkie-talkie. Half-way through we got the hang of it and it was awesome! There are four rooms, loads of different tasks to test your creativity, logic, powers of observation and even dexterity. All in all, it was a really enjoyable experience! There is a toilet and a clothes hanger in the welcome room, so you can leave your coats and bags there. The game lasts 1 hour.The location is another advantage of this attraction. It's very central, 2 mins walking distance from the New York Palace. It wasn't very hard to find, although I was worried. You just ring on the bell, the gate will open and the entrance to the Voodoo tales room is on the left, straight from the courtyard.Very good price as well, we got a discount because there were only two of us. Good value for money.

Great fun!. I did this today with 5 friends and it was great fun. I had not done an escape room before and I would definitely do one again. It was fun trying to find all the clues and keys while trying to beat the clock. Someone has taken a lot of time to set this all up and I would totally recommend it to others as it was truly a memorable experience and so different from the run of the mill tourist experience.
Do it! Now!. You simply can't leave Budapest before playing this game. Its a pure fun hour and it will seem like 5 minutes. Just do it. Now.

Heaps of fun..... I visited in April 2014 while on a four day trip to Budapest with my mother and sister. It was recommended to me by my manager who went the previous November with her husband....and would not stop raving about it. I am not going to spoil anything about this unique acitivity, it was so much fun, we argued, we laughed, we shouted and we cheered. Fantastic fun at a good price. Definitely worth booking and going...

Absolutely Brilliant!. This is 100% worthwhile doing in Budapest...we absolutely loved it. Totally different to anything we've ever done and so addictive. Some of the twists and things they have set-up in there are just simply incredible.
Amazing. This was like being in a hungarian crystal maze. Way too much fun! Incredibly puzzling, we were one task short of escaping as the time flew by!

Great fun!. I would like to say a lot about this game but I'll keep it short as it already said in previous reviews. This game is a must for logic lovers and creative thinkers. One hour of great fun and mystery right from the moment you enter the room!

Great fun. Booked into the Voodoo Room for the last thing of our holiday, luggage in tow before heading to the airport. From the beginning the atmosphere is spot on, not seeing/talking to anyone before you're locked in and the game begins is a great way to start!We did the game as a couple - escaping with about 10 minutes to go. Apparently it's quite rare for couples to complete it but it definitely required a lot of teamwork and a lot of no-nonsense actions - my advice would be not to overthink things too much and just try EVERYTHING if you're stuck!The rooms get progressively creepier which was cool, the final room in pitch darkness was a great conclusion. The tension builds as you run out of time but it's all just exciting rather than stressful. We were a bit gutted we'd waited until the end of the trip to visit as we'd defo go and do the other room if possible! One of the best hours we spent in Budapest by a distance.

Great fun. Very atmospheric.. We tried the first room and were so taken by it we went back to try the second one the next day! Wicklewood is the better of the 2 but they are both fun. They are great value compared to other cities. One thing Claustrophilia get right is there is no introduction, you're straight into the game with no human contact. This really helps the atmosphere. Top notch.
Exit Games. This is a very good game Really enjoyed the fun with family of 5.The people will give hints if needed and again their english is spot on. Worth doing

Fun and games. I am a fan of escape rooms and went there with 4 other friends. We got out of the Voodoo Tales room in about half an hour :). The begining of the game is a nice change as it is not like the other ones I visited. The quest was interesting and the decor was very nice. The staff was ok, but I would have wanted a bit more details as we kept track of the time with our own watch and the lady there did not give us anything specific in terms of how we did other than what we asked. Other than that it was quite fun!

Excellent way to spend an hour!. My parents and I visited the Wicklewood Heritage - Claustrophilia. We got stuck for a while in the first room, but the help person was very friendly over the intercom and told us how to get into the second room. It's great fun, nicely decorated, a good bargain, but quite challenging, which we liked. You definitely have to try this if you happen to be in Budapest!

Mamgi solved in 57. I can only recommend this Exit game. I just stumbled over on tripadvisor when I searched for things to do in Budapest. This was the first experience with escape games for us. We were four with children of 8 and 15 and it was really challenging. We got some help in first room, but then we got till the end three minutes before time stop. I reviewed some low ratings and believe they were only angry and frustrated not to solve the puzzle.

Good fun - a little annoying in parts. This was really good fun for an hour. There were only two of us and we actually really struggled, but were given help! One really annoying moment where we had worked out the puzzle but had read the number wrong so wasted about 10 mins! Beware that 1s look like 7s! Good fun. :)

Amazing fun!. My friend and I had read up about escape rooms before we went to Budapest and were excited to try it when we arrived. We picked Claustrophilia because of the good reviews it had, as well as being featured in print. It did not disappoint! From start to finish the experience was amazing, everything was well thought out, the aesthetic was really nice, and the help was useful when we were stuck. Definitely a must in Budapest!!!

surprisingly. When we came into the building, the game was already started. That was a very nice and unexpected twist. We had to unlock different rooms, solve puzzels, crack codes and to think simple. Think logic in this game (sometimes the awnser was so simple and were we thinking to hard)! It was a really nice experience, I would recommend it to everyone who likes to be a Sherlock Holmes.

Free Mamagi, the last voodoo priestess of Mahou Bai island. It was pretty cool, we managed to escape and free Mamagi within 40 minutes with our one-year-old daughter :)Nice and polite staff, interesting riddles, some real voodoo atmosphere :D

A fun activity to do with family or friends. They have 2 exit rooms: Sherlock Holmes and Voodoo, S. Holmes was all booked (all timings are online) so we picked Voodoo which added to the mystery. We were 4 and I would say this is a minimum because you need different brain skills and sometimes physically you need to be in different places at one time to advance in the game.So you go from room to room where challenges to solve are very different and inventive and at the end you find a key and this is to exit. I must say it was weird in the last room to not be able to advance any further because I thought we would find a treasure or something fun but it was just the key to get out!!!The good thing is, when you are stuck a voice helps you. When we got out in less than an hour the lady mentioned that we did well because some people, event with lots of help, are stuck longer and finally have to give up. You really have to think out of the box to get the clues. In hindsight it's seems easy but it is not at all.

Simply a must.....MAKE SURE YOU PRE BOOK.. This is an exit game where you have to work out how clues in order to get out. Be prepared to think out of the box. My husband and I did this together and only wish that it lasted longer than an hr. Really enjoyable and would he great doing it with kids too. Do not miss this as I've never done anything like it before and really enjoyed it. We prebooked in the uk and glad we did otherwise wouldn't have been able to do it in our 4 day stay.

Be prepared for something different!. If there's one thing you have to try in Budapest, it's this Exit game! I went with my partner, and thing that two people is probably a perfect number - not suitable for a group of friends as you'll probably get in the way of each other and argue too much over the taxing puzzles to make any definitive choices! We solved the game in theory... we simply ran out of time to complete the last task fully. So... don't dilly dally, go there and get on with it - as time is of the essence and it'll soon run out on you.

SOS!!!. I booked into Claustrophilia on Monday, I'm afraid I'm still here. I don't want to give the game away about the layout of the building but if anyone knows the way out of the third room could you please message me with a clue as the battery on the iPad is about to die out and I have about four hours before the flight departs.In all seriousness, this was really good fun. A lot of the tasks were well thought out and took a bit of brain so work our way through it. I'd recommend it if you fancy doing something a little different, for an hour of your time I don't think you'll regret it.

Voodoo Tales - lots of fun!. I booked Claustrophilia as a last minute thing - I'd been eyeing it up online before we made the trip over to Budapest and so whilst we were there, I took the plunge and booked. We also got a generous discount because we played as a couple. I don't want to give too much away to prospective players!! What I will say is that the whole experience to the moment you walk through the door, right until the end, was fantastic. So much thought and inspiration has gone into it. I have to admit we had quite a few hints but the further you go, the more you start thinking the right way. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Budapest that would like to experience something a bit different from the usual sightseeing. Thanks for a great time!

Great fun!. We did Voodoo Tales and had a great time! We were able to finish the game before the time ran out (and with only few hints). We found it a bit expensive, though. If it had been cheaper, we would have tried the other game as well.

Excellent activity for us & kids 11 & 13. This was definitely a highlight of our stay in the city. Would recommend to anyone - it's really good fun. You need to work as a team and the kids really helped and loved the whole experience. I would say that its ok for age 9 up. No good for little ones, they'd get in the way. We were very proud of ourselves as we escaped with 2 minutes to spare, exhilirating stuff!

Fun way to spend an hour. Had a thoroughly enjoyable, if frustrating, hour trying and failing to solve the puzzles. Help was at hand however,which was a good job or we'd still be trapped inside. Great fun even if you're rubbish like us it's still hilarious.

Fantastic experience . This puzzle room was fantastic. I love that you walk in and you're already in the game. The time went really quickly and we all kept laughing the whole time. I'd highly recommend this unique experience. Beware it is challenging but if you just take it as the fun that it is you'll have a great time! I can't recommend this enough!!

Interesting experience but Confusing. An interesting idea but we found it to be impossibly complex and as per the manager, only 1/3rd of teams are able to solve to end. I really doubt that number. Would be phenomenal if a new player can do it. There were no instructions to start with and you just enter a room and start. We could figure out some of the clues or guess some but for a small team to be able to do the entire thing in 1 hour is a real challenge. The manager although was quite helpful but they should add some instructions and make it more intuitive.

Fun, exciting, interesting and different!. Never done anything like this before and it did not disappoint. The game was exciting for the full hour. There were just 2 of us and we thought we would be at a disadvantage but we managed to escape with seconds to spare! Manager helped a couple of times along the way which helped us to progress. A must for anyone who likes to solve problems! Thoroughly enjoyable.
The best escape rooms in Budapest. I have visited several escape rooms in Budapest. but this one is the best experience I had. both of the games are unique and challenging.

Highlight of Budapest! . Me and my gf enjoyed every second of this beautifully designed puzzle! The game starts as soon as you enter which really helps fuel the feeling of being trapped and having to figure your way out. The puzzles were fun and challenging and we just barely didn't finish the entire thing. Compared to other escape puzzles this one was also very cheap, especially if you're a couple bc of the 40% discount leading to a deal of 6000Huf! All in all a must do for everyone and a super cool experience!

A lot of fun!. We did claustroplila since we had done a similar game in Prague (we are now hooked). It was a lot of fun. Only issue was that we were the first customers of the day and showed up 10 minutes before and the employee was late! It was a little frustrating but we quickly forgot once we got into the game.
A great family experience. It was different and interesting experience. The whole family enjoyed it very much. Required teamwork. We laughed a lot while you attempt to solve the puzzles.

Good luck. I went with my boyfriend to test how smart we are. Well.......we had a loooot of help from the staff so we could succeed but without those helping sentences, we couldn't even have continued from the very first room, which is by the way from the beginning so as soon as you enter the building, you are in the game. For a girl it can be creepy sometimes but keep on and wish for a very generous helping staff:)))

great fun!. Even we were just a couple, we had great fun ( more people more fun ) We failed at the end unfortunately but surprisingly you don't care of it anyway. One thing that shouldn't be missed when you are in Budapest. We tried the Vodoo Room and loved it. Next time we are gonna try the other room !

Excellent. Probably the first time my boyfriend and I had to work as a team for an hour straight - and it was such good fun! We did the Voodoo room and completed it within the hour. I was entirely creeped out for most of the time but it added to the atmosphere and made the experience so real. Excellent value for money - the escape games in London are double the price! And you get a discount as a couple which is bonus.Highly recommend Claustrophilia! Wish we had more time to do the other room. My boyfriend said it was easily the highlight of the whole trip.

Just great!. We were a team of two and did the Wicklewood room a few days ago. We completed it with one minute to spare and left with huge grins on our faces! The experience is exciting, surprising and challenging- really really good fun! We have just booked the Voodoo room too, so that probably sums it up- just go and play!!!

Good family activity - professionally run scheduling and support. I can't compare this with other escape games. However, we enjoyed our experience. We went to the website, followed the instructions to reserve, received an immediate response telling us what to do. (This is in contrast to escape game companies in Sofia which were rated but didn't seem to exist or Bratislava where we haven't received a response). There is a big sign on the outside of their building in a very safe part of Budapest. It gave us a comfortable feeling.I should add that the hour we spent almost getting out was quite enjoyable - and my kids are now looking for escape games in other cities.

Great Value . For 6000 huf (~$30) this was a bargain. My partner and I made it through all the rooms. The hour will go by so fast and you'll either be really amazed at your efforts or kicking yourself once you discover the secrets. I can't wait to play another game in the next city I visit. There are a number of different companies out there and I can recommend this one.

Great fun. Really really enjoyed claustrophilia, did the voodoo room which was genuinely scary at times! There was a slight malfunction at the end so we didn't realise we'd actually completed it, but that didn't affect the enjoyment of it, would definitely recommend!

A LOT of fun. We finished the Voodoo Tales game in less than 45 minutes, so well before the hour was finished. We started 5 minutes later than planned because there was a 'technical problem', but that was not their fault nor was it a really big problem.We had 4 people on our team which I think was perfect for this game. Afterwards, the co-owner told me 50% finishes the Voodoo Tales game and only 30% finishes the Wicklewood Heritage game. So if you're used to playing these kind of games (eg point and click games), you should probably try the Wicklewood Heritage.

Amazing Attraction. I booked Claustrophilia with my girlfriend based on the reviews on TA and we were not disappointed. We booked the 'Voodoo Tales' experience and it was the best hour we spent in Budapest. The game is brilliantly designed and my partner and I had a real challenge working our way through each puzzle.We finished it under the hour and we were told that only 50% succeed on doing this so we were very pleased with ourselves. We left with an adrenaline rush and wanted to do 'The Wicklewood Heritage too' (unfortunately it was booked up for the week). It was our highlight of Budapest and such good value for money (only 3000 HUF each).A must do!!!

Best way to end my trip. It was our last night in Budapest and we decided to go play this game and I am so glad we did that. What a game it was, exhilarating from the first minute all the way to the last. The staff is very friendly and help you a bit which is good. I have never tried such a game before and was skeptical about it at first but trust me, it is undoubtedly a must-go. I don't want to describe the game much as I might spoil it for you but I definitely recommend this game to everyone of all ages.
Must-do. it was our first time doing a game like this and we enjoyed it so much that we can t stop talking about it. good job to the organizers.

What a Buzz. Adrenaline fueled hour of puzzle solving against the clock with many twists and turns.. Just wish I could tell you more, but I don't want to spoil it for anyone.My wife was unsure about the concept when I told her that I'd booked it, but afterwards she became quite evangelical about the place, spreading the word to all we met for the rest of our trip. We solved it, just the two of us!Teamwork was amazing! Surprised ourselves to be honest. ;)

An hour well spent. This game was full of surprises. I loved the location and the feel of the game in terms of the set design and objects.We received a friendly welcome and enjoyed the balance between puzzle solving and finding relevant objects.This game is suitable for people of all ages.

Good teamwork and you can get far... :). That was so much fun! We went there in the morning on our wedding anniversary, and even thou we never have tried something similar, we did good (not great, just good, since we were not able to finish the game). We got in such a team spirit!! I will not review any clues, but seriously - look around yourself. There can be helpfull stuff in every little corner! We would really like to try another game some other time. This was really cool thing to do.

Outstanding Way to Spend an Hour. Two of us went there to start out the day. We chose the Wicklewood Room. The place itself was a little strange to get into... just a door inside of a residential area. We went inside and the game began. I won't get into too much detail about the game itself as to not spoil it for others, but let's just say that it was a very memorable hour! For just two people it was a good amount and the hints were great. For the price, this is an unforgettable experience and I highly recommend it! No bathrooms available, so make sure you use one before you get there!

The best Birthday present ever!. I booked Claustrophilia as a birthday present to my partner, and I kept it as a surprise to him until we were about to start the game. I booked the 'couples' option and it was only the 2 of us playing, and we had such a blast! At first we felt stupid and just couldn't figure out what to do, but we did got some help (truth be told, the person on the interphone had to help us several times, haha!).
