After a few minutes though we got the hang of the game and started really working together to get our clues and enter the next rooms! It was such a great experience! We both love games and it really felt like we were inside a gigantic puzzle. Working together, as a team, was really fun and we spent the rest of the week talking about this experience and how much we loved it! Next time we are in Budapest, we will definitely look for this kind of interactive game again! Totally recommended!

just the best!. We just got back from our first 'escape room game' ever and we chose Claustrophilia's Wicklewood experience, and I must say that it was amazing. We were a party of two and we were a little afraid that we wouldn't be able to get out, but we actually managed to finish the game, which was extremely satisfying. We highly recommend this little 'adventure' for people who want to do something other than regular sightseeing. I believe this will be my best Budapest memory.

Great fun and great value. We did both rooms and had great fun on both occasions. All team members could participate in solving the puzzles and they had the right amount of complexity.Though the official price was 10000ft, we got a family rate of 5000ft!Greatly recommended.
A must do. We had so much fun in the wicklewood room, we escaped with only minutes to spare! It's great but you need to know from the minute you shut the door and sign the form the game starts!
Super fun!. We went today and had so much fun almost solving the puzzles. Sebi was very kind in helping us through the rooms and we wish we had more time to visit the other room!
So much fun!. Such a well thought out little game with great attention to detail. A brilliant way to pass an hour!

Great fun and really interesting!. Completed the rooms with 15 minutes to spare :-) We decided to book the voodoo rooms after reading comments on here. We are so pleased that we booked this as we had a blast completing it. There are so many different skills you need to you, but great team work task. My sister and I had a brilliant time and would definitely recommend and come back again to a different room. Thanks!

First escape game experience. We were visiting Budapest with our family (4, 8, 11 yrs old kids, my husband and I) and I decided to plan and try something different. This surely was and everyone loved it! Everyone could participate, even the youngest one - and we almost managed to solve it! I definitely recommend!

Wicklewood Room - Lots of Fun. We did the Wicklewood course at Claustrophilia, and had a blast. The puzzle is set up to make you use a lot of different skills to get from one room to another. It was pretty difficult (we came up just short), but the Claustrophilia worker at the other end of the intercom helped us out whenever we got stuck, which made it a lot more fun. I definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Budapest. We went as a couple, but I'm sure it would also be fantastic for a family or group of friends.

What an experience. Arranged to visit this place following the review from tripadvisor. We were rather lost at the beginning but soon got the idea and had the best fun ever. Can truly recommend. Was an amazing experience!

Great Fun. We had a group of 8, with 4 people attempting the Voodoo room and another 4 in the Wickle Wood room. My team was in the Wicklewood room and we managed to complete with 5 minutes to spare.It is amazing fun with lots of puzzles and amazing attention to detail within the game.Would strongly recommend especially being only 10000HUF / £30 per room.

Fun but we failed miserably. Let me just say first of all that we failed miserably. We were four adults and two kids (13 and 10 years old). Based on the reviews in Trip Advisor we chose to sign up for this given we were traveling with two kids. We were in the voodoo room and were frustrated in the anteroom. We had to get help from the magic Wilkie talkie (which couldn't always hear very well). We also found that the locks in the second room were somewhat tricky and we couldn't get the numbers to move. The person on the Wilkie talkie had to appear and show us how to use it properly (not the same as the ones in US). My 13 year old was the saver of the day he figured out one of the more difficult pieces. So, having a teenager on your team that plays a lot of video games helps because the adults felt kind of dumb a lot of the time.

Family had lots of fun - one of favorite activities in Budapest. We had booked the original room but had so much fun that we ended up playing the voodoo room as well. There was some frustration as others have pointed out, especially at the start but it got better with time. We were 5 minutes too short on the first room but we did get out of the second one. All in all, it was a great experience and the family pricing cannot be beat (around $20).
Absolutely worth it!. I was convinced to go by trip advisor, and it was completely worth it. It was full of detail and completely enthralled my friend and me. Highly recommend it.

Fun for the hole family!. We had a great time in the wicklewood room! So far the best experience on our vacation according to our children 11 and 14 :-)! Can we book another room? Says it all! Well recommended!

Great Team Adventure!. Some friends of mine from Germany met my husband and me in Vienna and we traveled together to Budapest on a Sunday. I was afraid there wouldn't be much fun to do but I found this attraction on TripAdvisor and I'm so glad I did! We had a 16 year old boy with us and 4 parents. The adventure was exciting but not exhausting. If I ever go back to Budapest, I will go to the other Claustrophilia adventure. It was that much fun!
SO FUN!. We were a small team of 2, but, we had big fun. Did not make it out. Wish we could stay longer and do Wicklewood!

Overpriced, too much hassle for nothing. We went to Claustrophilia because all the positive reviews in TripAdvisor.we were in Budapest for 6 days, and at the last day we booked the Voodoo room.we were very disappointed, the task are very technical (find keys and numbers to unlock the locks)we paid 6000 HUF (about 20 Euro) for 2 people, it's a lot of money for one hour, consider that you are in Budapest (everything is cheap there) there is many other great things to do with so much money.It wasn't exiting as everyone said, you need to see well in the dark, and realized simple things, and if you don't you can use the "walky talky" and you will get all the help that you need.this attraction is by far over rated and much over priced... maybe would be ok for a family with kids if they want to spend a lot of money and get the kids busy... otherwise, save your money and the wasted hour and do something else in this beautiful city

Very fun and interesting !. I went there with my family, and there are two type of clautrophilias in Budapest : the Sherlock Holmes and the Voodoo, we did Voodoo. It was fun, and when we were stuck and didn't know what to do anymore, there was a person that would give us some hints. The only thing that I would have liked was to find something at the end, like a treasure, but our reward was to be able to get out of the room ! It was really fun and challenging though.

Great Room Escape Game. Brilliant! It was in a real apartment block which added to the authenticity.Challenging, but very entertaining. Only 30% get out, but we managed to get out as a couple.Very reasonably priced, a must do for Budapest.

Excellent fun for a small group or couple. Did the wicklewood game with three other friends and had an excellent time. As I booked the game I decided to keep it all secret so my friends didn't know what to expect which I was my only regret as there isn't much explanation before hand. Otherwise it's amazing!!

An Absolute Must. I still can't believe how good this was. I really didn't expect it. The perfect break from sightseeing. Locked in with brilliantly elaborate puzzles to move from room to room then to finally escape. I would recommend this to EVERYONE who ever goes anywhere near Budapest.

Great fun. Very different to anything we'd done before but was very enjoyable. Initially it's very strange and can confuse you but the clues are all there. Also a lot of hard work put into the experience, so it's well worth it!

something different. I booked this for me and my boyfriend as a break from sightseeing and something completely different to do together.We chose the wicklewood room and had a great time (although my oh did get a bit frustrated towards the end!) We were given a couple of hints over the intercom where we had overlooked something and were going down the wrong track and were allowed a few extra mins as they could see we were close.A new experience and really enjoyable.Just note there are no toilets in there and it is hot (although there are fans around) so worth taking some water.

Such such fun!. We have never done one before and decided to give one a to on our European holiday and are so glad we picked this one. Such a food story and atmosphere in the place. It really made us think and although it took us about twenty minutes to get our heads the right way of thinking it was so engaging and when we got into it we made great progress and found it so exciting and exhilarating! We managed to complete it but they kindly let us run over by 8 ,ins as we were so close to the end. We went in a group of just 2 so got a discount online which made it also great value for money for one of e best hours ever! 2 was quite hard so I ink 3-4 people would mean you could all get involved without getting in each others way. So good, definitely recommend and will try others too now!!

Claustophilia. Claustrophilia does not need my ringing endorsement, but I thought I would strike the bell. This feature was so much fun! We actually did both sites in Budapest. It's all very mysterious; finding the location, being buzzed in, walk into a room, hearing the lock click and then the game is on...try to get out within the hour. It's just like the Saw movies, of course without being life threatening. This is a great test to see who works best under pressure. Ding ding ding! Be sure to do it, it's awesome!

Go with Claustrophilia! - the original trapgame. Ideally, if you dont get stuck in the entrance - You get in an open door without meeting any people before the game, and the door shuts behind you. Your suddenly stuck with a disclaimer in paper before you for the game in a locked room, and need to start making your way out of there. If you think about doing these types of games in Budapest - GO WITH THIS ONE - the other ones are just rip-offs and bad copies with no original atmosphere like this one. And the ripoffs cost twice as much, like TRAP-game which is much less authentic.

Loved it. Amazing concept, not like anything we had done before and great value for money. Really really recommend this, would be great for team building. We found it very challenging as two 18 year old girls but found ourselves really engrossed by the atmosphere. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Budapest.
Fantastic. Exciting concept. Really enjoyed the challenge. We needed a little help as we did not understand the basic rules but would definitely go for a similar experience again

Interesting way to spend an hour. We did this on our last morning of our visit to Budapest. The is the first time either of us have ever played one of these room exit games. A challenging series of puzzles designed to make you think and work as a team. We did it as a couple. Based on this experience I would definitely look to do more of this type of game. I think these are best done in pairs rather than played alone.

Really fun! . We chose this company because it was a lot cheaper than the others and we got a couples discount. Was really fun and a little bit difficult so as a two we didn't finish in time however I think with more people it's probably easier. You get a Wilkie talkie where a man will give hints or you can ask if your stuck. Would definitely go back to see if we can complete it!

Fantastic and Challenging!. A novel game, and an excellent alternative to other tourist attractions. We went as a group of three to the Wicklewood room (the original of the two), and after a very slow start very nearly got out in time.To add to the intrigue, you don't see anyone who works there until after your time is up, or after you've 'escaped'. The game costs 10,000 HUF (around £30) for a group, which is definitely value for money.

Fun and challenging!. This was our first time in a room escape game and we loved it! As soon as the door shut and the clock started ticking it was all systems go to solve the puzzles and get out in time! Initially we were stuck but once we got going( after a little help) it was so addictive and there was no way we were not going to crack it! We went as a group of four, mixed ages, and we found we could all participate in some way and it was good to try something different! Highly recommend it to any wannabe detectives out there!!

Best part of our trip so far.. Myself and my partner booked this game before we set off on our holiday. We were relatively unfamiliar with the idea of exit games and so didn't really know what to expect. The whole thing is totally immersive right from the start. Don't want to give anything away but one minute you're walking into a random apartment and the next you're suddenly trapped and solving puzzles. It took us the whole hour to get out (a couple of hints were given by a mysterious voice coming from a box) but the game was well paced and interesting. Was cheaper as there were just two of us and it would have been great value for entertainment at double the price.Incredible is the only word to describe it and if you've considered it enough to get to the tripadvisor reviews then you should definitely give it a shot. You won't regret it.

Strongly recommended... We just played the game and it was great fun. We were able to finish it 5 minutes before the end. You can ask for help with the puzzles during the game. If you like puzzles and are looking for some extraordinary attraction in your trip you should definitely try this.
Book at least one week in advance..
I expected more. The place is disappointing. I found it quite difficult as did my friend. Was kinda fun but not worth the money

Most fun experience. Myself and my girlfriend chose to try this, we had never tried anything of this before but we enjoyed it so much.We got the discount for just 2 of us, which was good as it is the game that is harder the fewer of you playing it.It takes a while to get started but you soon get the hang of it. It's all very clever and fun, only criticism was that one of the puzzles included a combination and the numbers were slightly off (say we read it as 12-34, whereas it was meant to be 13-35). A bit of polishing on things like that and then it'd be perfection.

A little pricey for the experience but should give it a try!. We paid 10000fn (45USD) and went to play as a group of 3. Was really stuck initially but things got better in the later stages after you get the hang of things. First time we were playing this kind of game and it was quite an experience. Recommend it to those who haven't tried such games before!

Just do it!! . Love love loved this! My boyfriend and I did this together and we was absolutely amazed out how good this game was. You walk straight into a room sign a paper and get on with the game, this just added to the thrill of the game. Took us a short while to get around to the first bit but once we got the hang of it we were on the ball. Highly-recommend it to all its a must do as it is probably the most fun activity I have participated in during a holiday couldn't fault this game

Excellent fun - an original way to exercise that grey matter!. We had heard about Claustrophilia and were curious to experience it first hand so booked the Wicklewood game before arriving in Budapest. We weren't disappointed - all four of us (aged 10 to 48) loved every minute of it and felt a great sense of satisfaction for having solved a lot of the riddles without help, almost getting to the end. We were so impressed that we decided to book the Voodoo game for our last morning before flying home. This was also great fun, although we received a lot more help for this one which meant that we actually managed to finish within the hour. The children were able to contribute just as much as the adults as their insights and observation skills come in very handy for this game. I would highly recommend this, but do book ahead as it is very popular! The price is incredibly reasonable, at 5000 Forints for a family ticket.Please note that the Wicklewood game does not have toilet facilities, but the Voodoo game does.

Very different experience, new addiction!. When my husband suggested this I imagined us being found a couple of years later ala SAW film style. I was game for a try though and I am so glad I did, we had such a frustrating, exciting, annoying, exhilarating hour! We were in the voodoo room which I believe is a newer addition. The trouble is in writing a review I wouldn't want to give anything away, but the best I can do to say its great from beginning to end, although we deffo left with lingering adrenaline rush, needing to walk it off! The guy we met was really patient and helpful and if you are considering it, give it a go. Why not? Whats the worst that can happen?
good escape room. Friend and I booked the Voodoo Room. Got stuck :( Overall, good puzzles, good props, good experience. Some puzzles are really cool, but I wouldn't spoil the fun, go try it yourself.

A brilliant, mad, fun way to spend an hour in Budapest.... We have never done anything like this before so had no idea what to expect but saw it listed on trip advisor and read the reviews... Wow does it live up to them! A brilliant, unusual and slightly mad concept but highly recommended- you won't be disappointed!

Something Very Different & Fun. This was our second trip to Budapest and we wanted to do something different so chose the Wicklewood puzzle game. We had a lot of fun trying to figure out and although we didn't actually get out in time (we were very close) that made it no less fun. Note that you can (and we did) ask for help using an intercom found in the first room. There was a little confusion with a couple before us so we were met by a woman but as I understand it you wouldn't normally see anyone till afterwards, adding to the mystery. Well worth doing and very reasonably priced. Make sure you book online first.

Great fun - inexpensive - good mix of challenges. This was the first time either of the 2 of us had done a game like this before and we had a blast. The puzzles and challenges range from fairly simple to quite challenging - at least for the 2 of us. We needed help at times which came as needed. You only have an hour and we only got about 3/4 of the way through - I'm sure larger groups would make faster progress. Highly recommend.
Great fun. A team of four gave the voodoo room a dam good go and managed to complete the game. So much fun and well worth the price. Highly recommended.

By far the BEST live game, I've ever played - just amazing!. I've played a few games in the UK and overseas but nothing compared to this - I played the adventurer game first and I got such a buzz from it, I played the voodoo game 24 hours later... And for me, this was the BEST by far!! My whole body was shaking by the excitement - I'll come back to Budapest just to play this game again!! I tried another, with a different company and it didn't even compare!

Something different and challenging!. I completely agree with all the other reviews. The idea is very simple but just a fantastic way to spend an hour and great team building. It really gets you thinking and for us spliced up the day from sightseeing and museums by waking up our brains.Hunting through the rooms is really fun and quite exciting as you get closer to the hour and understand the links a bit better.Also the good advice; don't discount the relevance of any object in the room and every problem can be solved!

Very Exciting!!. If you're looking for something different to do while on holiday than this is the place and activity for you. It requires logic, problem solving skills and team work. Escaping within an hour is a real challenge and not for the faint hearted.

Smart, Thrilling Puzzle. I had a very, very fun time with my family playing the Voodoo Tales puzzle. It was such a unique, challenging, and exciting experience. It appeals to many different personalities and abilities. It is super easy to book online.

A Unique Activity- and so much fun!. I have never done anything like this before and I absolutely loved it! I do not want to provide too many details about the activity as it will ruin it, but essentially it is a real life version of the hidden object computer games. You are given 1 hour to solve puzzles and find your way out of the room. We opted for the voodoo themed room. I am pleased to say that we managed to solve the puzzles and escape. We felt that everything was well put together. I am still talking about it and grinning a few weeks later. I really want to return to Budapest so that I can try the other room. I cannot recommend it enough. Much cheaper than the other rooms in the area too.
Great way to spend time. Must go for all in Budapest with time spare! It's a unique activity for all to enjoy.Easy to book and pay for, all online or via email.
Excellent. 3 of us did this, was honestly one of the most fun things I've ever done. We had an amazing time in Budapest but this was the highlight. I can't recommend it enough.

one of the best room escape games in budapest. i played a lot of room escape games in budapest and i gave reviews to other games but this one has to be on top of my list , it is one of the best ones that there are in budapest

disappointment. Went there with two friends, because it is the closest exit game to my flat. I had big expectations towards this place, especially because it's the no. 1. "must see" here. The good things: it's a whole flat and it's not in a cellar. Things that I did not like: it was very hot in there, even though it was arount 12-15 degrees outside, the tasks were not so witty, I mean that the whole game is not about using your logic, but mostly about finding hidden things in the rooms and using them in the same, or in another room, and that's it. Also the installation/furniture was poor quality, especially in the middle room with the golf club. So I am really surprised that this game is the No. 1. attraction.
DO IT. Never written a review before but this place deserves 5 stars!so much fun if u get a chance do it you will not regret it.

uncommon activity. I've really liked that activity, because it was different than what i'm used to do as a touristic activity. It's quite challenging & not that easy! I will recommend it to everyone. It was definitely fun!

So see why this is number 1. Thrilled that we found this on trip advisor. Brilliant concept. Fabulous alternative to the usual attractions. Tough going to solve puzzle in a hour with only 2 but that made it even more fun. Highly recommend.
Great experience!. We went here with our friends when in Budapest. It was certanly something new and we all liked it very much. Surely very good time spent here :)

Class assignment I actually wanted to do. Had to participate as part of a class so I went with my teammates. We did wicked wood and had a wicked time. There were frustrating moments but the ominous voice will steer you the right way if you just need a little nudge to find that next key. Do it if you get a chance because you won't find anything like it elsewhere.

Great fun. Did the voodoo game on Monday. Great fun but you need to think about the game, everything in the room is there for a reason and do not forget the obvious in front of you. A great way to spend an hour. The location is next to the New York Cafe. It is same street as the synagogue but at the very top of it near the cafe. We walked the full length of it in 15 mins. Well worth the money and at the end if you were struggling with some of the clues the owner tells you what you missed. Give it a go. Final tip book in advance as soon as possible

Great fun. Something different and a great choice of activity for my husband, me and our two grown up children. Very frustrated that we didn't quite solve it, but it was great fun. Not at all 'claustrophobic' or physically demanding but it makes you think -and it's clever. well done to the people who thought it up!

Claustrophabulous!!. Couldn't agree more with the other reviews. Such a fab, fun and unusual way to spend an evening.We went at 10pm and the late night definitely added to the creepy feel. Ridiculously cheap price for the fun we all had!!

A great hour at Claustrophilia. Four of us have just spent a really enjoyable hour at claustrophilia and would thoroughly recommend a visit if you are in Budapest. With the help of a few hints just one puzzle short of making it out. We visited the Wicklewood room, great fun.

Absolutely bloody brilliant!!!. Went with the fiance on the 13th may 2014. Cost next to nothing and we jas a blast. Def makes you think on your toes and is of a medium difficulty. Well thought out and is so muvh fun. We did heaps in budapest.and this was our fav!! A must do for any person or family. Its only 1 hour of your time and you will not be disappointed. Auckland, NZ

Nice event. We visited Claustrophilia whilst staying in Budapest for a weekend and attempted to escape from the Voodoo room. All we can say is that we failed miserabley but would love to have another go. Highly recommended if you want to break away from bars and restaurants.

best thing in budy!!. absolutly brillaint costs nothing should be a lot more expensive due to the adrenline rush you get.best time to go in night time so it make it more scary and thrilling going into a random apartment in pitch black.deffo a must me and partner had an amazing time and the buss u get after is a high to start a drunken night out after :)

Awesome!. Claustrophilia was our first attempt at room escape game and it was awesome. The two of worked through most of the puzzles, but we did get a coupe hints from the moderator. I wish we had more time to do more game, it was so much fun!

interesting and challenging quest. There are two quests available. The one we took was about a traveller that created an apartment full of riddles in the center of Budapest. The location of the apartment in infront of New York building, so we started our quest with a coffee in magnificent New York Cafe. We were a party of two: my husband and I. The quest is designed in a very interesting manner, all the riddles are fun and challenging. The players are supervised by a staff member via small cameras in the rooms. It was amazing experience. We enjoyed it a lot.

Fun but rushed - less immersion. We did the voodoo one. The puzzle itself is really good, price is affordable. The only thing we didn't like is how it feels rushed to finish it, and we would enjoy more if the pace was more relaxed.Guy who runs it was cool, giving us tips (which some people may not like, since you don't feel like you're solving alone). Maybe it would be better to ask for tips on your own?I think it would be more enjoyable experience if they gave people an hour and a half to immerse themselves entirely. Also it would be cool if there was a stronger introduction story.It's 6000 huf for 2 people and they speak good English.

Worth the hype.. The reviews are all great, and there's a reason for it.Awesomely smart, well designed and massively interesting.I was a total doubter after reading the reviews, but this completely exceeded my expectations.Super cool.

Brilliant alternative attraction. My partner and I decided to book this escape game experience before we went to Budapest. Received a confirmation email and read many reviews who suggested we didn't turn up early - so we didn't! Turned up at exactly 9pm and said my name through the buzzer of the building. We then went up some stairs and through a door on the right, with no greeting from anyone. I have to say this was a little creepy but I get creeped out by anything and everything!We signed a piece of paper as per the instructions and the game began. It took a little while for us to get into the flow of things but once we had a hint for the first room we did pretty well. We were SO close to making it out of the whole game, frustratingly close! But we loved every second of it and would recommend it to couples or groups. So so glad we took the plunge and did it!

Fantastic. This was the first time my husband and I had ever tried any escape game and Im so happy we picked this for our first. The mystic atmosphere and the way the game started was well thought. We definately recommend this to everyone. It is so much fun and you want to do it again. The price is also very reasonable.

An experience, not a destination. The task(s) were well thought out and executed. It was challenging for 2, perhaps a larger group could easily accomplish it if they have their sleuthing wits in tact.

Great fun, give it a go!. This was really good - you turn up and its straight into the game - you don't even see anyone.
The puzzles were fun but challenging enough for it to not be too easy.

Challenging and great fun.. I love how they start things off. It's so understated and things aren't spelled out for you from the get go. It's challenging, we had a group of 5 and we were all occupied constantly, trying to figure out the next step. At times working on our own and other times working together. The best part was that we did it. We successfully got out! But only just in time. I think they gave us an extra few minutes to see if we could do it and I'm glad they did.

Phenomenal!!. Me and my partner can not rate this experience highly enough - We had so much fun! The adrenaline kicks in as soon as the time starts and we were buzzing for days afterwards! If you like puzzles, video games or always fancied your hand at the Crystal Maze then you'll absolutely love this experience.You need to book your slot and pay in cash (v. good price!) I looked up the address on Google maps street view before hand so we knew what the building looks like and so exactly where to go. It's true that you don't meet any staff upon arrival, (this only adds to the atmosphere and suspense of the experience and is a great touch) instructions are written in English on a piece of paper in the first room. The game is challenging but totally achievable (we are proud to say we finished it in 50 minutes! :) most of all its extremely fun, we are now on the hunt for all the other Exit Room Games. Book your visit now!!!!!!! Thank you Claustrophilia!!! :)
So much fun!. We loved this. Puzzles were challenging and we didn't finish - spent too long figuring out how to get into the first room. Will definitely look for similar attractions in other cities.

LOVED IT. this was our first experience of any kind of escape game and we loved it. The game is challenging and fun. There were only 2 of us, but I don't think that put us at too much of a disadvantage, There is a phone on the wall for you to ring for clues - we certainly needed this at the beginning!If you haven't done one of these before, so give it a go - you will enjoy it!. there is no need to be good at languages or maths - just general problem solving. it was like being in the crystal maze but for an entire hour.The time flew by and it was probably the highlight of our trip to Budapest.It was such good value for a really fun night out.

Quirky reminder of what can be down WITHOUT a games console!. The 'Voodoo games' room is a little hard to find, you need to buzz in next to some large black iron gates, so you know! A great idea, very original and had a real charm to it. My boyfriend and I had lots of fun, a few tantrums, we didn't actually make it out, much to our disappointment, but was still entertaining and enjoyable and we'll definitely be back! The man who greeted us afterwards was very nice, we hope they expand to the UK! Would definitely recommend!

Best Escape Plan game Ever. I went to this game after reading the review and rating in tripadvisor. This was amazing good game and never been so excited to get out in this fantastic escape game. Love to visit the other room next time i visit Budapest. It'also located in the middle of town near the main road. A must to see as couple, family or friends. Take the challange now!

Well put together. Basically you are given an hour in an apartment to solve different puzzles, moving from room to room. The puzzles test you, and according to the girl who works there most don't complete it within the time. The whole thing has been set up really well and some parts are quite elaborate. It's very well thought out.It's a really fun way to spend an hour, and very different from anything I've done before. Definitely worth doing - but remember to book in advance.

Like stepping into a video game. We had a great time doing this. The puzzles were challenging, but well thought out. I appreciate the one hour time limit as we didn't want to spend our whole afternoon playing games. My only gripe is that one of the puzzles involved searching for matching pictures on a huge board of pictures and, given the time limit, stressed me out!

Amazing. First room escape ever tried, it was real good fun! I partecipated with my husband and we really enjoyed the experience. We entered a poor-lighted room, we read a mysterious message about witches and evil spells and we heard a voice "you have to find the key!" and the game became! If you're in Budapest you cannot miss it!

I just can't rate this place enough - best Hour of the Year to date!. I don't want to explain what goes on in this game too much, as not knowing was part of the thrill - but if you enjoy puzzles, or ever played PC games like Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis, Monkey Island etc, you will LOVE this experience (even if you aren't a gamer - my friend wasn't). It is really good value for money, and a MUST-do in Budapest. You'll be talking about it all day!

Really fun!. Me and my boyfriend had never done anything like this, so we decided to try it. We chose Claustrophilia because of the high ratings on here, and the great price.Since the Wicklewood room gets fully booked and seems more popular than Voodoo, I chose to book that one first. It was really easy to find, big signs outside the door. After you ring the bell they will let you in and you walk up the stairs to the room. We liked that you got no information at all, except for a piece of paper, and when this is signed the hour starts! Not knowing what to expect, we had a bit of a trouble at first before we got a hang of it all, and we didn't actually finish the game in time, but we were quite close.Afterwards we were greeted by the friendly girl who had given us clues when we needed them, and she told us only about 30% actually finish the room, so we didn't have to feel too bad ;)Wanting revenge, we also booked the Voodoo room for a couple of days later. This one is harder to find, you have to look for a big, black iron gate and ring the bell for the room behind them. We actually walked past it, stressed out as we were (we were late) but managed to find it when we looked up the exact number. Now we knew what had to be done, and we ran around like maniacs to find all clues in time. We had some small issues along the way, but we actually managed to get out with around 5 mins to spare! We were really happy that we actually finished it! The guy who came out to greet us at this one was really friendly as well, I thought he would be mad that we were late, or not get a full hour, but no sign of it. We told him that we had tried the Wicklewood before, and he thought Voodoo was a bit easier, and I might agree (although it's of course hard to tell when you only finish one of them)Remember to bring cash, and you're all good!

Lots of fun . Not actually that hard to find. Was so fun! We did it as a couple and didn't finish (stuck at the last hurdle for ages frustratingly). Definitely recommend it, great way to kill an hour and very reasonably priced.

Harder than expected but good fun and a good laugh... At yourself. Definitely recommend. Was a very different experience and one that made you kick yourself at parts when you realised you'd missed an obvious clue or something. I did it with my partner, but more than 1 person to help you would be handy though not necessary.

Absolutely Amazing Fun!. Me and my boyfriend booked this based exclusively on the reviews on Trip Advisor!It was hands-down, the most fun I have had in ages!I had no idea what to expect, but it was a million times better than I could have imagined!We booked it so that it was just the two of us, and had an amazing time searching for clues and trying to navigate our way around the challenge!You must do this while in Budapest. It is unlike anything you have ever done before or will do again. Once in a lifetime. :D

Your very own crystal maze!. Me and my girlfriend booked into this after reading the reviews on trip advisor. A very unique but exciting idea. We booked into try voodoo, was good trying to figure out some if the clues together, we didn't finish the game but was a brilliant way to spend an hour. Highly recommend.

Amazing, challenging and great fun!! - voodotales. Me and my boyfriend tried the voodotales escape room, and the game didn't leave us disappointed! For a whole hour we both used our minds and physical skills to save a haunted soul, and with just minutes to spare actually made it!! Don't miss out on this activity while in Budapest!!! :)
Lived my crystal maze dream. We went with just two of us and started off a little confused but once we got in to it had great fun! Richard Obrien would be proud.

Amazing. One of the best things we did in Budapest. I read loads about it before, so was really excited. Booked a room with my wife. Really well-designed. Quite difficult unless you ask for some clues. We did the Wicklewood room, which is the original. Don't want to spoil it for anyone, but would recommend it as a must-do.We enjoyed it soo much that we booked the voodoo room too; that was tougher with 2 people so I would say try get more people for that.All in all, GO FOR IT!!!
Must do in Budapest. One of the best experiences in Budapest. Didn't really know what to expect, was kind of mysterious from the get-go. Really recommended !
Frustrating fun. I loved this and hated it - but only because we came so close but didn't quite escape. We would have been closer to escaping if my golf skills were better!

Great fun, and something different. We did this as a couple and did the Voodoo Game (as the other was fully booked) - was loads of fun and lasted just under one hour. We got a taxi there to make sure we were on time but walked back as it isn't as far out of town as first thought. Only advice - DONT ARRIVE EARLY - just arrive at the exact start time and away you will go.Would love to try the other more popular game by the same people in a larger group if we return to Budapest with friends. Don't worry you can ask for help if you're stuck, very different but lots of fun.Also at 6000 HUF for two people for 1hr we thought great value too

Brilliant. This was a highlight of our visit. Great fun and completely out of my comfort zone. I booked it for my boyfriend, but i was unsure whether I would like it however I think i enjoyed it more than him. I got totally involved in puzzle solving and finding the clues. We didn't make it out in the time but we realised what we had missed which was frustrating and made us want to do it again. If you book in advance its really reasonably priced and well worth it. Everyone should really give this ago, its original and different and gets your brain thinking.

Unmissable. If you are in Budapest you should definitely go! In one hour you will have so much fun...not easy to solve all the puzzles and quizzes in only one hour, I went with my boyfriend and we were able to solve up to the final 2 steps to get out...I would suggest to gfo in groups of 4, easier to be quick. The place is really nice and engaging, not good for claustrophobic people (no windows and you are locked in!) but if you are in trouble you can ask for help ringing a bell. ENJOY!

?????Amazing????. Brilliant..Thoroughly enjoyed it. I was actually shocked just how much I enjoyed myself. only down side we couldn't win! Well worth the money. would recommend to all. families, children and couples!

Pleasantly Frustrating...Needed Another 30 Minutes. My family and I "experienced" Claustrophilia. What a fun event it was, puzzling through a myriad of conundrums to try to find our way out of the rooms. We felt, I suppose appropriately, pressured by the clock, having only one hour to complete the brain teasers. I would recommend Claustrophia for a group -- you need a critical mass of people and ideas to make sense of the puzzles, especially in the time allowed. Good fun!

Wonderful intense experience. We did this game the last day of our visit to Budapest. I can recommend this to everybody who has some time left in this city. You will never forget this hour of intense searching and solving riddles!
Voodoo Room. Really fun, 4 room puzzle. Took us about 45 minutes, and had a variety of challenges. Apparently it is slightly easier than the other Claustrophilia puzzle room but was still very fun.

Odd, but a cool experience.. A bit weird when you first start out and it helps if you play hidden object PC games as you'll get the hang of it sooner. Don't expect to see anyone until the very end and the time starts as soon as you get in. The help is definitely useful at certain points and I would loved to have another crack at it. Brilliant fun if you enjoy something a little different and quirky on your holidays.
Awesome fun. Excellent flow of solving the mystery case. Makes you think a lot and be very observant of the situation. I have never had this kind of a fun place in my previous tours.

Good experience. I do not want to go into details, because it is best to walk in there unprepared and get surprised.Thats what I did and I got pleasantly surprised.It is a lot of fun to do it, especially in a small group and it is a great feeling when you finally manage to get out of there.Claustrophilia takes around an hour.

So much fun!. My boyfriend and I visited this today and had such a fun time. I was worried we would be locked in some gloomy dungeon somewhere but it's held in a flat and help is available if you need it. Which...we did. If you liked the Crystal Maze on telly and were the person shouting at the idiot on the screen this is ideal. Everything is well thought through and we haven't stopped talking about it since coming back to our hotel :)

MUST DO!!!!!. Absolutely fantastic game! Not like anything you have ever done. Two of us did the voodoo game and finished it just in time! Really fun and exciting. Make it a must on your trip to Budapest and you wont stop talking about it afterwards! ! Staff afterwards was very friendly and concluded our experience nicely. Overall 5stars*****#to find the place turn right at the main crossroads (east)... follow down 1+half blocks and look for a big metal gateway on the right hand side! You will see a number 57 on a white placard on the wall.Have fun!

Fun and unusual. We booked Claustrophilia in February and did the new voodoo themed one. There was two of us that did it and we found it challenging and fun; the hour went by very fast! The game starts as soon as you walk in (before you even meet any staff) and this really adds to the atmosphere. I would love to try another similar game in the future and would recommend it to anyone that wants to try something different on their trip.

I'm not a genius after all!. My partner and I did the "Voodoo tales" game. We'd heard that very few people complete the game without assistance, and wanted to see if we were special. Turns out, not so much! I would highly recommend this logic game to all. Afterward, we were even able to ask questions about the things we didn't understand, or find. It makes for a very entertaining hour, and was one of our favorite attractions in Budapest. Give it a go!

So much fun.. My girlfriend and I played the room escape game one of our last days in Budapest. The experience is fantastic, despite getting nowhere close to finishing the puzzles. Very challenging, but one of the best activities of our trip.

Amazing. The best thing we did in Budapest. Much better than TRAP!My girlfriend had organized it as a surprise for me and I had no idea what we were about to do when we entered the apartment... this added to overall experience and we got so immersed in the game and had so much fun.The atmosphere is incredible and the puzzles are challenging, but not impossible. We made it just in time, even though we received a couple of hints through the inter-phone. We really liked that the game starts as soon as you enter the apartment and there's no one to greet you.I hope you guys open a room in Berlin!

Amazing escape game. We played this escape game with 4 people. Having played many escape game, this one was really the best.Many surprises, including the entrance. The atmosphere is great, and it's difficult enough.We escaped with 4 min left, well done!

Communication is the key. Me & my husband attempted this game last week. We had no trouble booking on the website or finding the place. The statue tree outside is a good marker, then go to the doorway where Claustrophilia is clearly marked on the intercom. Google maps took us right there. (The 1st and only time it got it right!) We had a great time & the hour went so quickly. We got very close. We came out arguing over whose fault it was that we failed LOL which neither of us will agree on! I can see how people get the bug as we instantly wanted to find another one to try! They also told us that a 2nd Claustrophilia has just opened. Great way to spend an hour in Budapest!

Fantastic! Remember to pre-book!. Fantastic game that is great for the brain! We had such a laugh and where running around like madmen at one point as we knew we where running out of time! Very good and a bargain price. I came out of Claustrophilia (defeated, but so SO close) with a huge smile on my face and laughing!

How to feel like a genius and an idiot all at once!. This game is superb, you get a few hints along the way if you are completely stuck, we ran out of time just before completing the final task! It's like the Crystal Maze tv show with extra fun and complexity. A must try attraction for most visitors to the city

What a great novel Idea. Booked this on the reccomendation from here and wasn't disappointed. Don't want to give anything away but after an initial struggle and one hint, my girlfriend and I were very close to finishing the game and had one simple task left to do when the hour was up. The eeriness of having to turn up with no waiting room or introduction merely added to the experience. I will be looking to try more of these types of games out in the future.
Great to spend some time thinking. I enjoyed that 1 hour finding the way out the door. The best place on Budapest. I was there almost a year ago but I still love to remember that day

Badly advertised. We walked for ages trying to find this place as there is no address and not even the shop underneath had heard of it. Eventually found a little buzzer in a complex and were told they were booked up. Very unhelpful and wouldn't tell us where the other similar games were. Not very happy
great time. we had a great time! we had never done such a game before and we found it amazing! if you havent done it then you must! I wish we had something like that in my country too

Lot's of fun. Didn't know what to expect.We started the game without any clew what we had to do but that's just part of the experience. The less you know about it in advance the better the experience.A must do in Budapest. We were very happy that finished the game just in time...

Exciting, fun and unique. I went there with my girlfriend and we didnt know what to expect so we didnt have high hopes. In the beginning it was a bit scary, because no one comes to explain or welcome you to the place. Everything suddenly begins and then you have one hour to escape. We almost made it but we stumbled a bit in the beginning so we didnt complete the whole mission... A very fun and unique experience and we can recommend it to everyone who visits Budapest. REMEMBER TO BOOK A TIME IN ADVANCE! It's very popular...

A must-do!. This is the first time I have ever done anything like this and I can truly say the experience was amazing. I would recommend this to anyone.I came to Budapest to meet friends for the very first time and can say this was a good team building and fun exercise.I'm used to walking/sightseeing holidays and thought I would try something different and I'm certainly glad I did.

BRILLIANT fun in Budapest. I booked Claustrophilia as a surprise for my boyfriend during a trip to Budapest. We had a BRILLIANT timeand were very close to finishing as the time ran out. We LOVED it. It was so much fun. As other reviewers have said it's not impossible with a team of two but it is tricky. We had a lot of fun and HIGHLY recommend this experience. We are still talking about it several hours on. Give it a go.

Dang it. So close........ My husband and I almost made it but stumbled on a puzzle near the end. Very frustratingly close. I can see how groups can collect more clues and have a higher chance of escaping. PS Before you go in. If you do need the toilet, you need to go to a cafe or WC because when you step inside and shut the door, the clock starts ticking.......and you wont get let out. Hubbie had tea at breakfast and was close to bursting when we got off at the station. There are no toilet facilities at the venue, not even a face when you walk in, just you and the room......

Something a bit different!. Found this on Tripadvisor and being a fan of these games myself I was definitely up for doing this in real life. Booked this for myself and my boyfriend (who had no idea of the activity until 10 minutes beforehand) and it was the highlight of our trip. You get buzzed up to this room in the apartment with no one to give you any instructions beside a piece of paper. We did get stuck at one point and was given a clue as to something we've managed to oversee and managed to finish a wee bit pass the hour. Great for couples and small groups.

Highly Recommended. Myself and my boyfriend booked this in advance of our trip to Budapest due to the great tripadvisor reviews and it did not disappoint. It was very enjoyable especially as we are bost extremely competitive! We managed to complete it just in time as well. Just the thing for couples and groups who like a challenge.

Absolutely Brilliant. We didn't know a whole lot about this prior to our trip to Budapest, but it ended being the highlight of our stay - challenging and great fun, plus a real feeling of achievement if you manage to finish! Definitely a must if you are headed to Budapest.

Amazing. Can't recommend this enough! Best thing we did in Budapest. Rock up at apartment building and then you're straight into the action with almost no instruction. Great mental challenge and the buzz of it stays with you long after the hour is up.

Great fun!. My boyfriend and myself booked a slot at Claustrophilia in advance and we're so glad we did! From the moment we entered the door, it was intensely fun and challenging! Thoroughly enjoyed every moment & have been recommending it to all our friends and family.

Triumphant. We were in a group of three and totally enjoyed this experience.we found it challenging, with a good variety of different puzzles. We finished with 5 minutes to spare and only needed one clue so we were pretty pleased.

No wonder why it's number 1!. First thing I should say: BOOK IN ADVANCE! Otherwise you may not be able to play this game.Went there with my girlfriend, and we really loved it! The puzzles are really various, and all very fun! (Can't say a lot more without giving out spoilers...)The price is well good for this kind of activities, and the host was nice :)
So much fun!. Perfect balance between challenging and fun -- if you get stuck you can ask for a hint, and we were allowed to finish even though it toon us a bit over an hour. Great for couples!

Wow!. This was SO great. Difficult, maybe not impossible, for a team of 2. Some things are very tricky and require concentration (can't say much without giving anything away) but other things are simple. It's very exciting to say the least. Just know that the game begins as soon as you walk in the door, in the room where you read the brief directions - don't waste any time! Wish I could do it again, would absolutely recommend it to any kind of group (kids would also enjoy it/be helpful for certain things).

Fantastic - a MUST!!!. I've never done anything like this. But always wanted to after spending my childhood dreaming about crystal maze. This is a brilliant and fun game situated in the heart of budapest. Another review had said that no-one greets you upon arrival and they didn't like it. I found this to make it all the more strange and exciting and as if it was real! You are greeted afterwards by a lovely girl who is extremely friendly and polite. Very well thought out and intelligent game. I recommend it to anyone who wants to try something a bit different. We did it nearly a week ago and I'm still thinking about it! It also made me realise how nosy I can be!!

So much fun!. A different way to spend an evening in Budapest! the game is challenging and so entretaining makes, we couldnt finish the game but we were near! it was a great experience for me and my partner.

very much fun!. While on a business trip my collegues and i and lots of fun playing the game.
We are really into escape games and we liked Claustrophilia a lot. Lots of good ideas and well crafted riddles.

Not as good as hint hunt in London. Sadly although this game was invented here, and London is a spin off, this was disappointing.Not as enjoyable, lacked the personal touch from the hosts. In London you are greeted by staff, and it just seems better organised. Rooms more modern. Here there are no toilet or cloakroom facilities, nobody greets you.If you have tried London this is not as good.
Amazing. It was an amazing experience. The game was very interesting and the puzzles were great . We had a great time and we will visit it again.
Such fun. Something different and really cleaver. Only an hour and close to the underground if you don't have a car. Would love to do something like that again. Highly recommend.

Very hard for two people!!!. Brilliant game to spend an hour playing but the game starts as soon as you walk through the door and it is hard for two people. we got the hang of it and very nearly made it to the end after a few strong words where made to each other as we were getting stressed out as time was running out. lots of fun. would recommend.

Such good fun, best way to spend an hour. This place is great, go with an open mind and eat lots of Omega 3 that morning!Work as a team or compete, either way its energetic, not at all claustrophobic or intimidating. It's a race against time and is not easy, nor is it impossible!!Enjoy
Awesome!. Claustrophilia was so much fun and so unique! Made an account just so I could write this review. Definitely a must-do in Budapest.

Thoroughly enjoyable for two + . Was very brain engaging. You sometimes fall into a trap of over thinking the clues but it certainly builds collaborations with each other! We were only one clue away from the finish but ran out of time. Shame but it was thoroughly enjoyable!!! Staff mentioned that there will be another venue in February. May just come to Hungary just for Claustrophilia!!! XD
Interesting time-spending. Wery interesting game! And very important moment for tourists - its not require knowing any language!)

Wow.. What an experience... The game is beautifully crafter and my partner and I had a real challenge working our way through this... It takes a balance of cognitive power so it's good to do it in a small group / couple.We got so close to the end but just ran out of time... We left thrilled, and wanting to find another. One of the highlights of budapest and such good value for money.Do it!

Excellent visit. Had a fantastic hour here. The game was great fun and challenged us both. We didn't quite finish in the time allocated, but were probably 10 minutes away from it. If you have a spare couple of hours highly recommend you do this while in Budapest.

A lot of fun especially for teenagers. A great way to spend an hour with your kids, working together as a team. We left high-fiving each other and celebrated with coffee and pastries across the street at the gorgeous New York Café.
Perfect. Had the best time at claustrophilia. So smart and entertaining. Went with my girlfriend in October, and the game works really well with two people. Highly highly recommended

Brilliant! So much fun!. This is a fun and unique way to spend an evening in Budapest! The hour went by too fast. Unfortunately, we missed a clue and it took up a good chunk of our time but the experience and puzzles were very clever. Even our 8 year old had a blast participating.Highly recommended!

The best way to spend an hour in Budapest!. We turned up not quite knowing what to expect and even more so when no one is there to greet you - but thats the beauty of it. There's no messing about with money at the start so you're full emersed from the get go. The game ifself was so much fun and an hour flew by! There's some really tricky parts of the game so we had to use the 'help' intercom a couple of times. Though often he'd just have to give you a nudge in the right direction. The level of difficulty was perfect. Truly amazing thing to do and at great value.

Really cool!. A great way to spend some time with the wife figuring out a puzzle.The experience was complex and interesting. It was neat that we didn't meet the "game master" and instead were thrust into the challenge as soon as we arrived. It gave it an air of mystery.Worth a visit and very affordable.

Great game!. What a fun game to play in this age of electronics! Really makes you use your mind in long forgotten, other ways! My husband and I were visiting town, and saw the great reviews on Trip Advisor, so we made a booking and were not disappointed!! Now we are hooked and after this adventure promptly booked two games at other companies! Do not miss!

Great Game!. Played this game and others in Budapest. This one was a very challenging game and one of the better ones we played. Highly recommend this game for gamers; may be a little difficult for novices. Probably the best location of all the games in Budapest as well. The creator of the game has some great surprises for those who play. Name is the only negative as it implies the game may be Claustrophobic, but it is not. Great game - you should try it!

Clever gameplay. Chanced upon this in the TA reviews and decided to give it a go. It was my first time doing an escape room and though we did not complete it (came close!) we enjoyed it very much. The puzzles were very clever and it was a great experience. Worth checking out.

NOT TO BE MISSED!!!!. I booked this for our last day as we weren't flying out until late. What a way to end a holiday, simply memorable!!! I would have gone and done it again immediately but they had another booking. It is great fun, imaginitive and exciting. We needed a couple of prompts and didn't make it out in the hour, but in no way felt like we had failed. I love the 'cloak and dagger' 'mission imposssible' feel which starts with your email with your instructions, is carried on with the 'dodgy' apartment building and the fact that you have no instrucions/directions once you are inside.My husband and I have been raving to everyone who will listen. I would even fly back to Budapest to do it again. I think it could be totally addictive.Love what they guys have done and wait for it........they are opening another in January 2014 as they have found another apartment.Just do it!!!!PS sorry no photos as that would spoilt it!!!

aaaarg - just another five minutes!!. A great way to spend an hour and an excellent experience. We were a group of four and the time passed in a flash. There was a little help given to us but only when we were really struggling or had laboured overly on a clue. The game and clues are well thought out and the game play area is fairly roomy; we did not feel uncomfortable in the surroundings. We felt it was great value for money and would definitely look for a similar type experience in the future.

Soooo close!. This was definitely something unique and very cool! It is only an hour so it won't interfere with all your other "touristy" stuff. The building itself looks a bit sketchy at first, but that is all part of the cool factor. This was definitely one of the most memorable things we have done on our 3 month Euro journey!

Great fun!!!!!!!!!!. Me and my girlfriend visited in December 2013. We had never been in any similar type of game and we went there without knowing really what to expect. I won't share the details of it for not spoiling the experience, but our time flew and we had a lot of fun! We wish we could do it again but unfortunately we know all the tricks now. Very nice "mysterious" atmosphere. If you have never done any similar game do not hesitate and give it a try, it's well invested time and money.

Brilliant activity to do if you are looking for something random!. A bit of a strange concept if like us we have not experienced these types of games before but thoroughly enjoyable! Once you get the jist of how you are supposed to solve the game it gets easier, if not an intercom buzzer is there for help and a person is there on it to help you get started anyway.Unfortunately we did not finish the game :( (my partner was too stubborn to ask for hints as he wanted to 'solve it himself') remember you only have an hour and this will pass quickly if you get stuck!Would definitely do something like this again, it was worth the money. You do not feel 'trapped' at any point, if you do buzz the buzzer and you will be let out. Do not be afraid its fun!!

Nothing out of this world. Being a big fan of exit games since I live in Budapest, I tried Claustrophilia based on the good comments from Tripadvisor and personally think it was good but nothing really special compare to other places I´ve been. They have some clever puzzles but in general I had the feeling of a normal flat full of furniture with padlocks.

Amazing!!! Must try!!!. I cannot give this place justice within this review. It needs to be experienced first hand. On arriving at this place I became nervous thinking will we leave alive. However this was all forgotten as we stepped into a room and the game began. We needed one hint to move forward but after that we were on fire (not literally) you get so involved in the game you have no concept of time (there is a clock to remind you if needed). We were on the last puzzle when we ran out of time. But as less than 30 ppl have completed it we did not feel too disappointed. Overall a brilliant experience that I would recommend to anyone and everyone!!

Utterly awesome . Wasn't really sure what to expect of this. To get to it you have to go up some pretty shady looking stairs then enter a door which the name is hand written on. Wasn't sure whether we were going to a tourist attraction or going to be forced into the underground trade of Budapest. It was however, brilliant. There is no reception; from the moment you enter the door you're in the game. Everything counts. Every detail is something you should remember. We didn't finish but we were close!!

Simply amazing!!!. Since I have always been fond of escape games I thought that I should try a real one. It is really amazing, not easy i have to say, but we enjoyed a lot during the one hour duration of the game! It is an amazing idea and I would definitely recommend it.

Worth it!!!. I played this game with my girlfriend. First we entered the room, we didnt know what to do, where to start. There are plenty of minigame which waiting to be solved. But when we get used to the atmosphere it was wonderful experience for us. Every single details had a meaning! !

So much fun!. Note: The address on my TA app is incorrect! This is on Ersebet street right across from the New York Hotel.Family of 4 with an 11 and 12 year old. Great family fun. Can see visiting with adult friends as well. I can't explain how they do it but they had each one of us involved hunting for things, examining, puzzling, and having fun. Perfect amount of help. The overseer knew how far we needed to get to finish and when we bogged down or were way off he would pipe in via intercom with a tiny hint. Even though we got two hints we still felt a huge success at the end. They have nothing like this in the States so even though this was not an authentic "Hungarian" experience we are still so happy we had the opportunity. Not scary at all. It feels more puzzly then as if you are trapped.

Very well designed; unique and fun experience. My husband and I had never done a room escape game before and weren't sure what to expect. The game starts as soon as you enter to room, and we were surprised at how fun and challenging it was. Very clever and innovative puzzles, the whole experience is very well and carefully designed. We're a couple in our-mid 30s, but I think it would be a great activity for people of all ages and for families. There is an intercom through which you can ask for help if you get stuck (we had to use it a couple of times). We took advantage of their couple discount of 6000 HUF which is a great deal. One of the best things we did in Budapest - highly recommend.

Great fun! Must try while in Budapest. Me and my girlfriend are huge fans of the room so when we saw this game we had to try it.Its very well done from the time you get in the appartement the clock starts ticking and immediatly you have to start solving puzzles to get to the next room. Its all brilliantly put together with a wonderfull feeling for detail. The time flew by while we were playing this and didnt want it to end. The host is a great guy that tries to help you out if you get really stuck.Everyone in Budapest, i recommend to try this, its cheap and great fun right in the center of Budapest.

So much fun! Time Flys. This was our first live game experience and it was even more fun than we anticipated. It starts from the moment you walk in. Great puzzles and challenges. Really well designed and challenging. Well worth the money. Favourite thing in Budapest so far!

A must do. This a fantastic hour in Budapest. You need to book in advanced but your hotel can do that for you. Great to do as a group or just a couple. Nothing scary about it. One if the best hours spent in Budapest. A must do. Came away full of energy.

Best game. Easy to find, good for couples. We had amazing time there. Puzzels are great and you really have to think a lot if you want to solve them. You get a cople discount when you make an online reservation. Guy who designet the game was fun and prrepared to help in any situation. I will always recommend this.

If you like real life adventure games - do this!. if you like adventure games, and want to have a go at a real life one, this is definitely a good choice. If you are from the UK, think 'Crystal Maze' and if you like that - you will like this.Great introduction to the game setting, and innovative puzzles and games that make the time in the apartment rooms just fly by! Any hints given on the intercom are given in a clever way i.e. they don't tell you what to do directly but give you a nudge you in the right direction. Expect to feel your head whizzing to process information, some puzzles which will make you feel like you want to go 'argh' but are sooooooo satisfying when you figure them out, and for time to vanish in the blink of an eye!We did this experience as a couple (12Nov2013) as first timers to this sort of thing, and found it very interesting how we were good at picking up on completely different things. We completed in just over an hour, and it took me at least another hour to calm down from the exciting tension and buzz of the experience.Thank you for your great looking after of us to make this experience memorable and worthwhile.

A unique and fun experience in Budapest!. A fun way to spend an hour in Budapest. The game starts the moment you are buzzed into the building. The facilitator spoke great English and helped the few times we needed it. This is a great activity for a group of friends or a family with older children.

FUN FUN FUN. This game was great! My husband and I did it as a couple. I was a little apprehensive at first, but once you get locking in it is time to sink our swim. The sign up processes a little cryptic, but that just helps to set the mood. The challenge is doable, but we were fortunate to be allowed a little extra time, which we needed, and got out. If you are looking for something different to do this is it. It would be great fun for older kids too. We loved this game.

Expertly Designed. If you've ever played environmental puzzle games like The Room, 999, or Zero Escape, then you'll have a good understanding of how Claustrophilia works. Much like those games, players are placed within a locked room and must search that room for clues to help them find their way out. Unlike those games, Claustrophilia takes place off-screen, in an actual apartment in downtown Pest. But taking place off-screen only allows for a broader array of puzzle possibilities -- even if you consider yourself a master of the video games mentioned above, you're bound to mind some of Claustophilia's puzzles quite challenging.Although this is the only game of this type I've played, and I've heard there's about 40 or so in Budapest, I can't imagine a game of this type being much better. It's crafty and entrancing well beyond what I anticipated, and the love poured into its design reveals itself from moment to moment. None of the puzzles are either too simple or too tough, but if you get stuck you can always ask for a hint using a callbox. All elements of its design come together to form a top-notch room escape game.This has been my favorite activity in Budapest so far, and probably the most unique. If you enjoy solving puzzles, you'll probably find this a very special experience. And for those who might be concerned this might be a frightening experience, you can rest assured there's nothing but a ton of cleverness awaiting you -- nothing is going to jump out at you, and the room is average size so even those with light claustrophobia should be fine.

Give It A Go. This was the second escape game we tried in Budapest and was by far the best. The game starts as soon as you enter the apartment and the door is locked behind you. No one is there to greet you which adds to the overall experience. You are straight into solving clues and various types of puzzles. We where a team of four and successfully completed the challenge and managed to escape from the apartment in time. Highly recommended as an activity when in Budapest.

Great family fun. We gave this a try after reading the reviews with our children age 9 and 13. It was great fun, nothing scary or any sense of being trapped, just an hour which flew by solving the various problems to progress through the game. The children loved it and we all really enjoyed it...there's lots to think about it and a sense of satisfaction when a clue is solved. It was the first time we have done this kind of game and we'll look out for similar games when we travel from now. Also it was good value, 5000HUF for the family, and easy and efficient booking online.

Challenging and rewarding. One of the best activities I did in Budapest. Apparently these games are really popular all over Hungary, but this one was really challenging and we had to think outside the box. The atmosphere is also set up really well - the game is in a residential flat and there is no staff to greet you at the door. Instead, you're plunged straight into the game, because the front door clicks and locks behind you. We were the 4th team to get out without any help (if you get stuck there's an intercom), but it's actually uncommon to make it all the way through, so good luck!

Really good fun. We read reviews about this place and hadnt tried anything like it before so thought we would give it a go. As there was just two of us it was 6000 huf which was really good value.You enter a room and have to solve clues and puzzles to escape, its weird not meeting anyway to start but I liked it as it added to the game, very cool. We took a few minutes to get into but soon got the ball rolling. A voice will help you if you are really getting stuck. It was such good fun working together to solve the puzzles. You should definitely try this, brilliant!

Too much fun!. We are a family of 6 from 3 generations. All were tired when we arrived, but then we got started and the time flew by too fast! This is a terrific idea, and we all would love to do it again someday!

Great family activity-team building. Our family of 6 ages 11 to 72 (includes us grandparents) did this today. We are from U.S. And Germany 3 adults are attorneys 1 a C.P.A. So solving problems rocks our world! We had a blast and discovered we were most successful when we worked together! Highly recommend!

Room escape brought to life!. What can I say, I don't know what I was expecting, a real life version of those pixilated games? Where you spend hours trying to find the next clue..?This is exactly like that except it is a fast pasted, timed game, that makes it even more thrilling. Given no clues except that you have to escape the apartment in one hour. It involves problem solving, clue hunting, precision, concentration and patience.We had such an amazing experience, working together to achieve a goal, each person bring different strengths. Would recommend this to anyone coming through Budapest, looking to do something a little bit different. It's in a very central location and is very reasonably priced.Will be looking for more as I visit different cities!

Great family fun. We wanted to try something different on our visit to Budapest and boy was this different. Our kids get tired of trudging around looking at buildings and churches, so we decided to give this a try. The kids were a little apprehensive at first, but by about 10 minutes in they were racing around trying to find the clues. By far one of the most memorable adventures we have had in Europe so far.

So Good. Really well thought out and created in such a way that it doesn't just feel like an attraction. My girlfriend and I felt as if the whole experience had been created solely for us, as if we had stumbled upon it and had simply found ourselves solving puzzles & collecting clues. Obviously it was created with a lot of care and a love of point and click, logic & puzzle solving games. Genuinely unique - DO IT!

Loved it!. Easily the most unique attraction we've experienced during our time in Budapest. My boyfriend and I went together, both being fans of point-and-click escape games. It was great fun solving the little puzzles together, and very rewarding having completed the game with time to spare. Great concept and wonderful execution. We would recommend this to anybody, but bring your brain!

scaping a 'Maze': Culture and Entertainment in The Hague. The concept may sound a bit strange at first, but this is perhaps just natural when introducing an idea into a new environment. However, the game caught on fast and became widely popular in London, Barcelona and Budapest, where it has been set up in the past two years. Their Facebook pages are bustling with images of the happy teams who escaped, and the twitter feeds are full with positive remarks as well. Indeed, the live room escape game offers a fresh experience for the social agenda. It presents a great substitute for, or addition to a group's usual evening routine.http://newlux2.sytes.net/arts-and-entertainment2/53-indeed-the-live-room-escape-game-offers-a-fresh-experience-for-the-social-agenda.html

Great fun!. It was our first ever experience with a 'real life escape game', but what a fun we had! You totally go up in the game and forget about time and place. Apparently these games are popping up all over Budapest and the rest of Hungary. They'll probably become a success in other cities too. Great for an hour of fun with friends, family or colleagues. Some interesting discounts for families, duos, etc. Overall: try this, it's great!

Awesome!. This game was a great experience, if not the best, on our trip. We found the 'escape games' on TripAdvisor, a new expierence for the two of us. We booked this one because this was the only affordable one for a duo (6.000HUF). The place looked a bit weird but once we were inside and the game started we had great fun. Me and my girlfriend were at the last puzzle when the time ran out but we still had a great time. Some guy popped up out of nowhere and had a friendly chat with us. Definitely an attraction worth doing if you're somewhat adventurous-minded!

Authentic!!!. This is the real deal. With these guys being one of the newest in Budapest, they are doing a fantastic job! I only wish they had another adventure for us to do.We've done a few others in town with other companies, which are all great, but this one stood out.Straight forward, crack the codes, find the clues, unlock yourself and get OUT!

Great value and fun. Amazingly well thought-out. For 75 minutes you and your friends work together to solve puzzles and challenges to leave an apartment that you are locked in. Cheaper and better than a movie-- it's you as the star. Don't miss this when in Budapest.

Great game :). I heard that this was one of the best "escape the room" games in Budapest, so when my brother came to visit me we went there for a trial and were not disapointed at all. The place it´s very central, the game is full of exciting and unique details and the onwer is nice. We hardly escaped on time, so I definetly recommend it!

One of the highlights of our visit to Budapest!. My girlfriend and I came across this place by accident, but it turned out to be one of the best things in Budapest! The puzzles were very innovative and featured a lot of physical objects and contraptions. Highly recommended!

Daunting at first but really got into it!. Me and my girlfriend had never tried this kind of thing before and chose Claustrophilia because of the reduced rate for pairs. Initially we were daunted as nobody meets you there, instead you are immersed straight into the experience. We started off slowly and got a hint on the first task but got steadily better. In the end we really enjoyed the imaginative challenges and will have tales to tell for a long time to come. We are also likely to seek out similar experiences elsewhere!

Funny and challenging.
