This was our first escape game with my girlfriend and it was a very good surprise!The game is lots of fun and challenging, you are given an hour to find your way out (although we were given some more time, but we didn't finish).Basically you have to find keys by matching stuff or finding clues in the different rooms.The game is very clever and it's not just about opening all drawers you can to find a key, you will be given challenges and objects to associate together.Good to note that you can book through the internet even for the same day, and there is a discount if you are just 2 (price for 2 is 6000HUF at time of review).Highly recommended!Good for couples, families, friends...
Really cool. I´ve never done a escape game before - so I can´t compare it to others.But I really liked it. Don´t want to tell too much - just find it out on your own!

Amazing experience. My friends recommended this game to me, and it was something that I will never forget! You will need to reserve a time on their website, and you will get an email with instructions on how to get in.We didn't know what to expect at all, and we were really excited about the game. In the end it was a really cool experience. You have to try it out, and you'll see.

Rating. Hi, As a local guy, I have been to several room-escape room/cellars with our escape team in Budapest, so we ended up in Claustrophilia as well. Fist of all most of the room-escape points are located in a cellar in Budapest, but Claustrophilia is located in a flat. This makes it very accessible with any kind of transportation and also is easy to find (from the street you can already see the big advertisement)After a lot of exit games I tried, I was expecting in Claustrophilia the same: locks after locks and locks again and at last I have to find the out the 3-digits to open them......but this went quite different at Claustrophilia. They have lots of other creative ideas how to open the doors, find the keys, etc..I really liked those ideas which were very unique so far. On top of that when I was thinking the game was over....it was not :) The stuff is also very enthusiastic and were good hosts.Amongst the bunch of room-escape places in Budapest, my opinion is that Claustrophilia is definitely one of the bests, worth to try.

Clever & new. Didn't know what to expect, and was the first great experience in any kind of city game/puzzle/etc things. Me and 3 friends enjoyed and totally recommend, the guys who designed this are genious!
ORIGINAL. After visiting a few games like this, i have to say that this one is the best so far, different enigma to solve, original ways to open doors etc. higly reccomend!

Live room escape game in the city center of Budapest. In Budapest the so called live escape games are quiet popular. They are like the flash room escape games where you need to find the way out from a room using objects and solving logical puzzles. The live room escape games are the same but the situation is that you and your team are closed in a room and you need to escape in an hour. There are more than 20 games in Budapest and the Claustrophilia is one of the newest game in its genere and this is reallty unique game amongst them. Actually it combines logical puzzles and ability games and also you need to find and use objects in order to escape. So it is a complex game and the biggest thing in that that you don't need to speak hungarian to play this game, so it is good also for foreigner people. Me and my friends enjoyed the one hour of gameplay very much and I hope that they will open another room soon. Plus they have more discounts for students, for families and for couples as the maximum people who can play at a time are 5.

Cool escaping room. It's hard to describe this program without spoilers, so... just one word: GO! :)It was my 3rd escape room, and my second favourite, not te hardest one, but a very smart game with tricky solutions, so overall I'd suggest it.
Inception-esque brilliance. Mind bending escape room that almost beat us. We had a brilliant time and would recommend this to anyone who enjoys puzzles and problem solving.
Great fun. Not too easy, not too difficult, perfect for a small group, very entertaining, Nice people working there
Much fun :). The room was really great and the staff was absolutely nice :) She was also able to speak german and english! Give it a try, it´s worth it.

The memory thief. Having done a number of previous escape rooms, I found this one on trip advisor for my recent trip to Budapest. Have to say we were not disappointed! Don't want to give too much away, but there some well thought out clues and sone good surprises. Little difficult for 2 of us but we were given a few extra minutes at the end to escape!
Excellent Escape Game!. Loved this escape room, the clues were unusual and it was great fun! We went to another in Budapest and although good, this one really stuck out for us!
Cool experience. The mindcrime was my first (and not last) experience of escape rooms and it was very funny! We were 5 people but you can solve it with less too!

Mind boggling. Has fun getting each clue and moving to the next. You get the help when you get stuck but when u go back to see how you do each task its common sense but really makes you think out the box .. worth doing if u got a hour to spare

Get your spinning top totem ready!. We all enjoyed the lovely setup, the operator was very kind (all important questions were answered before the game and if you get stuck you could have hints over the screen with the timer on). The hardness level of the game was medium. It was an entertaining hour for us - thank you!
very good experience. we really enjoyed our game in the "memory thief" room. the decor is very beautiful and the puzzles are challenging :)

Suitable for families with small children. We went as a family with children 6 and 8 and we all enjoyed our time. The puzzles were understandable and decodable for my kids (actually there were some they found out, not us). Certainly a great adventure!

First escape room experience. We stayed in Budapest during January and during one rainy evening decided to check out an escape room. I found MindCrime online and after checking out the other reviews and the price it seemed like a good choice.I played with my partner so there was just the two of us (more people wouldn't be an issue but it's not a huge space and there may be too much going on) We arrived a few minutes before our slot (I emailed a few hours before on the day and luckily they got back to me very quickly and booked us in) once there the host/owner explained to us what we were going to do and asked us a few questions. The owners spoke great English and explained to us that we had an option of what to do if we needed help (we opted to wave at the camera) It cost about £11 for the two of us for the hour and it was well worth it. I'm not afraid to admit we needed help on a few things but it was still fun. On this particular game there were three small sections so there was lots to keep you going, it was really good fun. We managed to escape with only 22 seconds to go! I don't want to give too much away about the game, but I definitely recommend it if you have an hour spare in Budapest.

Super Escape Game. very interesting and tricky escape game, we really loved it. Time to time they make changes, so you can visit again and again. Never the same or boring. Staff is kind and professional. Everybody should visit it!!!!!!!!!!!!

First Escape Room Experience!. Didn't quite know what to expect but this was a super fun outing. Its also really cheap if theres a group of you, its something i would put down as a must do. Girl on reception was lovely also. Really interesting idea of being in the mind of someone. Great stuff.

Unexpected room, nice. We have played a few escaperooms now, and this one was very nice. Good games, difficult start, but with a little help we came out before time. Visit the game-pub afterwards, its just around the corner.

A little bit to easy, but good. I've done quite a bit of escape rooms already, it might be this or the room was a little bit to easy for us, we escaped in about 28 minutes and we did not rush the room or needed any help. It's a good one to start with if you want to be introduced to the escape games. English explanation was fine.

Remek szórakozás és szuper csapatépítő! / So much fun!!. 2015 októberben voltunk itt a barátnőimmel és remekül szórakoztunk! Nagyon izgalmas volt a játék és sikerélménnyel távoztunk!I heve been there with my friends and we had so much fun! The game was awesome!
Very exciting!. During our trip in Budapest we did three different roomescapes. This was the first one we did and we all loved it! Big variety in exciting tasks and lots of special effects.
A Definite Recommendation. A must visit for every escaper. No puzzle is illogical and the game posed a challenge. The friendly staff really helped the atmosphere.

Great first experience. We didn't manage this in an hour - but this was our first experience and we were only two. We were allowed some extra time and finally did it in 1hr 10mins. Missed a couple of clues but it was great fun - well recommended for family

Fantastic fun. Just brilliant! Not easy but that is what we wanted having never done a live escape before. Very professionally run. One for adults and older children because it is difficult and the audio is disorientating and would be scary to younger kids as would the confined spaces.

Tricky room with a great atmosphere!. One of the best rooms that we played during our central european roadtrip (we played around 13 escape games so there is something to compare with). Non-trivial theme, atmospheric sounds, nice design, the whole game felt like it was thought through. The game master helped us after the game with some navigation and was nice in general. The only suggestion for a game master: DO NOT GO INSIDE THE ROOM WITH PLAYERS BEFORE THE GAME! It can totally destroy the feeling of mystery.
Unexpected :). Best escape room we've been so far (out of 4 in Poland and Lithuania) it was certainly more than expected and truly worth trying :-)

Absolutely Brilliant!. We visited during one afternoon of our visit. The website was a big part of our decision to book this place - clear, detailed and with sensible information about the experience. We found the place, which is easy to find if you read the directions they give you (we didn't initially, our mistake!). We were met by a lovely host who explained the game and then we got started.I won't give away too much but the experience was both challenging and fun. One of us had done an escape room before, but the other hadn't, and we both loved it. The puzzles set were diverse so that, between us, we were able to solve them. We did need two hints but finished it with a few minutes to spare. It was definitely the most fun we had during Budapest and we would absolutely recommend it.

Flabbergasted!. Unfortunately, I am writing this review about 9 months after having visited it, and it looks like it has already become popular. It was quite new when I visited, and maybe this review would have been of more help then. I suppose it is better late than never.Disclaimer: This is the only escape game I've played, so I have nothing to compare against.I expected some sort of a challenge when I went to play this, but I had no idea I would be so challenged! There were 5 of us playing, and we still ran out of time before solving it. There were some really good puzzles and solving them provided a lot of satisfaction. The feeling as the last piece of the puzzle fell into place was amazing. All of us walked out having spent a really good time and were talking about the game for the entire next hour.

Very clever and exciting. This was our first experience of something like this. Very clever puzzles. It looks, sounds and plays very well indeed. An hour has never passed so quickly. We did have to request a few clues though ;-)

East euro trip. It was our first time to try something like this we were a group of 6 cousins with ages ranging from 16-26 . It was an amazing experience with lots of fun and excitement and some brain work ! And we would definitely do it again when they open the new theme room !... Also the staff are very decent and friendly and the ticket price is very reasonable..

Modern. Modern clean room, nice ambiance. Challenging and interesting.You have to find out the password from a rich man's account number from his childhood's memories, going through his things.You can ask for tips waving at the cameras and they will show a text on the TV screen above the door. But better to do that only if you are really stuck, as the tips are much more like answers so you can go to the next step.And as someone already said here: it is the best game price for couples (6.000Ft)
Great fun. Me and my friends really enjoyed this escape room. We want to play more escape games for sure, this one was challenging.

Cheapest escape game for couples (6000ft). This was our first time doing an escape room and it was really fun. It was quite tricky, we needed a few hints along the way. Not sure it is the best for beginners but we managed to solve it in 61min 40sec, just a little later than the 60min timeframe.Lovely air conditioned space.Cheapest one I could find for just two people at 6000f.

Modern look of the room. Lots of fun!. We really liked that room. The atmosphere was great, very minimalist and modern. We also liked the story. Puzzles were more or less all new to us, even though we've been to other escape rooms before! However, it was only 2 of us, but because of some experience from previous rooms it was quite easy for us. We totally recommend this one to beginners and/or couples!

Lots of fun, tough challenge! . This is my second live escape game. This was harder than the other one I did, but just as fun. We didn't make the time cutoff, but since no one was after us, the host allowed us to finish (71 minutes).Anyway, we had a good time. The place is clean, staff is friendly, price is very reasonable. We were a team of four adults.Recommended!

Professional and surprising. The best room escape we played so far. The game was pretty difficult and very surprising. The atmoshpere was great and we really felt like we were a part of the story. The entrance hall had a great design! Good job!
Remarkable. One of the best Escape Game I have played. It was very entertaining, we played as a couple and it was a lot of fun!

Enjoyed, would recommend. Had a great time here today with my girlfriend, our first visit to one of these escape-type games. The receptionist was really friendly and professional, and spoke perfect English. The game itself was really enjoyable, I won't say more in case it gives anything away. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone who enjoys puzzles.

A challenging escape room. It was our first time playing this kind of games. It was exciting, and difficult for beginners in our opinion. The game is well designed and needs a high ability of analysing. The host gave us hints only when we asked or were stuck. A really worth trying activity in Budapest.
Good game. I was here with my girlfriend and we had a great time. Its not so hard, the game can be solved if you are only in pair.

Fantastic adrenaline rush. It was the first time that we visited an escape room, we knew about it yestarday, we booked it and we loved it!We don't want to say to much but the puzzles are challenging and clear...after you get them.

A great new and hi-tech escape room. This was the third escape room we visited during our trip - and I think it really stood out and probably was the best. It is completely new( some of it still looks a bit like a building site, but nothing you hardly notice it). The escape room itself is awesome- very high tech and requires a lot of logic- probably the most logical game we went to. We managed to solve it by ourselves in ~55 min but it was not easy at all! If you have to go to one escape room and you like to solve riddles instead of just looting a room - this is the escape room for you. In my opinion, it's the best we went to.

NBS Lviv brainstorm. It was the first time we visit such type of games. It is a really good, interesting and exciting. Next I will definitely try it again but with other room :) I recommend to everyone who likes to stretch their brains.

A real brain teaser . This was the second escape room that my girlfriend and I had done and it was much harder than the first. You definitely have to use some lateral thinking and logic. Very fun and rewarding!!
good attraction. we were here. very nice, but little bit difficult. not fir chess masters :). original idea and gives mind job and brain activity. we had a good hour that passed in some minutes. ..

Five-star game. It was the first game of this type in our lives, so we were very excited with my partner, when the door closed behind... We felt mistery, tension, curiosity, and of course the desire to be able to push the transfer button within the shortest time possible. Well, we had to wait for that almost 60 minutes... :) We needed logic, memory, creativity, luck and team-work to get to the solution. Sometimes we would have happily "suffered" some more before the sound of the horn indicated: the host judges we need some help. :-) The game was a fantastic experience on the whole.

A must try escape game in Budapest. An excellent and complex game with lots of surprises, really interesting and creative puzzles, and so much fun!!! Not easy at all, we needed some help, but we did it in time. I think, everyone will find challenges during the game, and the host gives no more hints than the team requires at the moment to go on. Maybe there are a bit too many things to mislead you, but looking back it makes the game even more enjoyable. :) A stylish place in the heart of Budapest, with a very friendly and welcoming host, and I was impressed by the technical solutions. I can only recommend it to everyone who wants to spend an exciting and mind-refreshing hour while visiting Budapest. Can't wait to try their upcoming new game!

Really exciting mindcrime!. On our trip to budapest we planned an exitroom game and choose the mindcrime game. First the welcome van very friendly. It was our first time so we got a perfect explanation and then the game started. Is was so exciting! Beautifully developed game with lots of surprises and layers. We were just with 2 players, but it was very do-able. The game got us really paranoid but we finished just in time. We definitely recommend the mind-crime game if you visit Budapest!
Mind blowing Mindcrime. An absolutely amazing and refreshing spot in Budapest if you want to try out yourself in a real life room escape game. Well designed mind blowing puzzles.

Great escape game!. We had a lot of fun! The set, the storyline and the execution were great. The game worked well even for two players and we didn't even need any clues. I recommend this game to anyone who wants to have a good time with a friend or few and maybe a little challenge for the brain. I believe the game would work well for beginners too! We have played about a dozen room escape games ourselves before.
Nice first experience ^^. A wonderful first experience! Petra the master of game is SO kind and great, a lovely and funny time, I highly recommend!

Lots of fun!. A mix of tricky & easier problems to solve. We got stuck the longest trying to get the first one! Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Location is tricky to find so getting a taxi is probably best. Head a long the road which it is situated on & you'll find the Pirate door on the left!
Great activity!!. Petra was very nice and welcoming. The attraction is so cool!! We had a gelreat time and will definetlly recommend
Best escape room ever. You just have to go there!!! Amazing. We loved it. Petra the guide was graet. After doing 4 diffrent rooms this was our best one.

Fun and unique experience :). One of the many escape rooms we visited with very unique tasks and amazing ambience.Our host was very cool, friendly and professional at the same time. The interior is designed just like it should be in a „pirate's nest“ and there are some effects that made us feel even more into the story. Also, there were some puzzles we have never seen before and we were quite thrilled when we solved them :)Recommended to all, you will have to struggle a bit so solve all the tasks but the fun you will have is “pirate-size-tremendous”.

fun factor: 100%. Actually the Pirate Cave is amongst our personal top 5 escape games worldwide and I am sure it will keep it's position in our ranking list for long.The awesome story and decoration, excellent riddles and our happy and motivated Game Master let us (just two players) have a great time in the suburbs of Budapest.You guys should think about making a 2nd escape game - what about something really freaky like "The Alien" or similar? ;-)Thanks and best regards from Barcelona!
Great. Great game. We, two unexperienced players, managed to escape without any hints. Very surprising and adventurous escape room

Exciting and fun experience. The room is very interesting, with exciting and unexpected details, very innovative and creative. One of the best rooms I have visited. The stuff is really professional and kind too.

Extremely fun escape room!. This place was recommended to us by the owner of another escape room (we did a few while in Budapest) and it did not disappoint! One of the most immersive escape rooms we've done. It's not just a room full of puzzles - you really feel like you're on a pirate adventure. The tasks and puzzles were of a good difficulty, really varied and some of them were so ingenious and delightful we were talking about them all the way home! Highly recommended, and definitely worth taking the metro a few stops to get there!
So much fun!. Thank you Richard!! Set up the atmosphere perfectly and it was the best escape experience ever! So interactive and a lot of fun :)

Excellent. This was amazing and fun. My husband and i had a fantastic time. One of the best escape games ww have tried. We highly recommend
A++++++

Excellent!. We visited this escape room because of a recommendation on the internet. We had done one escape room a few days before, and we liked it so much that we wanted to do one more while we were still in Budapest. As fans of Pirates of the Caribbean, this escape room exceeded all our expectations. From the beginning until the end the tasks, clues and puzzles remained surprising and clever. It is impossible to get stuck because of an interesting magical help in the room, and because of the excellent guidance of the employee that served us. The only con is the location. From the heart of the city you have to travel for quite a while. However, in our opinion the travel was very much worth it, because of the excellent room, the lovely decorating and the enthusiastic service!
Super. Been here today and it was amazing! There have been a lot of affort in this room and its amazing! A lot of brainbusters and a lot lot lot of fun. Really worth a visit!

THE MOST FUN YOU CAN HAVE IN A CAVE.. Easily the most fun escape room we have done. Being our 12th exit room and it was an absolute joy. Steve was the best host and made it accessible throughout. Cannot recommend enough for anyone and any age! Amazing.

A fun and atmospheric escape room!. Although it is a little bit out of the city, it is certainly worth the trip. The room has an excellent story line and is very well set up in terms of props. There is a great mix of analytical and physical puzzles which engages the whole team. Hughly reccomend.

MY first escape room, amazing fun!. My girlfriend and I tackled this room (I was told that it's much easier with 3-4 people) and we just nicked it about 3 minutes over time, gutted!Really well thought out, really tricky and plenty of red herrings to trip you up. Beware getting wet though, that's one thing I hadn't counted on!It's pretty easy to locate, about 10-15min walk from Örs vezér tere station on the M2 metro line (depending on your walking speed). It's on an industrial estate of sorts, so maybe looks a bit off-putting if you're not used to such places but it felt safe and legit to me.The guy who met us and talked us through it (really sorry I forgot your name!) was really friendly and helpful too. Highly reccomend. Including travelling here and back from the inner city it's about a 2.5-3 hour time killer.

Great room. We booked this room in advance, just to make sure we won't miss it. It is located about 15 min away from the center by cab. You can take public transportation as well. There is a very handy map on their website. We were four experienced escapers and managed to get out in time. Usually I like to go as a pair, but I am glad we went four because there was plenty for everyone to do at any given time. Our guide was very nice, very welcoming, and got us into the “pirate“ mood successfully! The room is a little pricy compared to others 18,000, but we enjoyed the experience and didn't mind the price. Also, there isn't really a lobby to wait in, and we were told that there is no water to drink, so prepare yourself accordingly.

Best escape room yet. I really liked this place because the theme was really well done and consistent throughout the entire experience. The puzzles were challenging enough and really unique compared to the other escape rooms I have been to. I really wish I could do the escape room again with different puzzles or find another room of this quality.

Great adventure !. We made several escape games before this one and we spent a great time in Richard's Pirate's cave ! All puzzles are original and varied, we had a lot of fun solving them. The setting is also original and immersive too. We highly recommend this escape game!

Best escape game for us so far. Out of the 15 Escapes we have done So far, this was definitely the best one ! The immersion is total, the game master very nice and awesome surprises were waiting for us ! Thanks Richard !

very nice escape room. We enjoyed this escape room. it was a little harder than the other one we made but the story is really interessing and the riddles are really cool.
i suggest being 3 or more to be able to finish it in time.

A must visit!. Having attempted several escape rooms already this was definitley among the best, the theme, the challenges and the set up was all fantastic! All of the puzzles were relevant to the theme and were all solvable! Richard was a fantastic host and could not have done more! It is a little bit out of Budapest but the short metro ride is definitely worth it!
Families wonderful Fun time in the big city. Various puzzles and challenges entertaining. Hard to find the place. You should call to get accurate directions

Brilliant!. I was desperate to do the Pirate Cave Escape Room after reading all the great reviews, but being claustrophobic I was very nervous and was considering not doing it. When I got there I explained all this and was told that if I needed to come out then they would let me out and the rest of the group could carry on. Which was a relief. Once in the escape room I didn't feel claustrophobic at all, the puzzles were great and the overall experience was brilliant.

Birthday escape . Really loved it. Great puzzles, nice atmosphere! This was my first puzzle room, wasn't sure what to expect, but it was an enjoyable challenge to work together. Probably more ideal for 4-5 person groups if you are fussed about completing it. As a couple we had a great time and were happy with getting near the end in the allotted hour. Highly recommended!
Excellent time!. We had an amazing time at Pirate Cave. Well thought out, great theme, cool help, fun puzzles-- one of our favorite Escape rooms ever! Escaped with only 33 seconds to spare.

Best escape room so far!. I've been to over ten, this one is the best. The effects are amazing, the story is elaborate and extraordinary. And the game is very interactive, no boring puzzles with numbers and keys, everything is much different than in other escape rooms.

Amazing. It was my 3rd escape room. We had a lot of fun, a lot of effort was put into the plot, the riddles, the decoration. It was just the right difficulty, hard, but not impossible. The host is very tourist-friendly. The only downer is that the location is a 30-20 minute cab ride from budapest, but it's worth the trip.

One of the best escape rooms I've played. One of the best of the ~20 or so rooms I've played. Great set design, and some nice puzzles. Would be suitable for families, I think. About 15 mins by metro from the centre of the city, plus a little walk.
Best room so far.... We did 7 rooms in Budapest and this one was really the best. Challenging but fair puzzles, good atmosphere, nice story. I absolutely recommend it!

Absolutely phenomenal. I have done a number of escape rooms in the past and none compare to the detail, atmosphere and variety of Pirate's cave. It was like being on a TV program with the level of effects and the design of the room. Without spoiling it, there is a boat/raft thing that will 100% blow your mind as well as mental puzzles with magnets, mirrors, props and so much more. Most other escape rooms I have done have fairly mundane puzzles that all usually just involve working out a combination with a code but Pirates cave offered several unique challenges that I had never completed anything similar to before. You seriously have to do this if you're in Budapest and wanting to have incredible fun for an hour. It is only about 10 minutes away from the center by metro and was very simple to get to. Richard is also great and is clearly very passionate about what he does. I even made this trip advisor account just to write this review. It really was superb.

Best production value by far. I booked this escape room having already completed quite a few around the world. My girlfriend and I look to visit some rooms wherever we go and always play as a duo.The location of this room is not in the city but can be found by taking a train to the end of the red line which costs all of £0.95 or 350HUF and then less than a 10 minute very simple walk following either Google maps or the instructions provided by the company. This is one if the few games I've been to where there are environmental stimulation in respect of music, sound, lighting, air, water etc. There is a genuine attempt to make the feel more holistic which I thought was excellent. The game itsekf was well made and the puzzles I would suggest are moderate. As a team of 2 we completed it with 11 minutes spare with no hints. That isn't to say it was easy but that we are relatively experienced and some puzzles just clicked with us. Would be excellent for a family as the setting is fantastic. I'd liked to have seen an increase in the difficulty but beyond that I'd say this has been amongst the very best rooms I've visited. Well worth a visit and an absolutely lovey member of staff who was very friendly.

First-timers and loved it!!!. One of the two things that seems to be a 'must-do' in Budapest are the ruin bars and an escape room or two...As newbies to escape rooms I wanted something that would be pretty challenging but didn't like the sound of some of the more 'scary' set-ups, like nuclear bunkers, science labs or anything too dark or claustrophobic (I love a scary movie but not if I'm in it!) so when I read about the Pirate Cave it seemed perfect.Tina was a fantastic host and the rooms and puzzles were fascinating - quite challenging, a little bit physical but nothing major. We were only two people, so I wasn't expecting to finish it but I think she might have made it a bit easier for us (can't tell how!) and we finished with about 20 minutes to spare. Yes, it's a bit of a way out of town but Budapest is easy to navigate and the public transport system's good, plus they give very clear directions, so no problem.It's definitely given me the bug, I'm about to see what escape rooms are on offer in London...

Great way to spend an hour. Richard was very friendly, he designed and constructed the whole escape room himself and did a great job. Very immersive experience, definitely a good activity to do with friends/family. Bit off the beaten track but very easy to get to using the metro, and easy enough to find using the map provided on the website/confirmation email. Highly recommended.

Wow!!!. This is such an amazing room! We have done a lot, but this is certainly top 3 of all the rooms we visited. It is a bit further from the city, but taxi is cheap and it is definetely worth going there!

Awesome!. I usually don't write reviews online, but this time I had to- we were seven girls on a bachelorette party and we all had super fun! Both the experienced and the inexperienced. The operator Tina was amazing and sent us a great photo to remember our game by. Highly recommended.

A must do for escape-room lovers in Budapest. We're 3 people, with experience of over 40 escape rooms (each).We've come to Budapest to do some escape rooms, and this is one of the best rooms we've visited there (out of 7).Exciting atmosphere combined with great riddles makes this pirate adventure a must do for escape room lovers in Budapest.I would recommend it to 2-4 experienced players, or 3-5 new players.Would also recommend it for families looking to do something fun together.

The most amazing escape room I have been in.. This is definitely an experience you want to have, I have been in many escape rooms and brought my girlfriend (first escape room for her) to this Pirate Cave experience, we were introduced to the place by Tina who was an amazing game master. The game itself is heavily invested with props and puzzles you might only see in movies, it is unbelievable they reset the room for every team, we were having so much fun because the game is full of objects to interact with and solving the quests is never too hard or too simple. I would really recoomend this room for experienced and beginners - we were a couple so it was a bit hard on the time challenge but we managed to solve most of the quests and were 10 minutes too late for escaping, if you can hook up a group of 3-4 you'll have really good chance of beating the room :)

The best room I've been!. From the moment you'd set foot in this place you'd feel like on a movie set!Amazing experience, lot's of puzzles and great atmosphere!This is a must-go for all Escape Room Seekers

Pirate Adventure. One of the best escape rooms I've been to (out of 20 so far..). Our game master Tina welcomed us dressed as a pirate and she was the nicest game master I've met. The game has amazing atmosphere and all the riddles are connected to the story (nothing breaks the experience). Even the help was given in an atmospheric way. It's a little far from the city center but totally worth the ride!
Great Escape Game. This escape game is so much fun because there are so many details, special effects and you actually feel like you are in a pirate cove.
Arrrrr!. Very entertaining and great setting. Tina our host was very friendly. All in all a great experience.
Brilliant . When you have such a great idea, with the perfect host, you can't go wrong. We've been into few rooms already and this one is, by far, the most enjoyable escape experience we had.

Amazing!!!!!!. Wow that was the best room I've been at! The challenges are very smart and creative, the room is well decorated, the idea is totally awesome! Let alone the special effects which we didn't see in any other room we visited. Las and totally not least a very nice girl welcomed us! She was very welcoming with good English and a create attitude! Totally one of my best experiences in Budapest!!
Awesome escape game. This was a very fun experience - challenging puzzles, cool atmosphere, great theme and a very reasonable price. Can't recommend it enough!

Loads of fun!. I booked this escape room in advance and am so glad I did. My mom (mid 60s) and I took a stab at it. Some of the puzzles were challenging but we had a great time trying to figure them out. It was very fun and we couldn't stop talking about it after. The owner, Richard, was super cool as well. The experience was well worth it! Good way to spend a rainy evening. Taxi roundtrip from the city center came to just under $30 USD.
Great craic. Soo much fun! Peter is so lovely and helps as you go as we were disastrous lolReally recommend this place it's something different to do and great for stories when you get home :-)
Brilliant but hard!!. This is an ace escape game but it's hard compared to the English Locked in games. I can't really give much away but it is worth the money!!

So much fun!!!!. We visited as a group of 6 on a rainy day when we were in Budapest and we had such a great time! It was our first escape room and we were laughing and talking about it for the rest of the day. A great experience and the game master, Tina made the day that much better! Definitely recommend it :)

So much fun! . We had such a brilliant time here! Richard the owner is so lovely and helpful too. Can't give anything away but let me assure you it's awesome! The theme is a cross between The Goonies and Indiana Jones :-)
Loved it. First time in an escape room and the experience was fantastic. Loved the escape rooms, the riddles, the puzzles etc. Our host was so kind, polite and smiley. Thank you!
Fun and atmospheric!. Fun, atmospheric and adventurous with a very polite hostess - game master! One of the 2 best escape rooms in Budapest !You should give it a try!

Room Escape game creating quite an atmosphere. I have been to nearly two dozen escape rooms so far and this is a fairly good one. There weren't that many enigma's to be solved but various kinds and there are some unique, theme-related parts that add a special flavor to this escape game.

An immersive game. I took my husband to Budapest to play an escape room. It was the first one that we have played although we did do another afterwards. This was by far the best. Or guide Tina was so nice and made the whole experience even more enjoyable. The rooms are all really well decorated, the puzzles were great and the little details like the guide in costume and even the entrance door fitting the theme made the game so immersive that the hour flew by. The instructions to find the game were good considering that it is a bit out of the way. I would highly recommend this one to anybody. We had so much fun that we cancelled other plans to do another escape room closer to our hotel the next day. Unfortunately, it didn't quite stack up to this one. I think pirate cave is a hard one to beat.

Best escape game in Budapest!. My friend and I were visiting from Australia and have done other escape games. We were completely impressed with everything about this one. The attention to detail was amazing! The young lady at the Pirate Cave was friendly, helpful and very professional. I'll be recommending this escape game to everyone!

Amazing. Day of experience: 2015/12/13 11:30AMThe Pirate Cave Escape Room was not our first Escape experience. Actually, it was more our tenth (minimum). So we can have a minimum of other rooms to compare with the Pirate Cave.The Pirate Cave is indubitably in our Top 3 (and not necessarily in 3rd position), and, let us precise that our Top 3 contains only amazing escape rooms.We can give some reasons for this rate:- The scenery is incredible. We will not give any clue of why it is incredible, but yes, really, it is amazing.- You are actors. You do not play like a player, you play like an actor. You are a part of the scene, an actor in the scenario.- The scenario. The creator of the escape room come from movies' world and we can see it. The hour we spend in this room was a real adventure.- The puzzles. Of course puzzles are important. Actually, my (if I say "we" because we were 2 in the room, I can say "I" because I am alone with my keyboard here) preferred activity in escape rooms is solving puzzles. This escape room proposes a lot a different and original puzzles (a lot that I have seen nowhere else).- The search for clues is also nice and original.- ... other things we forgot to sayIf we have to sum up in one sentence this escape room from our point of view, it would be the following one:"Pirate Cave Escape Room is an adventure with laugh, wonderful scenery, original puzzles and searches."If we shall have to find one negative point, we may talk about the localization of the room, but only because as it is not in city center, people could miss this experience, and it would be a shame !From Fabien & Elodie, a couple of french people, coming in Budapest for 4 days.

The best escape room with Kids in Budapest. You need skills not only brains to solve the puzzles, - there are some easier ones and harder ones too - ideal for 4 or 5 people. The scenery is authentic and you literally "row" over from one room to another. Can be a bit scary for kids who are smaller or afraid of the dark. We had a lot of fun and our children (11 and 13) loved it.

Pirate's life for us.. We had a great time here, we really liked:- the decoration- the athmosphere- the logic of the game- the level of difficulty- that the staff was very helpfulPlease note that it's not easy to find it (just follow their map).Thank you for the experience, this was one of the best games that we played.

Awesome Experience!. This was our first ever escape room experience for all four of us and we were not disappointed! When we arrived we were welcomed by a lovely lady who explained what our game would entail, we were all feeling slightly "fragile" and had no idea what to expect, however, the moment we got into the room the cobwebs were blown out and it was game on! From start to finish we had fun and laughed at each others efforts (or lack there of) and the puzzles were genuinely challenging! This experience has got us hooked on escape games and we're looking to book more in the near future! I couldn't recommend any higher. Pirate Escape Room, You. Are. Awesome! Thank you for an excellent swashbuckling adventure! :)

Fantastic experience. Really nice girl that welcomes you. The game was fun and original like no other in the world. Lots of cool things that you won't see anywhere else! You MUST do this if you come to Budapest!
Great room. This was such a good room to play. We had an amazing time. The interior is very well maid. Puzzles are nicely thought of. Recommendation!

Great escape the room game. We have done about 8 of these and Pirate cave is one of the better ones. Really cool and atmospheric with some unique parts. The owner is great too, we came by without a booking and he welcomed us in and set everything up for the game in 10 minutes.
Best escape room ever!. Great puzzles, great production, great experience! One of the best escape rooms that we as a group visited.You don't need to bring anything except the good mood :)

Fantastic. The best escape room we have done . Great fun and great story and props. Slightly difficult to find but at the end of the M2 metro line and then turn right down Feher street. Cross road and about 300 m down the road see turning into industrial estate , Go through barrier and walk straight through industrial estate halfway down and look on your left for skull and crossbow sign .Well worth the trip . I guarantee you will not be disappointed.
TOP escape game!. First puzzle is find the location :-)...staff was fantastic and the room as well. Beautiful thoughtful environment in pirates cave with music and the other special effects.

So much fun!. We visited with our children ages 11, 10 and 10 and to be honest, they solved some of the clues more quickly than we did!We have never been to an escape room before but we loved this, so much fun! Fantastic theme, construction and effects and when we though we had cracked it ... there was more!Great staff too, very friendly and helpful, they keep an eye on you with cameras and lessen the sound effects if they see the children are getting nervous.Definitely a family highlight on a trip to Budapest :)
The best escape room in Budapest! . After going to six escape rooms, this is the greatest by far!Hard but satisfying riddles and wonderful theme decoration. The operator was really nice and patient.
Amazing !!. One of The Best Escape In Budapest !! Great Riddles, Wonderful Décor, not too hard or too easy... A fun family time you won't forget. Highly recommended.

A great escape room experience. We visited the Pirate Cave Escape Room as a couple and had a great time, even if we needed some assistance with clues! This was the second escape room we had attempted in Budapest and it was by far our favourite. The attention of details and varied nature of the puzzles makes for a truly unique escape room experience.

Amazing pirate experience. I would go again!! It was really exciting and scary in a good way. We really had to use our brains together in order to solve the triggers. They also offer the same idea but in the city environment, not in a room. It sounded very much fun too.

Great.. I can only repeat what others have said: A unique game with a lot of love for details, amazing decoration... This game deserves to stand out among the many escape games in Budapest. I wish the incredibly friendly and passionate owners a lot of success! A heartfelt thank you, you left us speechless! :)
Great experience! . Was so much fun. It is a little bit out the way, but still easy to find. First time we had attempted an escape game, and it was so much fun. Loved the pirate theme too

A place filled with fun, lough and mysteries. Visited this room last month with an other couple and had a great evening spent at this place. It has something different comparing to the previous rooms we've been visited. We recommend happily for everyone

Great room with a lot of love for details . We, two couples played this room and really enjoyed it! Two of us have already done exit games but this was not like the others - many kinds of riddles, a lot of action and an accomplished mission!

There's just nothing better out there.. Been to a few escape rooms already but this one tops the lot. Easily accessible, thoroughly equipped with a great story and adequate amount of tricky and funny challenges. These guys really put their hearts in it. All your senses are grabbed from the very first moment which is cool and rare. It's one of a kind and surely worth visiting.Thank you guys!
Perfect team building. We spent a superb team building in the escape room which was entertaining for all the 6 people:) There were many tricky tasks with quality workmanship!

Excellent team building opportunity. I was with my colleagues in the Pirate Cave Escape Room. We really enjoyed the game, it was great fun. The atmosphere of the room was fantastic and the puzzles were very creative. I enjoyed every moment of it and I'm sure I will go back. :)
Fantastic game experience. The place looks amazing, the best 1 hour escape room experience I ever had. I travelled in time and place and then had real fun while playing.

Excellent aesthetics and theme!. This game was so much fun and its obvious a lot of effort has gone into creating a fully immersive atmosphere. This game would be very suitable for a family with children and beginners. Staff were also very friendly and engaging, would fully recommend this game to others.

Exciting escape game with amazing visuals!! :). How can you cooperate with each other? This exciting game shows you. I was there with my family (all of us are adult). We really enjoyed it!! :) The cave is perfectly formed, visual elements are fantastic. We had 60 minutes to solve the problems and escape from pirates' cave. This time was full with experience. You must pay attention to everything and everybody ;) Try it and have fun! :)

Awesome logical escape game - fun stuff for the company. We went to try this game with the family - aged 20-60 - and all of us had great fun. The game is held in a large room from which you need to escape. You need to find clues on how to escape the place. As the aim of the game is to escape in an hour (or so), all of you need to cooperate and focus to accomplishing the tasks. It was a really new and exciting experience to all of us. If you and your friends like board games, card games, solving problems... or if you are a programmer :) you will definitely like it. I encourage and advise everyone of all ages to try it!

Be real pirates!. My friends and I had one of our greates experiences on this scape room! I also did others but this was the best for sure! Not so easy sometimes and also not only logic, so you must use all your senses to try to scape for the pirates!100% recomended!!!!

Great idea couples to escape :). Never tried such games before but had been thinking a while and happy to be there. Innovative way to engage people in a different level. Wisely done and worths a visit. The only downside was it was really hot inthere.

Great Escape for Family and Friends. Our kids and friends had the best time at the Pirate Cave Escape Room. This was our first experience and our friends' third experience with an escape room and by far we were told this was the best. This was perfect for our family - the Pirate theme (think Jack Sparrow/Pirates of the Caribbean) is great for kids and teens - fun, challenging, with unexpected twists and used our combined knowledge and sleuthing skills (yes even the kids figured things out the adults couldn't). It made for a very exciting and enjoyable hour. Dare I say we did some bonding and team-building! This is a must-do adventure while you're in Budapest, a great escape from the traditional tourist attractions and a treasure trove of fun!

Innovative escape game with amazing visual impressions. Our team of 6 people have visited several escape games in Budapest in the past months and the pirate cave escape room offered us something new, breathtaking and unforgettable!I am extremely fond of the pirate theme (obviously after Pirates of Caribbean it is not so difficult) and the Pirate Cave easily brought this environment.Highly recommended escape room with nice and kind staff!

Best Escape Game in Budapest!. Fantastic! We've been to many escape rooms in Budapest, but this was the very best of them all! The setting, the props, special effects are genius, you will catch yourself stopping during the game to appreciate the whole atmosphere. The owners are super nice and friendly, putting their hearts and souls into it - which comes across. The 5 star goes to them as well as to the game itself. I would recommend to Kalózbarlang to everyone; it's enjoyable for all ages, the place is clean and neat (which is indeed rare in escape roos in Budapest), the game is brilliant and a truly unforgettable experience! Congrats again to the owners, I wish them best of luck and looking forward to their new upcoming games!

Amazing adventure!!. The day before we went to another escape room in Budapest, and we'd want to go to enjoy another. We chose Pirate Cave and the choice was fantastic. It was really excellent afternoon, and the crew was very friendly with us. It's totally recommended.It's a bit distant from the center of Budapest but you can get on the metro and arrive at the place. You don't regret to go there. Sure!!!

Great Adventure!. The sights in Budapest were beautiful, but this game was the highlight of my trip to Budapest! There were some aspects of the game which were very unexpected and exciting. I highly recommend going!

Great adventure!. Great atmosphere! Great puzzles and challenges!Logic and mind puzzles was in focus, and not just "searching for stuff" as in some other games.The props, rooms and special effects were well crafted and really added to the experience.The background story was good and made a nice setting.The game master was really enthusiastic and fun to talk with.It was well worth the trip out of the city centre.Also if you like shopping there is a shopping mall at the train stop nearby.We have been on a few different escape games before and this was definitely the best.The only thing that could be better was that we sometimes had trouble to hear what the special effect voices said.

One of the bests escape rooms in Budapest. Very exciting set up inside, really felt like Jack Sparrow trying to escape! It was really excellent Sunday afternoon program with our daughters.Don't miss it.

Like a small Disneyland!. We visited earlier several escape rooms, but this way full of new surprises, and challenges, the setting and scenery was really brilliant, we really had the feeling at one point that we are in Disneyland (a very small one. :-))Not only getting out is a challenge, but getting in also, as the location is hidden in an old factory complex. It was a great fun with my daughters. Recommended for families and friends

Great attraction!. Our first experience in an escape room and it was great! You can see that a lot of effort and thought were put into it. You really test your abilities in many aspects and it is so much fun! Highly recommended for all ages!

A mini Crystal Maze. The first challenge is to try and find the place, as it's nestled away on an industrial estate in the middle of nowhere. However, once you find it you're in for a treat. For those who remember the Crystal Maze, that is exactly what we were hoping for and it is like a mini version which didn't disappoint. Great design and detail and some mind boggling puzzles to solve. I would definitely recommend it, although it's very hard to beat within the hour! It's a good test of a relationship as me and my wife almost had a domestic when the clock was ticking near the end.A good tip - they only accept cash! I had to walk 15 minutes back to train station to find a cash point.

Lots of fun!. My partner loves pirates. It was his birthday. I found this on a list of cool escape rooms in BP. It seemed like the perfect thing to do whilst on holiday! We had a great time! There was only the two of us, and we were very intense to watch (apparently!). We took it very seriously, and although we didn't complete, we loved sitting and chatting to the owner afterwards to learn how we could have finished it. The price was fair, the location easy and the puzzle itself was engaging and enjoyable. If you fancy getting away from the busy streets of BP and pretending you're a pirate for an hour then this is the place to do it!

Great fun for couples. We had both never done anything like this before, was a surprise for my girlfriend. While she was quite sceptical before, she really enjoyed it and still talks about it. We didnt quite complete the game as we were so excited in the last room to focus on some small but important clues. Overall good fun and will def. recommend it!
Gorgeous!. It was a very exciting and amazing program for us. Authentic decoration, smart and creative puzzles. Best escape room in Budapest! We had a really great time there! Thank you!

Magical journey in Pirate-land. One of if not the best escape room in Budapest! The atmosphere of the game is phenomenal! After 5-10 minutes we got sucked into the game itself and started searching for the clues and solution of the puzzles like it was for real! I've never had this kind of experience in any other escape room I've visited. If you're looking for a fun and unique way to spend 1 hour it's a must try!Also, there is a monitor outside, so after the first group finished the game, they can observe the second team as they try to find their way out of the Pirate Cave!

Fehér út 10, Budapest. Best escape room ever. You feels like you are the part of the movie Pirates of the Caribbean.☺️ The only room where it worth to wait till the last moments before you solve all mysteries.

Our TOP 1 escape game!. I have played more than 55 escape games since July 2013, but this place is still in the 1st place in our TOP 10 list. We loved it so much, and we hope, that they will create a new game, and we can go back to play.

I felt myself briliant!. This room is so entertaining and exciting! I and my teammates had to face a lot of challanges. I'm really looking forward a new game for the creators. I recommend everybody to try!

Perrrfect! ;). It was our first escape game experience, and also the best. The cave is magical and amazing and the game is absolutely interesting, so we had a great time here. All of us really enjoyed it. :)

5 stars!. This escape room sets the bar in terms of theme, decor, immersive experience, variety and cleverness of puzzles. Although it is a little out of the way, it is definitely worth the trip. We have played a number of escape rooms and Pirates Cave delivers an exceptional level of entertainment and fun. If you love escape rooms you will love this one. A must do!
Very nice experience(s)!. Very well executed escape room with a wide variety of puzzles (and adventurous moments) all of which are truly unique, very original and lots of fun!

Very impressive decor and atmosphere. Very impressive escape game . A lot of effort was put at the decor and atmosphere of the room. It was a lot of fun. One thingthat a bit ruined it for me - we were a couple and did not finish the game in 60 minutes. The guy then went inside the room and offered 20 more for minutes for extra charge. Weve been to plenty of escape rooms and never had to pay more if we needed a few more minutes. That's legit but left a bit of a bad taste after a great game

Adventure in Budapest. I arrived to budapest as part of my v isit in Hungary and my friend suggested me that we should go check out this place. So we did. It was worth every single penny. We had so much fun including mind games and many puzzles. The puzzles were really complex and we had to think a lot. The show was nice too and the staff was extremely friendly as well. I can only recommend this on place.
Superb!. An odd wait outside in the middle of nowhere but it was worth it. Friendly and really the best produced escape room I have been in. The waterfall was awesome :)
AMAZING. It was very challenging but interesting. I enjoyed it very much and the staff were very polite and helpful. I would recommend to everyone , great way to spend an hour.

Quirky and great fun!. This was our first time in an escape room and based on this experience, would definitely do more next time we're in town! Reminds you of how to work together - the two of us got out and had a blast. Although not in central Budapest, is easy to get to.Directions: take the M2 (red line) to the terminus (Ors Vezer Tere). When you arrive, exit the station and cross over towards the shopping centre (Arkad) then turn right along the main road (following the tram tracks). You will then come across a street on the left called Gyakorlo (which goes towards residential tower blocks >> nb. do not go down this street as there is no way to cut across into the industrial park and it is a long way back or around). Cross it, continuing along the main road, then take the next left which goes towards what looks like the entrance to a Soviet-era industrial park. The gate-house is manned and they will direct you to building 8 on the map. Just to the right of the entrance to building 8 is the pirate themed door where the adventure begins.

I felt myself brilliant!. This room is so entertaining and exciting! I and my teammates had to face a lot of challanges. I'm really looking forward a new game for the creators. I recommend everybody to try!

The best program I had this summer!. I went with 4 of my friends, and I was sure we will get out! We had so much fun, we are still talking about it. It was very interesting and challenging.
Unfortunately we didnt get out, but we didn't care.

Great place!!. My friends surprised me with this game, I even couldn't expect that an escape game can be so exciting! We've tried several games in Budapest, but I think it's the best one I've tried. You are surrounded by voices, great sounds, light and the interior is very stylish! We've escaped, but we had only 2 minutes left. Fuff!! Advise this game to everyone, especially good for suprises;)

Wow!. Budapest is filled with Room Escape attractions. So I looked for the most attractive and I found it. This Room Escape is amazing. The people who built it put so much work into the decorations, lightning and sound effects. The background story is very interesting and exciting. I was there with my friend, we were only two people and felt like it was perfect, unlike other room escapes that are made for 3 or 4 people and your chances of winning as a couple are very low. The only problem is that it's a little outside the city but you can get there very easily with the M2 underground. I really recommend making the effort. Thanks a lot. Had a blast!
Excellent . My girlfriend and I went and loved every moment. Really good challenge and very enjoyable! We made it out too, so even better!Thank you!
Jamie . Amazing took my partner here for a surprise and she loved it too. Well Worth the trip it's about 20 mins on the tram then a 15 min walk but don't miss it!!!! Will do it again next year
fab. most exciting escape room so far. very exciting combinations to get out from. waterfall were amazing and storm feeling with wind machine.

Best program with friends! :-). A "MUST HAVE FUN" in Budapest!!! :-) I did enjoy every moments of the game. It's more than an exit room. This place has wonderful and exciting pirate atmosphere. Thank You Guys! ;-D

Indi and Lara go wild in Budapest. This was our first escape room experience and my wife and I enjoyed it immensely. We did the Egyptian room and we got a little stuck but our guide "Anna" helps us when needed. We escaped in time and would do another room in a heartbeat. I am looking forward to doing one in our next city jaunt.

Fairly normal escape room in a city with many good ones. As part of a recent escape room trip to Budapest I took three teams along and each team played all three rooms in Scavenger. While the rooms are all perfectly reasonable games, they didn't match up to the many other options in the city.Mozart - if you're into music then this will probably be fun. The backdrop is pretty but I found a few of the puzzles were a bit samey and never really felt confident in the answers.Surgery - this was the weakest although it had a couple of nice moments in it. Definitely the one that all three teams got the most frustrated with.Egyptian - by far the best in my opinion. Some nice puzzles and looked pretty. Like the others, not really much of a story but overall fun to play.

Great experience. It was such a great experience! Really clever and enjoyable puzzles, nice design and atmosphere! The game master was so friendly and his enthusiasm and kindness really contributed to the game being so much fun! We highly recommend it! Can't wait to come back to the other rooms!

Best escape rooms in Hungary. The best rooms in Budapest! The quality of the rooms is outstanding, the game master is superb. I have tried all of the rooms and loved them all! All of them were challenging and fun, and also non repetative.
perfect. Enjoyed it very much! It was logical and the room was beautiful, all of my friends had a good time!!

Brilliant fun. First time in an escape room, this one was cheaper if only 2 were playing so we chose it for that reason. It was brilliant. We were in the Egypt room and the guide was fun and helped out when we got stuck
Excellent. We were four. We went into two rooms: Egypt and Mozart.And we loved both.The master of the game was friendly and great.We keep good memories!ThanksTamás + 3

Best of our "room escape weekend" in Budapest. Last weekend we did a "room escape weekend" in Budapest. Played 7 rooms in 2 days and I must say Scavenger is at least 3 levels above others. We did all three room and the design in all rooms was amazing. A lot of effort (and money) was put into it and we really felt like in a movie. The Egyptian set is the coolest one. Music and the perfectly planed details contribute a lot. Some of the puzzles were already seen but some of them were totally new and interesting to us. What we loved the most is our game master. :) She was so nice, smiling and explaining everything to us with such a passion that we "got infected" with her good energy. It was very important to us since we came to Scavenger Escape after 2 really bad rooms....better to say after 2 really bad game masters who almost spoiled our fun. Luckily, Scavenger escape made our day! Highly recommended to all room escape addicts (like us) and all who are jet to become addicts :)
Nice Escape room. A really nice Escape room. The two rooms we tried where great and well build. We enjoyed it very much.

Room nice, Gamemaster needs to improve. We were a group of 5 people who are really experienced in doing escape rooms - that's actually the reason we came to Budapest. We did the Mozart room - which is described as the hardest room they have. The look of the room is actually quite good, but sadly we had not a good experience playing the game. Although we were often able to figure out how the riddle was supposed to be solved, for some kind of reason we had a lot of problems actually solving them - even asking for tips or help didn't help at all. The staff was really unfriendly and we got the impression we were more of a hustle than a welcome customer. It's also the most expensive room we have tried - sadly not worth it in Budapest, where good escape rooms are on every corner.UPDATE:After posting this review, we were contacted by the owner of "Scavenger Escape Budapest" who apologize and (without asking) refunded us the money. He was very sorry and said that our experience with the Gamemaster was the first time he has heard about it, but he will def. make sure this never happens again. Also the "not working game elements" were partly because the Team before us more or less destroyed the items and the Gamemaster repaired them not correctly. Overall, this doesnt change the (sadly) bad experience we had in this room, but the owner really cares about giving the costumer a good experience and he assured us this will never happen again. We will definetly check out the other rooms when we are in Budapest again because the room itself looked really nice.

Very nice experience!. This site has three escape rooms, which are all very nicely decorated. We played not one but two rooms because of the bad weather and had a very good time. We played the Secret Surgery room first, which we found quite difficult, and Mozart's Mystery second, which we finished quite a bit faster. The hosts were very friendly in guiding, answering your questions and helping with the game if necessary. An absolute recommendation!

Nice brain exercise . Fantastic logical games at a very nice looking place with great prices!The whole idea is that you have a mission and in order to complete it you have to search for clues and use them to solve riddles. The rooms are detailed perfectly and you can find everything that you need to escape!

Venue is that good we did 2 rooms !!!. Stumbled across this little gem..First time for us but wow!!We did the Mozart room first.. Enjoyed it that much we then dived straight into the Egyptian room.. For 2hours of enjoyment and paying less than what you would pay for 1 room in the UK. Well happy. There is a guide who will help you if your stuck.Well done guys.Fantastic place. Many thanks.10/10..

Funny but challenging. We visited two rooms; the Mozart room and the Egyptian room. The Mozart room was in our opinion quite hard.. We were with the two of us. But lucky the girl working there was really helpful in a funny way and she made our experience the best! The Egyptian room is less hard, but still really challenging and fun. Location is also great, close to nice restaurants and areas.

Mozart room - average. Played the Mozart room at Scavenger Escape. Of the seven escape rooms I played in Budapest, I would put it at the bottom of the pile. It wasn't a bad game, but it wasn't very good - I felt there was too much trial and error. That said, there were a couple of nice puzzles in there.

Nice for unexperienced escapers. Played Mozart's room together with someone who did never do an escape room before. The room is rated as hard and best with 3-5 persons, but we went smoothly through with the two of us.

Awesome Egyptian Adventure. We have tried the Egyptian Adventure game all of us enjoyed the game. It was a little bit hard but after some help we managed to get out on time. Staff was super friendly. We will try the other rooms as well :)

Excellent!. Found the place spontaneously and we had a great time! We did the Egyptian room and it was great, so the next day visited the Mozart room as well (which was much more difficult for only 2 people). The place is nice and inviting, the operators were friendly and the riddles were interesting and orginal. The location is central and easy to find, and the price was great as well. Highly recommended!
Awesome!. It was super fun! We did the Egypt room and had a blast! The girl who treated us was so super-fun and really nice!

Best Escape Room in Budapest +++++. We have tried yesterday with few friends, all of us enjoyed the game. The game-master was really helpful and nice, we managed to get out with a little help. I have been in several escape game but I would say that Scavenger Budapest is far the best.

Beautiful and interesting escape rooms in the city center. Beautiful and interesting escape rooms in the city center of Budapest. Easy to access, kind crew, nice rooms with interesting strories.
So far the Mozart room was the best, and the laboratory is for those, who are really pros.
I really recommend it for everybody, a one-hour long fun and adventure.

Amazing Escape Room. We tried the Secret Surgery - super exciting game, brilliant for team buliding.
It was a bit challenging, but with a little help we managed to get out in time - and saved mankind :) Staff was super friendly.
Highly recomennded.

The Perfect Challenge. I visited Budapest on a business trip recently and found this escape room. It was unique and special in many ways. By the time I was done, I didn't want to leave. The challenge was equaled by the creativity that went into the planning. Now I look forward to visiting Budapest again on my own time -- not just on business.
3rd room on their list. Fantastic 4/5, visited with 4friends, challenging but not the toughest ever, we injoyed the game abd the gamemaster's play was also remarkable
scavenger escape experience. At first it was hard but after a little help we managed to get out on time.I recommend for more than 3 people.It really takes one hour and all your imagination.

Good game experience for a decent price. Nice equipments, thrilling game, good price. If we would have more time we would try more rooms, because we never played such an interesting game like this. You can get there by public transport easily. Price is good if you play in a group of 5 or 6. I recommend for families for the Egyptian Adventure (Mozart's Mystery could be too difficult as I know).

Childrens loved it. Unfortunately the weather was not too nice for us when we wisited Budapest so we were very happy that we found this escape game. Childrens loved it! Families and rookies also can enjoy the Egyptian Adventure in my opinion. The puzzles are challenging but they not too hard, and you can even use the help of the game master.

Great adventure in the heart of Budapest. We went out with a group of friends to try out something different than before. It was 60 minutes of pure fun!! The place seemed to be quite new, the interior was well designed - not mentioning the "escape stories". Crew is nice, and the booking also went easily.All of us enjoyed it a lot, so I can surely recommend it to everyone!

Special atmosphere. As a non-expert escape game players we decided with my mate to choose the easiest game, the Egyptian Adventure. The room has such a great atmosphere, and the mission is interesting, too. I'm really disappointed that we didn't have enough time to try the other rooms as they have two other. You can prepay online or by cash on scene. It's easy to get there by public transport.

Very difficult!. We enjoyed this game a bit less than others we did because it was really hard. We can't figure out if it's because we weren't on good form or whether it is just too difficult for normal folk like us!!Anyway the place is much smarter than other games we have done and has some really interesting / innovative features.

Best real-life escape game experience I've ever had!. I've been several escape rooms in Budapest, but Scavenger Escape Budapest is the place where you dont want to escape from. We had a fun time and I would definitely recommend it for everyone who want a unique gaming experience while visiting the city. The place is like a five-star hotel room. It seems that all the rooms and games was designed with love and profession. Everything is supercool there.I would love to play again and I will try the Secret Surgery.

A unique escape room experience. I visited the escape room with my friends and we had a great time.Everything inside is unique and handcrafted and you get the feeling that you have been transported back in time. It was truly amazing!

Truly luxurios experience. I've tried many escape games before but Scavenger Escape was far the best. We choose the Egyptian Adventure and it was really an adventure. The rooms' design is incredibly great. The whole place is highly professional and the staff is so polite and well-prepared. They also flexibly managed our extra needs.Definitely recommended for all. :)

Great game for a great price . My girlfriend and I found the 1984 game great fun! The difficulty seemed perfect and there was a good variety of puzzles and red herrings to look out for. David our host was great and made the game as fun as it could be giving hints just when needed! We would have loved to play the other rooms but it was our last day in Budapest.

Great entertainment & very helpful organiser. Our first visit to an escape room & the organiser, David, was very helpful - we did require one or two prompts along the way! We did the Circus Room & thoroughly enjoyed it. Cleverly put together & well managed.

Amazing. It was a amazing hour intense and enjoyable. We took the circus room. Many things some useless and some useful. The person in charge was really nice. He helps us when we were stuck. Replay funny time. We recommended
Very good !. A very good time with your friends. A bit difficult the first time but we had a lot of fun. I recommend it.

So elaborate and so much fun! . I came here with my boyfriend at the start of November and we both left saying how fun this was! We tried the 1984 room and loved it. There were so many different parts to it and it was challenging without being impossible - and for both of us this was the first escape game we had ever played. David was also great at giving small clues when we needed them without giving too much away. We were even tempted to come back and try the heaven and hell room but we ran out of time. Would definitely recommend!

Exciting escape. Have been to 5-6 escape room already and this one was one of the most creative. Well designed,several rooms,funny and scarry at the same time. We made it two of us and finally managed to escape in time!

Fantastic!. What a great way to spend an hour!! My boyfriend and I booked the Circus escape room tonight and had a ball! Dave (the man in charge) was a gent and made the experience all the more enjoyable! The room was challenging but fun. We needed a bit of guidance at times and Dave spoke us through it from a speaker. Great evening and we hope to be back to try another of the rooms before we go back to Ireland!

Absolutely great room. We played the heaven & hell room and have been very impressed with the riddles and the creativity that went into the design of the room. It was one of the very best rooms we ever played (and we played quite a view by now). We recommend E-Exit and will come back to see the other rooms.
Exciting. Very good activity for teambuilding. Will recommend this for both friends, families and Companies. We had a great time and staff on this Place was very Nice.

Best escape room we have been so far!. We booked Heaven and Hell room online and whole exprience was great! The place was easy to find and okay walk from the nearest metro stations. Service was excellent and even though we were beginners, everything was well explained by the friendly staff. The room itself was big, awesome and well made with interesting theme. We were having a hard time with only two people but with some guidance and and overtime we made it! Recommended.

So good we went twice!. We were recommended escape rooms as a fun thing to do in Budapest, and these ones seemed to be the most affordable. My partner and I did the 1984 room which was a really fun time. We enjoyed it so much that 2 days later we went and did the Heaven and Hell room with some friends from our hostel. If you're down for a good time and something different I would definitely recommend this place. The staff were friendly, prices reasonable and a really enjoyable way to spend our time.
Nice but scary. Interesting puzzle, nice decor, be careful if you are scared of small spaces, it might be surprising. Nice efforts of the owner to make something new

Amazing!. I played a lot of escape games all around the world, but this one was absolutely the best! We played room Heaven and Hell. It was thrilling, every detail was corresponding the topic. Tasks were well designed and all perfectly built. Our guides Suzie and David was really friendly. They took care, but definitely didn't help us more that was necessary, so it was challenging all the time. It was six of us playing the room and all of us enjoyed. Thanks!!! We will definitely come back to Budapest to play your 1984.

Thrilling experience!. We have tried the Heaven and hell room and it was amazing experience. The owners said that it took them a year to build and it was obvious that it is not because they were lazy. The puzzles fit together, good combination of different kinds of riddles and puzzles and we have managed to escape exactly at the time limit. Inspirational!

First time we tried it and loved it... came back the next day. First time we ever tried an Escape Game and we loved it. We tried 1984 and then came back for more the next day to play Hell and Fire (or something along those words)

FUN and challenging! . This was my first time doing escape games. My boyfriend and I done the 1984 room. It was very challenging but really fun. The staff were very friendly and helped out when needed. I would definitely recommend it.

1984 - best room I have escaped from, so far. We made a reservation just an hour before the game without any problems. The place was easy to find, outer door was kept locked but there seemed to be someone close the counter at all times. The staff spoke great English and really made us feel welcomed. The room 1984 was based on George Orwell's book. We were two persons, who had done 5 escapes before this room. Neither of us hadn't read the book but after the escape we decided to read it. The room was really well made and I enjoyed every minute in it. The puzzles were different from each other and the difficulty level was perfect for us. The escape felt really great!
