Excellent made rooms . We've done quite a few escape rooms and this company was awesome! There were some props and puzzles we have never seen before and it was all very well done! Did 1984 and heaven and hell!

One of my favorites!. The game master is very welcoming and the ambient is fun. I went there with 3 friends on a week end trip in Budapest. We went to play the "1984" room and managed to get out well in time. The operator told us we should try "Heaven & Hell" that we played the day after and fell in love with the room. Ingeniosity and fun at its best. We can see passion and creativity all around the rooms we played. We even played the "Circus" because we had so much fun there and would not want to leave.I strongly recommend you try out this Escape.

Wow! An absolute must!. This review will be completely spoiler free.Me and my girlfriend love doing escape games. We have done probably dozens of them already, but this one blew them all out of the water.We booked E-Exit's room titled Heaven and Hell for holiday in Budapest. The room was available in English (I believe all of their rooms are available in English). The room is in a nice location and it wasn't difficult to find. We got there a little early (it's always good to be a little early for escape games).Our host was very nice. He introduced us to the story (you are welcome to read about it in their website). The story was awesome and very well written.We started the room. I won't give you any details, but holy hell (pun intended). Very well built and extremely atmospheric. The puzzles were very good and innovative (even after playing many escape games).The game was quite difficult for only 2 people, and I would suggest to go in a larger group (perhaps 3, 4 or 5), but we were 2 and we had a blast.We have booked a total of 10 escape games for our stay in Budapest, and so far this one was the best.Bravo to the makers.

Good Rooms Nice Service. Dave gave us the instructions. The Circus room is a bit more trial and searching, 1984 is a bit more brainy. Even though two of us three we managed to get out of the Circus with 9min left and a few help calls. We got out 1984 with 20min left and help only once.we only booked Circus, but they had no more customers and offered us 1984 as well. For 12 CHF (10€) per game we were happy to do the second one as well. They made the room with love and they're atmospheric. Great place to have done the first escapes =)

Lots of fun!. We had a great time at the E-Exit escape game. Daniel was very welcoming and gave us useful information before we went into the game. We did the circus game as a couple. There was quite a lot to do for two people but Daniel gave us a few hints when needed. The location of this game is also good. Highly recommended!
1989 room. Very good fun !! It was our first time trying a escape game, we didn't know what to expect but I highly recommend you try this when your visting Budapest !!

Awesome experience in Heaven & Hell!. Escaping from "Heaven & Hell" was a lot of fun! The theme of the room is rather unique and the puzzles are really engaging. There is a good variety in tasks, so the game never gets boring. The room was perfect for two quite experienced escapers, but I am sure that a bigger team would enjoy it just as much. Overall, highly recommended!
Heaven and hell. Brilliant escape room, 56 minutes, 1 hint! Good difficulty, great atmosphere, little scary which adds to the adrenalin rush

Very good Exit Game!. We made a couple of exit games in Buddapest and "Heaven and Hell" was the best of all.Very amusing! A lot of love of detail and a very well thought out concept. David was a very friendly and helpful host who gratefully gave us a couple of extra minutes to solve all the riddles by our own - Thanks a lot for the great time!

Great room, friendly staff. It was a great experience, I went there with 3 friends, we barely escaped in 57 minutes. It was a challenge, and we all liked it. We got some hints, but only when we really needed them. I'd definitely go again. Thanks!
New type of escape room, love it !. Played the Heaven and Hell, amazing new things on puzzles and rooms for us who played games before. Hospitality of staff also perfect!

Really well thought out escape games . We visited here yesterday to do 1984 and enjoyed it so much that we came back to play heaven and hell today. We were a party of 2 and managed to get through both games with a little help from the very welcoming and friendly owner and creator. Highly recommended!

So much fun!. Found this place on a night out with friends, and glad we did!It's an indie escape room place that has so much character! They clearly put a lot of thought and effort into their rooms, as they are themed so well! We did the Heaven and Hell room, and had a blast. The puzzles were of the average level of difficultly compared to other rooms I have done, and as mentioned the theming was great, which meant it was fantastic for those in my group doing in for the first time! Would definitely come back next time I am in Budapest!For those wondering about language - we don't speak a word of Hungarian, and it was no problem! The staff and the games are English friendly.
Great escape game !. 1984 was the first escape game for me, and I really enjoyed the experience : stimulating and fun. The personnel was also really nice. I highly recommend it !

Top notch group entertainment. We loved this place so much that we came back twice to do all the rooms.The concept of these escape rooms is fantastic and a really good activity if you are a group. It won't break the bank either.We all enjoyed the "Heaven and Hell" room the most as it had lots of cool suprises. The detail and thoughts that go into the rooms is amazing, with there always being someone on hand to give you help if you need it.The staff were more than helpul and we were able to pre-book online without payment, and pay after we had completed the activity.Definitely worth a visit if you are in Budapest!

1984 Room as couple. Was a super fun escape room done while on holiday. It was our first, just me and my girlfriend in the room because we booked it for 2 for a fairly good price. The puzzle were not to convulted and were solvable that had hints when nesscary when you made silly mistakes. Would definitely recommend.Don't need to have read 1984 to be drawn into the room or understand it, but has a couple cool references if do. Have exactly 1 hour to solve room and readibg rules and story is around 10mins.Note to the owners.Would also love some kind of memento for completeling the room such as a badge or sticker nothing special just something to remember the room by and show off :).

Fun and different entertainment . We didn't book a time before hand, so most of the rooms where taken. So the only one available was the crazy circus one. It was okay, but not the best. The guy working there told us that the other rooms where much better, so we are going to try one of those next time. But it was still good fun.

Awesome escape !. We did Hell & Heven during our trip to Budapest with my girl and another couple.This escape was very challenging and created with passion. Mecanisms are awesome and a lot of détail are there to add to the immersion.A fantastic escape to do in Budapest for a small price !

Great visit, booked one room ended up doing 2!. With Budapest being the home of escape games we came with good expectations and were not disappointed. First we completed the 1984 game which was interesting and challenging. Then we decided to do heaven and hell which was more unconventional but very interesting. Friendly guys both called Dave. Winner for a few hours.

Awesome!. We tried the 1984 game and we found it absoltely awesome! The game is really well done, there are enigmas of different types - numbers, manual or logical. It is very well done, the puzzles and the enigmas are really nice and some of them are unique I think. The staff is really very kind and they helped us when we were in a dead end, enough but not too much to keep the suspens and the difficulty.This is a very nice thing to do while visiting Budapest, especially in a rainy or in a too hot day. It is absolutely convenient for tourists as there is no need to speak hungarian to play and all the staff speaks English.I highly recommend the E-Exis Escape Games!

Great fun, great value. A must do!!!. Myself and my girlfriend decided to do this escape game whilst on a weeks holiday in Budapest. We have done a couple of escape games in the past so knew what to expect (sort of).We decided to do E-Exit as was near to where we was staying in the centre of the Jewish Quarter, and it also had great reviews on TripAdvisor. On our arrival, David was very friendly and explained the game well, we took on the 1984 game which was really good with some very well thought out puzzles, the game was quite challenging for 2 people so we needed a bit of help from David!We loved it that much in fact the next day we decided to go back and do 'The Circus' which we found a little easier for 2 people but again was still a really good game with a lot of puzzles and tasks to solve! We completed this with 4 minutes to spare! WOO! Would highly recommend E-Exit to anybody! Great fun and very good value too!

1984 - fun, challenging and well organized. We went as a couple and have done a few escape rooms in various countries before. This one was one of our favorites because it was well run, challenging and a lot of fun. We did the 1984 room. It's also in a great area that should be easily accessible for tourists.

1984 - fun and addictive! . The two of us played the 1984 game today and cracked it with two minutes to spare! A great activity for a couple or a small group as its challenging, fun and addictive - once you've done one game you'll want to try them all. The staff here are great and really friendly too!

Escape from heaven&hell . Great game, exciting and challenging till the very last second! You are gonna need all your creativity to solve the puzzles in time, but if you get stuck, the staff helps you through video surveillance. Worth a try, even if you are an escape-virgin ;)
Great escape room. We tried a couple of escape rooms on our trip to Budapest. E Exits rooms was really good. You must try the Heaven and Hell room!

First ever game. We were coming. On holiday to Budapest and my daughter who works in one in Glasgow asked us to try. We had a great time but were absolutely useless at it . David helped us and was very patient. Would recommend this company definitely

Great fun, well organised. We went into the Heaven & Hell room with friends who had done an exit game before. The strategies were varied & challenging, and David our host couldn't have been nicer. A very well run activity and a fun thing to do as a team.
Fun room!. We played the room Heaven and Hell and had a really good time. The room and challenges were varied and imaginative. Great fun!

Heaven and hell. The e-exit complex consists of three rooms: circus, 1984, and heaven and hell. The heaven and hell room is the newest one, just a few months old, so we decided to try it. It was filled with many puzzles and rooms, a lot more than usual, which is a big plus. To all the sensitive people, the room is not scary, just the scenery is a little creepy, but there is nothing to worry about.We recommend the room to people who have already done a few rooms before.Glad we went!

Highly recommend. Group of four of us wanted to try an escape room on our last day in Budapest. We first tried the 1984 room, this was our first ever escape room and we escaped just after the hour. David was very welcoming and told us what to expect and gave us a couple of tips when we needed them. We enjoyed it so much we came back later for the Heaven and Hell room, which was also brilliant. Highly recommend either rooms.
Very good. Loved the heaven and hell room so much that we directly booked for the 1984 room too. Best escape game in Budapest.

One of the best... . I tried the 1984 and hell and heaven rooms with a group of friends. We're seasoned escape game players and broke the record of the hell and heaven room. The two rooms are really excellent, with great visuals and very nice puzzles. Hell and heaven entered my top 3 of the 30+ rooms I tried worldwide, I cannot recommend it enough it is really an amazing one.... You won't be disappointed! Plus, the staff is nice and even let us do the 1984 room with our baby in his stroller... Thumbs up for e-exit!!

Highly, highly recommend Heaven and Hell escape room!. My friends and I had SO much fun playing E-Exit's Heaven and Hell escape room, we can't recommend it enough. Thoughtfully and wholeheartedly planned and crafted, although it has the word "hell" in it, our escape experience was absolutely delightful! Don't miss out, definitely check it out for yourself! Thank you, David! We hope you and E-Exit continue to create and offer such wonderful escape games for a long, long time!

Escape Room Weekend. We visited E-Exit Escape Games during our escape room themed weekend in Budapest. We did the Circus Room and Heaven and Hell. Heaven and Hell is by far the best escape room I've been to (all across Europe) and I really recommend it to anyone. It's a must if you're into escape games. David has been really helpful to, so all in all it was a super nice and exciting experience!
Best escape room ever!!. We did Circus and then Heaven and Hell! Heaven and Hell was the best one ever and David was soooo cool there :) can't wait to go back to do the last one!

A great adventure.. We did all of the rooms and they were all great. The circus room is the easiest one. The other two were harder and a bit more impressive. An amusing to do on a (rainy or even a sunny) day. We enjoyed the 1984 room and Heaven and Hell room. The rooms were challenging and awesome decorated! The staff was nice and did an amazing job creating these escape games!

Deserving of its great reviews. We tried Heaven and Hell as our third and final escape game in Budapest. It was quite different to the other two we played with new challenges - some pretty tricky - and some bigger set pieces. We had a great time and David was a really good host. Visit E-exit, you won't be disappointed!
Great fun and a real challenge. Only our second attempt at one of these and loved it. We attempted Heaven and Hell which was very well thought out and challenging.

Amazing!!!. This was our first escape game and it was great! I was very nervous at first about it, but it was very enjoyable once we got into it. The clues were sometimes hard but really satisfying when they were figured out. We played the 1984 game which was amazing, it was so well thought out and with the help of David we made it out. He made the game fun! Will definitely be doing more escape games in the future but this has set the standards very high

1984 and Heaven & Hell rooms!. Me and my girlfriend were in Budapest for a long weekend and unfortunately the weather wasn't the greatest. Reluctantly, we decided to do something indoors. As we had already been to an escape room in Manchester, we thought this would be a fitting way to pass the time.When we arrived we were informed that we would have to wait till our designated slot - fair enough. Shortly after the planned starting time we were told there would be another short wait as the room was not set up from the visitors before us, again we didn't mind. Once we got into the game the puzzles varied in difficulty, ranging from relatively easy to fairly challenging, however you are offered help from the staff should you need it.We luckily managed to complete the game and escape the game with less than a minute to spare! Once we were congratulated and photographed we settled to bill and went to leave. As we were leaving one member of staff gave us a 50% off voucher for our game starting late (no time was deducted from game time).Due to us receiving this voucher, the weather being dreadful, and us having such fun the first time round, we returned the following lunch time to attempt another game!Definitely worth a shot if you fancy a challenge that isn't the norm!

Best escape room so far. We have already played around 20 escape rooms and Heaven and Hell was by far the best one! Perfect interior, smart puzzles, challenging difficulty and overall great atmosphere!

awesome game. heaven&hell was my third room at e-exit and I loved every minute of it. it's very creative and has pretty cool effects! I've been waiting for one year for this new escape room and it was definitely worth it! go and see for yourselves ;)!
Great experience - 1984. Very interesting and cool experience! Was the first time we played so don't have something to compare with, but have no complaints!!

Incredible experience!!. My friend and I have done several similar escape games in the past but this was totally unique and nothing like any of them! The Heaven and Hell room was extremely well-considered, clever and original with no expenses spared on the amazing decor and puzzles. The member of staff that greeted us was incredibly friendly and helpful. 10/10 would recommend, if you only do one escape room - do this one!!

So fun!. My mum, sister and I decided to solve the 1984 room based on George Orwell's novel. There were two other rooms to choose from: heaven and hell, and circus. We had never done an escape room before but, even though it was challenging, it was very do-able! The room was brilliantly set up and David was excellent at guiding us when we got stuck! It's safe to say we really enjoyed ourselves and it's all about teamwork!Thank you again to David for being so great from start to finish. We will have to go back and try the other rooms!
Best exit game experience. We had a fantastic time in all the three rooms. Friendly staff, nicely decorated rooms, creative and fun. Very good experience. We highly recommend it!

Great escape room! . We went there with a group of three and it was a lot of fun! We went in the Heaven or Hell room, which was quite challenging compared to escape rooms in other countries. We had a great time and the employee who guided us was very nice and welcoming. We'd definitely recommend this place.
Great great heaven and hell!. One of the best rooms we've ever played and we have played a lot! :) So much fun! Aaand the guy who was our game master was very charming and helpful!
A Great challenge . Me and my boys (16 and 18 years) had tried an Escape room once. Heaven and Hell was very good and challenging. With a few scary parts...

a great adventure אחלה חדר שבעולם. took the 1984 room.was the best we ever tried. the staff was great, and the room was sophisticated, intresting, and full of thought.enjoyd a lot.אחלה חדר. מושקע. מעניין. מסובך ויפייפה.הכי טוב שניסינו עד היום (והיו לא מעט).מאוד מאוד מומלץ.

Challenge. Our third exit game and it was the hardes but the lads let us continue until we escaped as no one following us ... I'm not declaring how long it took! Very well organised. Definitely challenging we did the 1984 game. Very reasonable price. If you haven't done one before, have a go... It's a lot of fun!
Heaven & Hell. Best escape room in Budapest! Hard abd fun puzzles with great story and design.. This game got great location in Budapest. THIS ROOM IS A MUST TO DO !

Heaven & Hell room is a must do!. My girlfriend and I are very experienced escapers with over 80 games played across several continents. The Heaven & Hell room at E-Exit was one of the highlights of our escape room tour of budapest.E-Exit is easily walkable or accessible via public transit, and our game master David was incredibly friendly and accomodating. We were early for our game but he was happy to chat with us about escape games with us for 20 minutes before our alloted start time.The room had a fun back story & the decor was immersive. Puzzles were challenging but fair, and there were more than a few twists and surprises! It was do-able with 2 players but 3-4 might have a better chance of success.I would highly recommend this room to any escape room fans. And thanks again to David for being such a superb host!

Excellent!. We tried 1984. It was perfect. David has made an incomparable escape room! I wish we had more time to go to the other two rooms, Circus & Heaven & Hell. Very clever riddles made by David. You have to combine perception with ability in order to escape. It was one hour of challenge, thrill and fun. Just great!!

Great experience !!!. It was really interesting to visit this place, which houses the original rooms of some of the most famous escape games. We took our chances in 1984 room. Although we did not manage to escape we had a great time and we enjoyed a lot. David, a ingenious young man was our game master. He was very helpful and friendly.He did make us feel at home.

Great Escape Experience . We visited a couple of escape rooms during our weekend stay - e exit was the best one we did. heaven & hell is really cool and definitely a must for escape room fans. 1984 is also a great experience. We will definitely come back to also play Circus :)))

fantastic experience. Me and my girlfriend tried the 1984 room.We totally recommend it, as it has been a fantastic experience.The room was well built and it expressed the sense of anxiety of the distopian novel.David gave only a couple of clues, which didn't spoil the fun for usTottally recommended
Not to be missed!. Excellent escape room. Beautifully designed and the difficulty level is spot on. The review is based on the "Heaven & Hell" room.

Excellent Rooms & Friendly Staff. The staff are super friendly. We did 2 of the rooms. 1984 which was great, but then we did the new room, "Heaven & Hell" which was simply mind blowing with excellent riddles and stunning decoration which gives a unique atmosphere, totally different theme from any other escape room we have been to. This is about all I can say without giving a spoiler. Highly recommended, a must do!!!

The "Heaven & Hell" room is a must for room-escapers in Budapest.. We're 3 people addicted to escape rooms (over 40 rooms each) and came to Budapest to visit some more rooms.After reading reviews, we've decided to come escape the 1984 room, and when arriving on location, they suggested we also do the Heaven & Hell room.The 1984 room is very nice - interesting riddles (some we've seen in other rooms and some new). The theme is strong, but quite basic. Recommend for 2-3 experienced players, or 3-5 new players. Kids friendly.After completing the 1984 room we've decided to do the Heaven & Hell.This turned out to be one of the best rooms we've done in Budapest.Great atmosphere, and very interesting and original riddles. Some very fun technological gimmics.Highly recommend (again 2-3 experienced players, and 4-5 new players). Not for Claustrophobic people!Enjoy :)

First escape room experience!. This was our first escape room experience and we loved it. The member of staff was very helpful and explained everything clearly. We did the 1984 room and I would say that this is a good challenge for first-timers. We didn't escape in the alloted time but we're allowed to continue and finish the game. One of the highlights of our Budapest trip!

Great escape. We have played escape rooms before, so we managed to escape quite quickly, 12 min remaining. Room was the 1984 room. Medium-challenge. Room was nicely decorated and had a story. Service was excellent, price was 9000huf for three persons, so quite cheap. Would recommend for new players, experienced veterans might run through room quite fast.
Escape game. Excellent escape game on a weekend trip to Budapest- did the 1984 room with a few friends and everyone loved it- well worth a try. David was a good host as well!

New room in E-Exit is coming soon!. What a room! You should try this if you like escape rooms, because it's so unique, so cozy and fun to go through. Heaven and Hell is the new generation of escape rooms. If you have never tried escape rooms before, this is the best way to start, you will fall in live with this type of leisure.

Challenging and fun. I've done a few escape rooms in Budapest and when I visit, I like to try a new one. My sister and I choose 1984. It was a good room with challenging puzzles and some nice twists. This one requires more thinking rather than physical puzzles but I found it to be very enjoyable. Our guide stepped in at the right time without ruining the experience. Nice job.

A rare treat :). We had done a few rooms on our trip and wanted to get some more in before the end. We popped in to do 1984 but with a view to doing circus room after. We discussed what we wanted with David (who was a real pleasure to deal with btw). He offered us the chance to not only play both their current rooms but also a new one coming out soon. 1984 was great - lots of atmosphere with some interesting twists; the circus room was playful as the name suggests... but the new one was definitely a real treat for us - it's one to look forward to.
One of the best escape rooms I've played!. Played 8 different escape rooms while in Budapest, E-Exit was the best of them! Special thanks to great customer service!

First escape room experience!. We did 1984 room, the first escape game we have done and it was a really intense and funny hour. David was very kind, he offered as some clues just on time. Highly recommended.
Great fun!. We played the 1984 game, and had an ace time. David was a really good host. The attention to detail made was brill, and we would definitely recommend. Thanks!

Awesom!!. The best way to have an hour of total fun!! The owner is super nice and the location is amazing! We tried 1984 room and we were so excited, that the following day we tried to escape from the circus room!

School trip. We were a group of 6 people and decided to try out this Escape Room Game. It was awesome! Really challenging and catching! We had a great time and a lot of fun. The owner is super nice and makes you feel at ease. If you are planning a trip to Budapest you can't miss this adventure, I really recommend it!!
Good escape room. Some rooms are very interesting, challenging enough had a great time thereOne of the best we did in Budapest. Close to the bars too :)

Everyone should go to this one! . We went to the circus one and has so much fun!! We were all laughing and the clues weren't easy but not impossible! If your looking for a first time escape game or even just a fun time this is the place to go!

cool atmosphere, neat puzzles. Took the 10 a.m. spot - maybe a bit too early, but there's ever too much to see in this city! Did escape after 55 minutes, needed a little help (that's normal) which came in just the right amount. The puzzles are not too linear (one after another), which I appreciate in my escape experiences - good design. Atmosphere and building are very cool, the staff was very friendly and helpful (thanks, David). Just one thing: the integration of the story/narrative itself could have been better.

another awesome escape experience. We had an awesome time in both escape rooms. Staff was very friendly and flexible. After we finnished the first escape room, we decided to make the second room as well. The difficulty was just right for us.
Great game. We did the terror circus and had loads of fun supposedly the other room "1984" is even better great value! David is patient and great to deal with go!

Great value for money !. Really great game!Very friendly and helpful staff that advised us which game to play.We went for the 1984 room and we were able to finish it 4 mins before the end ( with a healthy portion of stress).The enigmas were really challenging and funny. And the game is really cheap compared to other exit games (for a couple it was around 25 euro's in total).A real highlight for budapest !

A YES to do in Budapest! . We played the circus room game this morning (team of 2). The staff really helpful and the game fully explained beforehand. The room was challenging but fun, although we didn't manage to get out it was still a fun experience! Would come back to try the 1984 room abd the friendly staff mentioned a third escape room that is currently being built! A must do in Budapest!!!

Great game!. The clues were difficult which was good and the whole game (1984 room) is really stimulating+exciting. Nice decoration, clever references and helpful stuff speaking good English (David). Recommended!

Very exciting and simulating !. We did the 1984 game in a 2-people-team and we really enjoyed it ! Many winks to the book and movie; the enigmas are hard enough to stimulate our minds. Fortunately, we can rely on small hints in case we're stuck ! And a good thing is : if you don't have enough time to finish the game within the 60 min time limit, the staff will give you a few extra minutes to have the satisfaction of finishing it. Overall, a very good experience, I can only recommend it :)

Top. my friend and I did the circus game. it was fantastic. still cant believe that we actually did it. wasnt easy. guys, like REALLY do it!!!! definately worth it. the stuff was cool... he actually was very nervous to talk english, but he did very well! thanks
Exit was not that easy. Absolutely fantastic experience. The staff was really helpful. The clues were not easy to find. Really enjoyed it. Definitely one of the best attractions in Budapest.
Very nice game. We did it and it was fun. The electric passed out but not they fault. I and my kids had a lot of fun. It is quite complicated but very nice decorated. We did the 1984. Thanks
Great place . The puzzles were great and the staff were very friendly. I went with a friend and we had a lot of fun. Would definitely go again.

Escape room first timers. Rainy morning our last day in Budapest so we decided to try an escape room. Never having been to one before, we weren't sure what to expect but this was a great and very quick way to spend an hour. Without help, I'm not sure we would have gotten out of the 1984 room. In fact, without help, I'm not sure we would have gotten in! Good fun and definitely worth a visit.

heart pounding and exciting. It's a great place to go with your friends to do something fun and exciting. We went to both 1984 and the circus room and they were both mind blowing and challenging! I definitely recommend you to go if you are looking for an alternative way to spend time in Budapest.친구들과 재밌게 시간을 보낼수 있는 장소입니다! 꼭 한번 가보세요.

One of the best hours of our trip!. Cannot recommend this place highly enough!!! David is really friendly and helpful and the game is awesome! We had no idea but to expect and came out absolutely buzzing. If we had more time we would definitely have gone back for the circus game. An absolute must!!! Thank you, David!

So much fun!. This is great! A must do, we went as escape game novices and did the circus room not having quite grasped the concept, so safe too say we were rubbish and failed miserably. However we had so much fun that we went back the next day and did the 1984 room which we beat with 10 seconds to spare. I can't recommend these enough so much fun, really clever, so affordable and the people were lovely! A must do in Budapest!

So fun & thrilling!. It was my first time at an Escape Game, and I loved every minute! It was challenging, thought provoking, and a really great and exciting way to spend the afternoon with some friends. We were four in total, and the price was good for this many people. We were able to solve the 1984 mystery room with minimal help in the time allotted. Highly recommend for small groups of people. Such a unique idea! Staff was really helpful. We will definitely go back.

Great stop in Budapest. We had a great time at the E-Exit Escape Game. We had heard about escape games before, but hadn't tried one ourselves. We did some research, and when we saw the setup here we knew we had to try it. It was challenging and a lot of fun for four friends to do on a rainy afternoon. I would definitely recommend E-Exit Escape Game if you are visiting Budapest and want to fill an hour or two of your day.

Fun and well organised puzzles! . A great and interesting way to spend an evening in budapest with some firends, no need to know how to speak hungarian to solve the puzzles. Rooms are clever and unique. David= best G.M.! Thank you!

Super fun and freaky circus game. I was here my boyfriend and it was our first escape game. Difficult level was perfect and the staff was helpful and very nice. It was also affordable compared to others in Budapest. Would definitely recommend it!

Really fun! Something a bit different!. We had a great time solving the 1984 mystery rooms. David was a fantastic help and very friendly and made us feel so welcome! Thank you for a fun afternoon of something we haven't ever tried before. Definitely recommend :)

Fun & Thrilling. Me and a group of Swedish friends had so much fun at this escape place. We felt indeed welcomed and got good instructions from a very nice guy. A very fun, stressful (in a good way) and thrilling experience and very authentic setting. We did the circus room which was just enough tricky, so sad we didn't have time for the other one. Highly recommend this place!

Fun and challenging in the centre of the Jewish quarter. This was our first escape game and we did need a little help but it was a heap of fun and we have endeavoured to do a few more of these. We Noticed the staff also did well to accomodate children who did not wish to partake and they seemed like really nice guys. Would recommend

So much fun!. It was our first time on a escape room and we liked it so much that we went into the other room as well. We managed to escape from both of them on time but it was quite challenging and we were 6 people. The 1984 room was our favourite although we really enjoyed both of them. Our operator David was very nice and explained us everything perfectly.

MUST . Was travelling with my family, it was our first experience and we had such a great time!!!Did both rooms the 1984 and the circus, it was interesting, challenging, great vibe. we were very impressed. Strongly recommend if you are visiting Budapest to try at least one of he rooms. The stuff was amazing. We came tired after a long day and left satisfied with a good memory.

Excellent!!! . We made the two games they have 1984 and the circus. We loved it! Very well designed and it was really clever. We tried another game in city called enigma and although they have a lot of technology this one has music in the background, smart clues and a good story to follow... Highly recommended...

1984... Big Brother is watching you!!. This was my first escape game experience and it was fantastic. Suitably challenging, ominous without being scary (I am very easily startled). Had we not overlooked one key component toward the end, we would've made it just under the 60-minute allotted time. The experience was well-conceived, and it was fun to solve the puzzles as a team. I would highly recommend this to anyone interested in escape games. The proprietors are friendly and enthusiastic, and I look forward to going back to try their other game.

Big Brother is watching you. Excellent activity. The attention to detail with props and puzzles is fantastic. The atmosphere is brilliant, with the ide of escape being used really well with the ideas of entrapment in 1984. A must for visitors. Friendly staff and dictator sometimes helping on the outside too

Very challenging, well thought out and Lots of fun! (Though big brother wouldn't be happy about all the fun lol!). This place was bloody brilliant! Never been to an escape game before but I think we started with the best one! I looked online at the selection of games available in Budapest and this seemed like best value for money and we weren't disappointed! We did the 1984 game as the guy recommended it as the most challenging. It was just me and my gf facing the puzzling world of big brother and I have to say it was a good test on how we can solve problems together lol! We eventually made it to freedom but took a little longer than an hour (was really hard!). Anytime we got really stuck we had little helping hints from 'big brother' who was monitoring us through the cameras.The setting felt very 1984ish and commie music played through the speakers adding to the atmosphere.An excellent game for anyone visiting Budapest. Highly recommended.We're looking forward to trying new escape games but this one will be the benchmarking to which all the rest will be compared. Thanks E-exit! Dan and Fab (English and Italian couple)

Brilliant time. We found this place recommended through a backpackers guide where several were on offer but so glad we chose this one! We went for the 1984 theme and had a brilliant time. The staff were helpful and when we didn't manage to complete it in time due to a faulty torch they gave us a new torch and let us continue over the time. I also left my phone behind there and when we rung up to see where it was they were very helpful.

Escape terrible circus. Me and my friends were very well welcomed in this place. The guy is really nice and the place is very well done !You have 1 hour to escape the room and we were all very in the game during this hour. But choose 1984 if you want more difficulties.

An hour of tricky puzzles and entertaining challenges. We found this place here on Tripadvisor, and booked the "1984" because I had read the book and found the theme tempting.
The puzzles were good and challenging, and we almost used all the time up.
The setting and the

A visit from Sweden . Me and my partner have visited escape games in several European cities before, and this one turned out a clear favourite. We took on the 1984-challenge and had a solid hour of suspense and fun. The setting was different from any room we'd done before, and the riddles were a challenge even though we have comepleted many rooms in the past. We'd really like to recommend E-Exit to both old and new escape artists :)

Escape 1984. Myself and another traveller gave the 1984 escape a go for two people who didn't know each other well was a bit difficult I could see this would be really fun if there was a group of friends doing this. But the concept is great and the codes you have to think outside to decipher the codes.
Funniest ever. We did room 1984 and circus and they were both super funny. I can't unfortunately not return to this one, since I have done all rooms but can defiantly recommend it!

One of the better ones in town. I would call myself a veteran when it's about Escape games, I've done over 15 places and over 25 escape games already. This one was one of the best I've been in so far both of the rooms were extremely good. Good value for your money, English explanations and staff.

Really fun and challenging!. i had heard alot of good and bad things about the escape rooms but this one looked allright and was pretty cheap, it was deffinitly worth the money, 3 of us did it and we had so much fun trying to figure our way out of the room, we got abit stuck but there is cameras so they can give you a bit of a push in the right direction over the speakers, we were very hungover which didnt really help.David was the bloke looking after us and he was a legend!

Nice Experience. I visited with 3 more friends, all with some previous experience with escape rooms. The 1984 game itself was fun, nice riddles and very much in theme. There was a lot of “code searching” for different locks, not a lot of technology there. The operators were very welcoming and the room is located in an easy to get to area.
Great place. It was our first escape game experience. Lot of fun and challenges and the operator was very kind and supportive

Amazing time!!!,. Being there was very interesting and the game was cool and fun but at the same time hard work,especially for your brain,for find the way out....Everyone should try it!!,it's an amazing experience for who never tried!!!

Fun and challanging. We had a lot of fun escaping the 1984-themed room. It was very creative and quite challenging. David (our operator) was great. At one point we needed assistance, but the speaker through which we were supposed to hear him stopped working, but other than that we had a great time!
Exit game. A great game...hard work getting out but worth the time and money!!Lovely people help you go through...Something you should try while being in Budapest!!
Fun times. Great laugh! A group of 4, did both of the rooms. 1984 was the more challenging but both were equally fun :)Highly recommend!!

Fun afternoon!. Great fun and well-thought out 1984 room! Two of us went and the owner was really friendly with facilitating our game. He also gave us hints towards the end while we were stuck without ruining the challenge! We really enjoyed our day and hope to come back for the other rooms in future! :)

Fun and different. This escape game was so much different than the other i have experienced. We did the cirkus and i laughed in the second half of the game because of the tou animals we were saving. The riddles are fine byt the 5 stars is because og its original

an awesome experience. the 4 of us got into the game 1984 big brother edition, and we enjoyed every minute of it. tje game was thrilling, and very different -in a good way - from the other one we tried earlier.the extra items made us think more than the straight forward versions where everything. was a clue and you needed to use everythig. it was more challenging and felt like real investigation.I can only recommend it, totally worth the time and money

Absolutely amazing!. We visited the 1984 room, and we had a blast! It was so well thought out, and our gamemaster, David, was the kindest and most helpful person. He gave us the clues we asked for but otherwise didn't interfere with our game. Afterwards we stayed and talked for a bit and he told us more about the room. We will definitely come back and try the circus room, and we recommend this to anyone! The room was so interesting, and the service was incredible!We were only two people, but we managed to escape the room with only five minutes to spare so it can be done even if you're only a small group!
"Got us thinking". This was out second time playing a game like this! It was really interesting and fun. Staff were great! Would definitely recommend!

Brilliant escape room!. We completed the Terrible Circus room and loved it! We may have needed 2 clues but that's only because it was late at night and we were tired (swear)! I preferred this to the one we done in Prague mostly because it wasn't as scary so it was slightly easier to concentrate!
Challenging and exciting till the end!. Helpfull and kind staff. Surprisingly much challenging clues and puzzles. Good price also. Didn't expect this when walking in.

Very fun experience. I was not entirely sure what to expect, but it was in fact very fun! there were only two of us giving the circus theme room a go and it was actually very challenging but not stupidly difficult to make it not fun! if you have a group of people and a spare couple hours to kill then you should give it a try! Plus if you do get stuck the guy will offer a helping hand!

Awesome!. I didn't know what to expect but this was brilliant! Creative and very clever puzzles that are extremely satisfying to complete. The hosts were welcoming and friendly with well timed and helpful clues when we needed them. A great way to spend an hour and I wish we'd been in Budapest for longer to do their other game!

Above and beyond expectation. No matter how long or short you are visiting Budapest you have to include E-Exit in your itinerary! The staff is very catering, details are very well thought out, price is definitely affordable and best of all you are guaranteed to enjoy yourself! and end up going back for more.
Creative, with a soul. The staff is very friendly and helpful.The worlds they created are truly magical, they paid attention to every detail. 1984 is the best room-escape I have ever been to.

Extremely fun game, helpful staff!!. My two friends and I went to e-exit today and had an absolute blast. It was a fun and stimulating game that provided a great challenge for our minds. The staff were very helpful and courteous. I highly recommend trying this out. It's not your typical activity but it is certainly worth a try.

Very good and exciting . So it was our first escape game for my girlfirend and I, and following the numerous positives recommandations on TripAdvisor we decided to went there. We did the 1984 room, it was quite difficult but really fun, and the receptionist helped us when we where blocked, thanks to him for his help and his patinece To sum up a good discover and a very fun time. If you want to do something different than the traditional must see in Budapest go there !

AWESOME. It was my first escape the room game, and it couldn't be better! A loot of puzzles, lockers and fun!! We had a lil help from outside but only when we were completely lost ! Toootaly recommend! And the couple who owm the place were also really sweet and gave us discount because of the one-anniversary of the place!
amazing!!. must try it!! 1984 game is amazing, i'de recomand to do it in a group of 3+ (we were 2 and couldnt finish it on time :() i'de defenatly come back next time i visit budapesht

Thrilling and clever!! Our best experience in Budapest. LOVED IT!!! This was an AMAZING experience for us! We did the 1984 theme - because we love the book - and it was no disappointment. The game was very clever and exciting, not too easy and David was good at giving clues when needed, still not helping us too much. And he let us finish the game because no one was behind us (we didn't quite make it in time)! This was our first time trying an escape game, and we loved it so much, we booked another one for the next day. Sadly, David's Circus wasn't available (we were leaving the same day so we had little time) and we took one listed as a 'top 5' on welovebudapest travel guide. It was also fun - but the E-EXIT one was SOOOO much better!! It is more difficult, more clever, more 'real' than the other one we tried. I would DEFINITELY recommend E-Exit if you are a beginner (Like us) or experienced escapist,because in comparison to the other came, it was a much more authentic experience!
1984. We had a date night with my husband, and this was the best program we could choose :) It was exciting and fun, to find our way out!

Find the numbers, open the locks. There was me, my boyfriend and one guy that came in alone. It was his first escape game and our second.We did the Circus Room which was a well decorated room but not very challenging. It was basically finding numbers and opening locks, not much besides that. The recepcionist (jack or jackie) was a very nice girl who spoke good english though :)
Best escap game . Just wanna say thank you. This game is not too easy and not too difficult eather. My girlfriend and I had lots of fun today.

Nice experience, great challenge. The escape room we did (1984) was very nice. Quite challenging, but hey, that's the idea. The room was well decorated and the people that welcomed us and showed us around were friendly. Would recommend this escape room to everyone!

Great experience!. It was our first time ever doing an escape game and Budapest is the ideal place to discover this kind of game. We went to E-Exit and really enjoyed it. The puzzles are very interesting and so is the atmosphere.We enjoyed more the 1984 room, because we are huge fans of Orwell writings, but the Circus was also very well made. Thank you for this dicovery!
Amazing game! 100% recommend!. Went here with my boyfriend and had the best time! Very fun and clever. Would definetly recommend this for any person without a doubt!

Great atmosphere!. We did both scenarios suggested here, and can definitely recommend both :) Various tasks, amazing soundrack and perfect atmosphere! I think 4 people is max for each scenario, though.

Great experience! . We did a hour escape game in the 1984 themed room. There were five of us and we all found it so much fun it isn't easy or impossible and it is very out the box. We missed the time limit by a few minutes and it was so intense. They are really well planned out and David who did it for us was a lot of fun and we wish we could of stayed and done more.

It was so good, We done it again.. We went to escape the room with friends we met at our hostel whilst in Budapest. The circus experience was so good we came back for more. David the man in charge was amazing and very friendly. I would definitely say I've caught the escape the room bug. Thanks for the experience.

Great escape rooms!. Similar to what another reviewer said this was also me and my groups 2nd ever escape room. We had booked to do the Horrible Circus themed room but also ended up doing the other room called 1984 as it was free. Both Escape Rooms were really well done and both very unique in their own way, it's very hard to pick a favourite! The staff member was very helpful and friendly, he even asked if he could take a photo for us to be put on the website for completing both rooms which was nice :)Highly recommended!

First time trying an escape game, not disappointed . We generally like to try things a little different and being from dublin I have never heard of an escape room game. While looking through things of interest I came across these places. The first few where impossible to get appointments but when I called here David gave clear directions and a good time slot. Not sure what to expect we weren't disappointed and as David said if this is your first time you'll be hooked. I won't give too much away other than say it was the highlight of our trip and well worth a try. Great host, great fun! Book now and try it out

Definitely recommend!. This was my second time doing an escape game (I did one in the UK before) and really enjoyed it. This one was even better!There were loads of options for escape games in Budapest, this one was recommended by our hostel and already had great reviews.Great 1984 theme, friendly staff. Was really well thought out and decorated.Really, really enjoyed it!
Cool!. It was my first escape, but I enjoyed it so much! - ez volt az első menekülő szobás élményem, de nagyon tetszett, bátran ajánlom bárkinek!

A Great Experience. My friends and I had a blast at e-exit escape. We did the 1984 game and it was a lot of fun. You use clues and logic to find your way out of locked rooms. The atmosphere is relaxed and friendly and it's a great experience.

Great, affordable fun! . This escape room was excellent! The design of the 1984 room was so good and had so many unexpected elements. There were plenty of decoy clues, and the hints were only given if you asked for them. This meant it felt like more of an achievement than just being fed clues like some rooms do. The staff were so lovely, which made the whole experience that much better. I would absolutely recommend this room!!
Gameday. This was a fantastic experience! Fantastic place, awesome game and flawless service! Go go go play!!

Best way to spend the 60minutes in Budapest! . If you have an hour to spend , e.g. Waiting for the airport shuttle, there's no other way to spend it by playing the escape game!I originally booked the 1984 escape game for my husband birthday, and we loved it so much that we immediately booked the circus game for next day before our flight home!The staff: customer service is second to none! We didn't quite finish the 1984 but he let us finish it anyway. And when we book the circus game we have some time constraint, but he's happy to work around us to make sure it fits our schedule!The game: the detail and the wit of it will impress you for a long time, it's an experience you won't forget easily! The design of the game really blowed our minds away!We personally love the 1984 better, but then you have to find out yourselves by trying them both!

Perfect for tourist seeking a new kind of adventure in Budapest. A very well thought through game with a lot of attention to detail.If you are looking to experience a new side of what is cool in Budapest this is the place to go!Very creative room themes. We tried the circus, but will be definitely back to try the other room!
1984. awesome logic games! really enjoyed it with my friends to find hints and get out of the room :) i can really recommend it fit everyone who likes quests!

Excellent game and excellent customer service. I'm an English girl living in Budapest. This is my fourth escape game in Budapest and was by far the best, we did the Haunted circus. It looked great, it was difficult but doable and really fun. Not only that but it was the cheapest and had the best customer service. David made us feel really welcome, there were no rules about not taking pictures like at some of the others and help in the game was optional. This was a huge plus. Other companies give help if you like it or not and sometimes it felt like they were trying to get us through quickly. Not so with E-Exit...if you only try one try this one. .we're going back soon to try their 1984 game.

Wow, you have to try it !. I just took a short walk in the downtown with my girlfriend last Sunday. We were looking a new open pubs but find something new, somthing not ordinary. It was the E -exit room .I said that we have to try it! It was a unique and cool experience to escape from the circus and save the animals. The ownwer was really nice and helpfull .Thanx the one hour thrill :-).I recommend for everyone.

It's been fun, totally recommended!. It hasn't been my first escape experience so I can surely say it is well done. We were a team of 5 which proved to be just the right number to work together efficiently. We enjoyed it a lot and talked about it long after we'd left. So many witty, little details...!

Fun Escape Room! we had a great time :). It was new for us, and we loved it. The staff explained us the rules in English and we were ready to go. If you're looking for a special experience for your holiday, that's the one!

Great Fun. I came here with just my husband. I was a but apprehensive at first (i.e. being locked in a room, in a foreign country.....and paying for it!) but I had nothing to worry about. We played the circus game which was really fun and lasts about an hour. You don't need to know any Hungarian to complete the game as it mainly puzzles, keys, numbers etc. The manager speaks good English and is very friendly. We came here on our last day in Budapest and so dragged our suitcases with us which was not a problem as the manager stored them for us while we played the game.Highly recommended and something a bit different to do in Budapest.
Super fun highly recommended. We were a group of 6 visiting Budapest and decided to do this - super fun! One of the best things we did in Budapest highly recommended!
BRILLIANT!. Absolutely brilliant experience! If your in Budapest make sure you take time to do this. So challenging but so fun and exhilarating!
Amazing adventure. We went to e-exit twice.We were in the 1984 and the circus and both of them were a fantastic experience.The staff are very nice too.

Super fun!. We did this as a couple. Really nice personal and we had so much fun! We did take the 1984 room, this was the first room ever for us, but with tips we did get it, not in time, but they did let as finish it!

Quality. This was awesome, we got out with a min to spare. I can recommend this to anyone. We went to a few during out trip to budapest and this was by far the best one!!Really nice guys who run it, Thanks again!

Really fun and beautiful!. This was the first escape room we went to. I have to say this was the nicest looking room we've been to. Attention to details and very colorful! This room however was more 'loot the room and use speed' - it didn't require almost any logic( unlike the other 2 escape rooms we have visited that required a lot of riddle solving). This was so much fun and also different and the guys there were really nice, attentive and professional.

Awesome and fun, you won't regret it. Me and my boyfriend tried the 1984 room and it was really great. The decoration was spot on, it really got you in the mood, and the clues were well thought. The staff was really cool and helpful, really nice people. Besides, you don't have to know hungarian to play.

awesome circus game. this was like my 8th game and I have to say it's one of my favourites! the decoration and theme were really cool There's heating here and the lounge area has also been decorated! The game is a lot of fun. The ambiance and music both match the circus theme. You can feel that they have carefully selected the items and don't just wanna make money real fast now that these exit games have become so popular and seem to pop up all over town. The game involved more mechanical things, I prefer that. If you want a more difficult game try 1984. We're going there soon :)

Good experience. .. We booked the "Circus" game at our last day in Budapest and we really enjoyed it. It was very interesting and as we have played before in other games I think you have to use your brain more. We would also like to go to the next room "1984" but unfortunately we had no time. You must go..

Adventure time. We were really fun. We chose circus game, I feel like at "Saw Movie". It was creative game, be careful you have to evaluate all clue. We were two family with three kids. Kids also fun when were playing. they loved save the animals. Strongly recommended.. Try it not only one game try all game :)

Awesome Escape Room!. My husband gave a review already but I just wanted to add a couple things. This was the first escape room I had ever visited and I am now hooked! It was creative, well thought-out, and exciting. As a first timer, I was concerned it would be a problem that I don't speak Hungarian, but that didn't matter at all. So exciting, I highly recommend it!

Well thought out escape room, friends and I had a blast!. Went to E-Exit last night with some friends and had an absolute blast! They have two escape rooms that are very challenging but beatable. We escaped the first room with just over 5 minutes left and the second with right around ten. I liked the 1984 room better by both were great fun. If you are looking for a great way to spend a few hours give this a try!
Well put together. My friends and I went here after we had enjoyed claustrophilia. We thought this was more imaginative and generally better thought out. We really enjoyed it. Ideal for four people.

If you want an Escape game you MUST try this.. We ended going to this escape game when one of the ones we booked appeared to be closed. I must admit, I didn't have high hopes for it as there wasn't many reviews of it and their website wasn't the best, especially as they had space for us on the same day but this ended up being one of the better escape games we have taken part in. (Whilst we were in Budapest we did 4). The atmosphere was fantastic, a little bit creepy and scary (but that's part of the fun), the puzzles harder than other games we have done (perhaps a little hard for just two people) but I would definitely recommend it! The guys who run it are lovely and their little dog is the cutest, if you want to do an escape game definitely give these guys chance.

Great fun for all. I took my girlfriend there as a surprise birthday present. Exciting, intriguing experience that was well worth the money! A really well-designed, fun room. The people running it are kind, friendly and give you only enough tips to push you in the right direction. Recommend you go with four or more people!

Cryptic challenges!. We booked the Pharoahs Chamber as a little something different to do, and we were so excited afterwards, we went straight in and did the Samurai Warrior one! There were 6 of us and we all love a challenge. Staff were on hand via radio to offer help if required and there was a panic button if anyone started to get claustrophobic, but we found that it was fine.The game was challenging enough for 6 adults and the room was very authentic. The price was great and we would have spent all weekend doing the different rooms, but felt we should actually go and see the city!

Best ever - great game :-). We really enjoied this romms. The game master was great and tipped us along.We were two groups of six. Team building - we wanted to practice teamwork, problem solving and commitment. We were in an Egyptian room and a chapel.Everyone was surprised how exciting it was.

Lot's of fun and orginal mind challenges. Our family (4) did the Shogun's Shadow room, which was great! we've done a few escape rooms before so we had experience, and this one wasn't easy at all! had to work in parallel. the decoration was very good and the puzzles and problems we faced had some very original, great ones! we finished it successfully though. the team was very helpful

Best fun ever!. We weren't sure if we would like this but decided to try it anyway. Well, I'm glad we did! It was such fun. A very reasonably priced hour of fun. The idea is to figure out clues and puzzles to complete tasks to get out of the room.For example, an infrared light may show a padlock combination on the wall or the correct placement of a found artefact may reveal another clue. If you get stuck, there are cameras and speakers in the room so the person at the desk helps you or you can ask for help.Two of us did this, and it would also be fun for groups and all ages. There are different rooms of varying degrees of difficulty, we did the easiest one.This is definitely an attraction worth going to.

Rookies on the board. It was a very good experience. Just wait for the next oppotunity to continue the discovery of the mysteries. The staff was enthusiastic and helpful as well.Although our team is a "freshman" in exit games, we really enjoyed it.

Great game. We really enjoied this room, great puzzles and great atmosphere. Suitable for beginners and groups with children (assuming the children are not spooked by creepy music and some darknes). The game master was also great with mostly providing enough clues at the right places without spoiling the game for us. It might be a bit to easy for more expirianced players.
Solved the Shoguns shadow. Best game that I've been. Hard enough to get you thinking that it can't be done. Friendly and helpful staff.
Great location. Visited with colleagues and it was quite challanging. Very good organization, lot of fun in a great location.
great fun. VR @Mystique is funI especially enjoyed playing in a teamThe venue is also uniue - huge cellar underneath central Budapest
Excellent adventure. They were very kind and helpfull. The room was not too easy, we could solve it in the last five minutes. Thank you
Fun virtually. Was good idea.great entertainment but easy tasks.we were celebrating a Birthday .was funny to see each other wired
fantastic. My first expereience with escape rooms and I got addicted - we are trying now all the rooms, because it's such an adventure! Thank you to the organisators for the authentic environment!
Mystique Room. We were in 2 rooms: The Cathedral and Egyptian burial chamber. They were very interesting and exciting. The staff was very kind.
Cosmos Virtual Reality. It was an amazing time in a 3D virtual world. We played four of us, and we had to help each other in order to get out.
Great fun. We really enjoyed two escape rooms here. Really well designed. Shogun room was great for those with a bit of experience whilst pharaoh room was quite a bit easier.

excellent program. Fantastic programme for the whole family! The staff is very kind and helpful! Perfect location. The rooms are lovely furnished, the keys and codes well hidden, not very easy and not too difficult. Excellent for young children and their parents:)

Recommendation. Excellent place and and really enjoyable, absolutely recommended. Just one adverse remark (although it is totally subjective): 1 hour was a bit too short for such a lot of tasks so we lacked half an our bonus time.

Fun time!. Two of us did the Shogun room... and it was fun! We've done Room Escapes in various cities, but this was the first time in Budapest. Booking was easy via email but you couldn't pay online (would have been nice). We were in the last room of the night, so we were the only room going on at the time. The staff woman was very friendly and made us feel welcome. The room had many different kinds of puzzles to solve, which made it more entertaining! You are given hand radios so the staff can offer you clues or you can ask for help - as often as you want. We had a little help when we were really stuck.We were able to escape - even though we didn't open every lock we found. This was our favorite experience in Room Escape - and we would definitely go back to this location!
Great game!. Good time, nice place, excellent puzzles. Beautiful interior and friendly staff. We like wery much. Thanks.

smart puzzles and high quality set-up. I have visited more than 15 escape-rooms in Budapest and this one is in the top of them.Smart puzzles, high quality set-up and frendly staff. It is not the cheapest one, but it worth it's cost.They have multiple rooms, for me the best one is the oriental, than the egypt and the less interesting was the cathedral.

THE BEST IN BUDAPEST!. I have tried most of the top Escape Games in Budapest and Mystique is definitely the best by far. The games are not only well designed puzzles, but also incredibly beautifully built sets that tell a story and draw you in to the thematic experience. You can tell that the guys who build and run the rooms love what they do and have an almost supernatural attention to detail. Beyond that, the rooms are all clean and well maintained and the staff have top of the line monitoring systems and give you just the right amount of help... if you need it. Mystique sets the bar very high for the rest of the Budapest Escape Room scene to try to reach their standards.
it was fun. The escape room Shogun is truly beautiful. We had a lot of fun finding clues. Hope to go back for another escape in another room.

Really awesome escape room!. The setting, the decor, the puzzles and the ambiance of the room were all excellent. Easy to get to using public transport -- a good level of difficulty, and options for games to play. We played the monastery room, but got a sneak peek at the Japanese room and that looked very cool too. Great way to spend your time :)

Two wonderful rooms. I've played all their rooms, but the Japanese one and the medieval one are the best. The Egypt one is not bad either, but compared to the medieval room, it stands no chance :) Decor and atmosphere are excellent in their rooms, puzzles are diverse and some quite unique and game masters are really nice.

Our first escape!. Friends recommended this as a fun thing to do. They live in the city and took us to this one. You have one hour to "break out" of the room by solving a series of puzzles with clues you find. There were 6 of us, and we broke out in about 40 mins or so. It was a lot of fun. Highly recommend if you've not tried this before, and if you need a good group activity (or team building exercise). Not necessarily good for young kids, or anyone who is claustrophobic.

Great fun. That was an amazing experience! The stuff is very friendly and the game was interesting and challenging! We had the egyptian room. The stuff helps when you get stuck but let enough time to think by yourself. Would definitely do it again if I come back to Budabest

Escape room The Cathedarl and Japan. Amazing!!! The best escape room in Budapest!! the decoration and the games are really good!!! We enjoyed a lot doing these escpaes and we recommend them everybody!
Nice escape room. We liked Chatedral escape room, however our team is an experienced one, so we found it a bit too easy for us. Excellent for beginners, loved the Egypt room even more.

Amazing Escaperoom. We did the Cathedral and Japan Escape, and both were amazing. The decoration of the place is incredible and the games are really funny.I recommend to everyone this experience!!!!!!Escape room increible, de los mejores que he hecho, tanto la decoración como los juegos son muy buenos, no hay que perderselo!!!!

Lost in space, literally. Fantastic experience!you almost feel like you are stuck in space!! Recommended.PS: prepare yourself for some motion sickness too as with lot of movement for eyes its natural to get it. not a big deal, but just remember to have lots of fluid before and after.

Good fun. They have three escape rooms here, we did the pharaohs tomb and cathedral rooms. Good fun and the pharaohs tomb had a couple of puzzles that we found difficult which made it all the more interesting.
The staff were helpful and spoke good English which was a relief.

Shogun's Shadow better than Pharaos's Burial Chamber. We have visited 2 rooms and the experience was very different. Both rooms contain a lot of different riddles using various mechanisms. The Japanese room has a good flow of game, while I cannot say the same for Egyptian room, where there is a lot of clues demanding to much guessing with no rational behind it. The flow was also seen in focus of the children. The rating goes for Shogun's Shadow room. Pharaos's Chamber would get ration of Average.

The best escape game what we have ever played.. Mystique Room is a very good place to take a time with friends or family. This is one of the top places where we can play escaping games. The game story was brilliant and complicated enough to play it as a team. The game was a challenge and was good activity to make ourselves contribute as a team. We managed to escape. We loved each minutes of the game. The place is very clean and well-managed
family fun in Budapest. Good time for family including teen and preteen. Challenging in the right way for both for children and adults.

Fantastic activity - PHARAOH'S BURIAL CHAMBER. Set looked amazing. The puzzle had great variety in terms of what was required. The difficulty level was fair. Great for a small or large number of people. Shame we didn't try out some of the other rooms.

Rain and only a couple of hours. It was raining, so we looked for activities we could do without getting wet. Not willing to go to another exhibition, we found the advert of Mystique Room on the back of a map. The booking was easy: we just checked, if any room was available on their website and just called them. You can reach it pretty easily from Nyugati station, it's just down the street. Now regarding the game itself: The rooms (we chose the cathedral) were built and decorated nicely and the tasks you have to solve, can be done by everyone. You get help, if you have problems somewhere. We were three persons and it nearly took us one hour to escape, though I think it can be done quicker especially when you are more persons. The woman that worked there that time was really friendly and spoke good english. The prize is also very fair, so if you have one hour in Budapest to spare and want to do something new, you should definitely visit Mystique Room.

Bachelorette party. We really enjoyed the game "Katedrális", but I recommend you to limit the numer of people playing at the same time. As we were 7, I did not even realize some solutions. Anyway it was challenging and interesting, I would recommend it to my friends!

Had fun, but more instruction would be helpful. The room has excellent design, you feel really in a pyramid :) The keys are hard to find, but you can escape in a reasonable time. When we could go any further, we asked for a little help. This is the only negative point in the game: the instructor could not give hints. She just told what to do (where to find the key), not helping with little steps.
Very Enjoyable. We were 6 friends who did this escape game in what I understand to be the first home of escape games. This one was loads of fun with some very unique features.
great. this is a great escape game. recommend for everybody! the game was exciting, the stuff was nice and flexible.

shogun. Unfortunately it did not work the lights when we were there , so I had a cell phone with lights , making it difficult task. The assistants are very nice and helpful they were , the game exciting and difficult, but possible. We had fun. We tested the virtual room , which is still under development , and we want to try in the future Pharaoh well. It was great fun , thanks. Congratulation.
Love it!. Very interesting room(s) in egyptian style with great atmosphere and hidden objects. There are also very cool decoys that actually make sense.
Great escape room. This escape room is well located, nice staff and we could even book few hours before attending! perfect.
Monks in style. Brilliant time in the Cathedral room. Mix of ages who all enjoyed it (7 to 46 years). Highly recommend.
Great . We tried two rooms: Shogun's and The Cathedral, there are very beautiful. The riddles are well done and the atmosphere it's wonderful. Very pleasure time

Pharaon's Burial Chamber. This was the first time me and my girlfriend went into an escape room. We chose Mystique Room based on reviews from the TripAdvisor and I have to say that the experience was fantastic. The room had a great decor. It was real fun to get around the room and look for hints & clues. Also, the staff was really nice and helpful (they even suggested a great restaurant to us). All in all, it was a great experience, although, I think that the room could do with a little refresh, especially some signs/clues on the game objects were quite worn off (but not to an unbearable level though)

mystique room Budapest, the pharaos tomb. Perfect setting, exciting storyline, difficult enough, but not impossible to follow the clues and escape from the room. A really enjoyable hour, everyone should try it!

Amaxing. We did a few other escape games in Budapest before we attempted here- we did Shagun Shadow and The catherderal. Both were beautifully designed, and decorated. We thoroughly enjoy these rooms- however we did come across some issues puzzles. one room we did not have a key- another room we were able to escape without completing the actually puzzles (I think there was an issue with the door handles). However I would still recommend a visit!

Virtual Reality Room. It was on of my first escape games and I can tell, it was a strong start! It was fun to learn how to interact with my avatar and work as a team to escape alive. A very unique experience, everybody should try it:)

All rooms are great. I've been to 3 of their rooms already, and they are fantastic! The riddles are unique and interesting, everything worked without any problem. All of the rooms are really nicely decorated, they have a pleasant atmosphere. Best fun in town :)

Fantastic time. We had a fantastic time while trying out the new room. So far I never had any real virtual reality experience, this was my first time, but I feel that I am already a bit addicted to it. Also the game itself had lots of clever puzzles to solve, many that required cooperation with my teammates to a large extent thus it managed to pull in all the participants.
Good room. It is a good room and has one of the best design features I've seen so far. Nice guy to inform us about the room.Also there was good air in it which is an issue sometimes at other places.

Left this experience elated!. Stumbled upon this event in a list of "top 10" for Budapest. Friend and I travel a lot, so seeing the next museum isnt always the answer to a great time...but this definately WAS the answer. Enjoyed the experience immensely, and found the help and support of the staff to be right on with what we needed.

Virtual Reality Experience in Mystique Room. This place is definitely worth the visit if you're into gaming or problem solving in general. They have Egypt and Japan themed rooms, and they're all amazing, but the most stunning experience has to be their newest addition, the VR room. You can fly in space and shoot lasers while sitting comfortably in a chair. Since the VR is new technology I didn't expect much from the visuals, thinking it will be relatively simple. Actually it looked the same quality as a PC game. I've never tried the Oculus Rift before so I had no point of reference, but later I looked it up on the internet and watching different videos of VR games now I'm convinced that I had a totally unique experience. Avatarico's COSMOS seems to be a trailblazer even among VR games. I went to Mystique Room expecting the usual hour of fun, but I got even more. I'm still under its effect. I even looked up how much a VR set costs and what games I could play with it, but then realized that COSMOS was on a whole other level. As individual gamers, we probably won't be able to enjoy such games in our own home, so Mystique Room is worth the visit.

Shogun´s shadow: Very atmospheric interior with medium difficulty. We really loved the detailed and atmospheric interior! The puzzles are not technically mind blowing, but they fit the room´s theme very well. It has medium difficulty (we have played around 20 escape rooms so far).

Shogun's Shadow was Beautiful. The prettiest and most thorough theme we have ever played in an escape room. We have done many of these rooms throughout Europe and this was the best done theme we have seen. You really could be in Japan! The game itself was average difficulty and cleverness as far as these games go, but we cannot recommend this room more highly.

Best themed room ever!. Our group of 8 did the Egyptian themed room, and it was extraordinary! We really enjoyed it and made it out with 12 minutes to spare! The homemade items were very well done. I hope to be back some day!

Awesome Exit Game!. Our family did one exit game in the States before traveling to Hungary. There are so many exit games there, and the prices are great! We did Mystique Room. We had a group of 5 - 3 adults and 2 teens. We found it to be challenging, but not unbeatable. We did use a few clues and were able to get out in time. I would highly recommend this escape room!
Virtual excaping room. It was a unique experience when we sit dow the chairs and started to use Oculus Rift. We immersed in a fantastic virtual world with our avatars.

Amazing Virtual Reality experience!. It's been a while since my last visit, and I can say there has been a lot going on in Mystique Room.I was impressed with their new VR escape game. It's a truly amazing experience, absolutely recommended for everyone (not just for tech geeks like myself ;-) )The game involves immense teamwork, so there is no chance, that someone feels left out. It was fascinating to solve riddles in the virtual space, to interact with each other in this sci-fi "reality".The staff was kind and helpful, I'm looking forward for my next visit.

Virtual Exit Game!. It's fantastic! You have to sit down, you get a special glasses (you can put it above your own glasses :) ) and you find yourself in a fantasy word immediately. You feel yourself in the future, you can move in the word, you can see your partners, and you have to work together. We were two of us and we could complete the mission in 50 minutes.

Excellent game. It was an amazing and excellent game, the "quizmaster" very kind, the scenery imaginative, the game itself exciting. One of the best exitgames in Budapest. Ideal for friends, team-building or double dates as well.
