Cathedral. There was two of us attending the escape room called Cathedral. The decoration of the room itself was carried out in a sophisticated manner while the staff was kind and helpful. Great experience!
American Tourists and their Hungarian Friends. My teenager son and daughter and their friends really enjoyed the experience. They will go back again tomorrow to experience another room.

one of the best room escape in Budapest. beautiful execution, great ideas and puzzles, very friendly and motivated game master, i only tried the sogun room, but definatelly will go back to try the others
Superb fun for the second time as well. Friendly staff, nice interior. The Egyptian theme was really astonishing.We're definitely going back to play the other room(s). Thank you.

Really nice!. Very nice place! We hade only booked one of the three rooms but we liked that so much so we had to come back and do the other two!!All the rooms are really well designed and everything fits really good with their themes.
So much fun!!. Played this in a 2 person team and had so much fun!! Run by really lovely people, can't wait to come back and play the new rooms when they're built. Thank you so much!

Intriguing Archaeological Finds. My 14 year old son and I were enthralled by the story of the grandfather's study filled with clues to his life dedicated to Egypt and the journey to recover artifacts. The staff and game were exceptional. So much so, we want them to come to the Forest of Dean in England to set up something similar!

Good fun even with the little ones. Had done a few escape games but never with my kids. They are 5 and 3. But we decided to bring them along and they really enjoyed it. Thought they might be scared but they weren't and they even helped find things and figure things out. Good fun. Though the game was fun, the gamemaster was not very engaging or friendly.
Cathedral with kids. Escape room with small kids is an extra challenge...but they really enjoyed the Cathedral room and did't stop talking about it for few days.
Awesome!. Really good experience. Enjoyed the escape room and managed to get out in the hour but was very challenging and hilarious on a hangover!

Amazing Experience. We went to Mystique Rooms while away on a short break as a couple. We firstly completed the Egyptian room and had so much fun that we decided to do all of the games: the Cathedral game and the Japanese game. The games are exciting and challenging and were so much fun. I would highly recommend a visit here, as the staff were lovely and it was just so much fun and thrilling.
The Cathedral - Escape Room. A very well-designed escape room, with logical problems and puzzles. Beautiful setup as well. Highly recommended.
Pharao escape. The room was made very well. Some clues were hard to find but when you found them it was very logic. I would defenately recommend this room for everybody

Fantastic, friendly fun. My girlfriend and I had read about escape rooms being a big part of Budapest and had flicked through trip advisor before settling on Mystique rooms for our first time. So glad we did, the staff were amazingly helpful, guiding us through what we should expect of the puzzle and experience as a whole. The puzzle itself was challenging enough but not so far as to stop it being fun. The woman at the other end of the walkie talkie wasn't too quick to offer hints but also wouldn't let us wander round aimlessly wasting time. Really happy with our time there and only wished we had had enough time to do a second room.Very highly recommended!

Great game, solved it seconds before it finished. The Shogun challenge was a very well designed and laid out room with various interesting and cool puzzles to solve. It was way more challenging than we initially thought, and only managed to finish the room 20 seconds before the deadline.
Great escape game. It was a great game to play, the rooms are very nice and authentic! Thans for the experience, we'll come back for the other rooms!

Least favorite room in Budapest . This room is one of several that I tried in Budapest. We tried the pharaohs chamber thinking that it would be a good room since the company is so high ranked on trip advisor , but we were very disappointed.This may be a fun room for your first time but if you have been to other escape rooms, this is a kind of scavenger room with very few puzzles. Tired props thought the theme was fun. The progression was not the best either. Lots of looking and luck. Sadly, staff was unenthusiastic and generally unhelpful as well.There are too many great rooms and great companies in Budapest to visit this one. Try a smaller or cheaper company.

Authentically designed rooms. I have now played 22 escape rooms, in different countries. Here at Mystique we played the Egyptian room and then the Cathedral room. We really enjoyed both. They had put a lot of effort into the design of both rooms to create the right atmosphere. The puzzles were challenging enough to make us think without being too abstract. The communication when we needed a hint was good.
Janet Jensen Petersen. It was fun and a puzzling tricky game. I enjoyed it together with my friends. It's a good teamwork training.

Rainy day treat. Our group of eight spent a fun and stimulating hour solving puzzles in the Egyptian Room. It was a unique experience and it made us all want to try the other rooms in the future. The rooms are underground and are dark so this activity may not suit everyone, however groups remain in contact with reception throughout and there are panic buttons should anyone wish to exit quickly. There are lockers to store personal belongings before entering the rooms and toilet facilities.

Amazing escape room!. We tried the Shogun's shodow.It was an amasing experience with beautiful traditionnal japanese decorations and good enigms.After that, we continued by the cathedral enigm and the secret of the pharaon.We recommande mystique room.The personnels are so kind.We will come back soon for the 3 news rooms in construction

Nice room but nothing special. The theme of the room (Cathedral room) was well carried out. Some of the puzzles were however a bit far fetched. Furthermore the room was quite dusty. For one of our group members this was a problem because of hay fever. All in all not a bad room, but there are better ones to find in Budapest.

Beautiful and such fun. We had such fun playing the Shogun's Shadow Room. Ive played 3 room escape games and this one was the most pretty. We were with 6 people 3 of which had played a trap game before, we soon got into the swing of searching and puzzling and enjoyed every minute. They said this was the hardest of the games but we found it ok only had 1 hint and got out with plenty of time to spare. Really fun game beautiful and well thought out.

What an experience!!. This was the first time myself or my partner had tried an escape room and neither of us has any idea what to expect but we were far from disappointed!! From the warm welcome, whilst in the escape room and with the laughter when we had finally escaped (admittedly with a little bit of help!!) this is a must see attraction for all ages - will definitely be returning when we get chance!!

One of the best. We have done escape rooms all over the world. This was one of the best with twists and turns we have not seen before. Although they are designed with more players in mind, a couple can finish with an occasional clue.

Everyone loved it!. This was our first mystery room experience and we liked it so much we ended up going to all the three rooms on consecutive days. The Mysteries were clever and the rooms had great details. The staff were friendly and helpful. So much fun.
Fun. First time escape room for all of our group. Ended up finishing one room and booking again for another room. So much fun.
Nice "escape" in town. Nice escape room in town , friendly guest Xoxo, would recommend. tried the pharaoh , good scenario some items could be renewed a little bit

Amazing experience. We have tried 5 different mystery rooms in Europe and this one stands out as the best! There were a lot of different tasks to solve and the scenary and concept was very thought through. Absolutely recommendable!!

Great escape room for families. This was our first escape room and we all really enjoyed it! Our kids (ages 14,11 and 9) all wanted to stay and do another! Unfortunately we couldn't because they were all booked. We did the shoguns shadow over room. It was very challenging and the lady working there said it was one of the more difficult ones so I might suggest trying another if it's your first time!
Awesome!. Really enjoyed it, the room was a lot more than we imagined and all in all gave us a wonderful experience!

One of the hardest we've been at. A nice story and not at all easy. It was our fifth educate room, usually we get out in about 30-40 min this one took us the whole hour.Everything is in English and the guides were nice
Clever , fun and authentic. Our first expiriance in escape room and deffenatly not last . We had so much fun .The game was challenging and the girl at the reception was very nice
Great activity!. The puzzles were fun, totally fine for two people, the attendant spoke English and it was just a great way to spend an hour!

Another happy time. We really like such kind of pastime and when we came to Budapest with our group for the second time we for sure wanted to come back to Mystique room for another quest. And we were really happy to feel being egyptologists. We were successful. The quest was brilliant and rather captivating. Everybody liked it)
Absolutely amazing. Really good room, not an easy one! We are looking forward for the other too rooms they have. We tried the shogun, next time goes the faraon.

A "must-do" in Budapest!. Great escape-room, perfect that it was possible to be only 2 persons! Nice staff, easy booking. Only sorry we didn´t find this earlier in our stay, then we would have tried the other two rooms as well!

Amazing. It wasn´t our first escape room, actually me and my friend a working at a similiar place in germany and we have to say, WOW. Really smart puzzles and quests, one of the most difficult but funnest rooms ever.I would really recommend going there, if you are looking for a challenge.Really nice stuff and a great idea to visit in Budapest!!

Fabulous escape rooms. Pharoah's Challenge was excellent. Don't want to give any spoilers but very well organised. Cathedral room very good too and different challenges. Great time had by all. Recommend!

Beautiful scenes. This escape room was the most beatifully and carefully furnished of the ones I have visited so far. Especially the Japanese one (Shogun). You need logic and some skills, as well. I would definitely recommend it!

Amazing place, very cleverly made, great fun. We visited this place after reading reviews on trip advisor and we were not disappointed. We tried the Showgun room, we were given an hour to find the Showgun's samurai sword and escape the room. Clues were hidden around the room and we had to solve logic puzzles and find hidden items to get from room to room and complete the challenge. There was great attention to detail and it had been very well thought out, we thoroughly enjoyed the experience. So much so we are going back to try another room, there are three in total, before we leave. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The man looking after us took the time to take photos of us in the room at the end. If you are in Budapest this is definitely worth a visit.
room "the Cathedral". The ambiance was nice and the staff also.We enjoyed the game but it was a bit too linear.The idea of the disguises are interesting that way you are more immersed into the game.
good room!!. we really enjoyed the pharaoh room and to a lesser extent the cathedral. The decors were nicely done and the puzzles were diverse and some were even amazing!!!
Great Escape room!. We tried the Shogun Shadow and loved everything - great theme, the room is beautifully designed, and the puzzles are different and interactive. Would recommend!
Exceptionally well made!. My girlfriend and I have visited quite a few of the escape-games in Budapest, and the "Pharao's Burial chamber" is our absolute favourite!!
Amazing. I've been to a fair few escape rooms in different countries n these are the best I've done so far..!!

Mystique room - cathedral. We were on holidays at Budapest for 6 days and decided to try famous mystery rooms for the first time ever. The place was easy to find, and costumer service was excellent! Design of the room we visited was really realistic and you can see that they have spent time with it. Basically nothing bad to say.
Bots. Rooms were enjoyable, we did the Egyptian and Japanese. Staff were nice and spoke excellent English. Would recommend.

Great group activity. We went as a group of six adults in our twenties and had a great time in the Shogun room. We were walk-ins, but the staff were very accommodating. The lady was also very patient in taking lots of photos for us. Might be a bit tricky to know where to start if you were to only do it as a couple, but you can get as much or as little coaxing with the clues as you want. Would have gone back to play another room if we had time. Excellent!
Great Room!. We enjoyed it very much, visited 2 of their rooms, very challenging and well organized. In a good location in city center, easy to get there.
It was Ok. The people working there was very nice and friendly. They took pic of us in the end and posted it in facebook.The room was so so. It was a lot looking for keys and codes.
Worth a Visit!. Fisrt time in am escape room, played the Shogun's Shadow room and totally loved it!Thank you very much!!

Exciting and beautiful exit room. We tried one room with my Czech friends and there were no language barriors in the game. It was really fun and interesting! I would really recommend this game to everyone!

Clever puzzles!. After three hours of suffering miserably in the caves of Budapest, a buddy and I showed up for our booking. The young lady was very pleasant and took great care of us. The puzzles were excellent, and the attendant immediately corrected any issues (IE flashlight with dead batteries). It was a lot of fun! The puzzles were challenging without being frustrating, and there were suprises galore. Would definitely go back!

The Cathedral. The room was not that difficult as I thought - I was in this room with my 4 friends and we managed to escape in 30 minutes. But we are great team :)) Cathedrial scenario is very climatic, decoration and floor are awesome, engimas are logic.Few drawbacks: The girl have forgotten to close one of padlocks, but we were so ambitious that we solved this puzzle anyway. She doesn't speak Enligsh very well or maybe she was to busy to talk with us.All in all, I am very satisfied with this escape room and I definately recommend you to visit it once.

Great moment!. It was our first escape game ever. We first did the Pharaoh's room and we loved it so much that we came back later on the same day to do the cathedral! Everything was great. It was a bit difficult at the beginning as we had never done such a game before, but they are of great help. We definitely recommend it.

Thanks!. Very nice staff, interesting stories and exciting tasks, high standard scenes, thank you :)Kedves szemelyzet, erdekes tortenetek, izgalmas feladatok, magas szinvonalu diszlet, koszonjuk az elmenyt! :)

A visit back in time to feudal Japan. Very authentic setting and a few challenging puzzles. Very good overall. Do not want to spoil anything so no more details, go play for yourself you won't regret it. Parking is a little hard so recommend either a taxi, on foot or public transportation.
amazing adventure. My girlfriend and me went to play the "shogun shadow" exit room.It was our first time ever playing an exit game and it was a great adventure.Helpfull staff

Amazing adventure from Egypt to medieval cathedral. As the team of five friends we decided to escape from two rooms - Cathedral and Pharaoh's burial chamber. The scenery of both rooms is excellent, it contributes so much to the entire impression of the room and the games themselves. The clues are intuitive, tasks are logical and disposable time is just about long enough for solution of all the puzzles. Both games are very seductive - the more you make progress, the more you get thrilled and passionate to find the exit...Starting as short visit, we decided along the way to make this adventure all-day event, so we visited few rooms more during our Budapest visit! Sincerely I would recommend this adventure to everyone.

Exciting adventure. We visited Cathedral with a group of friends. The design is amazing, the adventure was exciting and the staff is really nice and helpful. We will definitely return and try the two other sites!

Pharaoh's burial chamber. It was a marvellous Saturday evening program, a pleasant surprise. Authentic design, excitin tasks; plots are worked out to the smallest details. Harmonized teamwork needed for a quick exit.Lots of fun and a life-time memory for me and my friends. It meets the highest standards in its category. It is the best in Budapest, for sure.Staff and the owner were very helpful and friendly. We will return some day for sure. There are 3 different themes. I can't wait seeing the the other 2 rooms too.

Excellent activity in nice setting. We did the Cathedral escape room. Rooms are nicely set in scene and bring the right atmosphere, you get also robes. The place is underground in a building square, which helps as well the atmosphere.Friendly staff helps in case of need, good support also in English.Makes sure to bring cash payment, but can pay in Euro's as well.Escaping the room is feasible and you get support if stuck, so you feel successful when leaving.This is a nice event to do with colleagues or friends and in cold wintertime ideal as it is inside.

Amazing room design. The rooms was very well designed, one of the best i seen so far . Especially the Shogun shadows room, puzzles are also great, not hard to solve, but it was not easy at all. The place was very clean and staff was nice and friendly.

Brilliant experience!. Myself and my boyfriend carried out the game in the "chapel" it was brilliant and I would love to go back and play the other rooms. The only critique I have is that I felt the woman prompted us too often via the walkie talkie before we got a chance to figure it out ourselves, but overall it was very exciting and challenging!
Katedrális. The staff was kind and helpful when we arrived. The game with the challenging exercises was creative. It was very entertaining, so overall we had a great time there.

Mystique experience at Mystique Room. Shogun's Shadow has amazing Japanese style design and beautiful decorations. The game is difficult packed with ingenious and challenging riddles, but it is fantastic for a creative and cooperating group! I suggest this room to everyone who wants to have 1 hour (or less) of witty fun. :)
Great fun. Good place, good game and even with child! All of three escape room are great, we tried them and we liked the most the Pharaoh's Burial Chamber.

The most beautiful design ever!. We did more than 20 games and this rooms are the most beautiful of all! Never saw so well designed rooms. When we saw Cathedral we book Shogun room right away! The task inside are quite different than in other games, especially Shogun. You really need to be creative. We loved it so much!

What an adventure!!. My family just completed Shogun's Shadow which completes our adventure for the Mystique Room's escape games - unless they gift us with more adventures!Each room has been excellent for our 3 children - two 11yr olds and one 9yr old. The Cathedral Room was completed with 4 adults with the children, Pharaoh's Burial Chamber was 2 adults with the children, and Shogun's Shadow was 1 adult with the children. It's tough to decide which is our favorite since they were all great and challenging. The kids have expressed they loved Shogun's Shadow decor and challenges. Residents and tourists of Budapest - book a slot and you won't be disappointed!

Very creative, but helping a bit too early. We visited Cathedral and made it 18 min faster than the one hour limit, with some help from outside. It was huge fun, maybe we could have been stretched a little more... :-)
Adventure with children. We enjoyed very much Mystique Room. Both children (age 11) and adults could have fun and we worked and played together. and we escaped :)))
Birthday. It was very interesting and funny. Splended organization. Helpful and friendly stuff. Overall a good family experience.
Cathedral escape. It is great with kids too, our group was 3 adults and 4 children between 11 and 15. We all enjoyed it a lot. Actually our kids wanted to do the other rooms right after we finished.

The Cathedral. One of the best escape rooms i tried so far. We played their "Cathedral" game, very nice setup, you can see that they put the effort in it. Great riddles, tricky locks, no scary stuff. The room was big enough for 6 people, we didn't feel squeezed, everyone could find something to work on.

Fun in the city. Nice place with nice staff. We tried the "Cathedral" game in cool monk suits. Very nice atmosphere and interior. Staff was helpful and English speaking. Try the Egyptian or the Japanese game for more challenge.

Egyptian room. Great experience. Very nice staff. Good fun! Also after the game you keep discussing the riddles. Perfectly suitable for groups (ours consisted of 8 people, youngest 9, oldest 75). Recommended.
Wonderful 1 hour. It was a great experience. The room was very detailed and we have fun doing all the puzzles. The staff was also very nice and friendly. Highly recommended!
Middle age room. It was a very good way to have fun! Our room was about a mystery in the middle age. Tasks were not too easy but not to difficult to solve. It was very exciting! :-)

An interesting experience. We are 5 couples aged 25 to 50, my wife booked as a surprise for us all during our weekend stay in Budapest. We split in to 2 groups my group did the Egyption room which was a matter of finding codes and keys, it's difficult to say too much without spoil ing the experience for you, we really enjoyed it and had a proper laugh. The other group did the medieval room which was more physical challenges, similar to crystal maze, again that group thouroghly enjoyed. All enjoyed it so much that we decided to do the opposite room, however on reflection we had given too much away, so it would have spoiled the experience. They staff there were really nice and were busy making a 3rd room, an oriental theme I think.We would all recommend a visit if you are in Budapest, it's not the easiest place to find, so give your self plenty of time.

Good atmosphere, but too much same locks. Egypt room was really super - gives the atmosphere of a Pyramid, main puzzle was made in this style.However the room can be really boring: for examle there are 4 locks with 3 digit code. We were lucky that the first lock we try was usually correct one. If not so, it will be "run through the room and find correct lock for your code"Expected more in "Motherland of quests"
Absolutely brilliant. We travelled as a group of 10 friends who split into 2 groups who cracked the clues in each of the rooms. We would all recommend this it was fantastic and so much fun.
good times. This was good times,a whole lot more fun then i even imagined. Challenging and still fun. The staff were also great and helpful.
Scenery, tasks. Choosen game: 'The Cathedral'. Lifelike, good quality scenery. Varied, enjoyable tasks. Helpful staff.
Exciting game, great experience, friendly staff. We spent great time there, getting out was not easy, but manageable. Staff was friendly, open and happy!Try and see it for yourself.

A hour of pleasant lock picking. Nice setup, especially the Egyptian tomb! The staff is very helpful and funny. It's a great way to spend an intensive hour with family or friends.The storyline is somewhat straight, and involves a lot of lock picking.

Excellent egypt room for our first ever escape game. As a couple who would quite fancy ourselves on the crystal maze, this seemed the perfect thing to try in Budapest. This was our first escape game.Our host was so friendly and welcoming. Design of the game and artwork was brilliant. The host gave exactly the right amount of clues for us beginners and a few big ones to speed us up at the end so we managed to complete it in an hour which felt awesome.Plus so many kind words said about us and our first escape game, so thanks for that! The egyption room did not disappoint.Liked it so much we tried two other escape games from other companies the next day, and this was the best of the three.

Great fun !. My friends and I really enjoyed this game. We have really laughed a lot, while thinking and searching together for indications in order to get out of the Cathedral Room. This activity is very original and allows the participation of everyone.

My friends and me are grateful for fun we had =))). 1 hour flies like a minute in that room (-s) =)) it was amazing experience for 6 of us. All decoration of the room (-s) is amazingly marvelous! It takes you to a really mystique atmosphere of Egypt, Pharaohs, maps, artifacts, and graves =)) Separate "gratitude" to the administrator. He was very polite, communicative, and mysterious =))
Excellent place. We were rescuing from the Farao's chamber, and it was really brilliant. We should go back to try the other tracks as well.

Unforgettable experience. It was great. It was our first experience of escaperooms and we loved it. Moreover it helped to strengthen the ties between the memebers of our team. The tasks were really interesting and amazing. We liked it very much
Budapest escape room. Thoroughly enjoyed this. Need at least for 4 for maximum fun. Different experience on a break to a lovely city. Definitely recommend doing this. Suitable for all ages.

A truely fun experience. I highly recommend visiting this escape room, my wife and i really enjoyed it. We have been to other escape rooms in our home country but this one was epic, friendly staff, cool customs and very challenging!
exciting, team-building experience. exciting, team-building experiencedemanding designinteresting, challenging mysteriesIt's worth to go and complete.
It's mysterious!. I was with my boyfriend, we got out and it was a wonderful experience! Both room is beautiful and well organzied! Thank you very very much!

Two well designed rooms!. We visited Budapest with the only mission to play a lot of escape rooms. We started with the Cathedral and found it so well designed that we immediately booked a slot at the Pharaos burial chamber. We liked both games thanks to great pussles, excellent interior design and a very nice game master.
Mystique Room. We had a great time, very exciting hour simply, and even if with a little help, but we got out in the last second.
Pharao. The room was very well equipped and facinating. Worth trying. Real adventure for all participants regardless age. look forward to trying other rooms.
Very Good, was there with husband and had very good fun. Very Good, was there with husband and had very good fun. Egyptian theme is very interesting, ask for all the clues and rules before starting.
The cathedral. It was a very great experience. The staff was wonderful. The game was challenging. We had good fun together. I highly recommend Mystique Room.
Great fun!. Highly recommended, we tried both the cathedral and Pharaohs tomb und had much fun! Surely one of the best Escape Games I've ever played.

Excellent place to visit!. It was really great and interesting. I truly recommend this place! Me and my friends will want to visit this type of places more in the future. The people there are very nice and it meant a lot to us.

Brilliant Fun. My husband and I stumbled across the mystique room during a rainy day in Budapest. It was absolutely brilliant. We loved it so much that after the 1st game we went back a few hours later to play the 2nd game. It was our first time doing anything of this sort but we'll definitely be checking out some closer to home in the UK now...it's safe to say we're hooked!
Awesome experience!. Alot of fun and very friendly staff! The rooms were very cleverly planned and we had a great laugh at the end of it :)
Played The Cathedral. Very nice entourage. We have played multiple rooms before, so we got out after 40 min. Very much fun with friends ;-)))))

Great fun. This was our first experience with and escape room and it was fantastic. Setting is great and was the right level of challenging without being frustrating! Shall definitely try out the Egyptian themed one next visit to Budpest
Katedrális Oct2015. The scene is very well carried out with ancient objects and mystic lights. The game was unpredictable and exciting.
one of the best escape rooms in Budapest. Both of their rooms are in the top of Budapest's escape rooms. Nice atmosphere, challanging riddles, kind staff.
friends visit. good ideas, I only did not like the soltuion for the final clue. Its timing was not logical. But overall a nice place to have fun for an hour
excellent. Ist a great time for the whole family!Exciting, funny, high quality game.It was one of the bests I have visited.I recommend it to everyone

team activity. This was a new and interesting exercise as a team. Spending one hour in a small room solving a puzzle with only our minds and imagination. would definitely try again if given chance. We were 5 in our group.
excellent. Nice, authentic equipment, challenging (lot of locks to unlock), entertaining, much recommended and worth its price.

Monk-ey Business. Having experienced only four Budapest Escape Room adventures so far, I would rank Mystique Room as very good. The design and setting was perfect. A great atmosphere. Certainly, it was fun to dress up as a monk. However, the clues were all of the same sort, so one was using the same set of problem solving skills throughout, making it less dynamic than others I have done. Nonetheless, it was engaging. I would say this would be a great first experience for Escape Room newbies - it will give you a real taste for how they work without being daunting.
Mind boggling. We went to both rooms over 2 days. It was very complex! Really stretched the imagination. Definitely recommended

Not the best roomescape in Budapest. During our trip in Budapest we did three different roomescapes, this wasn't the best one. If you never did a roomescape before it's a lot of fun, but for people who have a little more experience I'd suggest to try another one. The game itself doesn't have much variety.

A free time activity that you must check. I went to Mistique room with my two best friends as a part of a bigger birthday party. If you are familiar with this type of activity, you won't be disappointed. If you want classify by difficulty, I would rather grade it to 3/5.
The cathedral. It was our first game.It was very exciting.The rooms are very cozy.The master of the game was very frendly and helpful.Next time we come here again.
Amazing!. It was one of the bests "Escape room game" that I have played! And you can do it in any language. I recommend it!
Trip to the Ancient Egyptian Lands. Very well put together room with a lot of attention to detail. Overall had a lot of fun, even though we are an experienced duo of escapers.
Great fun. Well set up and a good challenge. Lots of fun was had and hints were given along the way to help us to the finish
amazing!. This is amazing experience! Team gives great support in English, so everything was easy to understand!
Was very good. It was an excellent trip for us. Wasnt very hard but was very exciting. Thank you the game for mystique room.

The Egyptian scenery is awesome. We (8 friends) arrived late evening, but we had to use our brains, because there were some really good teasers. The scenery is awesome, I loved it! We want to try Cathedral, too. Staff was very helpful and kind.

good fun. Took two teenagers (14) and they really enjoyed the egyptian game. It was challenging but the people on the desk help you when you get stuck. They wanted to go again to do the other game. Overall a good experience and worth the money.

A thrilling experience!. As a first experience, the Cathedral was really awesome.. Actually, we had so much fun that we did the Egyptian room two days later! Even though our team was composed by two people, they recommend to be four minimum as this one is a bit a harder.The clues don't need any knowledge in Hungarian, it has more to do with logic.

great fun with child. We tried both of the escape rooms - the chartedral and the egiptian also - and both of them are great! Our 10 years old son and my husband and me also enjoyed! If you have time don't hesitate! try them!!!
Autentic and fun. We where two people trying the cathedral and it was absolutly fun. The room was very well designed with autentic furniturr and a great combination of different kind of riddels.
FAMILY ACTIVITY. This is one of the best family activity which is good for all ages. No doubt, if you have 60 minutes than MUST TRY!!!
Fun. It was our first experience in an escape room. It was fun, engaging and challenging. We recommend it!
So much fun!. Genius. Great fun for the whole family and totally absorbing for an hour (or less if you can manage it!). We would definitely recommend Mystique Room to everyone!
Great fun!. Very nice ambience, straightforward puzzles, but still a challenge to get out in 60 minutes, best to play with at least 4 people. Enjoyed it very much!

So much fun!. This is the only escape room we did in Budapest but we chose it because it was recommended here by a reviewer who had done a few. We were definitely not disappointed! It was well designed, with lots of twists and turns, and the time pressure added a lot of excitement. It was great fun, one of the highlights of our trip, and I have been recommending it to everyone I've spoken to since!

Ace fun. We decided to visit here on the last day of our visit after trawling through internet reviews. This one seemed the most suitable, appropriate and best located to our hotel.The booking process online was simple and quick and we found the place with ease.The host was very welcoming and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience. I would recommend this place to anyone and it's inspired us to look for something similar back home. I'd also suggest you do this early in your trip because you'll want to do some more! A bargain at the price, too.

Excellent family programme. Was great fun with a 10 and a 4 years-old, parents and their aunt. The main required skills were logic and vigilant observations, all three generations could take part and enjoyed the game very much. Professional care provides just as much as needed for success during the game.
Great fun!. I highly recommend it, such great fun. Kids were really engaged too and made up when they could figure out a clue.

Engaging and fun. I wasn't sure about this 'escape room' craze in Budapest but decided to give it a go. After a quick google search, Mystique rooms had both A- the most reasonable pricesB- the most uniformly positive reviews.We rocked up not knowing what to expect, were greeted by an extremely pleasant and helpful staff member who explained the game to us.It was an engaging and fun experience that had my partner and me hooked the entire time. It is definitely not easy and a challenging game!I give this 5 stars. Such an awesome experience to do with your partner, or friends, or family. You won't be disappointed. Thanks for the great time!
awesome!. It was really great, can only recommend it to everybody, I'm definitely going again, and also want to try the other one.
Great game!. It was a really fun game with good ideas. The personal was kind and helpful too. I recommend it to all, it was great logic game!
so much fun. We had no idea what to expect, but it was a very nice experience! We had so much fun! I definitely recommends this!

A GREAT GAME FOR ALL AGES. We visited here on 17th July this year (2015) 3 of us , two adults and a very clever 11 year old young lady ! we didn't really know what to expect, we went to the Pharaoh's chamber and right away it was great fun. using different skills to find different clues, I don't want to give any details away that would spoil it for anyone but I would highly recommend this for all ages, not scary or physical. you must try this and I'm sure you wont be disappointed. we loved it so much that we immediately booked for the other room ( the Cathedral) for later that week.

Super Fun!!!. This was the third Exit Game that my friends and i tried in Budapest and it was one of our favorites. We especially liked the Cathedral Room. The puzzles were challenging but fun, the decorations awesome. The next day we returned to try our luck in the Egyptian room. We liked that room also but definitely preferred the Cathedral Room. If we didn't already know how to escape we would definitely come back!

Very hard and nice!. We did Pharao's burial chamber. It was excellent. Really tricky and hard, luckily we got some hints. We had little problems to understand hints, because we don't know egyptian vocabulary so well. But we managed to het out!

The most exciting room we've ever were. We were there with friends, and it was amazing. The ideas are very good, the room is beauty, and it was difficult to come out, be we managed to! :) For all of us it was a very good experience, and we already tried out other rooms by other companies, but this was the best! We offer it for everyone who likes adventures!
"Tomorrow we will be here again!". This were the first words of our teenagers after escaping! Highly recommended while visiting Budapest or living in the town! Excellent place!

Challenging, fun, highly recommended. We completed the Egyptian game. We really enjoyed it - it was challenging, fast paced, with a couple of red herrings and two rooms. My boyfriend and I finished it with 2.32 minutes to spare, though we did have a couple of clues. We enjoyed it so much, that we decided to fit a second escape room into our four days in Budapest!

Among the bests in Budapest. After completing the Egypt scene, I can conclude that it's a phenomenal escape room, fun and excitement is guaranteed. Can be quite challenging in some aspects even for experienced visitors. The decoration and feeling is near perfect, along with some nice, attractive high-tech solutions.

Amazing. It was truly amazing. The scene that you're in was well done and had an overall great vibe to it. It wasn't too hard nor too easy, and they are good to help you if you should get stuck.We only tried the egyptien part, but if I ever come back I'll make sure to get time to try out the other one.If you go to Budapest you should try it out.

Great fun, nice experience! . We did The Cathedral in a group of 4. We managed to escape with only 22 seconds left. It was real fun, the game was well organised and the staff was polite and also helpful when we were stuck, as they gave us a couple of hints. Definitely worth a visit, a great experience to be shared with family or friends.

Great fun. We did this as a group of 5 and it was great fun. There's someone watching you on camera and can give you a hint if you're stuck (we were) and there are loads of puzzles to solve. The theming was really cool and there was a lot of detail. Overall it was a unique experience, great value for money and I'd highly recommend it.
Great time. It was so nice...It's a wonderful place and we really loved this...We had a little bit more help but i think that we worth it...
It was awesome but we're too stupid. It was so cool and well organised. The plan was really well done but we did need some help. Which was oke. Deff a recommendation!!!
Idiots Abroad. There were only two of us so it took us more time and we got some help....fun time. Will definitely do again.

Travel back in Ancient Egypt. It was a very positive experience. The exercises are interesting and funny, they are difficult, but not a mission impossible. The staff is helpful, polite and nice. I recommend this game for everybody who likes adventures and try a funny Hungaricum.
Great success. This game was an excellent entertainment for all of us. Good ideas and thought-provoking problems to solve.
Very nice experience. Very interesting experience. A fun game to think and play, especially if you play PC games like this. Very helpfull staff... :)

Fun and excitement. We had a great time there for celebrating kids birthday party. We chose the Egyptian theme rooms. 10-11 years olds were able to find clues and get out. Of course they received help from the staff watching them from outside via camera. The place looks very well designed, sort of authentic looking. The kids got super excited and had a fantastic time. Later, we were allowed to settle in another room and had the cake together. I would recommend it to anyone, adults or older kids, we will go back again for the other Cathedral theme rooms.
AMAZING!!. I have never seen anything like it before!! best experience ever!! a lot of action, a lot of suspense, perfect place (underground room) and nice theme (egyptian)!!
Fantastic scenes!. Really fun games with so much thought gone into decorating, probably the best rooms so far visually! Great experience!

Good fun!. My family and I went to the Mystique room in October 2014. We had never done anything like that before. We were a bit concerned whether it would be suitable for our two children (11 and 8), but we were soon reassured. We booked the term online, arrived in Budapest, found the venua and had a most memorable time. My children were thrilled, and although we didn't solve the mystery in the time given, the friendly attendant helped us and allowed a few extra minutes. We still talk about this experience as being something we've done together as a family. One more thing: we heard that they have a new mystery and we are planning to ckeck it out at the end of May!

Creative and visually stunning!. Mystique's Cathedral room is an aesthetically gorgeous, fully immersive environment. Your team gets to wear monk robes the entire game, making you feel even more fully part of the story. The puzzles are fairly easy but very well designed and clever - perfect for both families and escape game experts. Very highly recommended!

Great adventure. The story of the exit game was not so special but the implementation of the room and the mysteries was professional and modern. We enjoyed the adventure, it was not so easy but was possible to escape.
Very good. The game was very good. It wasnt too easy and too difficult. Alll of the 3 generations of my family enjoyed it.
Great birthday adventure. Thought-provoking exercises, super sets. We had a good time. It was an exciting 60 minutes :) Would be nice to have a room like adventurous of you!

Great adventure. Probably the most atmospheric, spectacular exit game in Budapest, with a thrilling story: an investigation in an old Egyptian burial chamber. The riddles, challenges were really ingenious, creative, we had a lot of fun solving them :) We had a great time here.
get to know your children better. with teens its a very good adventure and afternoon programme. we never stop learning! its a good place to try yourself and have fun.

Great fun. After a wobbly start where we became stuck on the first puzzle (became apparent the puzzle had actually broken but these things happen) we had a great time! You get a real buzz from the countdown of the timer towards the end when you're so close to solving the game. Couldn't recommend highly enough.
Mystique room. Great fun, very well organised and good value for money. Probably too complicated for younger children, but older teenagers would be fine
Good time. Nice experience. For the escape games passionates, you should try it. I was skeptical about it, but I think it was a bit difficult. Very fun, though, and I would recommend it.

Egyptian Tomb. This is a room escape. Google for it if the concept is unfamiliar. This one is quite hard because it lacks of feedback ("bling, mission completed"). Still I will give it four stars. Nice staff!
Cathedral. Pretty cool escape room in the heart of Budapest. So much fun for friends, couples and families, too. Thanks

One of the best escape rooms in Budapest. Definitely the best in terms of design and authentic atmosphere, and the puzzles are varied and interesting too. Friendly staff, just enough help. Can only recommend to anyone looking for an hour of good fun.

Teambuilding fun. We visited the Pharaoh Burial Chamber at Mystique, and had a lot of fun with the colleagues. We managed to solve the mystery within the 60 min and got out alive:) I can recommend the place for everybody.

Awesome place!. I have visited Mystique Room's the Pharaoh's Burial Chamber with my mom and sis' and we had an unexpected amount of fun :D Even though we were really lame in the beginning solving the mystery, we managed to reach our full potential, thanks to the excellent organization and the great staff at hand. I'll definitely come back with to try out the other room later :D Would recommend this to anyone interested in a great adventure!

A great experience. Myself and my girlfriend had heard great reviews about this place and decided to try it out. We had not done any escape/trap rooms before.The puzzles were very well designed and a lot of fun to solve. They were great about providing some small tips to keep us going in the right direction, but not too many to ruin the challenge. Overall this was a fantastic time and would recommend it to anyone for a challenging and fun activity.

Great Experience. Had no real idea what to expect when I booked this event. Myself and six friends were visiting Budapest and I saw quite a few "Escape Rooms" on Trip Advisor. The majority all said up to 5 people. Mystique Room suggested 4-6 but after emailing them, I got a response that 7 people would be fine.We turned up on the day and although we had some issues with finding the entrance (maybe part of the game!) we made it in.Don't want to ruin the game for people but it was very fun trying to find clues and escape the room within the hour.We all agreed after that 7 people was too many but that was our own fault. 5 is probably the perfect number. Would be good for pretty much any age. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because some members of the group struggled to get into it as much as others. Still not entirely sure why but I guess it just wasn't their 'cup of tea'.Overall, was a good experience and would definitely encourage others to try it.Very cheap to do as well at under 11,000 HUF (approx £25) between us all.

Great fun, challenging and exciting!. This is a well organised escape game. I went with my sister, which was her first escape game, I had played before before coming to Budapest.Mystique Rooms is a well organised establishment, with lots of interesting puzzles. I might say the staff were perhaps to helpful at times, but there were only two of us, so I guess we needed a bit more help than other groups. Plus this is the first escape game where we have succeeded! Would highly recommend a visit!

One of the best escape rooms. This was my 6th escape game that I tried in Budapest.The Cathedral and the Mummies, both of them had beautifully decoration.I loved these rooms. I can highly recommend for everybody.

Amazing Cathedral. I loved historical place from medieval ages.The Cathedral tried to give back that amazing feeling, what the monastery gave me.The organ was amazing.If you like these type of scene, great way to spend an hour.

Great fun. We had a fantastic hour in Cathedral. We did the room and enjoyed it.If you're in Capital city of Hungary and you have one hour what you would like to spent in an interesting game, than try out this place.

The Cathedral. It was a great fun to play with my friends, we loved every second of it! It was very well built, we had to work hard to get out - what we managed to do at the end. I highly recommend it to everyone who wants to have fun.
Fun in the Cathedral. Great escape room. Well designed and challenging. Fun for all. Staff really welcoming. Would recommend.

Intense fun in The Cathedral!. We went through The Cathedral challange, as a team building event. All 5 of us really enjoyed it, as it was filled with great tricks, and original riddles. Hands down the best escape room I have ever been to!

It was outstanding. I found unbelievable mysteries in this room :) I have tried the room both the medieval part and the Egyptian. It is obtained some unexpected feelings while we were looking for the keys and codes.

Super fun introduction to Escape Rooms. Really you should not be reading anything about this before going to it. Go in knowing absolutely nothing about these places. Filled with great challenges and good surprises. Very well designed. In a central location in Budapest. We were there with 5 people and we were moving the whole time. Well worth it.

Egyptian thrills. What I really liked about Mystique Room (and the reason why this room stood out among the others) was the Egyptian theme: Pharaoh's burial chamber. Although, in retrospective, it didn't have the most difficult puzzles on the most creative challenges, it took us the longest to escape and we needed some extra hints. The attention to details is crucial, as this room is full of hidden symbols. When you need help, just ask for a hint on the walkie talkie you are provided when entering the room. The hints are not that obvious, and will not ruin the fun. Actually, you may realise what the solution is while asking the gamemaster for an extra hint, as it happened to us:)Like in the case of all other escape games, here also you have to book your place in advance and to arrive on time. Since we enjoyed this game a lot, we are waiting forward for our next trip to Budapest, so that we can try also the new room: The Cathedral. Judging by what the gamemaster told us and by the comments we read, it looks promising.

The Cathedral - new room!!!!. I have tried the room with the the pharaoh theme months ago and i found it awesome, so went back to try the new room with high expectations. Well, it was again a very pleasant surprise, interesting topic, great design and brand new challenges. So I would highly recommend you to try this room (or the other one), as I find MistiqueRoom the best among the escape rooms I have tried in Budapest. Also the staff is nice and the place has a good location. We were 5 , but everyone had something to do and had a great time!! I would highly recommend this place, if you want to have a a great experience by using your mind, creativity ;)

great experience. Highly recommended, one of the best escape games in Budapest. Visited both rooms, and what I really liked, were the short background stories of them.The decoration in my opinion looks awesome, you usually don't get this kind of detail and quality in other rooms.The staff is very kind and helpful, yet not too helpful in terms of the game (which, I think is important, they don't solve the riddles for you).It's also very easy to get there (either by tram, bus or subway).Thanks for the great time guys!

Very nice experience!. It was a great experience!!! A beautiful room with an eye-catching and gorgeous decorationl!!! The staff was so kind too, we really enjoyed the game! The teamwork was a nice experience, we weren't bored at all. The game had a very good mood. Thank you!!! :)
great pleasure. Was a suprise for the team and they greatly enjoyed themself. Nice and helpful staff. Even with the high number was still enjoyable.

seen both rooms. I have tried both of the rooms, the Egypt theme room and the medieval-monks-building-a-cathedral room, too. They were equally hilariously fun and exciting! :) They also have a nice background story to begin with. The staff is very helpful and polite, location is central and getting there is very easy.The one with the ancient Egyptian theme was full of old padlocks, hieroglyphs and every inch of the rooms were accurately designed to make an old, ragged and ancient impression. There are all kinds of sound and light effects, tons of logical challenges from easy to very complex. You need a group of more than three to accomplish the mission in less than an hour, even though you can have the staff to give you subtle hints on a walkie-talkie meanwhile whenever you need help.The other room was a bit easyer, but still very fun and the level of challenge was optimal to enjoy the one-hour mission. The tasks and the theme are completely different and you can come across brilliant ideas in this room, too. You have to be inventive to even swith on the lights in some places and every inch of the space contains hidden cues waiting to be discovered.It was awesome, woth the money! I' recommend it to everyone from 5 to 99. You can do this with friends or with your family, you can come here even on a double date :D So srsly try this!++++

rather good escape room. This was not our first room escape geme, sothe first half was chaotic and quite average, for us, there was nothing new in the puzzles, looked like a copy of another rooms, with all the codes, strange signs and UV lamps...second part was much more interesting.note for roommaster - you are right, treasure hunt must not be easy. But it must be hard because of the puzzles, not because of user unfriendly locks:-)If you have never played this type of game, you will like it....
Great. This was my first mystic game, we enjoyed so much with my friends. Great game, decoration, technic, worker.. what else?! Let's try it!

Great first experience!. It was first experience for my husband and me with this kind of escape rooms! We were just two, but is was enough. Team with max 4 people will feel comfortable there. If more, that it is too big crowd and hard to give and control tasks. What I liked is that the gentleman on the reception speaks English, what is very good for tourist groups. Besides, all the tasks to find the way out do not require from you local language skills. What was also nice, is that Mystique Room is located directly in the downtown, so you can continue entertainment and no need to travel far. I can recommend this place, definitely! Besides, as I understood they prepare now new rooms there, and I want to visit them as well, that's sure!
Fantastic!!. This was our first time doing this and we had no idea what to expect. It was so fun and we had such a great time!!

it was fun. This was my first escape room, so i didn`t know what expect, and it turned out fun. Six of us managed to solve a mystery with just a little help. Game seems high tech, although i still have nothing to compare it to. Recommended.

Great theme. We tried a few room escapes in Budapest, and this one had the best theme. Egyptian artifacts, atmospheric without being scary, with great attention to detail. Puzzles were good, if not the most satisfying we encountered. If you like Room Escapes, this is a good one and good value for money. If you haven't tried room escapes, you definitely should!

Wasn't easy, but very instructive!. We had a great time, and managed to learn a lot during this one hour, also of ourselves. We would not have make the escape without help, however, even if it was hard, we are very happy that we asked for it, to experience the feeling of success of getting out in the very last minute. Our instructor was there for us when requested, and always provided just a tiny hint, to help us go further. Great experience, thanks for that, longing to try the next room :-)

Great!!. We did several escape rooms in the city and this is one of the best. The difference of this one from others is that it was so clean and well maintained. It looks like the owner gives his attention to every detail, including the reception area and the bathroom (in other rooms they were in bad shape). The game itself is very good, loved the design and the puzzles.Very much recommended!!

Something old, something new.... My family and I booked this entertaining acivity online, prior to our visit to Budapest, and it turned out to be really engaging and a lot of fun for us all! We are in our early forties and our children are 11 and 7 and we wanted them to have some fun after hours of sightseeing. They were very impressed and willing to participate, but so were we! In the end, we didn't manage to solve all the problems in 1 hour, but the friendly member of staff let us finish this adventure successfully in 20 or so more minutes. We all left the room feeling good and stronger as a family. So, it is a huge recommendation from us!
Great experience. Very pleasent and fun hour :)The stuff were nice and helpful and the price is fair (specialy for large groups)

An hour of fun. An hour of great fun for the family. The manager was fantastic and without his help we would probably still be locked up! Challenging but fun game for a family with children aged 11 and 9. Recommend.

Family review from Budapest. My children and their friends liked a lot. It's really a good idea. The bad thing it's only one hour game for the money asked for (2500 Ft per young children), it should be at least 2 hours for that money.After doing the Online payment, a lot of e-mail notifications are received with wrong information. You need again to call them to confirm your booking! then why they call it online service!!

Had a blast.. A very thrilling and exciting room escape attraction. Alot of effort was put into this game and it is well shown in the decor and the background story. Had an option to go to only few room escape games in Budapest and I am very pleased it got to be one of them.I went there with a friend and even as a couple we managed to finish the game (although the nice guide helped us quite alot). I think he saw how startled we were being only a couple in a game that is made for 3-4. :)

fun time. I had my 2 weeks holiday in Hungary and went there with 2 friends. First exit game in all of our life...Been sceptic it was a good surprise: an hour when you forget everything else and live in an Egyptian movie. Team work is very important as work independent as well- save time, because that will run...Unforgettable, exciting experience. I recommend;)

First exit room experience and loved it. My husband and I had read about exit games in Budapest and decided to give Mystique a try when we wandered past it. We got lucky and the owner/designer happened to be there and had an opening for us to just walk-in. It was definitely challenging but the clues were very helpful and we had a lot of fun working through the various challenges. We've never seen anything quite like this and would highly recommend it to anyone traveling in Budapest! It is a good idea to book in advance. He mentioned that he is opening more room s soon too.

Best Exit Game in Budapest. My friend and I went to Mystique room after visiting several other places in the world.This is one of the best exit game I attended. It has amazing design, smart technological challenges, andSpectacular effects.The Egyptian track is realistic, it actually feels like you are exploring the work of an Egyptian culture explorer. The owner - Alex (?) is nice and welcoming.I strongly recommend you to try it.

A fun nut to crack. This was the first escape game for me. Although we couldn't figure everything out ourselves it was really fun and puzzling. We got through it with the help from the nice guy behind the desk. The hour went so fast! I played in a team of three and loved it :) Ps. Easy booking!

Very well done. Great design... probably one of the best in Budapest.. Played it in June with one friend. We loved it.... the concept.... the design...and all the clues.. riddles and puzzles. The host was friendly and helped via walkie talkie if we required it.Can't wait to go again!

Amazing!. I had a great time with my sister (13 years old) and my father at Mystique Room. It is advisable for friends who want to have fun and also for families. Maybe not for little children; it is not scary but its quite difficult. I hope you enjoy it as much as we did -it was a great experience that we will never forget.
great game!. unique and wonderful game! highly recommended for anyone that loves puzzles. best escape game i played so far. great game!

Fun in Budapest. We went to the Mystic room yesterday. It was fantastic! It was well organized and well done! We had so much fun. There were three of us and we spent an enjoyable hour in the Egyptian themed room. So much more fun than a movie. This is an activity that your entire family would enjoy. We took our granddaughter who is here visiting with us. She is an adult but kids would really love this game. It is kind of like a life sized computer game. We failed miserably but even that was fun. You should go and try it. We are just tourists here for three weeks but it was a blast.
Fantastic Game!. It was a great experience! Unique and unforgettable puzzle game with logical price and very good and helpfull staff! A place you must see in Budapest... :)

The best..... :). It was one of the most intensive, adventurous, exciting and entertaining experiences I have ever had :)High quality accessories, polite staff, interesting and new escape theme, more than the usual "open-the-locks" scheme. You should definitely give it a try!

Had a great time. We were a group of 6 friends, and enjoyed our time at the Mystique room. We visited the place on a lazy Sunday morning, still a bit exhausted with the amazing bath party the previous night, but as we entered the first room, we had to quickly get on our toes in solving the puzzle. It was a nice experience to decipher the clues and get out of the rooms. Felt like we were playing a live video game :). The person at the reception desk was very polite and helped us with some photo shoots as well as also gave us some hints from time to time, which was invaluable, because without those we probably would have been stuck inside the room for a few more hours.

Challenging!. We went there as a group of five, and was not easy to solve all the mysteries and secrets of the rooms. I really like the implementation, which is of high standard, as it resembles the ancient Egypt. I highly recommend this place if you want to challenge your mind and skills!

A new theme. And it’s Egypt! I’ve never seen this course anywhere else (I mean in any country), so I think this was a one of a kind experience! The course was near one of the biggest dance hall sin the city, so after finishing the course we grabbed something to eat and were off to party! It really set the perfect mood for a light drinking dancing laughing together kind of night!

Perfect difficulty. Not Nintendo hard but not too easy to lose interest in. The themed rooms were well made, the atmosphere was just right and we had lots of fun, all six of us! We laughed a lot, in fact so much that we could hardly finish the course (with six people!) within an hour, which is the time limit. I do recommend it for everyone, but be sure to keep the competitiveness at a friendly level!
The best exit-room game in budapest. One of the best exit game in budapest!Soo exciting, and the graphic is awesome!you have to try, if you come to Budapest
Excellent.. Excellent moment, even for beginners. Very good plot and tricky enigmas. Kind advices and ultimately a small extra time to finish!
